description: My top fave Thai restaurant in the city. I ALWAYS take my friends here for dinner when we're about to go out. I've been coming to this restaurant since I was little and nothing's changed for the worse. Always good service and even better food!
author: Marie C.

description:
Disappointing: We recently had a disappointing meal and
restaurant experience here. First, the  woman who came to take our order was very pushy about us ordering a menu item that we didn't even ask about. After her insistence that it was not to be missed, I ordered it. When it arrived at the table it was barely warm and appeared to have been sitting around. It was very mushy and unappetizing and after one bite, remained uneaten. Next, they brought a large bowl of rice over that we had not ordered so I told the waiter it must be for another table. Shortly after, the woman who had pushed the mushy fish, (I think she is the owner) came over and seemed surprised we didn't want the rice. Apparently it wasn't an accident that we were served it. Last, when the bill came, we were charged for 1.5 soups. We questioned the owner about the charge and she said we were four people, so we had been brought and charged for soup for four. We pointed out that we had specifically ordered a small soup, which said it served 3 people, as only 3 people were eating soup. She did not offer to adjust the bill and at that point we were happy to just leave. I felt ripped off and will definitely not return again! Never heard of someone trying to pad the bill by aggressively pushing dishes, bringing you food you didn't order and randomly deciding to bring you a "1.5" portion of soup! Very disappointing.
author: Anne R.

description:
Pretty small inside so there's often a wait, so make sure you come at a decent time!

I've come a couple times now, but I've come to realize that every time I come the spice level of my 3 favorite dishes changes... which is weird.

I usually go for the Pad Kee Mao, Angel Wings, Avocado Salad, and Pad Thai. The Pad Kee Mao especially is REALLY good, but can also be really spicy sometimes, so beware or ask for no spice!

Service here is also just mediocre. Everyone is always running around so it's hard to get their attention and often have to repeat drink orders to them a couple of times because they forget. 

Overall, this place really gets my thai craving satisfied and would be a solid 3.5 stars!
author: Carrie L.

description:
I've passed Marnee Thai so many times growing up in the Sunset and I finally got to try one of their locations. 

Here's what we had:

Tom Yum Soup- We got it with chicken and it was barely enough for three people. It worked out in the end because we were full from the other dishes. Good flavor.. More sour than hot.

Angel Wings- The sauce on the wings were great! The wings themselves were a little dry. 

Red Curry- Roasted duck was a good choice. There was a good amount of duck for the three of us to be satisfied. M didn't care for the fatty pieces of skin but I didn't mind. 

Chan Pad Poo- The noodles were slightly dry. In other pictures it looked more saucy. Good flavor and bite to the noodles. I didn't get enough crab flavor.

Overall, it was good but not as great as I had hoped. I would probably come back if there wasn't a wait. Service was slow since there was a large group next to us. 

We ordered everything spicy but it came out more mild. Next time I'll order extra spicy.
author: Lena H.

description:
Probably the best thai food in the neighborhood. Their Pad Thai is probably my favorite thing in the menu - it has the perfect balance of sweet and savory and the portions are decent. Their yellow curry is also very good! The service is always top notch but I do recommend making reservations here because the place is on the smaller side.  

They also take to go orders online through the Yelp app and the food is just as good as dining in.
author: Evonne T.

description:
My husband and I were very excited to try this location as it is in our neighborhood and when I saw all the fabulous reviews I figured it must be incredible! We usually frequent a couple Thai restaurants on Clement but figured let's give Marnee a try this time.

My husband and I ordered an appetizer, Satay pumpkin with sweet chili dipping sauce and for our entrees, Chicken Pad Gra Pow and Pad Prew Wharn w/Chicken. When the dishes arrived they looked and smelled delicious. We only ate a small portion of our entrees as we both started to notice our stomachs becoming upset. Fast forward to today we are still feeling the effects of possibly undercooked meat or unsanitary conditions, not sure which. For a $60 meal for two it was literally a waste!

UPDATE: DAY TWO AFTER DINING AT MARNEE!
HUBBY & I STILL ARE SICK AND UNABLE TO KEEP ANYTHING IN ARE STOMACHS! OH & THE MEAL WAS $72. W/TIP, NOT $60!!!
author: Martini K.

description:
I recently moved to the Bay Area from Seattle, and I was craving Thai food. My friends and I decided to give Marnee Thai a try. 

Parking: We went to the Inner Sunset location, and there was a lot of street parking in the area. 

Space: It is a small space and not ideal for groups bigger than 4. Tables are placed closely to each other, so you are extremely close to your fellow foodies. 

Service: The woman who served us was rude to us; she took the order quickly. We asked to get water and extra bowls multiple times before we got them. The food came out slow, but this is because the restaurant was packed when we ate. 

Order: 
1) Pad Thai, $11.95: This was full of flavor. However, it didn't seem like it had been in the wok for long, as I could the flavor was not fully absorbed in the noodles. 

2) Spicy Angel Wings, $8.75: This was recommended to us; however, I was disappointed in the wings. The spices and flavors were delicious but was drenched over wings that were not crunchy. If you have had wings at San Tung, this is no comparison. 

3) Tom Yum w/ Chicken, $9.95: This was my favorite dish, and I have not complaints about this. 

Verdict: 3 because I have had better Thai food in Seattle. The service was not great, and my friends and I did not have a pleasurable experience here.
author: Michelle B.

description:
I haven't written a Yelp review in 2 years, but had a bad enough experience here to bring me out of retirement.

We were here on a Friday night as a party of 5, including an elderly grandmother. The restaurant was so packed with tables that there wasn't space for the staff to move around, and so every time they needed to access the tables next to us, they made us scoot ourselves in uncomfortably close to the table.

If there's not enough room to serve patrons without disturbing others, the restaurant is too full. I counted 40-50 people in the dining space. I didn't see a posted maximum occupancy placard.

The food was pretty lackluster. We won't be coming back.
author: John L.

description: Great food. Ordered from this place multiple times. Place could be a little more spacious though.
author: Blake M.

description:
I had the fried rice style with chicken! It was good and I finished the whole thing!
I came with my 9 other friends and all my friends' food were good too! EXCEPT, I have to take a star out because one of my friend's food was late because the waitress forgot or made a mistake.
author: Candice L.

description:
Pretty decent Thai food. Good enough Thai food that I will gladly order something other than Pad Thai or Pad See Ew & Mr. Joy orders something other than green curry. This year marks their 30th year anniversary. One of the few times someone looks forward to 30.

From the outside, I wouldn't expect the entire place to be covered in what looks like the bamboo mats that my grandparents sleep on. The hanging plants and stringed lights sort of give it an island feel. It's a tight space and the tables are situated very close together. The angled bamboo sheets of the faux vaulted ceiling actually makes the place feel even more claustrophobic. 

There always seems to be a long line around peak times. Apparently you can call to make a reservation. The 9th Ave location is similar, but doesn't feel as claustrophobic.

Thai Iced Tea ($2.75): 
very sweet. The condensed milk covers about 1/3 of the glass. The tea flavor reveals itself more as an aftertaste

Spicy Angel Wings ($8.50) - deep fried chicken wings sauteed in chili-garlic sauce, topped with crispy basil:
Yes they're good. Crunchy, sweet, & spicy, like a lot of Asian-style fried chicken wings. My favorite part is the crunchy basil.

Thai Style Potstickers ($7.95) - pork & vegetable stuffed potstickers served with spicy green curry sauce:
pretty good potstickers with a decent crunch, topped with shredded basil leaves, curry sauce adds some flavor

Kang Dang/Red Curry ($13.50) - medium spicy curry with coconut milk, bamboo shoot, Thai basil. Roasted duck with pineapple, tomatoes, bell peppers:
The flavor of the curry was delicious and pretty mild. It seems like the amount of coconut milk they use really mellows out the red to an almost yellow curry. Duck was really good too. The pineapples added a lot of sweetness. The large tomato wedges seemed a little out of place though. The dish was topped with a little white sauce that looked like creme fraiche(?).

Panang Beef ($12.95) - beef with panang curry paste, coconut milk and Thai basil, with broccoli:
Beef cubes were nice and tender and had good flavor.

*Rice costs extra. Rice doesn't come with your meal or with the curry dishes. To me, rice & curry is like bread & butter. Curry needs a carb, just like butter needs bread. You probably wouldn't want to eat straight up curry or butter on its own.
A side of rice is about $2 per person. Some restaurants charge for rice. I prefer the ones that don't.

It's been a while since I've seen the owner, who had a ... colorful personality. 

Overall: good food, prices are a little high for this area, atmosphere is unique. Plus, they deliver. I give it a 7/10.
author: Joy W.

description: Quality Thai food in SF. I've tried dozens of different menu items and they all check out! Curry, soups, larb, noodles, veggies, etc. Anything you order will be very very tasty. Thx Marne!
author: Cainen G.

description: Amazing food! The atmosphere is a bit overwhelming at first though. It's kind of like going to a friends chaotic family dinner. It's loud and there is a women who clearly runs the show, shouting ordered in a very motherly way (if that makes any sense). She's very sweet but kind of blunt. Anyway, it's crammed and loud. But I would definitely come back! Loved the experience!
author: Karmina R.

description:
Yum!  Came to this restaurant on a Thursday and was very pleased.  There was no wait and it was 1/2 packed but smelled delicious.  The menu had so many amazing choices it was a really hard choice to pick what I wanted but decided to go with the fried roti and green curry with chicken.  The fried roti was delicious, the dipping sauce was bomb!  The green curry was great - a very good ratio of chicken to sauce.  Usually when you get curry dishes they skimp on the meat but this was literally 90% chicken meat and a few eggplants.  

Great portions and good prices - I would definitely go back!
author: Kimberly L.

description:
The food is 4.5 or 5 stars. Their wings are amazing - sweet, juicy and garlic covered. We also got Pad Thai, Pad Kaprow, Chicken Larb salad.

The only downside to this place is the price and delivery fee. Everything is about $2 more than I'd expect to pay, then they put a delivery fee on there and what I would expect to be a $50 order is now $65.
author: Ross H.

description:
Marnee Thai is definitely a must have in SF if you're a fan of Thai food. I had their Pad Kee Mao with chicken, which I was a HUGE fan of. Their food is bursting with flavor and fresh ingredients. I also had their golden triangles for an appetizer. It was really quite filling as well!

The staff here really likes to stick to their guns about the food on the menu. This basically means that they'll make substitutions, but man, you won't hear the end of it! Which I actually enjoyed, because honestly, the food on the menu is made the way it is for a reason. Trust the chef and the staff, and you definitely won't be disappointed.
author: Omar B.

description:
Came here during the end of 2015 nye dinner. My brother, cousin, and i during the rush hour dinner. I would have gave this place a 4 stars if the waiter didn't leave us hanging. When we walked into this restaurant, the waiter just asked us how many people and then went straight to the back/kitchen area without coming back for a while. Especially that we notice there was a an empty tables that can be seated for 3 tables. It was until an older lady came out (possibly the owner) and told us that someone already made reservation for the bigger tables. And the give us a ready tidy table for 3 people. 

Anyways, we were looking at the menu to see what we want to eat for dinner. Took a while until someone came to us to get our order since it was busy. The owner came to our table get our order. She was pretty loud but funny. She was the only person getting the orders for each other while other workers just bring out food. 

These are the foods that i tried:
Homemade hotcake(this dish came out really quick since the owner was yelling to the worker or just shouting out for this dish). Only had to wait couple minutes while the other dishes we had to wait a while. This dish was really good and yummy. It has that sweetness flavor. It came out really hot since it was in a hot pan looking thing. It was bite size (almost like bagel pizza but a little smaller) 

Hot & sour soup: thought it was good. It had that tangy taste flavor.

Pad thai with chicken(this was my main course while my bro and cousin had their own dish). Pad thai is always good no matter where you go. It has good amount of flavor. But compare to other restaurant, the plate and portion at this restaurant are kinda small

The prices here for dishes that we got are alright.

Anyways the foods made it worth it despite the wait.
author: Julie N.

description: Darling little Thai place that makes delicious angel wings! These are not your standard angel wings (i.e. not ground up meat coated in batter and then fried) - this is real chicken y'all, and it's delicious. The wings are spicy-sweet, with garlic and basil. They're so good, I almost considered ordering another round even though I was full. Note, these might be the angel wings from hell if you're on a diet. Every other item I tried here is pretty standard (mango salad and pot stickers with a green curry sauce). I dined here on a weeknight and was seated immediately. However, I've heard on the weekends this place is poppin' - fair warning.
author: Jennifer H.

description: It's a cute lovely place with great quality food. The tom yum soup was delicious but I have to admit that it was a bit too spicy. The pad Thai was excellent with good flavored chicken.
author: Nora E.

description:
I have to try this place out a few more times to decide how I truly feel about it but for the time being I will say there are a lot of great aspects here with a few fumbles as well. 
The atmosphere was great. Listening to the traditional Thai music was comforting & brought back memories of Thailand. The look is cozy & the decorations reminiscent of places in Thailand. Chairs could use some cushioning.
The food had stunning hits but also a few misses. 
I give Marnee on Irving St. 4 stars for the time being, because some of the dishes I had were beyond excellent. Way beyond. I can't give it a 5 stars because Marnee missed the mark on a few things a Thai restaurant should not miss the mark on.
author: Gilbey G.

description: I think this review would have been higher if the service was better. The place wasn't that packed yet it took the waiter about ten minutes to take our order. I had the pad Thai and it was really good, probably one of my favorites here in the Bay Area. I would come back but not for a lunch break, you would be late.
author: Kendrick K.

description:
Some guy walked out of here saying it was a shit show...and then I understood why. Though we got seated right away, it took about twenty minutes to order our entrees. There's only one person taking orders, and she was the HBIC. She screamed across the restaurant to order the other workers around. I thought it was inappropriate but it didn't seem to bother the other customers. It took another half hour for our orders to come. The wait times weren't too bad, but there's definitely a better way to run the restaurant. 
I also sat next to the kitchen so I saw and heard a lot of what was going on. At one point she took a small portion of food off a plate (I guess the serving size was too large), gave the plate to the customer, and continued to tell the customer that she purposely had the chef make the dish larger. That was a total turn off. 

The pad Thai was good, but won't be returning here because of the service.
author: Betty T.

description:
The Scene: A run-of-the-mill Thai restaurant
The Cast: The Usual Suspects... Papaya Salad, Satay, Pad Thai, Pad Kee Mao, Tom Yum, multi-colored curries etc
The Verdict: Unexciting and boring after years of repeated indulgence!

The foregoing is of course an awful and unfair judgment as I do recognize their popularity with the masses. While I love Thai cuisine, the ubiquitous presence of these usual suspects in most Thai restaurants is beginning to bore me. I picked Marnee Thai for a reason. It is not just another Thai restaurant. It does have all the usual suspects and then some.

Thai salad dressings are pretty generic. They are mostly an appetizing blend of refreshing, zesty flavors.  My taste buds tell me that whisking lime juice, fish sauce, sugar and ginger was the secret to most delectable Thai dressings. Instead of the hugely popular papaya salad, I opted for the cooked Calamari Salad ($8.95). The salad was fantastic with finely sliced red onions, lettuce and fresh herbs like mint leaves and cilantro. The star was of course the calamari, which believe it or not was tender instead of being chewy or rubbery. Imo, portion was skimpy and had there been more pieces of calamari to include tentacles, this would have been a perfect salad! (3/5)

Tom Yum is common whereas Po Tak ($11.95) is less so. This is a magnificent Thai seafood soup with sweet and sour overtones. In Marnee's rendition, the fragrant broth was the best part and the taste stemmed from the judicious use of ginger and lemon grass. The broth could be made mild or fiery depending upon your heat preference and stuffed with a good variety of fish and shellfish. I remembered imbibing this soup sold by a street vendor in Bangkok, with the heat factor being a double whammy... the heat from the soup (spiciness) and the heat from the scorching weather. But it was nevertheless gratifying, bordering on a self-inflicted masochistic perversion and a very sweaty forehead! (4/5)

Being a seafood lover, a fish dish seemed like a good idea. Well, not just any fish like salmon or catfish but maybe a fish native to Thailand. Basa Fillet ($13.95) popped right out in the Chef's Suggestion. Basa is indigenous to Indochina, which included Thailand. It is a white fish, mild in taste with a soft and flakey texture. Although classified as a catfish, it does not have any muddy taste, not at all. There were 3 different prep methods and the basa fillet topped with the spicy mushroom in curry sauce and coconut milk was our unanimous choice. We ordered it mild so everyone can savor how the pan seared basa could be such a culinary delight. (5/5)

There isn't much to talk about on the ambiance. Let me just describe it as a glorified hole-in-the-wall with a minimalist aesthetic approach. The bamboo panel on the left wall added some Thai flavor to the décor and the rest of the wall was adorned with some kitschy Thai artifacts. Tables and chairs were packed in like sardines although the white linen and table top orchids did lend a small touch of class. Service was pretty ho hum throughout our entire meal and we felt neglected especially since we were the only other table at 4pm.
author: Geoff G.

description: These people basically dress up Thai street food to make it look pretty for hipsters, and then charge a premium. They straight up try to hustle you by pushing the more expensive items on the menu as 'suggestions' and then ignoring your party in order to prioritize non-minorities under the assumption that they'll tip more. If you grew up in an Asian household or SE Asia, you'll know right away that this place isn't anything special. I honestly cracked up at their whole shtick and what they were trying to get at with their menu.
author: Zhi L.

description: The food is really good but their service was bad. They had us wait for over 30 mins once they got us seated and two parties came after us, got their orders taken and food brought to the table. Each of the staff member kept coming to us and said yes, ok , I will be back and none of the 4 peeps came back to take orders until I had to say that we have been waiting for over 20 mins and that is not nice. They didn't get water even after asking twice. I was a bit upset because this is my third time here and the service is usually good. I guess they were busy and didn't do a good job on time management and effiency. Their food quality is still the same - yummy.
author: Puja I.

description:
Came here for lunch and ordered their duck noodle soup ($10.92 including tax for their lunch time special) You can pick between different types of noodles (egg noodle, rice stick, etc). I opted for the rice stick noodles and they were perfectly cooked! 
However, after I finished my food, I was DYING of thirst. I didn't purposely drink any of the soup so I was a bit surprised. Also, there was very little duck meat inside so I was very disappointed. 
Overall, just an okay lunch but not worth it for the price. Maybe I'll try something else next time ): 
(RIP Jackie - too much thirst)
author: Jackie T.

description:
We are currently eating one of the dishes that we ordered (the stewed pork belly) after an HOUR AND A HALF of waiting. My hubby is beyond hangry at this point. They have been fulfilling togo orders before the sit in customers which isn't right. I'm not sure if it "tasting good" is worth the wait. Pad kee mao is seriously a few ingredients...ive never had to wait this long for thai food...for food in general. :(

If it's good....I guess I'll togo
author: Jenny K.

description: Randomly came across this thai restaurant today. Ordered a pad thai & some other dish, along with a thai iced tea. First of all, they forgot my thai iced tea but that's no big deal. The pad thai was a little sweeter than any pad thai i've ever tasted. Still thought it was delicious tho! The place was rather small but the decorations were nice. The price is on the higher side for thai food, but will probably visit again :)
author: Vita N.

description:
Came to this place to have some fried banana ( my fav thai desert) .. the lady came to me yelling saying that If I wanted to order desert I had to order a entree first.. that she couldn't do that for me.
I'm a food lover and I never heard that in my whole life! 
Horrible customer service! Zero stars to Marnee Thai food.
author: Karla R.

description:
Ordered red curry lunch special, vegetarian style. Lots of veggies, 4pcs of tofu. Decent portion for lunch. Watery curry, and no bamboo shoots (per description on menu).

Maybe their noodles are better?
author: Lily H.

description:
Came here for dinner and we ordered the following:

-Chicken Satay (Good)
-Pad Kaprow w/Chopped Chicken (Good)
-Roasted Duck (OK)
-Pad Thai (Just OK / too sweet)

*Friendly Services
author: Wendy L.

description: Best thai food i've fond outside of Thailand. Can be a little slow, especially for pick up orders. But worth the wait. Qualitatively better than any other thai restaurant. Better ingredients and better taste. Authentic!
author: Derek R.

description: This place is currently my favorite thai restaurant, but the customer service is ehh.. The food is more on the spicy side if you love spicy food and everything was great from salads to entrees! Will definitely come back and try other dishes.
author: Pam Ela Y.

description: So goooood!!!! Probably my favorite Thai restaurant in the city. The food is delicious and tastes like authentic Thai cuisine. It's a very tiny restaurant so there might be a bit of a wait during peak hours but it's very much worth it. The staff is super friendly and even though they may get a little distracted when it's busy, they never lose their friendly demeanor. It's beautifully decorated- the overall experience is extremely positive and I try and eat here at least once a week. I would highly recommend this place!
author: Ricky C.

description: 2.5 stars. It's edible. Sure. But when spending money for food outside my home I want it to be good!!! They have every standard Thai dish on the menu, but the execution is seriously lacking. I've been here twice (my mistake giving it a second try), and both times the food just didn't have the right balance of flavors in any of the dishes. That's what Thai food is about. Also the eggplant dish is totally mushy and blah, which is often my favorite dish at Thai restaurants. I wouldn't return again.
author: Jen B.

description: This used to be one of our favorite Thai restaurants. However, over the years, the quality has gone down. Whether it's Pad Thai, curry or other popular dishes, it no longer has that savory taste. Just above average.
author: Jeff N.

description: Marnee Thai is the go-to restaurant for Thai food in my neighborhood. I've been going to this place since many years and their food is usually high quality. However, I noticed in the last year, the red curry duck has barely any duck meat in it. I ordered this dish again to make sure it wasn't a fluke and noticed the meager portion of duck meat. There were many large pieces of pineapple and tomatoes, and just 4 to 5 small pieces of duck, half of which were mostly skin. I am very disappointed as this is not the red curry duck that I am used to from Marnee Thai! I would expect around 50% more duck in the curry dish. The same amount of meat if it were chicken or something else.
author: Katia H.

description:
Just a solid meal with the lady. 

I had heard about this place from another friend and I was not letdown at all. This spot here on Irving is nice. There is limited seating but don't let that fool you. The food was my expectations. I decided to get the Pad Kee Mao with beef. It was another great selection. The taste of the meal was very much consistent with other places in which I have had this meal.

The thai tea was excellent. Just well made and the right about of sweetener. I love me so Thai tea. Had some soup here as well. I do not recall what the name of the soup was but there is a picture. I know that it was made with coconut oil and shrimp. Whatever it is...IT IS FREAKIN AMAZING. I the soup itself is awesome. I had one serving because I had to make room for my meal but this is definitely a soup to learn how to make if you like this place. 

All servers and workers here are friendly. The cooking of the food is perfect. Be careful though, the food here comes hot. Not hot as in spicy but very warm food. Once the food is cooked thoroughly it is placed on a place and served. Remember to blow on your food just a bit to cool it down. Unless you can HANDLE THE HEAT!!! Also be mindful of the spicy dishes as well. 

The decorations on the wall here are also a nice touch as well. Lots of elephants!! For those of you who know why, YOU ARE COOL!!! For those who do not, look up the history.

Side not, this is the ORIGINAL MARNEE THAI not the one on 9th ave. 

Just some good chow for my eager stomach. Don't me shy, this place is cozy!
author: Robert F.

description:
Whenever I crave Thai food, this is always the spot I head to. It's always such a pleasure coming here, I love the décor and ambiance here plus the waiters are always super nice and friendly.

I've sampled my fair share of things here but here are a few that stand out:
- Mango salad (with soft shell crab): I don't like ordering salad when I eat out because I never think it's worth it and it never fills me up, but I saw good review for this and was trying to be low-key healthy haha. And it was awesome! Everything tasted fresh and I got a good amount of mango, avocado, and crab :) And it was definitely enough to fill me up so major thumbs up!
- BBQ Pork: Friend got this last time I came and this was definitely my go-to entrée back in the day. Soooo flavorful!

Would not recommend the imperial rolls, they were pretty tiny and pretty average IMO.
author: Jingxi Z.

description:
I ordered my food to-go and through Yelp, which went smoothly.

If you love spicy food, this is a great restaurant that literally spices up your food up! I got the flat rice noodle with beef and vegetables and requested it to be very spicy and they weren't kidding! I underestimated Thai spice and noted it for future reference.

The only thing that was a pain was trying to find parking to get my food.
author: Aj C.

description:
I got the pad kee mao and it was pretty good, even good when eating the leftovers.
The place is pretty small so had to wait a little to get a seat but it wasnt a long wait at all .
I also got a thai tea which i would not recommend since it was super watered down and did not taste like thai ice tea .
Love thai food and this place was satisfying!
author: Julia K.

description: There's better Thai food, this place wasn't worth it. The pumpkin in the pumpkin curry wasn't even soft.
author: Connie H.

description: This is my go-to restaurant in the Sunset, and may be my favorite restaurant of all time. Here's why: I grew up on Chinese food but find the Chinese food in the Sunset disappointing.  Marnee Thai never disappoints!  Order anything and it's perfect.  Find your favorites and you'll be compelled to re-order them many times. (BBQ chicken and Thai Fried Rice with a side of Cucumber Salad.) Secondly, the people who work at this location are so pleasant and accommodating.  I never have to wait more than a half-hour for takeout.  I never feel unimportant or ignored as I do in so many other SF restaurants.  Five stars all the way.
author: Lisa E.

description:
Really good prices for SF, and some of the best tasting Thai food I've had in a long time!

However...at first I hated this place. When I first came in for an early dinner on a Friday night with friends, it smelled like wet dog in here. I was hesitant to stay to eat, but at that point I was just so damn hungry that I didn't care if there was potentially any mildew in my food.

Good thing that Marnee only went up from there, and eventually the stench went away (no clue if whether it was the restaurant's fault or not in the first place, I'd like to give them the benefit of the doubt). Marnee has a big menu with a lot of vegetarian options. I got to try both the vegetarian pad thai and the tofu pumpkin curry and both were a total blessing. Back in the Castro Valley area I had been enduring disappointment after disappointment in trying to track down good Thai food, but Marnee was my light at the end of the tunnel! Everything was well cooked, well presented, and *so* flavorful. My only complaint would be that service was a bit on the slow side.

If you're in the area and looking for some good Thai food, give Marnee a try! Though it may not provide the strongest first impression, the food will have you very glad that you stayed.
author: Desiree S.

description: Pretty standard Thai food. Nothing blew me away. I did not like that there was a minimum order per person (this is different from credit card minimum). Service was meh' the server told us that we had to order more food in order to meet the minimum. We had already ordered two dishes.
author: April Y.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night recently. Food was good as usual, but I'm taking two stars away because the customer service was horrible. Waiteress came over to take our order and my friend was in the middle of telling her what he wants, and the waiteress decided to ignore my friend and talk across the restaurant to a coworker about something I can't understand because she was talking in Thai. After she was done, she did not apologize for being rude. She finished her converstaion, turned around to our table and did not say a single thing. The entire table was silent for a second because we were all shocked at how rude she was, and was expecting some kind of apology, or at least for her to say something..anything but she just stood there so we continued placing our order. 

My other friend was placing her order and said she wants her dish without eggs and garlic, and the waiteress said "ohh..you shouldn't be this picky." Are you serious?! I'd understand if this place specified that customizing your dish is discouraged due to the small kitchen and it'll delay food coming out (some places do that and I'm okay with it) but this place did not. 

Marnee Thai, yes you have 1000+ reviews, but with customer services like that, people will not be coming back. I won't be.

For me, a place can offer okay food and have amazing customer service and I'd want to come back because I want to support the business and the people behind it. But if a place offer amazing food, but bad customer service that'll ruin the entire dinning experience for me. It makes me feel like they know they offer good food so they can treat people however they want knowing they'll still come back because the food is just that good - that's how I felt at Marnee Thai.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Great flavors across all dishes.
Fast and friendly service.
Visually delightful presentation.
Get the mango sticky rice dessert, yummy!
author: David H.

description: Ordered pad Thai and on their menu it says it's 12.95 but I ended up having to pay 14.95...not sure why. I've had better Thai food.
author: Jackeline B.

description: We are looking forward to our next visit! Thank you for great service, great atmosphere, great prices and some of the best Thai food we've had.
author: BrianBethany H.

description: Can never go wrong here. Our goal living near it is to try everything on the menu! They bring Thai cuisine to a new level with taste, flavor and variety. It's my favorite Thai place of all time!
author: Ishani S.

description: Loved the pad Thai and the coconut milk soup. The server seemed put upon in the beginning but warmed over the course of the meal.
author: Alissa F.

description:
Pretty good overall -- nice, clean, cozy place. 

Can't here after venturing around the city. I walked in and it was pretty packed. Perfect timing though since they were able to sit 6 of us within 5 minutes. I do think the place is pretty squishy. My group and I ordered a few things. 

Appetizers - I recommend starting out with some fish cake and imperial rolls. Have to try more when I come back. 

Pad Thai - tasty. I usually get a side of peanut butter sauce to add some flavor. 

Pad Sew Ew -I recommend getting the chicken. More tasty than the beef. Maybe it was the way they cooked it but we compared and the beef had less flavor. The noodles were perfectly cooked as well. 

Mango fried rice - It was okay compared to the others I've had. I like pineapple fried rice better. 

Sticky mango rice - I was disappointed they ran of regular sticky rice so they substituted it with black rice -- it was still pretty tasty just not as sticky. 

Overall I had a great experience. Service was great and the food came out pretty fast. They have a nice set up as well. I would come back here to try their curry!
author: Abigael M.

description:
Probably a 3.5 star place but hard to say without followup.

A bit on the cramped side yet warm and welcoming. I've never had Bassa so it was a must-try, and it was really good. The Angel Wings were good but nothing that rocked my world. I'd try this place again.

Listing says not wheelchair accessible but I got in, albeit a tight fit.
author: Dennis R.

description: This is one of my favorite Thai food place in the city. The food is authentic, tasty and delicious. Their popular dish is the Angel Wings and we order that every time we come dine here. We also like the Crab Pad Thai or Crab Fried Rice, which isn't on the menu but you can ask them to make it. Both dishes are very tasty. The curry dishes are also good. The papaya salad and the mango salad are all very good. Customer services is great. The owner is very friendly and likes to come around to chat with her customers. The waitress and waiter dress in traditional Thai clothing. The interior has many Thailand decoration, so you really feel like you are dining in Thailand. However dining here with a large group can be a problem because the restaurant is small, so it is really hard to accommodate large parties. So I suggest coming here with smaller group of only 5-6 people. The wait time for dinner can be around 30 minutes since the place is small. So best time to go there for dinner will be before 6pm to beat the crowd. I have to note that the portion of the dishes are a lot smaller now compare to a few years back but I'll still come here when I want food Thai food.
author: Sandy A.

description:
This restaurant in the Outer Sunset has the UMPH that the Inner Sunset location doesn't seem to have and I don't mind driving a little further to get a better meal. Nonetheless, both Marnee Thais are great. I just prefer this one.

You Must Order:
Chan Pad Poo- The best, best, best!!!! Think of Pad Thai minus the shrimp w/ an added spicy kick! This noodle dish is topped with lumps of crab meat. Need I say more? You can thank me later.

Enjoy!
author: Briana H.

description:
I seriously don't understand how this food gets good ratings.  I just ordered in 3 dishes which were barely edible.  The worst Thai I've had.  The pad se ewe had cauliflower in it but no chinese broccoli.  the eggplant was barely cooked.  everything had shitty second rate mushrooms.  None of the dishes had any flavor. 
Do not order for delivery!! maybe its better when you eat at the restaurant, but i won't be risking my time or money checking that out.
author: Galen J.

description: Stopped by for lunch before heading into ggp.  We ordered the Thai potstickers with green curry, pad see ew and basil pork.  Everything was delicious.  The curry works great with the potstickers.  Service was friendly.
author: Linda L.

description:
Marnee Thai was the BEST Thai restaurant in the San Francisco Bay Area. Me and my boyfriend went there for dinner based off a recommendation from one of our friends. We were celebrating our two year anniversary and were excited for the experience! 

The staff was warm and welcoming when we walked through the door. Bright smiles and showed us to our table. There was a sense of elegance with the server pulling out the chairs for both of us. 

The food was TOP quality. I would definitely recommend the Kang Dang (red curry) and the Pad Thai. Both were really good and prepared to perfection! 

I would recommend this restaurant to any one that is a local, Bay Area traveler or tourist. And one last thing....the Mango with sticky rice is AMAZING!!  I can't wait to go back for more.
author: Chris C.

description:
where do i even begin? 

long story short: i'd pass on this spot. 

came in on a recent sunday evening, visiting sf from out of state, and looking for a good thai spot on yelp. this place had over a 1000+ mostly good reviews, so i thought, "why not?"

WRONG DECISION.

first of all, the space is tight, and the tables seem as though they are packed like sardines. like no room if there's a party waiting to be seated before you at the door kinda packed. but i'm willing to overlook that, after all, you can't judge a book by its cover right?

ugh. 

also, the employees really are hovering around you, shouting across the room, making the environment a very difficult spot to converse with the rest of your party. very abrasive.

as for the food, it was ok? the red curry was better than the green, but i've had better at other places. it was also awkward that the waitress started scooping rice into my plate -- was confused there for a second as i've never had had that happen in tons of restaurants i've been too. 

OH AND THE BATHROOM. EWWW!!! i didn't go after someone else in my party went and came back telling the rest of us that if we didn't have to go, DON'T. THE BATHROOM'S FILTHY -- like next level filthy. apparently, the soap hasn't been changed for years that it's become a lotion like consistency that you have to pool for from above by opening the canister. judging from other reviews, it seems like this has been the state of the bathroom for 5+ years, at least. 

i'm not one to throw around one-star reviews like candy, but it's unfortunate that this was my experience. 

IT'S EVEN MORE UNFORTUNATE THAT THIS WAS MY BIRTHDAY. i've been to many a thai restaurants, but this was definitely an experience i've never had. :(

needless to say, i won't be back if i'm ever in the area again.
author: Hamza M.

description: Really nice ambience and food!! We loved the green curry and a noodle dish. Did not like the pad thai much though.
author: Kiran C.

description: This restaurant has been in business for a long time -- and I know why now.  They have two locations in the Sunset (Inner & Outer) and both places serve the best Thai dishes!!!  Their lunch specials are reasonable -- I especially luv the diced basil chicken over rice dish, grilled pork chop over rice dish, samosa, pad thai.  The only bummer is that their curry dishes are at dinner (a la carte) prices, but worth getting cuz they taste so good!  I haven't tried their desserts yet...I have my eye on the fried banana and coconut ice cream the next time I'm there....can't wait!
author: Kristina T.

description: Something in menu Thai tea leaf salad is awful because Thai doesn't have tea leaf salad!  Staff is horrible
author: Moe R.

description:
One of my favorite Thai restaurants. They have two locations in the sunset but this one has the cute theme going it could be a nice date night restaurant. 

The Curries are delicious, my personal favorite is Panang and the angel wings are yum.
author: Yas J.

description:
The som tum was delicious,  it had a good mixture of sweet and lime dressing. The sticky mango was also good and fashionable! 
Service was fast and prompt.
Atmosphere was nice, bamboo roof gives it a beach house vibe.
author: Em S.

description: solid place, with really tasty pad thai and because my gf loves all things veggie, she especially sang about the eggplant. Not sure what potion they Putin their special iced tea, but I knocked back 3 of those babies, which is saying a lot since I usually stick to a Thai beer. Their red curry with prawns was also a winner, sop it up with the rice. Their rolls as apps were also pretty killer, a bit on the greasy side but if you get fried food, I guess there's really no way to make it less oily. We'd go back, but I love Thai food and usually stoked to try out new places. By the way, the prices were also low, especially for the amount they give.
author: Mack L.

description:
I first came to Marnee Thai about 6 years ago. I wasn't super familiar with Thai food back then, but I did like what we ate. Years later, after many Thai meals, I'm now a little more versed in Thai cuisine. Back in July 2012, I decided to take the roommate to Marnee Thai. We ordered:

*SPICY ANGEL WINGS: deep fried chicken wings sauteed with chili garlic sauce, topped with crispy basil
*TOM YUM with Chicken: spicy and sour soup with mushroom, tomato, lemongrass and a touch of lime juice
*BEEF SALAD (NAM TOK): beef with mint leaves, cilantro, onions, toasted rice powder in spicy lime dressing
*PAD KAPROW (Chopped Chicken): sauteed with fresh chili, garlic, bell pepper and thai basil
*KANG KEAW (Green Curry) with Pork: spicy green curry with coconut milk, long purple eggplant and thai basil
*PAD THAI: fried rice stick noodles sauteed with prawn, bean curd, egg, bean sprout, green onion and ground peanuts

The angel wings really are delicious! I love their chili sauce! The tom yum was flavorful and comforting. What I look for in a soup! I love green curry and this satisfied my craving. And of course, the roommate always gets pad thai and pad kaprow. Those are actually his two favorite dishes. The only thing he didn't really care for was the texture of the chopped chicken. I know he prefers the chicken to have a finer chop.

I do wish Marnee Thai delivered as I would have their food more often. I guess I'll just have to make my way to Outer Sunset the next time I'm craving their angel wings!
author: Elena N.

description: Our food was fresh and delicious, very flavorful; they kept the water glasses filled and were very nice. Two birthdays were celebrated while we were here,we enjoyed ourselves.
author: Yvonne R.

description: I prefer the one on 9th. This one is waaay too compact. When we went here, it was super crowded and loud. I could barely hear my husband from across our tiny table. Our waitress was also flamboyant, which made the experience less enjoyable. Go to the one on 9th.. it's much better in every way!
author: Steph L.

description: Came here tonight for the first time with a friend. GREAT SERVICE (polite) but tight space. My friend ordered the spicy pork and loved it. I wasn't too thrilled about my panang curry beef. It tasted like pot roast instead of the red creamy curry sauce I was expecting/used to. Maybe they messed up my order? The beef needed more spice. A little bland. Wouldn't recommend that dish but would recommend the spicy pork if you are into that (#37 on the menu).
author: Priscilla Q.

description: One weekend, I walked up to Irving to hunt down some bun cha Hanoi, but Loi's was closed and I ended up wandering around the block. One thing led to another and I went into Marnee Thai, hoping to satisfy my curiosity. It was a pleasant surprise as I didn't have to wait for a table, the ambiance was great, the decor was tasteful, and the food was authentic. Green curry and pad kee mao had just the right amount of kick and Thai ice tea was indulgently sweet. Two entrees are a lot of food for two people, so value wise, Marnee Thai is a great deal.
author: Chii L.

description: After driving all the way from San Jose to this place for khanom krok coconut milk dessert that I was craving for, I was so disappointed for the one found here because it didn't taste so authentic. And was pricey for the quantity they give compared to other places. So it was not a worth drive for me to come this long for this dessert.
author: Nayana V.

description: My favorite Thai place in the city.  It's tiny inside so peak hours can be tough to get a table, but getting take out from there is money.  Love their noodles (Chicken Pad Thai and Pad See Ew are great).
author: Alex P.

description:
This place is alright. Haven't found better Thai food in the sunset yet, so it will do. Very small restaurant, the tables are super close together, and the staff even brushed up against me a few times. It was pretty loud in there kind of a hectic vibe. Since the place is so small, it can be a pretty long wait on weekends.

The food was pretty good though. We got the lettuce wrap special, yellow chicken curry, and some type of spicy meat dish as well. I would give the food 3 stars. Definitely not the best Thai food I have ever had, but if you want Thai, this place will do the job.
author: Hayley D.

description:
I don't know why this place has high ratings but it ranks one of the worst Thai places on my list.

Pad Thai and pad see ew: dry, bland and barely any veggies. Either there were no sauce or they put a teaspoon worth, but it was so bland that hot sauce couldn't even help. Only had 3 broccoli pieces in pad see ew and chicken pieces were tough aka dry as well. Pad Thai needed a lottt of lemon to make it somewhat flavorful, but still didn't help. 

Overall, I only had a couple of bites and couldn't even finish 1/4 of it because of how terrible and bland it was. The ratings here are deceiving and I would never come back.
author: Angela T.

description:
Marne Thai was recommended to us by a friend.  We got there a little after 5 & the place wasn't too busy.  We had 5 adults and 4 children. 

When we first walked in, the place is tiny.  The walls and roof are covered in bamboo & it feels like you are in place far from the city.  

The service was not the most friendly, but they were very quick with our appetizers and drinks.  The appetizers are a little bit expensive for the amount you get.  We ordered the samosa triangles, imperial rolls and Thai potstickers.  They each cost $9 for 4 to 6 pieces.  The rolls and the potstickers were worth it!

Our food came out quickly.  The kids shared chicken pad Thai and Thai fried rice.  The kids couldn't get enough.  They loved it & the portions are great to split for little kids.

The rest of the food was SOOOO good!  The wild sea bass with curry is so flavorful!  We also had roast duck, chicken satay wraps and duck curry.  This is the best Thai place I've ever been to!

It would have been 5 stars, but the place got very busy and cramped as they try to fit in as many people as possible.  It's hard if you have to take a kid to the bathroom.  When we finished, there was quite a line!  If you can, get there early.  

I wished we lived closer so I could order takeout!
author: R T.

description:
Recommend: red curry with duck, Tom yum soup, and papaya salad 

Great Thai food with a clean finish. Left feeling satisfied and not overstuffed. The inside is beautifully decorated to make you feel like you're in a hut. Perfect to order family style
author: Hanna K.

description: Beautiful interior! It's as if you walk into a different unique world once you step in. Although the place is tight, it's cozy and you can still enjoy a meal with friends despite sitting only inches away from another party. Had the pad thai, pad see ew, and mango sticky rice for dessert. Food was delicious, but I can't say it the best food EVER. Still a great spot to satisfy those Thai food cravings!
author: Jocelyn C.

description:
We went yesterday around 5pm to this place that was recommended to us. The food was kinda ok ,nothing special. Green mango salad was awful as well as tom yum soup. Pad Thai was ok. But the worth part was customer service !!!The waitress was rude ,and wanted us to leave quickly. 
Also , it's expensive !This is more like a small eatery place  with tables so close to each other that you can barely move.
author: Mariya S.

description: Best Thai food and service in the sunset and possibly all of san francisco! Highly recommend the chefs special.
author: Ed L.

description:
Pretty good/standard Thai restaurant! 

(+)
- avocado shrimp salad; sounds so basic, but very flavorful, creamy (from the avo) and has a lot of texture throughout from the cashew and mango. This is usually a must-order when I'm here!
- pad kee mao; moist and flavorful wide flat noodles with a mild kick!
- red curry; bamboo shoots, thai basil and your choice of protein. Love this over rice.
- mango sticky rice; probably my favorite Thai dessert!
- angel wings; sweet, sticky, crispy and flavorful! 
- pad thai

(-)
- pad see yew is one of my go-to thai dish, but I don't think this place makes a good one. Dry and bland! (go for the pad kee mao!)
- tables are pretty close together
author: Kris C.

description: The worst customer service, and the manager of the restaurant lied to my face. I came in to order take-out, with only one seated table, I figured it I'll be out of there in no time. The place got busy and they served every single table that came after me, then lied that they had ordered ahead of me or are just having appetizers as if I can't see for myself that they had their entrees as well. Instead of apologizing, the manager said 10 more minutes without even looking at me, and then laughed it off with her staff. Very disappointing to say the least.
author: Smirne D.

description: Brought home delicious take-out last night from Marnee Thai. Great food! We ordered the Pineapple Fried Rice which was moist and full of pineapple chunks. Red curry with chicken was creamy and well spiced, just what we asked for. Then we had a thin, red, vermicelli noodle dish - the name escapes me now - it was fabulous too! We topped it off with sticky fried rice with fresh mango chunks. Delish!
author: Donna R.

description: Red curry with duck.  This place has excellent service, quick, polite and courteous. The portion sizes are reasonable. And they always give you extra rice if you take some home.
author: Jesse S.

description:
The beef in the beef pad see ew is delicious! Other places give you tough, thinly sliced meat. Not this joint! The noodles are good, but a little flavorless. Grabbed the chili jar and woo mama, that's spicy. Yum.

The fried rice with chicken sausage was just ok. Nothing special.

The roti paratha was greasy (as usual) but the sauce here is better and more flavorful than most other places. The cucumbers on the side were delicious and a refreshing compliment.

Ambiance is a cozy, homey mom & pop spot. Weekend late lunch was busy but not too crowded. Service was prompt despite being busy; my water cup never went empty. Overall, I don't think I'd go out of my way for it, but if you're in the area I'd recommend this restaurant.
author: Cat C.

description: Horrible horrible horrible service in the entire world please avoid these place just for these disgusting service
author: John N.

description:
This place is the cutest little Thai restaurant I've ever laid eyes on! It's in the middle of a strip of random Chinese stores and groceries (reminds me of Chinatown, but less crowded). The outside looks like a little shack, but when you walk in, it's completely different! The place looks like a little hut inside, and the decor and ambiance is awesome. 

The menu is pretty large with a lot of variety. The first page lists the awards that the restaurant has received for their foods, which was very impressive! I followed the recommendations of my fellow Yelpers and ordered the Chan Pad Poo. It has the same type of noodles as Pad Thai, but this one is mixed with crab and egg and plenty of spice (note the stars next to menu items mean SPICE not favorites) The plate was about $12, but it was a huge serving and I ended up taking a good portion home, so definitely worth it! The plate is big enough where you can also go to this restaurant and treat it as family style. They lay out plates for you in case you wanted to do that. 

I'd go back here in a heartbeat and make it one of my regular spots if I lived closer!
author: Tsyria T.

description:
I too would agree with several others reviews.  The service at Marnee Thai was rude, and it doesn't matter about the food at this point.  We came into the restaurant when the place was almost empty.   The host wanted to seat us against the wall, and I asked if our 3 top could sit in a center table with more room.  He said no.  Nobody ever sat at any of the 4 center tables the entire time we were at the restaurant.   So, why would these people not let anyone sit down in the center tables with more room?  I will never know because it's the last time I will be there.  Make sure that you ask for the center tables on your visit to enhance the dining experience!  The guy kept saying.... "or you can sit over her (against the wall)." 

At this point, my gut said to leave this place.  We felt the rush as we our server hovered over us.  This lunch was not relaxing at all.   I  need some asprin.

As far as the food goes, it was ok.  But it was most certainly not as good given the rudeness of the employees. 

Did I mention the dirty spoon and the awful bathroom? 
My daughter told me the bathroom was soooooo dirty. 

And we're walking.....
author: Hot O.

description: Was there a few times and always find 'mistakes' in my bills with extra items in their favorite.  Crooked business practice.  My advice is to avoid this place, but if you must, make sure to double check your bill.  BEWARE.
author: Harrison W.

description: if i could i wouldnt give a last star because Service is very poor Especially the fat woman..I can't believe it's a restaurant with four stars food（3/5） service0point...will not return .
author: Jeff C.

description: My first order of Tom Ka soup didn't have any tofu in it and then the second batch that I received had a mysterious and gigantic insect leg in it. NEVER AGAIN.
author: Christy T.

description:
Grubbin. Manager with short hair is super sweet and gave me a big tea to drink the other day when I came in for my take out from the pouring rain. 

I always get the pad si ew beef. It's awesome. I love the duck salad too. Samosa triangles are tasty.
author: Katie K.

description:
The best Thai food I've ever had in the Bay Area!

The angel wings: 
very flavorful and tasty! Very crispy outside and moist inside. It has just the right amount of sweetness and spicy taste. I also love the hint of basil. 

Mango salad with shrimp/ soft-shell crab: 
It's a very decent salad. Very refreshing and flavorful.
author: Evelyn W.

description: Had the red curry with roasted duck, nothing short of amazing. My friend ordered the roasted duck salad and it was very very delicious ( A lot of duck I know ). The service here was spectacular and you get a cozy "home" feeling with the "Thai Big Mama" walking around making sure you're enjoying your meal here :) I lived in the neighborhood for years and have never dined here until tonight. This spot will now be my go-to for Thai food. 5 out of 5 stars.
author: d n.

description: Worst experience in my entire life! Had to wait 15 mins. for ice water.  Waited for 45 minutes for our food and still hasn't arrived!  Owner says that the corn cakes takes a long time to make!  She then tells me that they have a lot of to-go orders.  I respond with "so you take care of your to-go orders before your in house guests?  Also a table was sat about 15 mins. after me was already digging into their dish! What the?  After one hour of being there, I couldn.t take it anymore!  I asked for my bill for my thai ice coffee and told them to cancel my order! The owner said your food is coming.  At that point I just left some money for my coffee stormed out the door! Never again, will I return to this place! Everyone, please don't make the same mistake I did and come here.  I used to come here for over 30 years, what a way to treat your long time guest!  Thanks a lot Marnee Thai!
author: Tony L.

description:
Hmm hmmm I tried this place a while ago. I love the service, like the food, don't dig the claustro-feels the place gives me.

This place is SMALL. Literally small. And it gets busy, so a lot of the tables are really close to one another. It was so snug that I had no space between myself and the table. Ehhh. Definitely not the kind of restaurant that claustrophobic people should go to.

Their menu is similar to any Thai restaurant, in which it has varieties of curry, salads, meats, vegetarian dishes, etc. They have a lunch and dinner menu, with prices being higher for the dinner portion.

Ordered the following: 

Curry & noodle lunch special: The noodles for my dish were kinda... Soggy? They used rice noodle, but I was expecting it to be a little more dryer and flavorful. But alone it was bland. I practically dumped all my curry onto it hoping that it would give it some flavor but it didn't. It just made the noodles extremely more hotter (hahaha) but really it did. 

Mango fried rice: I liked the fried rice, it was savory meets sweet in my mouth. There were huge chunks of mango, which is a big plus because no one wants less mango in their mango fried rice.

Ordered a beef dish but i forgot what it's called lol. Overall it is an okay joint. But in my preferences I would rather try somewhere else.
author: Jerianne G.

description: This place is truly special. The staff is amazing and welcoming, they have great attention to detail and most importantly the food is the best of the best when it comes to Thai food.
author: Shawn B.

description: Great service & very accommodating. Delicious appetizers & entrees. Loved the Whole Coconut with Juice. Angel wings were very crunchy & finger-licking good. The Tom Kha gai soup was very generous with meat. The Larb was refreshingly tart & minty. The Padthai had the right sweet & sour sauce. The Mango Fried rice was very original. Will be back soon
author: Carol L.

description:
My sister & I stopped by here while in San Francisco. We got the Angel Wings & the pad se ew. The angel wings came out first and they had a great flavor to them. Just the right amount of spice.

The pad see ew lived up to expectations. It's balance was just right and was pretty filling. I also liked the metal rice bowl that they use.

The service was good here too. I was completely dehydrated and they always kept my water full. If I'm in the area I'll be more than happy to come by again.
author: Arthur K.

description: We were celebrating my GFs bday. Party of 7. It was our 1st time here. We heard that they cooked for the Royal Thai family when they visited here, so we assumed it was going to be good. Boy, they did not disappoint. The Angel Wings were perfect, not too saucy with just a little kick of spicy. The spring rolls were so delish, we had to order another plate. Papaya salad and The Mango Salad w/ soft shell crab was to die for. The fish (forgot the name), and the pork belly dishes were insane! Also had the Phad Thai and chicken fried rice. For dessert, of course everyone recommended the sticky rice with mango. Yummy!!! OMG May, the owner, was the perfect host. Totally made us feel welcome. Felt like we were talking to one of our Auntie :) We will define be back. I will now compare EVERY Thai Restaurant to theirs. The bar has been set!
author: Johann M.

description:
I have no idea how this place has awards or great ratings. This would probably be the first time I was so disappointed in a Thai restaurant. Not nice restroom. Not nice staff. Super difficult to get vegan curry. One server kinda figured it all
out but all curries have fish sauce and or shrimp paste. Options for chili sauce
are not good. Mango fried rice was not even flavorful. Sigh. First time I've ever been so let down. Never coming back.
Get your vegan options and staff correct. Blah.
author: Mona R.

description:
Services are HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Food are overpriced and little
Overall, services are not satisfied, the attitude of servers are awful. And what's the matter?!
author: Annie Y.

description:
Tip of the day: Always ask your Uber/Lyft driver where the best neighborhoods to get certain cuisine located. 

Before I go into my review, I should probably explain my tip of the day, right? Well, I was informed by an Uber driver recently that the BEST place to go for Asian and Indian food was the Sunset district. Chinatown for Chinese food? He laughed in our faces! Don't be fooled, he said, you won't want to walk into half of the places, but they will offer you the best food out there. Wise words, indeed. 

I happened to be near Golden Gate park and was craving some Thai food so I walked over to Marnee Thai. I wasn't starving, per say, so I kept it light. I ordered the chicken wing appetizer along with the avocado salad as an entree. The chicken wings didn't specify whether they were spicy or not and I love me some spice so I requested a few extra chiles be thrown on there. They were more sweet than spicy, but good wings nonetheless. The avocado salad was great and left me feeling satisfied. The salad included lettuce, cashews, prawns, avocado (by the motherload), mango, and some sort of sweet dressing. I'm not sure what was in the dressing, but I would recommend getting it on the side as they drowned my poor salad in it. 

On another note, service was rather slow, but it is what it is. The waitress/hostess were very helpful. 

Would I check this out again? Probably, but I'd get some noodle dishes maybe even a Thai iced tea to see how it compares against other places in the Bay. 

Future updated review coming your way soon!
author: Denisa R.

description:
Pad Thai- always a good choice. It was especially good here. They made it the right amount of spicy, it was a good portion, and shrimp were bomb. The only slight modification I would make would be to put more things in it; some veggies or maybe some chicken two (only 4 shrimp- could use a little more protein). 

Not a big complaint, just felt like I was carbo loading in the end (on tasty noodles though!)
author: Kelly G.

description:
Food: Pad Thai- too sweet, beef red curry- too sweet, green bean beef- too sweet, chicken kaprow- good flavor but too salty. 

Service: Poor. Waitresses were yelling what was available/not available on the menu across the length of the restaurant!

Very disappointed with experience.
author: Qutie F.

description:
Marnee Thai is my family's favorite Thai place in the city. I've been here a bunch of times growing up so we've tried many things on the menu... but a few of the highlights:

Spicy Angel Wings - deep fried wings sauteed with a house chili-garlic sauce and topped with crispy basil, I love the flavor of these juicy wings.

Chan Pad Poo - rice noodles stir fried with crab meat, eggs, and chili garlic sauce, the noodles are similar to the type of noodles used in Pad Thai. This dish has great flavor and I love the crab. 

Kang Keaw - green curry with eggplant and thai basil, served with a choice of beef, chicken, pork, or prawns. The curry has great flavor, creamy and they make it as spicy as you like it.  

The place always gets pretty packed in the evening around dinner time, but it's a plus that they take reservations! The staff is very friendly and accommodating, but beware that the owner tends to yell when waiting the tables, but this is just her style and I guess it works.
author: Elaine N.

description:
You can't go wrong with anything at this small hole-in-the-wall. Their angel chicken wings & roasted duck are the best Thai food I've ever had! The angel wings are sweet & has a hint of spice. The duck is perfectly glazed with a honey-texture sauce. These dishes are must-try's! 

The service is quick & efficient & the employees are really nice & welcoming.

Wait times can vary on days & times you go but it can get pretty busy during weekends & lunch/dinner hours. The wait is worth it if you have to wait! Parking is tricky since its located on busy Irving.
author: Trisha G.

description: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in the Sunset District. They've got two locations, both are great, but they're also both very small - so you may have to wait for a table. Everything tastes like what I remember from all of my favorite Thai restaurants all around the US, as well as Thailand. Don't be afraid to try their specialties, even if they're a little weird. They're all delicious. The tables are small, so it may be problem fitting all of your food on there - like it was for my wife and I - but the upside is that it's great for conversation. Solid choice for a first date and it's easy to find parking. Try their Nam Tok, Sticky Rice, Tom Yum, and Chicken Wings. All fantastic.
author: Byron E.

description:
I've had food delivered from Marnee Thai countless times, but I'll never do so again. There are many other Thai restaurants in San Francisco that provide good, dependable, edible meals.  

I typically order my food medium spicy with extra spice on the side, in case it's too mild. Tonight, my food was so burning, extra spicy that it was inedible. I let the GrubHub delivery staff know. They said that the restaurant refused to address my issue.

As a result, I've wasted my time, money and I'm sick to my stomach.

Frequent this restaurant at your own risk.
author: Samuel H.

description:
Never trust them on when to come pick up your food. They say 20-25 minutes but it regularly takes 45 minutes. They make you stand in a dark toilet hall for 20 minutes not giving a damn about your time!

Food is Ok. But again, never trust them on time.
author: Jacob J.

description:
We came here for lunch with family and this place rocked.

Parking: Street metered. We found a good spot, but you may have to walk a bit to it.
Seating: A bit limited, and on a "hill", so call ahead and make a reservation.
Menu: Standard american thai options - pad kee mao, a few curries, pad thai, etc. Rice does not come with any curry, you have to pay extra for it, which was weird. 
Quality: Food looks great, is tasty and well priced. You can also ask them to make something custom or off-menu.
Ambience: Not a first date place. More to hangout and eat with friends/family that you know.
Overall: On my list to visit again.
author: Neil P.

description:
May, I believe who is the boss, made us know in a very rude way it was time to leave. It was busy on Saturday night and they wanted high turnover rate, they did not even ask if we wanted dessert.
Wrong choice if you want to have a relaxed dinner.
author: ELENA C.

description:
I discovered this place a few weeks back post-Outside Lands. My friend and I were hangry and we were craving some Pad Thai. Marnee Thai posted up as the top rated Thai place that was still open at like 9:45pm on a Sunday. 
The place is small and hole in the wall feel yet the staff is dressed in traditional Thai clothes. We had to wait a bit for our food to come out about 15 minutes even though we ordered the food 10 minutes in advance over the phone. 
The thai pad was on the more citrus side and I wish there was more of a tamarind flavor. Overall, it filled us up and the prices are fair for SF.
author: Casey B.

description:
God I love Marnee. It's incredibly consistent, and the flavors are always good - I think you can probably order absolutely anything off the menu and be satisfied. My particular favorites are the Thai tea leaf salad, satay lettuce wraps (a must must appetizer -- build your own lettuce wraps with satay chicken, sprouts, herbs, peanut sauce, etc. etc.), pod woon sen and green curry. 

The consistency also applies to the service, which is quick and friendly. Take-out also good. For very solid traditional Thai cuisine, look no further, hungry friends.
author: Elena K.

description: Hot damn that was good! We had the Pad Thai and Pad Garlic dishes. They were served really hot (temperature) and were both delicious. This place is located just across the street from the Golden Gate Park near the Academy. I wish I was hungrier so I could order more food.
author: Mike P.

description:
I came here for the first time a few days ago. The food here is delicious! I tried the Pad Thai and the Thai Style Fried Rice along with some Thai iced tea. The restaurant itself is well decorated and cozy. 

My only criticism is that the Thai iced tea is too sweet and our waitress was rushed and distracted while taking our order. She forgot an order but it was quickly fixed when brought to the staff's attention.
author: Shannon L.

description: Went here again recently and had a great time. Delicious food well served. One of my friends in the group has a disability that causes her to talk loudly and be hard to understand. The waitress was super patient to make sure she got to order exactly what she wanted. We enjoyed our meal. :)
author: Esther L.

description: It was easy to book our reservation. We walked in with the fragrance of calla lilies. It was cozy but clean. We orders appetizer first for the hungry kids, and they served quickly. Pad Thai was good, we orders #33, the eggplant, some fried rice, and the avocado salad with prawns. All very good!
author: Judy L.

description:
I went there and ordered green curry chicken with brown rice, and found raw chicken meat!  The owner argued that it looks cooked to her, but I have pictures to proof it is definitely raw on the inside and warbles like a jello.  Which if anyone knows about cooking chicken, it is raw.   Of course our neighborhood police station told me that's not their problem, and told me to somewhere else. 

Never again would I take a chance in my health, and will not go back in this lifetime.
author: DAVID T.

description:
I haven't eaten such delicious Thai food in a long time! Most places offer the same generic Pad Thai, Pineapple Fried Rice, or Yellow Curry for a reasonable price. 

I must say that for a little bit extra cash, Marnee Thai sure delivers the quality and taste. 

My friend and I ordered the Mango Fried Rice, Angel Wings, and Pad Kaprow. I'd agree with other reviews that the Angel Wings are reminiscent of the chicken wings from San Tung, but the Angel Wings are more saucy. Therefore, in this comparison, I'd still have to prefer San Tung, but these Angel Wings come close. 

Surprisingly, the rest of the meal including the Mango Fried Rice and Pad Kaprow were delicious. The Pad Kaprow had just the right amount of spicy kick that wasn't overpowering, but still conveyed a savory flavor of the pork. The Mango Fried Rice was also a beautifully savory dish, with a nice sweet touch with the Mango. I think if there were more Mango slices and were cut in smaller cubes, I believe it would have made the dish supreme.

The service was a more "home/mom-pop" atmosphere on the Sunday evening I dined at MT. There were a lot of huge parties and that resulted in the waiters/tresses screaming in Thai to one another about the next orders, seats, and drinks. Still, we were treated fairly and understood the staff was doing their best even though short staffed for a busy time.

If I'm not looking for a quiet/relaxing meal, want delicious Thai food, and in the neighborhood, I'll be coming back to MT for Round 2.
author: Jonathan T.

description:
I think this is possibly my favourite Thai restaurant now! 

Rarely have I entered a restaurant where the aroma of the dishes permeate the air and entice you to order everything on the menu. Please note that this is *very* different from those poorly ventilated restaurants where the dining area is stuffy and filled with smells and fumes that makes one wonder if one is sitting in the kitchen instead.

This time, I have to admit, their usually amazing Thai BBQ Chicken was a little less than sublime; but it was still good. I believe it might have spent a little more time than it should have on the counter, tapping it's finger, waiting for a server to "take her away."

I loved their green chicken curry. It is obvious that the meats and the vegetables have been simmering in the sauce for a good while, judging by how flavourful they were; many a times and oft have I eaten numerous green curries where the wonderful flavours manifests themselves only in the sauce, but nowhere else.

The stir fried chicken with bamboo-shoot (I forget the name, but it was #30 on the menu) made for a wonderful contrast to the curry. I have lost count of the number of times when two different dishes taste all too similar; especially when it comes to the coconut based sauce. This was not it. This was sharp, and pungent, with it's own distinctive spicy flavour.

My only grouse was their servings of steamed rice. The container is so huge, and the rice portions so small, we had to keep asking for more. I wondered if they were bringing in single servings of rice every time, in spite of the fact that there were three of us at the table. Anyway, that's too minor to ruminate over.

Before I forget, we had something called a "coconut mini cake" or some such, it was hot (temperature) and creamy and smooth with a sprinkling of corn on top. It was pretty good. I was rather surprised that the "angel wings" were not boneless; I am used to having them boneless and stuffed with meat, vermicelli, and a smattering of nuts. The green-curry pot-stickers were pretty good though it seems the 'green curry' merely meant it was served with the sauce poured on it; I thought the stuffing was going to be a green-curry based meat.

At $73 (incl tax) for three appetizers, three entrees, couple of drinks, and numerous rice trips, I think this was definitely value-for-money.

I can't wait to go back again (and try their Thai fried rice)!
author: Umesh T.

description:
Amazing! Had the chicken wing app, bbq duck, and crab noodles. 

Everything was amazing. I plan to bring my parents here
author: Elaine S.

description:
Not a huge restaurant so wait time can be on the longer side if they're full. The dishes are tasty which came in decent portions.

For the Pad See Ew that we had ordered for takeout, I thoroughly enjoyed the broken pieces of scrambled egg that clung on to the sauce. There was also this container of tangy, spicy garlic and peppers which brought out another level of umami to the food.
author: Julie L.

description:
Yesssss. How does such an amazing restaurant exist in what seems to be the middle of nowhere?! Our airbnb hosts recommended this place, so my traveling companion and I stopped by for a relaxing dinner.

We shared the pad kee mao with prawns. Amazing!!! Perfectly cooked prawns with the most perfectly seasoned spicy sauce. The noodles were a teeny bit overcooked imo, but it was negligible.

If I was nitpicking, I would mention that the serving sizes were smaller than the average Thai restaurant and that I was disappointed by the lack of prawns (only 3!) in the dish.

Other than that... Service was alright, they were perfectly cordial even though we came in somewhat close to closing time. The waitress did seem a bit put off that we were sharing one dish, but what do I care... We were saving room for dessert :P

Either way, the food was tasty enough to say that next time I'm in the area, I am definitely returning.
author: Michelle C.

description: I am always satisfied by Thai food. Had some soup and Thai style fried rice with duck and pineapple. This restaurant seems to have been around for a long time. It's pretty good. Prices are over-priced by a $1. Pretty cool tiki interior..located near 20th and Irving.
author: Denise C.

description:
I love this place. Best Thai food in the bay area. I have been coming here for years.
If it says vegetarian ask if there is fish sauce. 
Thai iced tea is a must.
author: Oliver K.

description: Ordered the pad kaprow, papaya salad and the green curry all with medium spicy level. I thought all of the dishes were very mild. They are a bit up and down with the spicy level, last time a medium was much more spicier. I thought the food was overall a little too salty. Good portion size though .
author: Yoomi C.

description: This is not my first pick up from this restaurant, and every single time I experience the same - not being on time! Whenever i come the food never ready and it always take more then 40 min, and when i come they say 10 min, after 10 min they say 15 min more! Sometimes I think just to stop picking up the food from this restaurant! I think to make customers wait is a baaaad idea!
author: Navfal A.

description: The red curry came with dark meat chicken which tasted terrible. I could not even eat it. The pad thai tasted good but there was barely any chicken. Also, they don't have sriracha which i like to add to my pad thai. The service was horrible, and the waiters were rude.
author: Vaibhav C.

description: I don't usually write a review but this one got me with their amazing food. We enjoyed every bit of the food they serve.
