Excellent flavor and believe me, all the dishes we ordered was out of this world. The only reason I gave 4 stars is because of their customer service. No greeting or visiting the tables that were sat. People were just left waiting for a server to come and greet them. Basically it's just when you are ready to order, you have to wait for them to see us. No one checked on us through our entire meal. That was bummer. Understandable they were getting busier but at least whoever was our server, should have followed on us as a courtesy. But overall I think I will go back again and again just for the food.
author: Poonam S.

description: I hate to give 3 stars but I found the food to be too pricey. The service is amazing, food is delicious but it felt too expensive.
author: Andrew K.

description: The green vegetable curry is so tasty I ordered one to go for my lunch the next day. I've only come twice, but liked both times I came :)
author: Ashley M.

description:
After seeing Marnee Thai on KQED's Check Please, I wanted to go and try this restaurant. We arrived there around 1 pm and snagged "rock star" parking right in front of the restaurant. This was a good sign! The place was full except for two 4 tops and two small tables. The waitress/host wanted to seat us in the back a the small corner table. I asked if we could sit at the one of the 4 top tables. She rejected that request. So we took the one of the small tables next to the front door. I usually order a lot of food and I knew it would be hard to fit all of the food on a small table. But we agreed because we were hungry and we where on the way to the Asian Art Museum for the Terra Cotta Warrior exhibit. 

The menu looked interesting with several specials on a separate sheet. We ordered 5 items:

Tom Yum Shrimp soup                    3/5 stars small portions lots of shrimp normal
                                                                               everyday run of the mill Tom Yum Soup
Chicken Larb                                     3/5 stars  regular chicken larb didn't wow
Special Satay Wrap                          2/5 stars  just chicken Satay with lettuce leaves
                                                                               and bean spouts and peanut sauce
Penang Pork Curry                           5/5 stars  the best dish full of flavor tender pork
Mango Sticky Rice                             4/5 stars nice warm sweet rice dessert.

The restaurant was busy, and the soup came first. As we were consuming our soup the Chicken Larb came which took up all the space of the small table. So we hurried up and finished up our soup. As the waitress took away the the soup bowls the Satay Wrap came. We asked for chopsticks 3 times with 3 different servers, it was not until the 4th time did they bring them. As we started trying the wraps and the larb the Penang Pork Curry came. Sorry no more room on the tiny table. I commented to the waiter that I had asked for a larger table that remained empty. He proceeded to put another small table next to ours and rearranged all the dishes. Very intrusive that did not have to happen.

For dessert we had the Mango Sticky Rice. It was good and I could feel that the servers were feeling awkward about having put us a such a tiny table. I am usually some what discreet about taking pics of my food but I wanted them to know this experience would be reviewed. 2.5 stars round up to 3 not worth driving to SF for.
author: George F.

description:
Amazing food, friendly staff, and cozy interior. Really enjoyed Marnee Thai and highly recommend. Their food is very authentic!

Oh, and don't forget to try their desserts, especially coconut ice cream -- good stuff.
author: Zhamal Z.

description:
Believe it or not, this is my favorite Thai restaurant regardless of the dreadful street parking in the Sunset. I lived in San Francisco for almost 20 years and I cannot believe I have not had a single Thai dish here!!!

My sister and her husband took me out to dinner here after an hour of cycling. I mean you can never go wrong with Thai food, worth wasting the calories burnt at the gym.

We ordered the Basa (Fish) Fillet with fresh garlic and pepper sauce, Shrimp Pad See Ew, and Satay Eggplant with Minced Chicken. Everything was delicious. Their Thai Iced Tea was refreshing. The decor was nice, simple and authentic. The lady who served us knew exactly what we wanted to order and had a few suggestions. You gotta love a woman who can suggest what's good to eat!
author: Johanna M.

description: Terrible service... had to ask for my first water 3 times and it was not like they were busy since there were only 3 table being served. Marnee Thai has really slipped over the years.
author: Brian T.

description:
It gets crowded in here, but it's worth it. 

Avocado Salad - This was on the specials menu. It had chunks of avocado tossed with shredded green mango, shallots, prawns and topped with toasted coconut. Couldn't really taste the coconut, but if you love avocado, you'd love this salad. I would ask for less dressing next time, because the flavor was quite heavy. 

Spicy Angel Wings - Apparently this dish is very popular, but I didn't find it any good. I wouldn't order this again. The flavor was a little off and I was done after one. I barely tasted the basil flavor. 

Spuc Mae Kuer - Sauteed eggplant with veggies...this was pretty good..but it LOOKS very unappealing. 

Mango Fried Rice - The fried rice really lacked flavor...but it complemented all the other dishes which were really flavorful. 

I would come back, but doubt I'll be craving anything from here.
author: Anna S.

description: This place was so yummy!  They have unique and flavorful vegetarian combinations.  We got the Pumpkin and Potato Samoas, Mango Fried Rice, and my favorite The Pad Thai!
author: Vanessa H.

description:
Food is good - 4 stars
Service - 3 stars

Coconut hotcakes are really special and delicious. I think it's made out of coconut milk and rice flour batter, cooked in a griddle, topped with corn, pumpkin, etc. They're lightly sweet, more on the savory side. All other main dishes are delicious. Service is non-existent bc they get really busy, but I'm ok with that. For lunch, try to arrive around noon or before to avoid the crowd/ line.
author: Irene S.

description: LOVE this place! Don't miss the corn cakes, but really everything is good.
author: J.r. F.

description:
I went here last week with a few friends and we showed up about 30 minutes before closing. They squeezed us in and we had the manager come over and personally take our order. She was so enthusiastic and nice that  you could tell that she takes pride in her restaurant and service.

The food was amazing. And well-priced for what you get. If you're looking for a great thai place or want to introduce someone to thai/siamese food, go here!
author: Zachary H.

description: Had high hopes for this place but I was disappointed! I ordered the tom yum soup, pad kee mao, roast duck, and chicken wings and not a single dish satisfied me. None of the servers greeted us with a welcoming smile either. Maybe I came on a bad day or something but I will not come back since I had better Thai food elsewhere.
author: Joyce C.

description:
I can't believe i haven't reviewed Marnee Thai. I've been coming here for years. I feel like i've commited a sin but taking so long to write a review.  I never had a dish i did not like.  I love the corn cakes the best! It's like a fried corn patty and it's sweet, you have to order this if you love corn.  The pad thai and pad see ew are both great dishes to get for lunch. I also love their crab fried rice, they do give you lots of crab and the fried rice is never too mushy.  And if you haven't read in the rest of their 978 reviews already, you have to try their angel wings. It's similar to the ones at San Tung except that it's sweet and spicy. So they give the chicken a little kick.  Just a word of warning, this dish will get your hands sticky and will give you a challenge if you are using the fork and knife to eat it. 

You can ask for the level of spiciness on some dishes. Such as the tom yum soup and the curry dishes.  Just make sure you can handle it.  the tom yum soup is sour, just the way i like it.  We asked them to make it a little more spicy and it was perfect, especially on a cold winter day. They also add a lot of ingredients in the soup.  The green curry is just as good as the yellow curry. I suggest if you are a curry fanatic to get the green curry instead.  It has more spices to it. 

My favorite dish is the pad param  with is a dish with chicken, spinach and peanut sauce.  I can never get tired of eating this dish.  it's cooked and blended together so well and it goes perfectly over rice. They have a new item on their menu this year that is the traditional hotcakes. This is cooked in a griddle and it comes out in the griddle.  It's a coconut with corn, onions and pumpkin so it's kind of like a pudding. You can order it as a appetizer or as a dessert. If you get it as a dessert they will make it sweeter.  

If you still have room for dessert, i recommend the Mango with sticky rice or the roti with ice cream.  If you are a mango lover you can't go wrong with the mango and sticky rice. The portion is kind of big to me so i recommend sharing it. The roti with ice cream is so good.  I love funnel cake so i might be biased. So this is exactly like a funnel cake to me and they top it off with coconut ice cream. 

As for drinks, if you want to order a thai ice tea or thai coffee you can always as them to make it less sweeter.  I usually ask for my thai ice coffee to be less sweet.  The young coconut drink is ok, but if you are expecting the drink to be sweet you might be disappointed. It's more of a refreshing drink than a sweet drink.  You can always ask for a spoon to scoop all the coconut out.  The thai beer here taste like the chinese beer that i've tried before. I ordered a 7up to make a shandy out of it.  So i got to play a little bartendering.  

I have yet to try a dish at this place that i don't like. I recommend reservations at both locations. If you have a big party, i recommend the Irving and 9th location because they have a private room.  No matter which location you go to, the food will not disappoint you!
author: Belinda C.

description: Love this place! You can't go wrong coming here. The food and service is very great and is always the same. We will be back again and again.
author: Lynn R.

description: As a person that has been to Thailand I can honestly say that this is a great representation of what it's like to enjoy a meal there! Great food, great hospitality and no sky high prices. If you're in the neighborhood it is worth the stop.
author: Nicole C.

description: Disgusting pad Thai. Very watery. Could not even eat. Will not be back. Also pretty expensive lunch menu. $10-11 bucks for pas Thai at lunch. Geez.
author: Casey M.

description:
The inside of the restaurant is really pretty and cool! Look up when you walk in!
I got spicy chan pad poo and it was delicious! 
There's also nothing to complain about for the service. They also have paintings and cool stuff on the wall for you to look at.
author: Mai L.

description:
We were craving Thai and came here for the first time.  I love the ambiance here and it was a little bit crowded here for a Tuesday night.  

We ended up ordering the Angle Wings (based on the reviews on yelp), the green curry, and the yellow curry (I love potatoes, so definitely had to go with this), and the Thai tea.  Upon trying the angel wings,  thought they were not bad.  It was definitely crunchy enough, but it wasn't something too special that I'd end up craving.  The curry wasn't too bad either.  It came with a pot of rice as well to match the curry.  The thai tea was good and not too sweet.

Service was a bit slow but they were pretty friendly.  Somehow I expected a bit more based on the reviews in the past.
author: Teresa W.

description:
Very nice spot.    The staff are very friendly and the restaurant very cute.   

The food was very good.    Basil chicken was very tasty.  It was quite different from other versions I have had.   There was less liquid and more oil.  Non of greasy but more than usual for thai cooking. But it was tasty none the less.    The basa fish dish was good.   And soup was not bad but could be creamier. 

On the whole a nice spot with easy parking to be found as well.
author: Peter T.

description: The Thai dumplings with green curry sauce are a good time!  I'm pretty happy ordering almost anything here, but I am disappointed that when I say "hot!" or "Thai hot!" I expect super spicy food and they never deliver on that.  I almost always use like 50% of the chili oil sauce that is on the table.  The waiters were nice, but not all that together.  I appreciate they hand out candies with the bill.
author: Shaun W.

description: Everything was so good and even better it's the only Thai place that I have seen that sells coconut hot cakes.  My family and I go here all the time.
author: Denice Arielle M.

description:
We waited one hour to get in for a party of 2 and another party of three was waiting in line right behind us.  All the sudden, a party if 7 walked in and our tables (which were already in the process of being cleaned) was given to them.  Be prepared for unfair wait times!

We did stay because we were tired, hungry, and just wanted a decent meal.  We e fed up ordering from the specials and one dish was the hok mok( a fish, curry custard).  It is a hard dish to make and not surprisingly is made in batches, frozen, and then reheated.  This is okay.  What is not okay is that it came out still half way frozen.  The next day, I got chills, nausea, and general food poisoning from this dish.
author: Jackie K.

description:
Street parking in the avenues isn't fun at times.  You just have to do it because you rather avoid the meter.  Stepping out into the cold air and as the mini trek over to Marnee Thai is finished; we see a car right in front of the restaurant just pull out.  Also, today was a Sunday.  Meters were free by that time too.  Bad luck and stupidity all rolled in one.

[PALM TO THE FOREHEAD]

That night we were dining with a couple friends.  Amongst half chatter and half looking over the menus, requests for our order came.  "Are you ready to order?" the waitress asked in a slightly abrasive tone yet with a hint of politeness.  I think she was the boss.  If she wasn't, she at least had the aura of one.  "Sorry...one more minute...almost ready..." we replied back.  This was a common occurrence with me at Marnee or any Thai restaurant for that matter.  This was the second time we had to repel the waitress away.  

For simplicity sakes I'll just go over what we ate this visit.  Our friend said the SPICY ANGEL WINGS were gnarly delicious.  So we had to get a plate of those.  Staying away from the usual pad thai, we ventured for another selection from the noodle section.  It came down between the fun to say, chan pad poo or PAD KEE MAO.  We chose the latter.

No Thai dinner at our table would be complete without a curry, and we got the yellow curry.  They have a fancy name for that it, KANG KA REE.  It's probably not fancy in reality, it just sounds like it to me.  To round things out I picked the PAD NOR MAI.  For sake of ease, I pointed and called out the number on the menu, "#42".  

Spicy Angel Wings:  The fried chicken wings were excellent!  Crispy outside, coated with a finger licking special chili garlic sauce.  Too bad I had to share.  

Pad Kee Mao:  Who doesn't like wide noodles like this?  Everyone likes them.  Great part is consistency all over all the noodles.  There weren't any patchy parts missing any chili, garlic, sweet Thai basil combo they have cooked in there.  

Kang Ka Ree (Yellow Curry):  We chose pork.  The ingredients labeled in the description do not taste exactly like your normal yellow curry.  Mildly spiced, not mildly flavored, and Marnee unique; they don't mess around with the run of the mill yellow curry.  As the waiter came to take away the almost finished curry bowl away, I said "Wait".  I proceeded to finished spooning out the remaining curry sauce onto my rice.  "Ok, you can take it away now. Thanks."    

Pad Nor Mai:  Simplicity of the description on the menu compared to the actual aromas the of the dish tells you otherwise.  Choosing the shredded chicken I was afraid the flavors wouldn't flow throughout the meats.  Boy I was way wrong.  Layers of all the ingredients were cooked throughout the dish.  I'll give it two thumbs up and two bonus big toes up.  

I've convincingly decided Marnee Thai is my favorite Thai restaurant.  Every time I come here and everything we order.  It is a winner.  The GOLDEN TRIANGES (THAI SAMOSAS) and the plate you can't go wrong with, PAD THAI.  This is always a sure fire hit with Bun.  My focus is the food, and I guarantee they'll dish out some really top notch Thai food.

Smonkey's Tip:  ...I'm still thinking about those SPICY ANGEL WINGS...try them at least once, if not order them again.
author: Arnold T.

description:
The food was decent. I enjoyed my papaya salad.  It wasn't that spicy although I got spicy but that was expected.
The pad priking with beef was ok. Nothing special.  
The fried rice with roast duck and pineapples could have been better.  It was on the bland side.
The stewed pork belly came out really late, basically after we finished most of our food.  I felt like maybe it was mirowaved because the temperature was different for the meat at different parts of the plate. Some parts were lukewarm and the others really hot. The taste was just ok for me. 
The best part of the meal was the roti with coconut ice cream. Imagine fried dough with glaze, condensed milk and coconut ice cream.  I devoured it.
Service is pretty slow. I think only one lady takes orders.
author: Heejin L.

description: Horrible system on waiting for a table! They need to have a sign in sheet or something to get more organized. Been waiting here and they sat down another party that came AFTER us... Annoyed!
author: Tiff C.

description:
Came here twice.  First time everything was fair.  Second time it was kind of empty but the holiday decor was very festive.

The food was decent again.  Pad see ew was a little dry.  Yellow Curry was good.

Service was a little off, we sat for a while waiting for them to come take our order but they never came until we asked them to.
author: Michelle T.

description:
My mom suggested coming here for lunch the other day and my girlfriend has been mentioning it lately. Even though my family has consistently dined on Irving for the past 20 years for some reason we have never came here before. From the outside it is easy to walk by and pay no attention to, but from within is a whole other realm to transport you to a south eastern asian feel (kinda? lol).

Right when you enter you are greeted by a bunch of achievements by the restaurant and the chef. And the food is a product of those achievements. We ordered:

-The chicken yellow curry (#23, $10.95), it had a nice aroma that the rice perfectly soaked in.
-The pad thai (#46, $10.95), to describe how good it was I'll just quote Drake, "best I ever had."
-And the eggplant with ground pork (#33, $10.95). I'm not usually a fan of eggplant, but it was so tasty from being sautéed with soy bean sauce and the thai basil provided an exceptional taste. If you think you can go with an additional dish, I definitely recommend this!!

Everything tasted so fresh and cooked to order in small batches specially for your order. The dishes might look small, but it is so filling.
author: Micki H.

description:
I love this location! This is still my favorite Thai restaurant in the city!

My favorite:

1. Pad thai: either with shrimp, tofu or any type of meat this dish never disappoints. The flavors are amazing. The only thing is never order this to go since the condensation from the to go container moistens the noodles and dilutes the taste. It always tastes better fresh at the restaurant

2. Tom yum soup: spicy but filled with ingredients and goes well with white rice

3. Spicy angel wings: sweet chicken wings that has a spicy kick to it

4. Curry: any of their curry goes well with rice

5. Roti with ice cream: great way to finish a Thai meal with something sweet and savory!

It can get packed at dinner time but no worries you can always make a reservation.
author: Joanne K.

description: Great place to be squeezed 3 people with a table of 2 with some ok food especially when the restaurant is more than half empty at 5pm and 3 tables for 4 are available. Why? In case if 3 parties of 4 show up. Money is money
author: Jean-Yves F.

description:
Eater beware!  Microwaved food!!! 

I got the special hok mor (red snapper) only available on the weekends and when I got my dish it was cold. Not even warm. Cold and slimy. I menu clearly states,  steam snapper in leaves. When I told the waitress, rather than  make us a new one, she went in and came back 2 minutes with the exact dish we sent back and it was warm. Still not hot. Didn't even ask us after how was it or if we wanted another one. 

Got another beef dish and it was cold again!  Asked for a new dish and waitress said they'll heat it up. Seriously?  If I'm paying for microwave thai, I'd go to trader Joe's.
author: Kevin L.

description: Ate dinner here at Irving and 24th Ave location. Food was flavorful depending on what you order. This seems to be a little family run restaurant. Parking in meters until 6pm enforced. A little difficult finding parking space as we park 2-3 blocks away. Lots of little Asian shops along this street. Seating a little cramped maybe can seat 40-50 people. Decor,  tables and chairs should be replaced or cleaned very thoroughly. Food was very good.
author: Clifford W.

description: This place is over rated. The foods was not good. The service was horrible. The server tried to sale to foods to us. Wth was that? She tried to make us to order more than what we need. And one more thing, she asked one of my friend if she is a boy or girl then laughed and said she just wants to make her smile. That was so rude and mean. Unbelievable!
author: Kimvy N.

description:
I've been to this location once. It was a bit crowded and we had to wait a little bit, but I think the food was good at least. One of my friends ordered a salad for the table, and me not knowing much about Thai food then just dug right in. After about a minute, my tongue and lips started burning. While all my friends were laughing at me, I chugged through a can of coke and 3 glasses of water. By the 3rd cup of water I could finally put food back in my mouth again, but I felt like lost my taste buds. Towards the end of the meal, I was finally able to taste again and I remember the noodles and meat were all good.

Don't be a fool like me, and learn your Thai spicy tolerance before rushing in.
author: Mike O.

description: We waited for 30 minutes on a Sunday patiently, as everyone got sat before us. They don't have a name system so I feel that they were letting everyone who was Asian first. After there was no one left outside they came out and said our table was ready!! We were already across the street as 45 minutes had passed.
author: Ellee W.

description: This has been my favorite Thai restaurant in the city for some time. The food is very good, so this review is for service. My boyfriend and I are both holed up at home with injuries and called to check if Marnee could deliver all the way out to his place. The woman who answered was exceptionally rude - told us bluntly to go online and hung up without ever hearing what we had to say. Her approach was unnecessary and a polite redirection to the internet would not have been difficult in the least. Frankly her manner was so off-putting we decided not to even bother with our larger order and went somewhere else with the same ratings.
author: Kelly C.

description: The complaint I have is about the service. I put an order online before 4:30 pm thinking that would give enough time for s 5:00 pickup. My daughter goes in to pick up the food a little after five. She's told one order is missing. She almost has to wait an hour for her order to come through. There's no excuse for her to wait that long. Do a better job, Marnee Thai!
author: Robert K.

description: Even though the place was packed, they always came around to refill our water glasses without request.  The food was very good.  We had the tea leaf salad, chicken satay and pad thai were hits.  Didnt care too much for the curry and basil fried rice, a little bland.  One thing I really didnt like was the lady yellling across the restaurant.
author: casey j.

description: My friends did not like this place as much because it wasn't "authentic" Thai. For the location though, prices were reasonable. I had the pad thai and it was average.
author: Christina W.

description:
Came by for lunch. Parking was extremely challenging in the area...

Upon arrival, I noticed that Marnee Thai modified their front door to include a motorized close! ...sweet! The inside of the restaurant was cold...freezing cold...

Started off with the Spicy Angel Wings which came out over-fried which led to the meat being too dry. The sauce and the spicy basil was tasty.

Moved on to the Soft Shell Crab over Mango Salad which was mediocre. The Soft Shell Crab was tasty, but the salad was definitely not worth the $12.95

The Tom Yum Soup Prawns was on the bland side and the prawns looked more like shrimps.

The Pad Khee Mao Duck was tasty, but the portions were definitely on the smaller side.

The Chan Pad Phoo was good, but again, small portions and not much crab...

Marnee Thai has come downhill. It took a few requests to the waitstaff to get waters...
author: Derek S.

description:
WORST DINING EXPERIENCE!  Well, I don't usually write reviews, but this time I have to!
Came here on Saturday with my friend, we waited a bit.  Well its Saturday, what do you expect?
And then after we waited for like 5 minutes, a lady(probably the owner of this restaurant) told us there's a table for us but we had to share with two people that we don't know!  OK FINE, but guess what, the table was super small! Are you sure that is a table for four people?!
Ok so we sat down, but these two people sitting next to us ordered hella dishes, and their dishes occupied the 3/4 of the table, that was pretty awkward.
So I asked one of the waitress about moving to other table, sadly she said we can't, and I was like WTF?!
The food was fine, but me and my friend stayed there for less than 30 minutes and we decided to leave.
Probably this is the worst thai restaurant I've ever been to.
author: Max H.

description:
So Michelle Pfeiffer's birthday is April 29th...just couple days away and one of my  friends is mad because I can remember Michelle's Pfeiffer's birthday and not hers...whoops. Priorities I guess.

Well a good meal with another friend who isn't so picky about me remembering her birthday (but I did and it's today; but yes she had to remind me 3X) and I are enjoying another great meal at Marnee Thai.

This is our go to Thai place when she's in town.

I really like their coconut pancake special appetizer, beef satay, golden triangles (samosas really) and their pad thai here.

I'm not a fan of their regular beef curry (yellow or green)...hence the 4 stars out of 5.

Yet, I think they do their specialty dishes well, like their fish with thai herbs and curry sauce, pumpkin curry, or their sea bass.

Oh yeah, and I like their mango sticky rice dessert, which I always save room for. And when mango is not in season, my go to is their coconut ice cream and sticky rice.

Yum!
author: Jack R.

description: I'm new to the area and personally having a staple Thai restaurant is really important for me. Yellow curry is not an option to me. They have fantastic friend tofu that holds up really well in the curry. My leftovers didn't last very long. The employees are so kind and sweet also, even though I was a take out customer not too long before close. Can't wait to dine in soon! Thanks for having many vegan options, I will surely come and have each one
author: Danica N.

description:
I ordered the red curry with duck and steamed rice, and thought it was pretty good! The curry was very savory, but maybe a bit under spiced for a "medium" spice curry.

The pieces of duck meat was also really good: tender but not too fatty. I wish there was a bit more duck in my curry; I really felt like the restaurant skimped out. 

The employees were  very friendly and I would visit again to try the rest of the menu.
author: Jeff M.

description: I love this place and consider it some of the best Thai in the City. As such I was about to place a delivery order. Unfortunately they do their deliveries through a site called 'CAVIAR'. Holy Freaking CRAP!!! They just tried to charge me a $10 fee just to make a delivery order?!?!?!?YOU HAVE GOT TO BE KIDDING?!?!? People!! It is not some amazing privilege to order food from you that you can charge me $10 to do so. Have you gone completely INSANE?!?!?Anyone who uses this service is contributing to something very VERY bad!! What a shame. I love this place, but out of principle will never go there again.
author: Byrne B.

description:
Came back for lunch and left beyond disappointed and admittedly, not full. 

Ordered the Mango Salad w/ Prawns again and the dish overall did not live up to expectations from my last visit. Also, since it was lunch, I think the portions were smaller than dinner though the menu/prices were the same. The salad had five scrawny prawns and four cashew nuts.. The citrus vinaigrette was good though. 

Bf ordered the Pad Garlic w/ Chicken and it was a TINY PORTION for freaking $12! There wasn't anything special about the dish at all. An additional $1.50 for a bowl of rice. 

Our food came out in ~5 minutes, but the service itself is spotty. Based on my recent experience, I would not come back again soon.
author: Samantha C.

description:
Overall Impression: Slightly overpriced Thai food with good customer service.

Cost: Slightly overpriced. A bill for 7 people came out to be 180 after mandatory 20 in gratuity, but we did order additional soup and samosas along with the entrees.

Taste: The samosas and chan pad poo were on point, perfectly spiced and all. The red curry didn't have much in it except for a little meat and a lot of bamboo.

Customer Service: The lady was very interactive with the guests and even sat down to chat with some customers while they were eating. It was pretty interesting to watch.

Ambience/Atmosphere: Very stuffy and crowded. I'm pretty sure it was a fire hazard.
author: Kevin T.

description: Mediocre Thai food. Kinda bland curry, not too impressed, also prices were a bit high for what they offered. The place has such potential to be wonderful, great location on Irwin. service was kind though
author: Sean M.

description:
Only weeks after an interesting discourse with fellow Yelper, John S. I found myself back at Marnee (the topic of our discussion) on Irving, a long-standing favorite.  It was a small, mid-week meal shared by two, consisting of Calamari Salad, Green Vegetable/Tofu Curry, white rice, and tea.  It'd been at least one year since my previous visit to Marnee and many, many years since I'd been a regular patron of the place.  How many?  Ms. Marnee predicted the gender of my oldest son, now 21, when I dined there routinely for years leading up to his birth.  

Marnee was once the standard bearer against which I measured every other Thai restaurant.  When I realized that none approached Marnee's stature I stopped going elsewhere.  What I loved there was what I ordered this time (all of their curries were complexly flavored, rich, and aromatic) plus Miang Kum, Chan Pad Poo (a pad Thai-like dish with sweet crab), and more.  And I liked their interior too, which was kind of kitschy and crowded but in a way that caused me to imagine I was dining in a bustling little thatched hut in Thailand.  

On this visit I noticed that the serving dishes had changed.  The Calamari Salad, which once was served on a wide flat plate, was now served in a bowl.  There seemed to be more salad-like ingredients and fewer calamari despite the rise in price.  It was still good though; spicy with complex flavors.  

The green curry though was a different story entirely.  Again, the price was more (as expected) and the serving dish had changed but these things would have made little difference if it had been excellent, as my sense-memory recalled it.  It was not.  It was warm when it should have been piping hot, watery when it should have been stick-to-the-spoon thick, and lacked the layered flavors it once had.  This is sad: Marnee was once renowned for her complex curries; whoever is making them now is not making them the same as they once were.  

Which brings me back to this:  The conversation that John S. and I were having on Marnee Thai was regarding the troubles of their second branch, on 9th Avenue (in 2013 they were briefly shuttered by the Health Department for violations).  Could it be that the original location is not keeping ingredients as fresh and clean as they once were?  Or could it be that there's just a different chef executing recipes differently and not as well as they once were?  I'll never know.  

I still really like Marnee but no longer feel great raving about their curries.  And those prices?  Whew; that 2-dish dinner for 2 ran just under $30 pre-tip.  It is true, I'll likely return and eventually re-sample all those once beloved dishes.  It is also true that I'd continue to recommend Marnee to those who like Thai food.  I'm treading a little lighter this time around however.  The last time a place I loved started disappointing me it was the beginning of a slippery slope that led straight to my (probably) final and generous 2-star review.
author: Tracey A.

description: Very unique Thai food in a pretty cozy setting. The food is good and consistent. The staff are a little bit blunt. Go for their specials over their regular menu.
author: Sty S.

description: Our favorite Thai restaurant. It'd be nice if the ingredients they used were of better quality however. All restaurants need to start buying local and organic products
author: Xrysa Z.

description:
After walking by a few of the restaurants in the area, I was pleasantly surprised by the setup at Marnee (table cloths with flowers on the table, clean restrooms, etc)

The appetizers were my favorite part. We had Thai samosas which had an interesting mix of ingredients and were quite tasty! The imperial rolls had a full shrimp which is unusual for your standard fried spring rolls. We also ordered the fried corn cakes which were literally fried pieces of corn - how could you go wrong with that!

I was a bit disappointed by the entrees - my biggest issue was the lack of vegetables. I believe it was the pad prig pow with chicken that mentions bell peppers but came with just 2 small pieces of bell pepper. Similarly, the pad see ew was just noodles and meat with a few pieces of basil. If you like seafood I would recommend the fried basa fish - lightly fried and flavorful and comes on a bed of bok choy

The fresh coconut water was sweet and refreshing and the coconut had a lot of "meat" that we could scoop out!
author: Mona B.

description: Worst service I've ever received. We were one of the few groups in the restaurant before rush hour. We ordered or food and we literally waited for 50min before the first fish came out. We ordered 5 dishes and each one came out 20min after the previous. We saw other people come in after and get served before us. They also didn't refill any of our waters until an hour into the meal. The food was good but honesty not worth dealing with the shitty service. Just go to Chabaa Thai instead
author: Austin L.

description:
I thought the flavors here were spot on, very authentic.  I ordered the coconut "hotcakes" as an appetizer.  Oh my, these things are fantastic.  I would order them for desert as well.  They batter is fluffy and they're topped with coconut cream, corn and pumpkin.  You get 7 served in an escargot cast iron pan.

Next, I had the silver noodle salad, but I didn't like it as much.  The flavors were good, but it had way too many noodles and not enough ground pork/chicken.  It had only 3 or 4 very small shrimp.  I would probably try the green papaya salad next time.

I ended with the green curry chicken.  It had lots of eggplant.  I really liked it, but there wasn't a lot of it.  I'll try a stir fry next time.
author: Michelle R.

description:
Marnee Thai is great family owned restaurant. The food comes out quick and is reasonably priced + consistently delicious.

My favorites are the spicy angel wings, chan pad poo (47) and pad kee mao (48). The noodles pack some heat as well as lots of authentic flavor.
The green curry and tom yum/tom kha gai aren't bad either. 

I love the presentation of their mango sticky rice so I try to always save room for dessert :) This is my favorite Thai joint in the city.
author: Jenny Q.

description: Very tasty! Have the coconut rice noodles! Loved the lime tang over the coconut flavor! For dessert I recommend the mango sticky rice. Service is good as well
author: Silvana N.

description: The food was disappointing. The Panang beef was smelly and not freshly cooked. The fish was not cooked properly and tasted bad. Service was also bad. Definitely we will not go back there
author: Irsanto O.

description: Bass fillet fish , ginger and garlic ,not worth $15 for frozen food, some flavor is left out in cooking. Maybe I know about Thai cooking using lemon grass, basil leave, 3 kinds, tangerine flavor stick missing in soup, dry basal missing in soup. Maybe the cook is tailor for American customers.
author: Dragon F.

description:
Came here for a late lunch and was not disappointed! We had a special for the day; soft shell crab over a green mango salad. There was a nice hint of spice that kept things interesting and the texture of the deep fried crab over the cool mango was really nice. We also had a shrimp/scallop curry which was nice, although subtly flavored. 

The service was good and waters were kept filled. The location is also very good; right across from GG park. Had a nice walk there afterwards to burn off some of the food!
author: Sharon W.

description:
It's been a while since I've been back in the city and I was in the mood enjoy some new flavors from the local scene. Marnee is the last highly rated Thai place in the area that I haven't yet tried, so it was time to complete the cycle.

We ordered the clear broth soup with chicken and veggies, the special pork belly curry made without coconut milk, and the chan pad poo, or vermicelli noodles with crab. The soup is great for warming the soul on a cold evening, though a tad under seasoned for me. The pork belly was tender and delicious, but I wish I had gone with one with coconut milk, which would have made the dish more hearty. The crab noodles reminded me of a really sweet pad Thai, which I guess it was really. It would definitely appeal to the western palette but I thought it was overly sweet.

Service was friendly and the hostess/owner was a lot of fun. Decor actually reminds me of being in Thailand, and there was a warm buzz throughout the busy and cramped space. Definitely felt like home. It's a tad more expensive than its Thai neighbors, but food quality was clearly higher. I'll be back, but I'm sticking to my guns next time!

Food: 7/10

Service: 8/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 9/10
author: Joe M.

description: This is some of the best Thai food I have had in the Bay Area.  Great meal and excellent happy staff in a great ambiance.
author: Chris B.

description:
I was pretty disappointed with my dinner. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing? I had the Cashew Nut (my go to order anywhere that has it) and it was underwhelming. Dry, fairly bland and the tofu was over cooked. Plus, you have to order rice separately?

I expected much more for a restaurant like this, with those reviews, in SF.

Sad face.
author: J J.

description:
It's surprisingly good! Being a Singaporean tourist, I am no stranger to authentic Thai food found easily in Singapore and Bangkok.

This Thai restaurant is worth the money and worth eating. Great for a day to Golden Gate Park.
author: Joshua L.

description: Very good, but a little pricey for the quantity you get.  We liked the green Papaya salad. The garlic pepper chicken was quite good. The classic pad Thai in my opinion was sweet but did not have enough fish sauce. We also had the crab pad Thai that was quite unique and spicy. Everybody liked this dish.
author: Bill S.

description:
This is the best thai place in San Francisco! I have come here numerous times and I still crave it. My favorite dish hands down is the Pad Kee Mao with beef! It's so bomb digityyyy. It's a spicy flat noodle dish with basil, tomatoes and a bomb sauce. I'm probably not giving it any justice with my description, but if you're looking for a dish, trust that is the best. They also have really good hot sauce that is on the table that I absolutely LOVE. It's like fish sauce with spice in it and it's a little sweet. You have to try it for yourself.

The service is pretty good! They always seat everybody in the order they've arrived. Sometimes it can get a little busy and I think they're pretty organized with good customer service. :)
author: Mel T.

description:
Honestly what's the point of making a reservation if they don't ask for your reservation name or time once you arrive? When I tried to get their attention the lady with short red hair literally gave me the hand and told me to keep waiting. All she did for 20 minutes was go back and forth to the door asking how many people in each party. Whenever we asked how much longer she just says "just a little longer". HOW LONG?? Two parties after us went in before us and they didn't have a reservation. I told her I had a reservation and she said okay and left. She was so rude.

If you're not going to honor reservations don't take reservations. I stood there for 40 minutes and haven't been helped except be asked how many people is in my party multiple times. I left for Chabaa a block away.
author: Sarah T.

description:
I can't decide whether I like Marnee or not. Mind you, I've only been here once, but a few things rubbed me the wrong way.

First, why is there no lunch special? Second, why are fresh spring rolls soooo expensive? I guess this isn't specific to Marnee Thai since every Thai/Vietnamese place charges like 8 bucks for rice paper, bean sprouts, and like 3 shrimp. Should've gone with the angel wings, which looked awesome on that other table.

The Chan Pad Poo was pretty good. It's basically a spicy crab meat pad thai. I didn't expect it to look like that so I was surprised when I came out. Somehow when the menu says "stick rice noodles" I thought of the thick rice cake kind. Oh well.
author: Sherry L.

description:
Busy/slightly chaotic on weekend nights, but very worth it!

Feels like there's more variety than other Thai restaurants. Everything I've had here has been good, but I especially recommend:

- Sea bass w/ spicy curry, mushrooms (overly pricey though) 
- Basa fillet w/ pork, ginger, mushrooms
- Shrimp pad see ew

Also good:
- Basa fillet w/ garlic, black pepper sauce
- Banana curry (I liked this curry flavor better than the yellow/red curry, but am not big on plantains. If you like plantains, you'd enjoy this)
author: An Y.

description: My rating is mainly based off of their service and horrible attitude. In terms of our meal, the food was great. We ordered two dishes one being their infamous Chan Pad Poo and second their, Coconut Silver Noodle Stir Fry. They came out with a pancake dish with coconut milk in it and since we didn't order that dish we polietly told them that this wasn't our dish and the waiter just looked really confused. A few second later, the manager with the short hair I presume comes towards our table and asked us what the matter was and we said had told her we didn't order that and instead we ordered the stir fried coconut silver noodle. She pressumes to accuse us of confirming the pancake order with her, but my boyfriend and I clealy remember saying " no bean sprouts please " and she had written that down in our order so there was no way we told her the wrong order unless she put in our order wrong herself. After that scenario, the whole staff just antagonized and just gave us weird looks which just made our whole meal experience very uncomfortable. It was our first time there and will likely be our last.
author: Tina X.

description: Thy claim to have 1 Michelin Star years ago. Very good Thai food. That is why even though the area is small but there is always crowded inside. Quite expensive compared to other Thai restaurants, given the fact that it is located at Chinese area. Worth to eat here.
author: Tran M.

description:
Best Thai restaurant in the Sunset, if not all of San Francisco! Whenever I crave Thai food I go to Marnee, but only the 23rd & Irving location and definitely not the one on 9th. I guess they're supposed to be clean now, but I just can't let myself enjoy a meal at a place that used to be infested with cockroaches. Ugh, cringe. But this location is great! They have excellent customer service! They're super nice and attentive- I never had an empty glass of water. So my bf and I decided to order angel wings, tom yum soup, pad soowon, and mango sticky rice. 

The angel wings are so good! An order comes with 6 deliciously sweet and spicy wings. The sauce coating the chicken is amazing. This was my favorite dish. I could have eaten a whole plate to myself. 

For some reason, the tom yum soup was too sour and salty this time. So much that we couldn't finish the whole bowl like we did before. Maybe it was just an off night? 

But they made a comeback with their delicious, lightly sweet vegetarian pad soo won. It came with silver noodles, tofu, bean sprouts, broccoli, mushrooms, and egg. So good! Would order this again.

We decided to order mango sticky rice at the last minute and I'm so glad we did because that was the best mango sticky rice I've ever tried, ever. The rice was warm and sticky and had just the right amount of saltiness to complement the sweet coconut milk on top. The mango was perfect, not too sour nor sweet and the presentation was really pretty.

Highly recommend Marnee if you're craving Thai!
author: Stephanie G.

description: My favorites: tom yum soup, larb salad, calamari salad, and thai beef fried rice.  Marnee is one of my go to thai spots in SF and this isn't because my girlfriend lives a block away.  I've never been blown away by the food and it's never disappointed.  For the Sunset, I believe the prices are slightly above average, but worth it if you're in the mood for thai.  My girlfriend and I eat here once a month.
author: Kevin N.

description:
Satisfying Thai food, packed into the tightest little restaurant.

The food was baseline, good, but I was not blown away or anything. My friends and I got the Golden Triangles (Samosas), Chicken Larb, Massamun Curry, Red Curry with beef, Pad Cashew Chicken, Pad See-Ew, and some jasmine rice. The Golden Triangles were good basic thai samosas and they smelled so good and tasted as they should. The Chicken Larb was disappointing to me; this is usually my favorite thai dish, but it's just different from what I've had. The curries were standard and yummy. Pad Cashew Chicken was very normal. Lastly, the Pad See-Ew was really great, probably the standout dish for me as it was perfectly cooked and seasoned.

Coming on a Saturday during dinner rush hour is questionable and you are most likely going to experience a wait. Once inside, there is little room to move around the restaurant. The services was kind enough, nothing to complain about. There were two birthday celebrations on when I went, so they turned off the lights and made a little celebration of both.

Overall, Marnee is a basic Thai restaurant. I was not disappointed, but I was not amazed either. I would come back for the Pad See-Ew and to try other things.
author: Valerie Z.

description: Amazing little place we walked to in the past. Green papaya salad. Soft shell crab salad. Spicy chicken wings (can be very hot and spicy so order appropriately) Coconut chicken is so sweet and tender with a great gooey coconut milk coating? Pretty much anything we've ordered here, we loved, or at least liked! I recommend trying them out and see what you think.
author: Kirk M.

description: Service wasn't good, glasses were dirty and with the lipstick marks. Food was so-so for the price. Waiter wasn't attentive even though there were just 3 tables taken.
author: Anton V.

description:
I came to Marnee Thai with my two friends, while filming a documentary. We were hungry from filming, and craved Thai food. I went on Yelp and found Marnee Thai. Now, if it was up to me, I would of gone to Regent Thai, but I was not the driver, and she did not want to drive all the way up to Noe Valley. The reviews on Yelp for Marnee Thai looked promising, but I doubted the place. It truly was an instinct of mine. As an avid Thai Food eater, I question the reviews who state that Marnee Thai is "killer Thai food", or "amazing". In my opinion, these Yelpers HAVE NOT experienced what really good Thai food should taste like. 

The restaurant was not packed when we entered. It was lunch on a weekday, and Irving Street felt more asleep and tired than it usually does. We were seated, and given menus. The ambience/decor of the restaurant is a bit overdone. Very brown, bamboo and wooden accents everywhere. I ordered the Panang Beef, and my friend ordered the Vegetable Curry. My other friend wanted to order the Hot Cakes, however, the waitress rudely told us that they don't have those. We also ordered TWO Thai Iced Teas. The waitress came back with THREE Thai Iced Teas, Panang Beef, and the Vegetable Curry. We told her we ordered only two, but she insisted that we were wrong. Ridiculous.  

The Panang Beef was terrible. Dry chunks of beef simmered in a greasy sauce. I could barley chew the meat. The Vegetable Curry was nothing special at all. I expected good Thai Food, not disgusting Thai Food. My other friend did not get to eat, because she really wanted the Hot Cakes, which I guess were not "available". 

Marnee Thai is not authentic, and not good tasting. I do not recommend coming here, and I do not see what all the great reviews are about. No, the food is not "killer", or "amazing". Marnee Thai is Yelp for Two Stars ("Meh. I've experienced better). I think I'd rather drive up to Noe Valley for Regent Thai. Now THAT'S good Thai Food.
author: Emmanuella Z.

description: Called in my take out order around 7pm and was told that my food would be ready in 15 min. I got to the restaurant around 7:15pm and was asked to wait in the hallway behind the kitchen... The wait staff did not ask for my name or what my order was. Turns out only one woman was in charge of answering the phone and taking care of all take out orders. I asked her if I could check on my order and she told me it would only be a few more minutes. I waited 30 minutes in the restaurant for my food. So much for a 15 min wait! I was starving at this point and they didn't seem to care that I had been waiting so long at all. They were very short with me and the other people waiting for take out. I really love the food here so it pains me to say how terrible the service was. Even when I've eaten at the restaurant, the service is only so-so... Bring lots of patience if you eat here!
author: Taylor W.

description:
I have been looking for good quality Thai food in SF for a while now. Marnee Thai has fulfilled my craving and  exceeded my expectations with their dishes. The owner is charismatic and full of energy. She personally greets most people coming through the door. We had the angel wings and the crab noodles everyone talks about. Both are pretty spicy. The wings come in a rather small portion but it is an appetizer after all. Crab noodles taste similar to Pad Thai. We also had a green curry and a fried bass dish. Curries do not come with rice. Curry is pretty standard as it comes with some veggies and your choice of meat. The bass was surprisingly delicious. It was crunchy and light with a delicious garlicky sauce on top and some baby bok choy on the side. I look forward to coming back to try their other dishes. 

P.S. Only disappointment during our meal was their limeade, which was super watered down. Try their other drinks instead.
author: Susana T.

description: Great service and prices, but my pad kee mao was really greasy and the noodles were overcooked. It seems like my food was probably reheated instead of cooked fresh.
author: Christa K.

description:
Nom nom..love the Angel Wings here..except I get it with tofu instead--less messy. :P
The sweet/savory-ness of the garlicky flavorful sauce. OMGZ. Plus the crispy basil that goes with it? oooooh man..craving it AGAIN. haha. 
Also love the Tom Ka and Tom Yum here. Haven't gotten to try too many of the specials because I always end up craving the Angel Wings and the soups. hahaha.
Service has been great every time I've gone. And the prices are reasonable! :] Take out is very fast as well. :D
author: Mariel A.

description:
This place is pretty nice, clean and cozy.  I came here with my girlfriend and cousins for lunch.  It wasn't that busy at first, but quickly became packed later into lunch time.  We started off with the chicken wings, papaya salad, coconut cakes, and tom yum soup.  The salad was excellent, spicy if you eat the pepper seed, but perfect otherwise.  The soup was good too - not too sour or spicy.  The chicken wings were hella good, not crispy, but full of flavor and sauce.  Never had the coconut cakes before, but these little guys were good too.  They are filled with corn, taro, and coconut milk.  

Now onto the entrees!  The pineapple fried rice was really good, but typical.  I was really looking forward to the pumpkin curry, but it was kind of disappointing.  Have to say I've had better - the flavor and creaminess was just not there.  The seafood curry on the other hand, was perfect.  The dish was very flavorful and packed a lot of meat.

Overall, we enjoyed the place and service - would come back again!
author: Kevin N.

description:
I was catching up with a friend and we decided to go for Thai food. I hadn't been to Marnee Thai in a while so we went there. 

I've been a fan of this place for a while. The decor is endearing, the staff is nice enough, and the food is great! My friend and I decided to split an order of the Goong Sarong (prawns wrapped in bacon, wrapped, and fried) and an order of Pad Thai with prawns. 

The goong sarong was great. Fresh and tasty! Hot at first, so don't bother eating it right away if you order it. The Pad Thai was great too. Probably one of the best Pad Thai dishes I've had although the portion is smaller than other places. 

Great place! I love it here.
author: Sofia R.

description: Yelp reviews are questionable. I ordered shrimp mango salad and panang beef and both were lacking in flavor. Especially the panang beef, beef was soft but was totally bland, curry has zero curry flavor. I saw other dishes being carried out to other tables and none of them look appetizing. I was thinking about getting the pad see ew but that didn't look appetizing in real life either. Won't be back.
author: Yenn T.

description:
What happened to this place? The food is salty and burnt nowadays. For the price, it is not worth coming here anymore. Next time, I'll just head to King of Thai instead. We told the server that the food was too salty, so they just washed the food. I wish they re-cook it instead because the food was still very salty. 

The service was always pretty rude, but this time it was just bad. I guess this is the first time I dined without the owner around to yell at the workers. The workers looked as if they wanted to get off.
author: Brad C.

description:
Well, i saw Marnee featured on the TV show "Check Please" and everyone at the table raved about it.  So we planned a visit to go check it out.

First, up front, this is a small place that tends to be completely full at peak hours, which means you'll be eating almost face to face with your stranger table mates.  This kind of dining is not for me, but for really good food, I can usually tolerate it.

Last night, in particular, was rough.  We had to endure every detail of the conversation next door.  Awkward.  Crowded dining like this should be outlawed.  But, the restaurant was completely full with a line, so the food must be killer...and so the anticipation grew.

Had a reservation but we waited a bit.  That seems to be the way here as I've read that in other reviews.

Service was pretty good despite the crowd.  The owner (I'm assuming it was the owner) mills around the restaurant giving recommendations and taking orders.  She's extremely loud and borderline obnoxious but she didn't bother me really.  A restaurant needs a character like this--it's like a mascot for a sports team.  I think she actually tries to be a bit off-putting to put on a little show.

She came to our table and didn't lower the volume.  She scolded my wife for putting too much hot sauce on her coconut hotcakes and threatened to charge us for a jar of it.  And then she smiles and laughs big.  You see?  It's hard to dislike someone like that--even if they're abrasive.  She really pushed the Angel Wings as her recommendation so we got those.

Here's what we ordered:

RED CHICKEN CURRY:  Huge curry lover, but this one fell below the mark.  The sauce was fine, but the chicken was a disappointment.  Tough and dry, not like chicken should be in a curry.  No good.  Didn't eat much of this.

ANGEL WINGS:  I'm very picky when it comes to wings.  I only eat the drummettes and never eat the wing side.  2 of the 5 wings they served were drummettes.  I ate both of them and they were very good.  They were fried almost crispy and then sauced.  And the sauce is unique, sweet and addicting, but not spicy enough.

AVOCADO + PRAWN SALAD: Big let-down as I'm a huge fan of this combination.  Avocado was not fresh, a bit discolored in fact.  Lacked salad items, no cucumber, all I tasted was cilanto and mint.  And WAY over dressed.  It was like a soup.  You get the picture.  And the kicker?  The shrimp was undercooked and inedible. This salad gets an "F".
 
THAI BEEF SALAD:  Looked appetizing when it arrived but the meat was rubbery and had that "what kind of meat is this" flavor and texture.  Again, inedible for me.  My wife was reluctant at first to agree with me, but after a couple bites she stopped eating it.

COCONUT HOTCAKES:  Served as an appetizer, these cute little coconut puffs are tasty.  With some hot sauce, they were enjoyable.

CRAB FRIED RICE:  This was good.  Not the best I've had, but it was done right.  Best crab rice I've ever had is at HONEY THAI in Milpitas.  If this is your thing, try it at HONEY THAI. Thank me later.

STICKY MANGO RICE:  This is the second time having this dessert.  The first time, at another restaurant.  This one was pretty good.  We special ordered coconut ice cream to be served with it.  Heavenly combo.  Highly recommended.  Sticky Mango Rice needs that third element! That said, their treatment of the sticky rice component was good in flavor but not 100 percent happy with the texture.  I'm going to do make this at home and play around with getting the sticky rice just right.

CONCLUSION:

Because I'm fond of "hole-in-the-wall" places like this, I wanted to like this place.  And I do like it.  HOWEVER, I think people are exaggerating the greatness of this place.  Some say it's "the best Thai they have ever had".  Well, maybe those folks haven't gotten around much.  I've been to Thailand and that really heightens my perspective on this place.  This is *not* the best Thai I've ever had.  It's standard, and I'm sure they have a few specialty items on the menu that would qualify for excellent.  But two of our 5 dishes were inedible for me, and that's not good.  I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt with a 3, but honestly, I don't think I would come back.  If this place was in my area, I would use it as a take-out place for certain dishes, the Angel Wings and the Crab Fried Rice etc.

Yes, overrated in my humble opinion but that happens occasionally, especially when a place like this gets some airtime on TV.

I'm not a hater, just someone who is keeping it real!
author: Darien R.

description:
I LOVE Marnee Thai! I've only been in SF for 8 months and haven't had the chance to try every Thai restaurant, but this is my absolute favorite so far. I've been to this restaurant and ordered takeout countless times.

I've had their pad Thai, vegetable curry (red), avocado salad, tom kha soup, see-ew noodles, spring rolls, and Thai tea of course. Everything is so good. I love the decor of this location. Every time I come here I feel like I'm back in Thailand. Very authentic with lots of flavor.

It's impossible for me to not finish my meals here, even though I'm so full at the end. Worth it.
author: Mika S.

description:
Growing up in a Thai family and having gone to Thailand several times, I know what good authentic Thai food tastes like in the motherland and have rarely found a place here in CA that could compare... until I tried Marnee! I was skeptical at first but was pleasantly surprised by the quality and taste of the dishes here.

SETTING
-I really like the look and feel of this place. Super cute bamboo hut set-up. You really feel like you're inside a room made of bamboo. 
-Lots of traditional Thai decor, from the bowls/dishes the food is served on to the traditional garb worn by the waiters.
-They have a sister location on 9th Ave, which is run by the owner's son. I personally prefer this location on Irving St better - it's a little more roomy and spacious and has a more romantic ambiance.

FOOD 
-"Hot Cakes" - They have a special appetizer going on right now (Traditionally called 'Kanom Krok'). It's a popular Thai dessert that is rarely served in the US. It has a gelatinous texture made from tapioca flour and is cooked with coconut milk, and has bits of corn and taro in it. I recommend trying this out! 
-Po Tak Sopu! It's basically like Tom Yum Soup with seafood! Spicy and delicious! It had a lot of fresh vegetables, shrimp, octopus, and mussel for calamari. It's seasoned with a thai herb (kaffir lime) that I love so much that really brings out the authentic flavor of Tom Yum soups. 
-Kang Keaw! This literally translates into 'Green Curry' and is my favorite type of curry. It comes with eggplant and thai basil and is served with rice. We ordered ours with chicken. Winner.

Definitely will be coming back! :)
author: Grace J.

description: The food was extremely delicious here! I had spicy angel wings, pad thai, pork with garlic, basil chicken. I would definitely come back to try something else the second time around!
author: Melanie N.

description:
Delicious.  

A Lyft car driver told us this was his favorite Thai estaurant, and now I understand why.  This place is authentic and super yummy.  I should be sharing more detail about what made my meal so delicious, but every time I think about it I caught up in the memory of how great everything was.  

Just go there.  You won't regret it.
author: Mookie S.

description: Good authentic Thai food. Definitely try the Thai curry and chicken satay
author: Vydesh R.

description:
This is KILLER Thai food.  I really like the other Marnee, but this was infinitely better.
We had:
hot cakes - coconutty, hot amazing
angel wings - perfect sticky texture and deep rich flavor
avocado salad - sweet and delicious
tom kha ga soup - could have had a more balanced sweeter flavor
penang beef - tender and flavorful
sea bass w garlic and black pepper - amazing flavor sensation - i love the "sauce"
The hut ambiance was adorbs.
The waitress was a little pushy, but also adorbs.
And the birthday tradition w the gong rocks.
author: Andrew K.

description:
This place is just ok. Don't understand what's so special about it. Standard thai food

I ordered the red curry with chicken and my friend ordered the pumpkin curry. His food came out within 10 minutes of ordering and I was sitting there twiddling my thumbs for an additional 20 minutes for my food to come out. I finally asked the waitress where my food was. She brought it out a minute later but you could tell it was sitting there for a while and they had forgotten to bring it out since it wasn't very hot. 

The chicken in my curry was way overcooked, kind of a disappointment since I had to wait so long for the food :(

Nothing impressive, mediocre, and no reason to go back.
author: Sheena N.

description:
Food is decent. Service is good. Wait is long for dinner. It has a festive atmosphere around dinner with hustle and bustle of an authentic Thai restaurant. I decided to try them out after watching the Check Please Bay Area episode about Marnee Thai. I was not disappointed even though I was not impressed by the food.

The Seasonal homemade hotcake (Grilled rice coconut cakes w/ corn, green onions, pumpkin) was delicious (bit sweet). I was not impressed by the Green Curry even though it was decent. The Roti with Ice cream dessert was good (decadent).

If I am in the area, I will go back again to try their Spicy Angel Tofu and Pad Ki Mao. A great ambiance and experience. Price is bit high for the food. Food can be bit better and flavorful (which is very subjective).
author: Sid P.

description:
Pretty good good food. Decent prices. But the wait can be long. 

Called the other night before coming and asked how long the wait was. They told me to just come and that it wouldn't be long and refused to give me an estimate. I showed up and of course the line was out the door. Expected that, but would have appreciated an honest response. 

Other than that, the food has been great every time I've eaten here. Duck curry, Larb, Pad See Ew, fishcake, all legit. Reccomended.
author: Kevin W.

description:
There's nothing I can say that will do this place justice. My friends in Buffalo, NY who have only ever been to SF once actually recommended this place to me after I'd already been!  

They serve edible flowers with many of their dishes, which is a beautiful and delicious touch, and the service is always great. The food though--I could write sonnets about their samosas and noodle dishes.

Definitely go to Marnee Thai, or order takeout, both are excellent options! We find that we always have enough food for two meals which makes the higher prices totally worth it!
author: Daphne W.

description: Medium sized Thai restaurant that has cute decor. The Angel wings and Pad See Ew are excellent choices here. Both had very good flavor and stood out. Also, good is their Tum Yum Soup and Pad Thai.
author: Ali F.

description:
Came here with two other people. We had to all sit at a two person table so it was cramped. I had to sit in the isle so it was awkward and uncomfortable because people would be walking past me and I had to constantly scoot in and out. 

The people don't have much logic when it comes to service. Oh and I was right next to the door too. 

They also got one of the orders wrong but I'm not telling them that. They won't do anything about it. 

If you are lucky you will get a normal table. If not then they don't give a foockkkkk
author: Victor T.

description:
This place is mediocre and on more then one occasion, nasty.  

   The usual foreign owned place, crap service, rude with the attitude that if you don't come back, another round eye will (believe me, Thais don't eat here).  The food is just not very flavorful, I had the diced chicken and had a bad taste in my mouth for hours; I believe the chicken was just turning.  I could go dish by dish, but what for.  

   This was once a very good spot with tasty fresh food, but now it's just like 90% of the places in San Francisco, mediocre if not crap food, with a customer base of "foodies", what the heck is a foodie anyhow, don't answer, for your answer will make me sick.

   It would be a money maker to find an authentic Thai place, that cleaned the place every couple of decades, smiled when you walked in (Thailand, Land of Smiles remember) and had good food.  Ok, whatever, as an SF face tattoo girl would say.  

   Save your money, find another place, expensive (very) and half assed food.
author: Rusty G.

description:
This place is hands down one of my favorite Thai restaurants! My aunt claims the woman working there is a little bit too bossy and pushy, but I don't care; I just eat.

They have mango fried rice rather than the typical pineapple fried rice. Whenever I get pineapple fried rice, I usually pick the pineapples out because I don't like the idea of my fried rice being sweet, but the warm sweet mangos goes with it just right.

They also have other fantastic dishes like curry chicken skewers, curryies, pad thai and some veggie combination I don't remember. 

But what keeps me coming back is their mango fried rice and their Chilean sea bass. I've been coming here for about seven years now and I still can't stop raving about the sea bass.

Well portioned. Space is a bit cramped.
author: Trang B.

description:
I'm not usually in the Inner Sunset, so this was actually my first time trying Marnee despite having heard the name for so many years. It was not bad!

For lunchtime, it wasn't as crowded as I had expected it to be.  My friend and I really enjoyed the hut-looking interior sprinkled with orchids on the tables.  We came in and were seated immediately.

I ordered the Pad Kee Mao with beef, my go to Thai dish. At first it looked pretty plain: just noodles, egg, beef, and broccoli.  The noodles were cooked to my liking, soft and piping hot. Everything else was yummy, but lacked a tiny tiny bit in flavor; I added some of the chili on the table for a nice kick.  I would have liked more veggies as well. 

Service was very friendly and attentive, though I had to remind them for a bag about 3 times.

They offer a large variety of dishes, so I would definitely come back and try others!
author: Monica V.

description: Best Thai food in the bay area. Found this gem of a place as we were driving around town. They had some house specials like Pan Seared Sea Bass in garlic sauce which was delicious. We ordered it twice. There was tofu with bean sprouts and rice noodles and chicken satay wrap which were also mouth watering good. Would love to go back and try some of their dishes again. We also loved and appreciated their kind service. Overall, more than 5 stars.
author: Lisa H.

description:
The first time I came here I got food poisoning. The second time I came here (and it's only because my friends wanted to come here), the service was so bad. We had a large party of about 10 and the restaurant is pretty small and everyone is closely packed together. They messed up our orders and there was nonstop foreign language yelling in our ears. I got vegetable pad see ew and was fearful that I would get food poisoning again ( the first time I got chicken pad thai) but luckily I didn't. The prices are reasonable for a Thai restaurant ~$10 a dish. I wouldn't come back again unless my friends wanted to come.

Street parking only which can be a pain since it is so busy. Also, it is metered.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
I have been coming here for 10 years, whenever I am in the neighborhood.
Ever since Check Please had this on their show, I feel that the quality has gone steadily downwards.

Last visit of weeks ago, their famous Angel Wings had NO crunch unlike prior.
Shrimp curry had like 6 small pieces in a small portion.

Long lines on weekends clearly shows that this is stilled a famed place and well loved.

Just hope the owners who read this cares about quality control, and not just about profit.  

Thats how you keep loyalists coming back.  Otherwise it will be another has been
author: David H.

description:
We were on the way to Golden Gate Park when we dropped by this small Thai restaurant. There seemed to be a line even after lunchtime on a Friday. After a short 10 minute wait, we were seated promptly and offered menus. The inside is definitely darker than I'd like it and because of this, I saw an elderly couple beside us that was having a hard time reading the menu. I ordered a Thai Tea while I looked over the menu. They had a variety of selections and after some thought, we decided to go with the Green Papaya Salad, Panang Beef, and Pad Pra Ram. The Green Papaya Salad came first, which was very rich in flavor and a little spicy but when you got to the bottom, the dressing can become a little overpowering. Next came the Panang Beef was a little tougher than I would like it but the curry helped to round out the dish. I also would have liked it if they gave a little more curry sauce. Last came the Pad Pra Ram, which impressed me the most. The chicken was very nicely cooked and peanut sauce was able to give the curry the extra punch it needed for a great dish. 

Overall, although the portion sizes were a little smaller than I'd like it, the food here was pretty good. Paired with decent service,  I'll be sure to drop by the next time I'm in the Outer Sunset area!
author: Jason C.

description: Ok - let me just be clear here. I woke up this morning craving a warm soup and some delicious noodles to start my day- no eggs today, it was game time. This place absolutely SUCKS- the Tom Kah tasted like rats urine- so sour, no flavor- gross- I'd rather my cat piss into a cup- it would have probably tasted better. The pad Thai was TERRIBLE- no flavor at all! How is this place even in business? Yet alone has 4 stars?? I'll tell you how- money - these guys pay for higher ratings on Yelp and are featured because they paid for the ranking- don't be fooled - this place is AWFUL.
author: Vadim Z.

description: The food is great and that's the saving grace. Sadly, the service is complete trash. From take out orders to dining in house they do not know how to handle their customers. My 3 experiences here consist of being stuffed into a tiny corner after making reservations for 6. Waiting in a cramped corridor for my take out order after having paid. Last but not least coming here with my fiancée to a semi empty restaurant and constantly having to ask for water, tea, order being taken, order being delivered, etc. my recommendation to these guys is to start treating your customers as just that, paying customers, not sheep to be taken through the ringer of bullshit excuses.
author: Daniel G.

description:
Marnee Thai is not a place for the claustrophobic. Everyone is squeezed in real tight at the restaurant and you'll start to feel pretty cozy with the table next to you. It not the most comfortable of restaurant settings, but they do make it up with good food!

I don't know what makes Thai Food good, but Marnee's dishes are delicious. The pineapple fried rice is flavorful and hint of the pineapple flavor will fill your nostrils. Extra kudos for them because none of their fried rice dishes are super oily, which is common among other Thai Places.

Order a Thai ice tea to go with your meal. It's served in a cool tall skinny glass. It's 3 bucks, but trust me, you'll get more value than the 3 TeaWays you're about to get from down the block ;)
author: Ringo M.

description: This is my favorite thai restaurant.  Doesn't get better than Marnee Thai.
author: Jonathan G.

description: I love the food but their Service is not that great the place is a little too small so you feel like you're sitting on top of each other
author: A. M.

description: First time here. Loved the spicy chicken soup!!! Would definitely be coming back! Satay chicken was a little too sweet for my taste but my hubby loved it.
author: Rup B.

description:
I ordered the 34, I forgot what it's called but it was chicken, cucumber, tomato, bell pepper, and onion.
I thought the dish came with rice but it doesn't. So i ordered white rice for $1.50. The food was okay to pretty good, but it got me reaching for the glass of water every time. The dish was saucy which went well with the rice. I don't want to eat dry chicken. Not much to say about this place but overall, it is expensive for what it is. Don't think I'll be back because food nor price was spectacular.
author: Julian Y.

description:
Pretty solid Thai food on Irving, especially the pad thai and the fried rice. If I ever find myself wanting Thai food in the Sunset area, I'd probably come here first before anything else.

The only drawback of this place is the seating availability, and sometimes the slowness of the service. It can get quite crowded; it is often close to full, and they make up for it by stuffing people on the sides of the tables in addition to the usual seats. As a result service can sometimes be slow.

The other annoying bit is the older waitress there seems to love to encourage you to order more food than you originally wanted, whether it's drinks, appetizers, or upgrades to your entree. Obviously I suck it up and politely decline each time, and I know that she's just doing business as usual, but personally it's always a pain to deal with.

The Thai tea is delightful though.
author: Tony D.

description: Food was good but the owner was too loud.  Constantly yelling at her waiters and waitresses in front off the customers.  Can be annoying.
author: Ahm B.

description: When we arrived in Marnee at about 6 pm, we easily found a table for four. And only in half an hour, it got packed with a line outside... So our timing was good. I had the pad praham (#36) with shrimp. It did not had a star that indicated how hot and spicy the food is but it was still a bit too spicy for me yet DELICIOUS!.. The iced thai tea had a bit too much cream. Next time, I will ask whether that tea can come with milk only. I look forward to going back and trying their other specials such as the mango fried rice.
author: Elif B.

description: I don't understand the high ratings and reviews.  It used to be ok, last night it was horrible.  The hot cakes were the only thing edible. Even the iced coffee was undrinkable. The tom ka was swimming in chili oil and barely any coconut milk. The fried banana was overdone and they added SALT. On top of all the lousy food, the service was terrible.  When I finally got the waitress's attention & told her about the soup she gave me an attitude and refused to correct the situation.  I'll never go back.
author: Nancy K.

description:
If you're a glutton for being rushed out of a restaurant,  devoid of ambience,  this place will be right up your alley.  The food was good.  But that means nothing when the staff as well as the demonic manager are making pests of themselves, hovering about,  driving you nuts, and, as intended, out of Marnee Thai.  I ordinarily love Thai food and my Thai girlfriend has no equal when it comes to its preparation.

Three of us at the table hadn't seen each other in a long time and were happy to sit down and share a meal. But that atmosphere is 'mass production' and insipid.  Trust me, go elsewhere.
author: V H.

description: Super good and authentic thai food. I got the pad thai and red curry. The pan they use smokes the food perfectly. Really cozy place. And I met the owner at the gym once and she's really nice!
