author: Steph N.

description:
I ordered the prawn salad and the pad thai to go. I liked the salad better. It was spicy and sour all in one. The pad Thai was good but the chicken was a little dry. I think it's also a harder dish to eat to go because the noodles get clumped and lose their texture. I wouldn't order it again with the chicken. 

I waited a while for the takeout order so I would recommend calling in first. Make sure you ask for the chili/garlic sauce on the side!
author: Allison S.

description:
Legitimate Thai in the sunset with little/no parking (thankfully meters stop at 6pm). I've had Marnee on my yelpdar for a while (at least a year) but just now finally made the journey down 19th.

B R I E F  S U M M A R Y
-- Good luck with parking (residential & metered)
-- Small restaurant (can feel a bit cramped)
-- Reservation might have been a smart idea
-- Wait on Sat night for 3 was less than 20 minutes
-- Definitely had the "Mom & Pop" Thai restaurant feel
-- "Mama Thai" runs the restaurant and yells in Thai (staff is all Thai I think)
-- Authentic and legit Thai flavors and spice
-- Angel Wings *must try* spicy & flavorful basil peanut sauce
-- Tom Kha Gai soup: serving was small for 3 but great flavors and taste
-- Pad Thai is legit (not spicy)
-- Ask for Prick Nam Blah (Thai peppers in fish sauce) to spice up your food
-- Chicken green curry: great flavor, spicy and consistency

I sort of grew up on Mom & Pop Thai restaurants so when I was really happy with the overall ambiance and atmosphere of Marnee Thai. The only place that I can really compare it to is Osha since it's also in SF. Even though, they're both Thai, I feel like Marnee is a bit more traditional especially when compared to the Osha Cafe's like the one in Glen Park that I frequent. Overall I felt like Marnee had better flavor and were more authentic and traditional versus the more modern Osha.

After finding parking within a block *meant to be*, we waited for less than 20 minutes. I knew it was going to be busy, I mean it was Saturday night and we had just gotten out of a movie. I want to say it was around 6 or 7pm.

I tend to like Thai places that have a lot of character. Someone else on yelp referred to the elder Thai running the restaurant as "Mama Thai." I don't know if that's her nickname but it fits. You can tell she's been running a restaurant for a long time but she has a great personality and spirit. She took our order and was very vocal on suggestions and helpful with questions (not that we had many).

A N G E L  W I N G S: The last time I was out this way, I was at San Tung trying their famous chicken wings. My GF's Mom works nearby and insisted on the Angel Wings. Now I love chicken wings and I like San Tung's but I'm definitely more of a fan of Thai food and officially a fan of Marnee's Angel Wings. The last time I had some Angel Wings at Osha, I was disappointed. Marnee's wings were deep fried and dressed with a dark red sauce. You could taste the garlic, basil and spice plus there was some peanuts for texture and nuttiness. Be careful, the wings are super hot when they come out. I could probably eat a whole appetizer with some white rice and call it a night. You must try them if you're a chicken wings fan.

T O M  K H A  G A I: Also known as coconut soup with chicken, this is my favorite soup to get especially when I'm cold or sick. It came out mild but I added some peppers and took it to the next level of heat. There were so many great flavors coming out of the soup. The subtle sweetness of the coconut mixed with the lemongrass and ginger plus the spice of the Thai peppers makes this soup delish! I definitely recommend on a cold SF night.

P A D  T H A I: Whenever I go to a Thai restaurant, I have to at least try their Pad Thai because it's one of Thailand's most famous and popular street food. If you have good Pad Thai, you usually have good everything else in my experience. I was not disappointed at all. Marnee's Pad Thai had the right amount of sauce and again the flavors had lots of depth and freshness. I added some prick nam blah (ask for it) and it took it to another level. Pad Thai in general is sweet and savory but when you add the Thai peppers it gives it that "sweet heat" that Thai food is known for. Add jasmine rice to cut the overwhelming spicy and sweetness and you're on your way to a Thai food coma!

C H I C K E N  G R E E N  C U R R Y: I'm a big fan of green curry because it's usually served with some heat and it has eggplant. I've recently become a huge fan of eggplant and I was not disappointed here. The curry wasn't as creamy as I prefer but the flavors were still outstanding and rich. I mixed my curry with rice and devoured most of the curry myself. I loved the texture and taste of the eggplant with the chicken and rice.

Overall the meal was outstanding. We didn't wait too long for food. It seemed as if things were flying out of the kitchen. I was really happy with the service except the drink refills (which came eventually). I was very pleased with all of the dishes and I really enjoyed the character of Marnee. I'll definitely be back again!
author: Daniel D.

description: As soon as we entered we were transported back to our Thai honeymoon! Loved the yellow curry and the fresh coconut juice. Great fast service too.
author: Phoebe D.

description: Order 2 crab fried rice both came out very bland and no crab meat just felt like I was eating tasteless fried rice  I definitely would not recommend these place there are better Thai places out there
author: Alex N.

description: I had been going to Marnee Thai for decades.  We ordered take out yesterday and I could not believe it was so bland!  Also, it tasted more like Chinese food than Thai.  The pad thai had a piece of cabbage in it.  We  will not return.
author: John S.

description:
Please beware fellow dinners this place is not up to health standards and won't take any RESPONSIBILITY for their actions. I WILL NOT DINE HERE EVEN IF YOU PAY ME.

I have eaten here a couple of times. I use to think this place was really good but the most recent experience here will keep me from coming here ever again. I came here with my boyfriend for a late lunch before buying some groceries at Sunset Super down the street because we were hungry. 

I ordered the Pad Thai and my boyfriend ordered the Chicken fried rice. First couple of bites was great, I was complementing to my boyfriend how good it tasted. Then a few bites later I told my boyfriend I think there might be some egg shells in there. 

I didn't think much of it because I chewed it up already, no big deal, it happens in my mind it wont kill me. A couple of bites later, I'm still eating the "egg shells" or so I thought. 

Finally, I got a piece of the "egg shell" out of my mouth and I was gonna show my boyfriend. Well I realized it was not eggshells at all.. it was clear and shinny. At first I was like what is that and then I was horrified, because I realized it was a piece of GLASS and not egg shells, I had been chomping on for the past few minutes.

My boyfriend waived down the waiter and we showed him the piece of GLASS. He asked me if I'm okay. I told him I think so but I've already eaten some of it. I told him I didn't want it anymore, and to be honest I lost my appetite. He then waived down another lady I'm presuming is the owner.

Here is the double whammy of why I would not recommend this place.

She told me she can make another one for me. I told her I don't want another Pad Thai. She told me that there was nothing she can do and she can't give me any other dishes. I told her again I don't want it. But she kept insisting that she would pack it as a togo order. Okay at this point I was done talking; I didn't feel good, it made me sick just thinking I had ate glass. She comes back out with a packed Pad Thai and guarantees its new and a different one. Seriously, I wouldn't trust eating it, would you? 

We ask for the check, and yes we were still charged for the GLASS Pad Thai. I've never had this happen to me before but from my understanding shouldn't they at least comp my dish and not force me to take the same Pad Thai dish for take out. Which I won't eat anyways...Yes you guessed it, I threw it in the trash; I was not going to risk myself in eating more glass.

I have never in my life ingested glass, so I didn't know how harmful it can be till after I did some research on it when I returned home.

I consider myself to be a really nice person because I was in total shock and didn't complain or throw a fit at the restaurant, nor did I call the HEALTH DEPARTMENT. Which I should have at the restaurant. Oh well, I'll rant on yelp.
author: Susan K.

description:
The last tie we ate @ Marnee Thai we were @ the 9th Avenue locatoin & we thought the prices were higher there.  To test if that is really true, we came here to the Irving location aiming to order the same thing as last time to see if the bill would be any different.

We started out with the Homemade hotcakes which were both sweet & savory but not very well balanced.  I also wasn't too into the crispy on the outside, soft on the inside textural contrast.  We then moved on to the Pad prig khing which was garlicky, not too spicy, & just delicious.  We also had the Hung Lay curry which we usually loved.  But for some reason, the pork was though, there was very little sauce, & the presentation was pretty shabby.  We finished off with a Roti with coconut ice cream.  It was the most delicious thing all night but the awesomeness of the ice cream has definitely worn off.

We didn't order the exact same meal as when we were @ 9th Avenue but we ordered items that were the same price so it wouldn't unfairly affect the bill.  I tipped the usually 15% & our bill was $2 less.  We were right!  The be honest, even though the 9th Avenue locatoin is more expensive, it's probably worth it because the lighting is better there & there wasn't that traditional Thai music that would ring in my ears for hours to come.
author: Karen S.

description:
Came to Marnee Thai with my best friend for lunch.

I ordered the pad sew ew while he ordered the curry pork. I'm not a fan of curry or pork so I skipped it. My pad sew ew however was amazing. Better than what I had at Osha.

The staff are friendly and very efficient. I recommend coming here for the pad sew ew and an authentic experience.
author: Mabel Y.

description: Chan pad poo is great. Service is nice and fast. The environment is good for group of people to dine in. Price is reasonable. I will visit this place again soon!
author: Kai-Chuan H.

description:
Maybe this was a result of higher expectations. After seeing the restaurant reviewed on "Check Please, Bay Area", and raves from some friends, we finally made it down there while in the city.

We ordered the Spicy Angel Wings app. One word - amazing. These wings were smothered in a thick sauce that was like a hybrid of sweet Thai chili sauce, with a crap load of extra garlic, simmered down to a carmelized mess. They were so good that we ordered some to go before we left. 

So like I said, expectations were very high after this. Ordered two entrees, the braised pork belly stir-fry, and what I consider the measuring stick for all Thai joints, Penang Curry (beef, in this case). The pork belly dish was decent, but I wouldn't get it again. The Penang Curry was a complete miss. The beef was overcooked,  dry, and very tough, and it was served with steamed broccoli like it was a side dish. This was supposed to be a curry, onions, peppers, and other veg in a sauce. There was almost no sauce. I've been to Thai places where their curry was drowning in too much sauce (no like), but this was 180 degrees the other way. What a letdown.

One last thing, and if anybody actually reads this, please answer this question. Is it a West coast thing to charge for steamed rice? All the years I lived in Florida, and all the Thai/Viet places we went to, I can't ever remember being charged extra for rice. My mother was Indonesian. Steamed rice on the table at mealtime was like breathing air. Who eats a curry, stir-fry, etc, without rice? It just isn't done. But now I am.
author: Phil A.

description:
Passed by a million times but have never gone in.  Finally dined here.  Mama-- no, not moi, but my actual mother-- was feeling adventure-some.

Marnee Thai has been here forever (i.e. since childhood ;P).

Popular even on a Sunday and full of customers during an off hour between lunch and dinner.

Seldom do I try Thai, but I'm guessing Marnee does it as well as any.  Seems like homey comfort food.

We had a simmered pork in red curry, some pot stickers in green curry, and some rice.  Red was good, but think I liked the green curry better.  Both were spicy.

Prices are reasonable, and portions are modest.  That seems characteristic of Thai places.

Our water glasses were re-filled promptly.  Service is efficient and generally nice.

The elephant-theme crafts and art work decorating the walls are lovely.  Then again, if it were cows or goats, I would not be charmed at all.

Alright so, what have you learned here?

1) Jade no eat Thai food much

2) Jade loves elephants

Wait, don't hit the "useless" button yet.

3) Marnee Thai is a neighborhood establishment with decent fare.
author: Jade T.

description: We had reservation at 5:30 for 6.  We were on time so was seated immediately. Also know what to order cause they have a tendency to suggest specials which is usually more expensive items on the menu. Wasn't busy at the time but during the meal people started coming in and filling up the place.  There was a waiting list by 6pm.  The hosted kept trying to rush us through our meal.  Some were still eating when they asked us if we wanted dessert.  We said no.  5 minutes later they come to fill our tea and water glass and then return with the check yet people still was finishing up eating.  This is not the first time they rush us through our meal.  We were out of there in less than 1 hour!
author: Wally W.

description:
3.5 Stars.

I've been to the Marnee Thai on 9th and finally decided to eat at this one. The atmosphere is so different than the one on 9th. When you walk in, you feel like you're in Thailand or something with the bamboo covered walls and ceiling and the decor on the wall. 

I ordered the Chicken Yellow Curry with a side of rice (not included). It was so delicious and filled me up! It was not spicy (I was so glad) and had like 3 potatoes, a couple of carrots, and chicken pieces. The sauce was perfect and I could taste the spices in it.

Service was okay. I did feel neglected at times but I guess it wasn't unbearable or worth complaining. Just small things...

Guess I'll have to come back to try the angel wings that everyone raves about.
author: Lauren K.

description:
Came here for dinner last night, and yeah.....the reviews were right...awesome thai food! I've had my share of thai and laos food before and this place is pretty spot on with their flavors. 

On our visit, we ordered the papaya salad in medium spice which was a little too spicy for us but the flavors were good. I only wish they served it with cherry tomatoes instead of regular tomatoes, and cabbage instead of lettuce. We also ordered the chicken larb which was good, but a little too much lime juice. And finally, we also had their crab noodle which was AMAZING! Definitely would come back for that!

One MAJOR setback though........NO STICKY RICE! First time I've been to a thai restaurant that doesn't serve regular sticky rice.....that was a bummer :/
author: Marco M.

description:
this place used to be my go-to for thai food until i found a beetle/cockroach in my yellow curry take out. 

so disgusting.
author: P M.

description:
Had a great experience here for my first time!  Upon arrival, I wasn't sure what to expect based on the old-looking exterior, but once you enter Marnee Thai, the interior is clean and updated.  It has that authentic Thai feeling that comforts you, as well as the modern twist you want.  

It was around 12:30pm on a Saturday, and the BF and I got seated right away.  The service was quick and people came trickling in and made it a full house.  We had the spicy angel wings, thai potstickers, green curry, and shrimp pad thai. And WOWZA was I impressed!  

The chicken wings were packed with flavor and is a must-have for chicken wing lovers like myself.  I've never had thai potstickers so this was interesting for me, still good though.  The green curry was pretty standard, and didn't leave a heavy feeling in my stomach.  The pad thai was my favorite and definitely set the standard for me.  All in all, excellent experience.
author: Marissa K.

description: I went here awhile back so this is a much needed to rate, if your in the area and looking for quality Thai food this place is it. I went here with a group of 6 we called a head and they were very nice to put a few tables for are dinner party. Can't wait to come by and engoy some good food.
author: Seaera T.

description:
This is my absolute favorite Thai place in SF! Came here on a Friday night which wasn't packed thankfully, so we got seated right away. The service was absolutely wonderful& attentive,& all the food that we ordered was amazing! My friend&I were really hungry&excited for the food,so I had forgotten to take pics..nxt time! 

Chicken Satay Wraps - great start to our meal & was very light w/ the lettuce wraps
Pad Kaprow (Prawns&Calamari) - spicy but very delicious. The prawns&calamari were cooked perfectly
Pad Thai - my favorite noodle dish! Def recommend 
Green Curry - the flavors were amazing! Curry was soo good, not too thick but jst right. Def recommend as well

Overall, great experience w/ good food &company. Would def recommend trying when you're in the Outter Sunset area!
author: Trina N.

description:
Recently made the move from east bay to the city and finally decided to explore and find myself a new Thai restaurant. 


This place is awesome. Our waiter was super attentive (even with a full house and him being the only server). 

Things you have to try: the pad Thai (some of the best pad Thai I've ever had) and the yellow curry with chicken. And of course, Thai tea.

Mmmmmm I'm getting hungry just writing this. Try it. It will be your new favorite Thai place.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Gave me food poisoning so that was cool. Two stars for my two friends that didn't get food poisoning.
author: Ashleigh B.

description:
As a cracker living in the land of Asian food on Irving, I often receive spotty service and indifference from Asian staff at restaurants. That is never the case at Marnee Thai. 

The food is always flavorful and fresh (even delivery), and the staff is polite and efficient. 

Yes, it's always busy. For a reason.

They turn tables quickly, so this isn't a dawdle over your meal kind of place. With real estate what it is in SF, who can blame them. If you want to linger, go to the other Thai place down the street. There's never a line.
author: J. M.

description:
Just a note: The portions aren't American-sized portions so being on the smaller side, some of the other members of my party were quite disappointed since each plate cost $9-10. However, I thought it wasn't that big of a deal.

Spicy Angel Wings (4/5) - Deep fried wings with a sweet chili sauce and topped with (basil?). Definitely very delicious. Actually is reminiscent of San Tung wings, but with a slight sweet twist.

Beef Satay (2/5) - Thinly sliced beef, grilled to medium-well served aside a small portion of fresh veggies with a light dressing and peanut sauce. Great mix, but I wish it was cooked a little more on the medium well side.

Pad Garlic Pork (3/5) - Sliced pork cooked simply with garlic and black pepper. Pork was cooked just right.

Pad Nor Mai Chicken (3/5) - Garlic, bamboo shoots, egg and basil to accompany the hero of this dish - the chicken. Chicken was not dry or stringy; the other components played nice without overpowering the chicken.

Pad Thai (2/5) - Prawn pad thai with rice stick noodles, bean sprouts and a slight hint of peanuts. Although the prawns were cooked right, the dish didn't impress and was actually a bit heavier than anticipated.

Woonsen Vegetable (3/5) - Silver noodles (clear noodles), mushrooms, egg, broccoli, bean sprouts, cucumber, baby corn and green onion. Simple sautee with light seasoning.
author: Gabriel C.

description: this is the worst service place in USA I come. I came here with my 3 other friends after work and I am not really want to eat. we order 3 meal and the owner come to said that she not service 3 order for 4 people. that is the fucking rule service  I hear in this country. and she said have to charge 10 dollars extra for the person not eat. what that feaking funny reason hear. I will never to come back and tell all my friends about this
author: Van L.

description:
The BEST THAI I've eaten in SF and I've been hunting for 15 years plus! 
This place has great staff and prices as well for this authentic and delicious, FRESH thai!
my favorite was the coconut noodles and their salads are SPOT ON.
I rarely come to this part of SF but I can't wait to trek over again just for Marnee!
author: shanestar h.

description:
This is the best Thai food I have ever eaten. Ever. 

Parking sucks, but it is S.F. Still worth the 20 minute circling for a parking spot. Once you've parked, your golden. The food is worth the wait. 

We tried the coconut fish cooked in a banana leaf, the coconut cakes, the Thai fried rice, eggplant, and two beef dishes (one a noodle dish - do not remember the names of these). All the dishes were excellent. I still dream about the coconut fish and the coconut cakes, two Thai dishes I had never had before. 

Great place, unique food. A standout even in S.F!
author: Nora S.

description: My favorite spot for tom yum goong and angel wings.... BOMB!!! Oh and their meung kum. I think i spelled that wrong but whatevz. Owner comes out hella loud to speak to the customers and mingle and she is super nice. The place is small and cute but sometimes there is a wait. Other than that i love it!!!
author: Theresa M.

description:
I would probably give 3 or 4 stars for the food, but the customer service shot this rating up to the top.  The GF and I came here about half and hour to an hour before closing.  There was about two or three other tables eating when we got inside.  The menu was fairly large, so lots to choose from.  The GF wanted to order this corn/coconut type cake from their seasonal menu.  We also ordered the mango fried rice, as well as the Guay Tiew Koor.  

The appetizer was very interesting- I do not think we were expecting what we got.  We got about half a dozen pastry puffs filled with coconut, taro, pumpkin, and corn.  They were really hot, and served on a hot plate type deal, which I am guessing keeps it warm.  It was pretty good, and something very unusual to taste/see.  Here is where one example of good customer service came into play.  The waitress gave us a lid to put on top of the plate in order to preserve the warmth of the pastries.  

The Guay Tiew Koor was nothing special-- just chow fun.  I could have made it myself.  There was one part of the meal were a noodle got stuck in my throat for a short period of time. That was quite uncomfortable!  Moving on, since I do not think you care about what got stuck down my throat....

The mango fried rice was quite good.  I honestly have never seen fried rice offered with mango at any restaurants.  I have only seen pineapple fried rice.  The mango fried rice definitely tastes better than the pineapple.  It is sweeter,  and less acidic.  I feel like it compliments the rice more too.  

Good food, but more importantly, great customer service.  Right when you walk in, to the minute that you leave, they make you feel like welcomed guests.  That is truly hard to find these days.
author: Victor L.

description: We ordered coconut hot cake, duck red curry and pao something I forgot the name. Food was great. Taste great and the staff was friendly. The coconut hot cake wasn't sweet, so if you want something sweet, get a dessert. Last, if each dish has more food, I would come here a lot more often. It wasn't a big portion
author: Nancy H.

description:
"Feels like I'm in a little shack" - that's what I said to my boyfriend at dinner here last night. 

It's a small place & pretty comfy & cute. Service was good. We ordered...

Spicy Angel Wings - not really spicy but pretty good.
Chicken Pad See Ew - yum.
Thai Iced Tea- yummers!
Sticky Rice w/ Mango- yummiest!

Would definitely be back again :)

Ps: they dimmed the lights during our mid-dinner. Romantique :)
author: Amy C.

description:
We came here on a Sunday night, expecting good food. The place was totally full, and we waited right inside the entry way for a while hoping to catch the attention of the hostess, before realizing that you must cross through the restaurant to the back counter in order to putyour name down. The hostess/grand dame of the restaurant seated us as quickly as she could, adding a third chair to a table of two, which the waiters then had to dance around the rest of the night. The interior of the place is lined with woven reed mats and there are old school Christmas lights hanging from the ceiling, and beer bottles lining the interiors of the planters. Definitely a smaller, different vibe from the 9th street location.

We are vegetarian and ordered the corn hotcakes, green papaya salad, pad see ew noodles, green pumpkin curry, and tofu praram.

Green papaya salad was standard. The pad see ew was delicious and perfect and had cauliflower in it which we enjoyed -- we judge and compare thai restaurants by this dish and they passed with flying colors. The corn hotcakes were not fritters, or really anything like pancakes, as one might expect-- they were closer to quiche or flan in consistency and tasted like coconut. We enjoyed the flavor of the pumpkin curry immensely, but wished it had more pumpkin in it. Tofu praram sauce was delicious,  but the tofu it covered was deep fried (and not fresh deep fried) which took away from the dish.

The true highlight of coming here was watching this grand dame dim the lights, beat the gong, and lead the restaurant in singing "Happy Birthday" to various customers who presumably were celebrating their birthdays. This happened no less than three times, and each time she followed the song with a speech tailored to the individual that was part benediction and part stand-up comedy. Phenomenal.

We will be back, probably for a birthday, in the near future.
author: T K.

description: Wow!!! This place is amazing and definitely exceed my expectation. I tried their pad kee maw and it was the best ever I have in Bay Area!!! Highly recommend this place!!!!!
author: Kirsten W.

description:
Love it! Crave it! I've enjoyed every dish...
Caution: when you ask for spicy... behold... Spicy!
I never hesitate to stop after coming from the SF Science Academy or The de Young Museum.
author: Teresa S.

description: Delicious food! This isn't your generic Thai restaurant (but they do have pad Thai if that's your thing). I always try their new specials and I have never been disappointed! Yummy!
author: Chase B.

description: Great in expensive Thai food! Had the chicken satay and pad se ew and it was amazing! Would come again!
author: Melanie T.

description:
Marnee Thai is a staple in San Francisco and definitely a must try Thai restaurant.  The location on Irving and 23rd is a bit smaller and can get quite crowded on weekends and evening so reservations are highly recommended if you don't want to wait hours.  Another note on the size of the restaurant, since it is so small, the tables are all squished up together and you could be sitting backs and elbows to the tables next to you. 

Must try dishes here are:

-Spicy angel wings: so good, they have a nice sweet glazed texture

-Pad kaprow (chicken): it's basically minced chicken. It's super flavorful and a nice meat dish to have with rice

-Chan pad poo: personally really like this because it has crab meat and a sweeter taste (and it's a nice alternative to always eating the generic pad thai which is also very good here) 

-Pork with string beans (not sure what it's called but this is basically what it is): favorite veggie dish here
author: Truc D.

description:
Food here is pretty delicious and ambiance was good.  

Made reservations for 6 here at 7:30pm and still had to wait.  Wasn't too happy about that, but at least the wait was only for about 15 minutes.  

-1 star for being so crowded that the servers walking by will bump into you.
author: Jenny L.

description:
I've been here about 15 times and now finally writing a review.

Marnee Thai, you will be my only go to place for thai food. I made the mistake of trying other places and I will never do that again! SoCal's Thai food CANNOT compare to this. Marnee's dishes are cooked to perfection. Their awards are well deserved!

Pad Thai: 3.5 stars. When I first came here about a year ago, their pad thai was a 5 star for me but I dont know why the quality went down... It was the only dish I ordered every time I came here, but not anymore. However, it still beats other restaurants. You can choose chicken or beef and it comes with prawns. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/marnee-thai-san-francisco?userid=sd4E5iKUZotDEeiF3cC81Q#TWD-IJtcTjsp5ZAt_TcTZg
Pad Kee Mao: 4.5 stars. Cook to perfection. There was a lot of flavor to it and this was basically thick flat noodles with sauce over it and you can choose whatever meat you like with it. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/marnee-thai-san-francisco?userid=sd4E5iKUZotDEeiF3cC81Q#tOSN0OjzMB5zTASFmKxZTA
Pineapple Fried Rice: 3.5 stars. Maybe I'm picky, but it's a little bland. However, it is still good. It was rich with pineapple, chicken/beef (whichever your ordered), and prawns. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/marnee-thai-san-francisco?userid=sd4E5iKUZotDEeiF3cC81Q#WcSUyRH_EzUfqKua1m93DA
Pad See Ew: 3.5 stars. My friends LOVE this dish. I personally think it's average. It is definitely full of flavors. This is basically flat noodles with beef/chicken (your choice but I personally think it's better with beef) and eggs. 
Thai Iced Tea: I personally never tried it before because I ALWAYS head to Teaway after, but my friends tell me it's pretty good. 

+Parking: good luck. street parkings! BUT after 6:00pm its free at meters!
+Service: Waiters and Waitress were very friendly and it felt very homey. 
+Ambiance:  the interior was very unique. Walls were decorated with a type of bamboo material and I was kinda in the feel of Thailand. The restaurant was VERY small though. If you come at a good time, you will have the restaurant to yourself, but if you come during dinner the wait is kind of long and you will be right next to the tables next to you.
author: Chena N.

description:
I've been here a few times before and it's one of my go to Thai places. However I came here last night and was somewhat disappointed. I ordered the Duck Pad See Ew which is usually a slightly sweet but savory dish with a generous amount of duck stirred in. This time the noodles were salty and soggy. There wasn't much meat either, mainly pieces of duck skin. I was sad because the Duck Pad See Ew never disappointed me before.

My friend got the Seafood Curry with Rice, it was only a curry and the rice had to be ordered separately. It tasted amazing, very smooth and creamy, just the right consistency to pair with rice. But for the portion size and price, it should have come with rice.

The waitresses weren't very attentive either. We wanted our waters to be refilled but they didn't notice when we tried ot get their attention. They were busy spraying their orchids with water. The flowers got water before we did! :(
author: Anna F.

description:
I'm not being a hater, but really, a bunch of 4 or 5 stars?  I don't know if we ordered the wrong things, but it just seemed like it was missing oomph!  We got pad thai & the pad prew wharn which was chicken sauteed with pineapple, tomatoes, cucumbers, & onions in a sweet and sour sauce.  Bf wanted that dish....I think he really likes sweet n sour chicken, as for me, (even at a Thai restaurant) I call it a fake Chinese dish!  

Maybe I'm just so used to going to Vanida Thai on Taraval, where we get different things, but the pad thai there has more flavor and the portions are bigger for the same if not a little less money.  Service was fine and food came out fairly fast.
author: Cat C.

description:
Actually 3.5 stars. 

Promised 15 minute pickup took over half an hour....not that big a deal.

Food was okay: You ever wake up with the salty effect? Yeah me too...it happened here.

23 veggie Kang ra re....pretty good although some of the potatoes were not fully cooked....nice and spicey though

25 kang keaw...another curry but green....I really did not like this. It was oily the eggplant was grey and it was not flavorful.

40 BBQ pork...ding ding ding...winner winner chicken dinner. This was an excellent dish..lotsa meat and flavor.

57...the ubiquitous vegetarian pad thai....good okay ehhh....was fine but not wow.

55  Guay Tiew Koor pan-fried wide rice noodles with chicken, egg, bean sprouts and ground peanuts ,,,,,,a very good vegetarian dish....surprisingly good.

Over all for the price you cannot beat Thai Time....they just do it soooo much better..and even though they are crazy busy...they always get it out on time.
author: David G.

description:
Stoked about this place since I did some research around the SF area for the best thai place and came across Marnee.

Located in a relatively chinese neighborhood in Sunset, I was surprised to find Marnee here. I came in for dinner and away from the streets I was taken into a settled thai ambiance. The interior was shaped like a hut, look up to the ceiling and you'll see what I mean. The whole place was wrapped with bamboo or straw and decorated with exotic plants. Humble soft instrumental music was playing. I felt like I was in the tropics.

After narrowing down my choices, I came down to Angel sticky wings for appetizers, chan pad poo for the entree and mango with sticky rice for dessert. Service was quick and the wait staff was very attentive, my water was refilled nearly every 2 - 3 mins. The wait staff even checked up on us too which is rare compared to the asian cuisine I've tried so far in SF.

The angel sticky wings were delish!!!! Holy moly, I don't know what sauce it is but it's finger licking good!!!! I loved the crispy leaves that was topped over the wings. Tip: while ordering any spicy dish, be careful with the level of spice. I got mild and I was still able to taste the spiciness on my lips afterward.

The chan pad poo was just as amazing. The noodles were soft and tender, there was a lot of flavors in the dish. It was piping hot while served and still hot while I ate it. Steam was coming out the whole time. Yet it didn't burn my tongue. The only flaw with the dish would be the lack of peanuts but that's because I always love having peanuts in my thai dishes. It feels like a necessity.

Lastly, the grand finale, the mango sticky rice. It was a savory chunk of sticky rice drizzled with coconut sauce and paired with a generous serving of freshly sliced mango. The combination of both sticky rice and mango was delectable. The sauce was a great compliment for the mango as well.

Another note, this is the FIRST restaurant I've tried in San Francisco that had the aroma of the food flowing from the dish itself. I smelled the wings while the waitress was walking toward me. The food was also served right off the grill yet it was still warm enough to eat! Such perfect timing.

Given in mind for the price and quality, Marnee is off the roof. They give 5+ stars quality and service for a small and reasonable price. This is definitely one of my favorite thai restaurants of ALL TIME.

Marnee holds the quality of everything a thai restaurant should be. Authentic, flavorful and spicy.

So if you're in the area, skip all those chinese restaurants. It's a waste of money and time. Come to Marnee for an authentic experience and phenomenal thai cuisine. I promise you, you'll be taken to another place the moment you step in. The music they play does wonders in blocking out any outside noise. 


Marnee, you've outdone yourself compared to the thai cuisines in NY. You are #1 on my list. Keep it up!!!!
author: Virginia Y.

description:
Restaurant was bustling even after the lunch rush but there was an empty table so we got seated right away.

Servers seemed to have their hands full. Took a while even get water (which I had to ask for twice).

Had the special and a chef's dish (#42?).

Crab mango salad. Sauce is light, tangy, a little sweet and spicy. Mangoes used seemed to be cut near the rind so they were a bit firm and not too sweet, which provided a nice texture.

Chef's dish was fantastic -- ample pulls of chicken, and just a little spicy. Can't recall the dish too well as it wasn't all that memorable, but a good staple nonetheless.

Will come back after I finish my tour of the neighborhood.
author: Christophe C.

description: Good little Thai place. Had a special coconut stirfry noodle dish that was great as was the coconut soup and wings. Restroom is tiny but clean. Fresh orchids on the tables are a nice touch.
author: Mark J.

description:
Man, this place was delicious!
I know it was busy, but I think we came at the perfect time and were seated right away.  My poor cousins had a difficult time finding parking and were driving around for a quite a while. I hear that is how it is in SF! We did family style ordering all sorts of things! We tried I think 7 different dishes from curry to the fried fish to the garlic chicken and peppered rice to my favorite little white dish with corn and onions on it.  Everything was packed with booming flavors that satisfied all sorts of cravings.  It fed 6 of us :) We had to get the thai iced tea too!  We loved everything and the service was quick, helpful, and kind. Love this place.
author: Alyssa Y.

description: The best Thai food I've ever had! It's a must if you're coming in to the city and if you become a regular they'll take extra time to chat with you. The green curry potstickers and Pad See Ew are the best!
author: Catherine G.

description:
Was feeling a little sick and wanted some Thai soup. I was particularly craving pumpkin curry soup so I ordered the red curry pumpkin soup with chicken and a side of white rice. So many flavors with tons of chicken and melt in your mouth kabocha squash. I'm pretty sure I could have poured the curry into a wine glass and sipped on that sumbitch with my pinky up. Do yourself a favor and pack a nice ball of rice on your fork and dip it in the curry, trust me, you won't be disappointed! Next time I'm going to try the spicy green curry since the red curry was too mild for me. 

Definitely one of my favorite neighborhood thai restaurants in the Sunset.
author: Nick L.

description: I went with my cousin who is a regular here. She loves this place so I let her order for us and everything was so delicious. We shared the angel wings, chicken red curry, garlic fried scallop and shrimp (customized, not on menu), this dish with eggplant in it, mango and sticky rice, and the roti. We had thai iced coffees to drink. I have never left a restaurant so satisfied. Best thai food!
author: Nessa R.

description:
I came here with a friend few days ago. My friend highly recommended their Angel Wings, so I gave it a shot. OHEMGEE, the sauce is amazingly good!! Although the menu marks this dish as spicy, it is really not. Its sweet and honey taste that I just couldn't get enough of it! 

Besides the Angel Wings, we also ordered the Honey/Sweet BBQ Pork over Rice. This dish was not bad, but definitely can't compare with the Angel Wings sauce. In addition to this BBQ pork rice, we ordered a coconut milk baked with fish fillet and veggie dish as our entree. I think this coconut milk bake is called something like "Hah Mu." The fish and veggie are wrapped in some long leaves and covered with creamy red curry-looking sauce topped with creamy (not "liquidy") coconut milk. It is not spicy even the waitress told me that it is. I personally do not really like it. 

Lastly, we ordered the Sticky Rice with Mango as dessert (this is the whole reason that we came to this restaurant). We ordered way too much food, so in the end, we both had take-outs :p. But we finished the delicious dessert in the end. When the warm sticky rice with salty coconut milk is being eaten with a small slice of fresh mango, it creates this heavenly as well as a blasting (warm rice + cold mango) feelings. I was not expecting the combination would be so GOOOOD! After the first bite, I just could not stop eating it even though I was already full from the previous dishes. 

If you were going to eat at this place, I would recommend their ANGEL WINGS and the Sticky Rice with Mango! :)
author: Pui L.

description: Awesome food and friendly service! Highly recommend soft-shell crab papaya salad and spicy angel wings as appetizers!
author: thuy l.

description: Tasted great 15 years ago and still is now. I asked for spicy the lady gave me the 'are you sure' look. Dish wasn't as spicy as if like but it's yummy :). Will be coming for more, for sure
author: Yen T.

description: Marnee Thai definitely fools a lot of people. It's over priced for what it is and you could definitely get Thai food for cheaper with more flavor pretty much anywhere else. Just because the restaurant looks a little fancier than other Thai places and the prices are higher, does not mean at all that the food is better.
author: Jillian Y.

description: Great place to go and eat! Highly recommend this if you are if the area. Had the mango fried rice and it was amazing!
author: Alexa C.

description:
Thai food is my favorite (next to burgers) and I've been boasting Marnee for years! I've not been disappointed walking out of this place until my most recent visit.

I've been on a Massaman Curry hype for the last year and knew that I HAD to order it at Marnee during my next visit. To my surprise I was very disappointed in their version. Extremely watery and not that flavorful.. I hate to say even I make a better massaman curry and I've only cooked thai dishes a little more than a handful of times..The chicken was super tender, that was pretty much the only good thing about it unfortunately... 

But! Other than that I've always left satisfied. The wings live up to the hype for sure! My boyfriends not even a big fan of Asian/sweeter wings but he enjoys these ones. I also love their "golden triangles" which is pretty much like a pumpkin samosa, super yummy. I've also enjoyed their yellow and green curries...and although I'm not a huge pad thai person I love theirs! I enjoy how theirs is a little more spicy than it is sweet unlike other places...

This place used to be pretty cheap and now, not so much...but with SF being so expensive and their popularity I don't blame them. I hope my most recent experience was just a "bad trip" (everything else was good though) and not a sign of them going downhill. Still looking forward to another visit in the future..

side note... I've been to both of their spots but personally prefer this one. I like that it kind of has a "hut" feel to it...the other is cramped in the front room and semi bougie in the back.
author: Melissa C.

description:
I live in the sunset and have been here a couple of times. The good is pretty good but I feel like most Thai places in the sunset is pretty up to par in standards. I choose to go here because it's a friend of a friend's family restaurant. 

Today something happened where they charge another patron for my order. They said I should go home and get cash bc they couldn't fix it in the system. I live maybe a 10 min drive away but it is such a hassle. Couldn't they just write up another ticket yo charge me? They really had my food already. It was all so silly. I had $26 on me and the bill was $36. I don't expect them to give it to me for $26 but at this point, they've lost not only the $10 but the $26 too!! It was absolutely not my mistake and she acknowledges that. It's just upsetting that she had me standing there and didn't try to explain till I asked if there was something wrong with my card. There was no effort to come across apologetic. I even explained  out of frustration how easily it would be to just walk down the street to another restaurant.

It was all just so silly... Food is good but service is inconsistent.
author: Wanster L.

description:
Blech.

I rarely ever write a bad review. Especially when it comes to a spat on bad service or something else inane. However, this review is only for the food.

WTF? This was a mushy disgusting mess. 

I got two things: green mango salad with crab and  green curry with chicken. My order was for take out. I ordered when I got to the restaurant so my food never sat around. It was quiet in there and the food was piping hot when I got home.

I live right around the corner. 

The green curry already had a film of oddly colored oil at the top. The coconut milk used in the curry smelled rancid. I asked for extra eggplant and got it- but it was so overcooked that it was brown and the purple skin had faded. There was too much salt. There was no trace of other vegetables. Everything was a mushy, ugly brown mess. 

The mango salad wasn't green- it was fully ripened. The crab on top was fried to oblivion. There was no cilantro. There was so little mango. I paid $13 for this dish?

Never again. I'm going to drive out to Thai Time next time. It's really not that hard to make Thai food with some fresh veggies. UGH.

I SPENT $27 on this mess? UGH.
author: Priya S.

description:
I love Marnee Thai. 

They make the best Angel Wings! Their pad see ew is so flavorful. Their pad thai is perfect. Their service here is amazing as well. Usually when I go to asian restaurants I'm used to service lacking, but not here. They are so nice especially the lady with the short hair. It is little small inside, but I don't even care about that. The food is just that delicious, yummy, and worth every penny. 

Always consistent, portions are on point, and service is great!
author: Celeste M.

description: This place is OK but smells like fish sauce.  We ordered pad thai, chicken satay, mango curry, and tea leaf salad.   Food wasn't bad but not great either.
author: Ishi C.

description: The pad thai was delicious and the fried rice was okay. The service was nice; we were seated immediately and the waitress did a check in on us. Things to try on the menu: avocado salad and yum woon sen. At the end of our meal, we also received guava candy (yay!). Great place to stop by if you're craving Thai food around Irving.
author: Cat B.

description:
Homemade coconut cream cake things are yummy.
Green papaya salad very yummy.
Basa filet with the #2 sauce spicy mushroom thing was alright.
Young coconut with the juice served to you in a coconut was refreshing I just wish they had a coconut service to scoop the meat out for you.
Then the roti with coconut ice cream was tasty. 

Service was good the food came out fast. I want to come back to try the curry dishes. Definitely come in and try it if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Clara H.

description:
Just arrived in San Fran for a short visit and while wondering the street we stopped a couple and asked for a recommendation.  We got a very enthusiastic "GO TO MARNEE THAI!" so we did.. and are very happy about it!  Fabulous Massaman Curry  and a chicken peanut dish over spinach that was also wonderful.  

Friendly efficient service.  would definitely recommend and would return if we hadn't also gotten enthusiastic reviews of three other places for our remaining two nights.

**and as I read a few other reviews one touched on something I thought as well--the portion sizes were noticeably smaller than when we get the same dishes at home in FL, which is really fine since we didn't need the leftovers, but thought everyone ought to know.
author: Barbara G.

description:
It's 7:11pm on a Saturday night and it's packed! Seriously, no moving room and my boyfriend brings up, "this is a fire hazard." I glanced around and there are no signs for "maximum capacity ____". The staff are very attentive and nice. They come quickly to take your order. The turn around time is relatively fast. I JUST WISH THEY DIDNT TRY TO CRAM EVERYONE IN AT ONCE. I understand this is a business but I also appreciate personal space without waiters brushing into me and people bumping into my chair as they try to get by. 

However, angel wings are fucking good. Angel wings over San Tung wings
author: Norman L.

description:
Tom kha gai - on the sour side. Not the best probably not worth it won't be ordering again.

Angel wings - reminiscent of San Tung up the street. One of their employees must've snuck their and stole the formuoli in the night. Honey garlic glaze with some spice. WORTH.

YUM woon sen - dope; after the noodles are gone you gotcha self a nice little salad. 

"BBQ chicken" Shaq voice - pretty solid but also a pretty staple dish in any restaurant. Not super impressed but I still ate it 

Green curry - kind of watery, not packed with flavor, eggplant didn't live up to the hype   

Thai tea - dope as always

They have two ply in the bathroom !!!!!!
author: Tommy H.

description:
I have no idea how this place has 4 stars!
This place is a joke. Actually the worst customer service I've ever seen.. So bad it was comical. Firstly they say they take bookings but really it's first come first serve... so be prepared to wait outside in the cold. The tables are so close together you are practically eating your meal on the persons lap next to you... We got moved table after we had been seated for 15 minutes... I had to ask for my beer 4 times... The owner yells continuously over everyone's head while you are eating with no regards for the people seated... Albeit the food, when it does finally arrive, is pretty decent.. Hence the 2 stars. However good the food - not worth the stress. Try somewhere else.
author: Barry G.

description:
The only thing that justifies giving even half a star to this played out, overhyped lootsuck is that it's about as good as the other Thai places in the Sunset. 
That is to say, it's fine, but my latest experiences here and at other places made me realize that very often it's customer service and all that entails that matters more than food. San Francisco is rich in decent neighborhood eateries, and the only ones that stand out to me are the ones that have excellent customer service, and the ones that have terrible customer service. Marnee Thai falls into the latter column.
In my latest visit I ordered ahead on Eat24 and my wife went on her way home to pick it up. They treated her like dirt and gave her a hard time when she tried to pick up (she wasn't aware that my order showed up under my Yelp handle, not my real name. Rather than trying to help her sort it out, they told her to get lost. They eventually sorted it out, but not in a pleasant way. My wife is generally a nicer and easier going person than me, so when she tells me that somebody was rude to her, I believe it. When I called Marnee Thai to voice my displeasure with the way they handled the situation, the person on the line argued with me about what had happened and why. A simple apology would have sufficed, but this person doubled down on justifying their rude behavior. She put more effort into arguing with me on the phone than she put into helping my wife when she was there in person. That was the straw that broke the camel's back for me. We won't be returning or reordering from them ever again.
And by the way, the food we ordered that night was mediocre at best - bland eggplant, gross pad Thai, dry flabby chicken. 
If you want good Thai food paired with better than average service, hit up Chabaa or Sri Thai instead.
author: Jay L.

description:
This restaurant is consistently excellent.  I have eaten here dozens of times & have never been disappointed.  The dishes are well rounded & very flavorful, & each flavor is distinctive.  The wait staff are friendly & attentive, the dining room is clean & inviting, and the bathroom is always clean & stocked.  This is the kind of place you would want to bring out-of-towners to brag up the Culinary Arts of SF.  I have eaten at alot of Thai restaurants & I still have not found one that holds a candle to Marnee.  Take advantage of this little slice of heaven right here on Earth! They have 2 locations.  I like the Irving one better because of the awesome bamboo decor and wider dining room (9th Ave location is long & narrow).  Otherwise, food quality is the same.

I have so many favorite dishes that it takes me forever to decide! I just love & would totally recommend any of the following: Chan Pad Poo (crab stirfried with rice noodles), banana curry with pork (on the specials menu), red curry with chicken or vegetable protein, most of the "Pads" (Pad Kaprow with chopped chicken, Pad Phed, Pad Prig Pao), Angel Wings (award winning recipe), potstickers with green curry sauce (on specials menu), Tom Ka & Tom Yum.  Skip the regular old Thai dishes you are used to ordering (Pad Thai, Param Pak, Chicken Satay, etc) & go for a new dish you have never tried.  You will not be sorry!!!
author: Charm D.

description:
Greatest pad Thai I've ever had.  Price is a little bit high, but that's to be expected from a Thai restaurant.  The place was packed and their service was very slow.  It took a good 10-15 minutes to order, which was pretty irritating.  The waiter was not very friendly, maybe because the restaurant was so busy, but it still would have been nice if he gave us better service.

Update: I heard that they closed for a little while because of a pest infestation. I'm glad they fixed that issue...! Didn't know they had those problems before!
author: Sally Y.

description: If I'm ever craving Thai food in the Sunset, I always end up here. The pad thai has never let me down, its just that good every single time! The tom yum soup also tastes amazing but remember to add an order of noodles. It says it feeds 2-3 people but I finished it myself. Parking is a bit hard to find during dinner time and sometime there is a line for this place. Overall, I would recommend this restaurant.
author: Maybo L.

description:
Usually most Thai places taste about the same to me, but Marnee Thai is actually a standout! I came on a Sunday at 7:30pm so parking was really easy since all metered parking is free Sunday after 6. Also, for a party of 2 we got seated immediately. 

However, once seated, it became obvious how overcrowded the restaurant was. It was pretty awkward, because the couple next to us was seated uncomfortably close. I was sitting closer to the stranger next to me than my date across the table. Our 2 tables were only like 1-2 inches apart so it was basically a communal table. And to the other side of us, they tried to squish a 5 person group in a 4 person table so sometimes when I ate, my hand would accidentally bump into the back of the person sitting in the other table. Another minus is that when we ordered, our waitress (she might have been the owner?) kept pushing us to order another special they had that I didn't want to the point where it made me feel kind of awkward and I had to make up a fake excuse that I didn't like taro lol.

But onto the food! We ordered:

- Golden triangles: These are Thai samosas stuffed with pumpkin/potato/curry. It was probably the best samosa I've ever had! 
- Stir fry Pork Belly Stew (one of their specials): I usually only order either curry or a noodle dish when I go eat Thai, but I'm so glad I tried something new! The pork belly was not only full of flavor, but it was also super melt-in-your-mouth tender. They also put a tiny bit of coconut milk on top and it was perfect!
- Pad Thai: I was craving noodles, so I got the Pad Thai but it was just alright, very average. I wouldn't recommend it, because there are much better dishes here that you can get. The flavor was okay, but there wasn't enough eggs. I would recommend the Guay Tiew Koor for noodles because it has bigger/more flavorful pieces of fried egg and fried egg is awesome.
-Hot Tea: costs $1.25/person but there is someone constantly refilling the tea so you never have cold tea!

Overall, I would definitely be back for takeout (definitely a 5 star takeout restaurant), but because it's so overcrowded I would hesitate before coming in for a sit -down experience. Still, the food is awesome!
author: Christina L.

description:
Well let's with greetings. Very dry demeanor. Non welcoming staff. We ordered the red curry and it's the worst water like curry I have ever had. Chicken was hard and had no flavor.

Service was rude. I am amazed at reading the reviews. I came in after reading the reviews.

Totally disappointed. Lacks taste and service needs a tutorial
author: Ash K.

description:
I watch a lot of community supported television. One of my favorite shows on KQED is Check Please Bay Area! Once again, I set out to try another one of their featured restaurants. This time Marnee Thai was on my to-try list.  I decided to bring the parentals and grandparentals with me for dinner.

On tv everything looks bigger right? The restaurant looked a lot bigger when it was shown on the program. It's nice and cozy but for the 5 of us, we were a bit cramped at our table. We wanted to sit at a larger table but the waitress said it was reserved. 

The portions were a bit on the smaller size so maybe that also looked larger on tv as well. We ordered the green curry pork, sauteed prawn and scallop, sauteed chicken, tom yum soup, pad se-ew and pumpkin curry. Everything was alright. There were no standout dishes. We also got the mango sticky rice for dessert. I thought it was a little disappointing. The rice was very mushy and the mango slices were a bit skimpy. Overall average Thai food. The service was OK, nothing too memorable.
author: Liv A.

description: Boy is this place overrated. First, yes  loud and noisy. Second, we just ate there last night, having searched far and wide for the best Thai in San Francisco. This aint it, I can tell you. Delicious? I think not. Maybe if you dont know Thai food. Or have low standards. We ordered the Tea Leaves Salad as an appetiser. That was fairly good, but way too much lettuce. Also under appetiser the kling something pork, spicy wrapped in lettuce cups. That was pretty good, and spicy as promised. Then things went south. The banana (plantain) chicken red curry was unacceptable. Chicken tasted freezer-burned and was tough. We ordered the dish spice and it was actually not only mild but bland and tasteless. Weird for Thai food. Not enough sauce. When we sent it back for a more spicy sauce, they just sprinkled a bunch of red pepper on top. How lame is that. We sent it back and ordered instead the Pad Prig (spicy chicken stir fry.) That also came with red pepper sprinkled on top. It was spicy but an extremely dull boring uninspired dish. What a disappointment this place is. It is just plain mediocre. Good Thai food is really fantastic. This doesnt come close. All the reviews and stars  - there is zero passion in the food. Riding on their (undeserved) reputation, folks who know no better think it's good. The best Thai, as far as I have experienced, in SF is: Thep Phanoum on Fillmore, and Lemongrass on Polk is also quite good.
author: Anne B.

description: 5 stars! The food is so good; especially the pad Thai (cliche I know) and the sweet and sour chicken. A little bit pricey but definitely worth it!!
author: Crystal X.

description:
I've been here twice. The first experience probably would have gotten a 4 or 5 star rating from me. Solid food and nothing bad about the service. But the most recent time I went, the SERVICE WAS TERRIBLE and so condescending!

I went with 4 other friends on a wednesday night (it was New Years Day). The place wasn't full but it had a good amount of people in it. Everything was fine but just the way one of the waitresses would talk to us was so condescending, as if we didn't know anything.

What really annoyed me was when we had to pay. 2 of my friends paid with cash and then I was putting the rest of the tab on my card. I KNOW to give a 15% tip from the total receipt. I've been to enough restaurants to thats what you do. But the lady insisted that she add the tip onto the total. I kept telling her no because I'm going to add it on my card. But she kept saying that its what they have to do.

BULL.

First of all, you've been kind of annoying the whole night so I DON'T actually have to tip you 15%. But it was a holiday so why not. But the fact that you act like we're not smart enough to tip the regular amount is so annoying. PLUS SHE ADDED THE TIP BEFORE TAX WHICH INCREASED THE TOTAL BILL.

...okay it only increased it by like $1....

BUT STILL. ITS THE PRINCIPLE OF IT.

anyway, terrible experience. I'm not going back. It's thai food. Thai food tastes the same everywhere.
author: Gregg H.

description: Marnee Thai was highly recommended to us and two years ago, yes, we thought it was quite good. But tonight we were sadly disappointed in the quality of the food and the shabby condition of the place.  Then a cockroach crawled down the wall right by our table.  Yeew!!! Never again.
author: Avon L.

description:
I was in the mood for some good thai food, and this place popped out with good reviews, and right across from a nice ramen joint across the street. 

Was please with the look of this spot, and very cozy yet small venue. The staff was nice, fast and friendly. 

Started off with chicken sauté, and wine. Then ordered kang ka ree and pad prig pao. 

The app was great, with an awesome dipping sauce with some remnants of curry flavor, and both entres were super fresh and tasted great. Plenty of food, and enough for leftovers. Thai merlot washed down smoothly along with some water with lime sliced in. I definitely would come back, and would love to taste more.
author: Benjamin B.

description: Always great food and wonderful service. Gotten a bit pricey over the years, but to be expected. Love all the dishes! All very yummy!
author: Min Min S.

description: Probably the best Thai restaurant in the bay!  It's a small restaurant and generally pack but it's totally worth the wait.  I haven't found any other thai restaurants that serve chan pad poo (crab fried noodles) which was packed with flavor and generous amount of crab meat!  the pumpkin curry was also delicious and so far the best mango sticky rice i've had so far.  I'll definitely come back again if i'm craving for thai food.
author: Len L.

description:
I was looking at all the 4 and 5 star reviews for marnee thai, and I think my expectations were set too high. This place is super super cramped. So many tables squished into the restaurant, I feel like the waiters and waitresses had their butts in peoples faces, were turning to the side to squeeze by tables, and I'm surprised no one was elbowed. Given that, for how quick paced this restaurant is and how many people they were serving, it was run pretty well. Our waters were refilled without asking, and we did get some attention from the wait staff. The food was good, but not amazing. My pad Thai was your average pad Thai. The pad ke mao my friends had was super SPICY. They were only able to finish about half of it. We also ordered the calamari salad to share. It had potential, but the sauce that it was marinated in tasted straight up like like juice. My mouth puckered with every bite, even when I picked off the top pieces (the bottom of the dish was drowned in like juice) 

Overall, I wouldn't rush to return here. The food is good enough to return for, but the restaurant is so cramped and fast paced I couldn't fully enjoy the food.
author: Kay A.

description:
I drafted my review with 5 stars, and had to wait until after my trip to Thailand to complete my review for Marnee.

The verdict? Oh yes. Oh so worthy.

The typical American Thai dishes (green papaya salad, pad thai, pad see ew, etc.) are fine, but the pièce de résistance here is the SEA BASS. You can order it prepared one of three different ways, and all are magnificent. We love coming with large groups so that we can order a huge variety. We especially like:

Sea bass with curry + mushrooms
Sea bass with ginger + mushrooms
Spicy angel wings (also good when made vegetarian!)
Pumpkin curry
Sauteed spinach
+ all your typical thai noodle and curry dishes are good, too.

If you come here for one thing, get the sea bass.
author: Elaine Y.

description: The best Thai food you will have outside of Thailand and even better then some of the Thaifood we had in Thailand. Outstanding food at a fair price.
author: dub g.

description:
This place has solid reviews, and of the three times I've been here I've never been solidly impressed - it must really depend on what you order. 

This time I had the pad Thai and it was very disappointing - a bit too sweet but seemingly lacking flavor - and the noodles seemed overcooked. And I am *not* very hard to please when it comes to Thai food - I just get consistently disappointed that there are a thousand Thai places in this city and none that consistently wow. 

Friends I was with today got a spicy eggplant tofu dish they raved about, so maybe try that. 

Service was slow yet flustered today. But they did let us throw down a few cards, which I really appreciate in this city. 

I'll definitely come back to marnee but will avoid the pad Thai (which I should've not ordered in the first place... I know, I know).

Also, for what it's worth, the ambiance of this location is much nicer than the 9th street one - high ceiling, well lit and nice decor!
author: Courtney A.

description: Best Thai cuisine and service ever!!! This is a cute little location decorated as a bamboo hut. All the servers are friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. The Thai potstickers with green curry sauce is a must try. Yellow chicken curry was delicious. We used the sauce over our rice and other dishes because it was so good. Praram sauce (peanut and spinach) over any meat is delish. The basa fillet with Thai curry sauce was really tasty. For dessert, the roti with coconut ice cream is just about as good as it gets. Can't go wrong with a fried banana with ice cream or a Thai iced tea as well. Only down side to coming here is the parking. Be prepared to drive around for about 15 minutes before finding a spot.
author: Cyn L.

description:
If you don't want to wait, come around 6pm or so on a weekday. It gets packed around 7:30pm or so.

I came here on a Friday night and the wait was about 15mins, not too bad.

The place was quite packed, but the service was good.

Had the Tom Yum soup and Pad Kee Mao. The Pad Kee Mao was a bit overly sauced for me. The sweet chili sauce was a bit too much. Their Pad Se Ew is really good. An upgrade from King Of Thai. Their fried rice was also good. 

Their curries are pretty decent, nothing that quite "wow" me. However, some curries are meant to be quite mild.
author: Mandy D.

description:
This place is awful. I went here last night and I'm telling you the food is really iffy here. I ate something that did not taste like meat. I ordered some beef skewers and they tasted really fucking awful. I almost threw up. I asked two different servers what that was. They looked at me and smiled, having difficulty with English words. I asked if what I was eating was beef. It took them awhile to say it but they said it was beef. I been on this planet long enough to know what beef tastes like and I am telling you that wasn't beef.  I stopped eating it after one skewer and said forget it. I'm not going to risk going to the hospital over this crappy food. It's like a dog's breakfast here. 

It's quite possible that this place is so damn cheap they use old meat and serve that. Or what I ate was horse meat or some kind of low grade dog meat that you get from Korean places. In any case, I don't eat dog. I find that despicable. 

I am highly suspect of this place. They seem to really just want your money. I wasn't offered another dish or anything. The customer service is nil. You should stay away from this place if you care about your health. 

I just I don't wanna get sick and neither should you.
author: Tiffany R.

description:
Businesses like these don't realize that their success is because of the community that they serve and they are nothing without them. The owner has no respect for customers and just does small talk with people ....a totally rude and impolite lady.

Like all food lovers in SFO ...I have loved the Ambiance and Food at Marnee Thai ...but today I had the worst customer experience on the hands of the Owner of the Restaurant. 

I have regularly been visiting the restaurant for a while ..but today I visited at 9:00PM (an hour before the closing...no crowd) with my wife to enjoy the  'Roti and Coconut Ice cream' ...but to our surprise...we were RUDELY and TOTALLY UNPROFESSIONALLY told that since this is a restaurant and not a desert place by the owner ...they will not entertain our order. The owner was so RUDE and had head stuck so high up her .... that she never realized that she was DISRESPECTING A CUSTOMER .... which goes against  the prime rule of running a business. 

Overall i will never be returning to this restaurant for sure.
author: Asutosh G.

description: The food was hot and ready when I came to pick it up! The chicken pad thai was excellent. I ordered mild and it's not hot at all. Medium has a tiny bit of kick. I'll be back!
author: Ashley M.

description:
This place was great! I came here with a friend today and it was both our first time. We had the green mango salad. It had some spice but was really light and tasty. I ordered the red curry chicken and it was a home run. My friend ordered the Chan Pad Poo and that was really good as well. 

The service is really good here too and the prices are reasonable. Just an overall great dining experience. We event took take-out menus when we left.
author: Natalie F.

description: I absolutely adore this place. Great service and very friendly. I enjoyed everything about this restaurant. The yellow curry, angel wings, roasted duck and papaya salad was delicious
author: liz t.

description:
The location on 9th is fantastic!

This is the second and last time I've visited the Irving St. location. Both times have been disappointments--the food, while good, pales in comparison to the other location, the service is abysmal, and the bathroom is filthy.

The two stars (rather than 1) are because even though the pad Thai here is terrible compared to the other location's, it's still better than most restaurant pads Thai.
author: Adriana V.

description:
I give Marnee Thai 4 stars for the following reasons: 

1. Food taste 
2. Service

-1 star for the yelling and found a small hair in my food but didn't know if that was from me. food was too good to deny so I braced myself and pretended to be on fear factor to continue eating. 

I happened to be in the area when I was hungry and looked up the best possible place near me on Yelp. Reviews and ratings suggested this place. I really didn't know what to order but the older lady who appeared to be or act as the owner made some awesome suggestions and she wasn't wrong. The food was amazing! and the service was great. They were very attentive. 

There is one thing though that I think every person should know about this place. Its not going to be your typical quiet restaurant.... lol I guess you have to go for yourself and figure that out. 

The owner lady.... lol she reminds me of my aunt. Very loud. She holds conversations with the kitchen crew from the front door which is across the restaurant. For some reason this would typically annoy me but again it reminded me so much of my aunt that I had to forgive her for it. She was very sweet, despite a comment she made to me which was a little forward yet it was all innocent. You would almost think you should be in an italian restaurant somewhere in NYC but no...its thai. 

If you could look past the obnoxious yelling then you'll love this place. 

I will come back for sure. FOOD WAS PROBABLY THE BEST THAI I'VE EATEN SO FAR.
author: Ish A.

description:
I ate there in 2010 and loved it. I went there today for lunch and found the place run down, cold/drafty  (no heat(,  and was  sickened by their  nasty tiny restroom.   

The bathroom was dirty , rundown, not up to code, and filthy  The  toilet was not attached properly to the stool and moving about.  The smell was out of order and the sink piping was exposed and leaking put partially padded with some nasty looking wrapping.  It ruined my appetite to go to a ill-kept, one stall restroom that was not properly designed as a restroom. If is not up to code and is in a narrow hallway and a person with a wheelchair , walker, or if the person is over 6'  0" could not get through the cooking area .  This cooking area  leads you though a narrow hallway, leading to the tiny weenie one-stall 3 foot by 4 foot (estimate) restroom.  

Food:   The food was not hot  (temperature) and was pretty unexciting.  I ordered the #37 The curried chicken, over spinach.  I am sorry to say that the dish was full of hard-to-chew long and stringy spinish stems that were plentiful but unwanted.  The actual spinish leaves were so sparce that  I ended up leaving the dish full of stringy and fiberous stems.   Awful.  

I will not return.
author: Vanilla C.

description:
This place is as good as advertised. 

The wings are delicious, I tried the eggplant and green curry it was delicious. Also tried the sour prawn soup I'm kinda on the fence about it. Do get the fried bananas and funnel cake.
author: Beni R.

description:
My review is for the service which was TERRIBLE! I came for dinner(Sunday night, 6 PM) with my boyfriend, we were seated, brought water and forgotten about, then the waitress came back told us to move to a table in the back corner because she forgot a table of 3 had made a reservation. She wasn't even polite about asking us to give up the table we were at. She didn't even apologize until we stated that we were already seated and wouldn't like to move. She began to grab our menus and told us to grab our napkins. 

This is by far the worse I have been treated at any food place. When she did come to take our order she was very brief and I didn't even finish what I was saying before she started snatching the menu out of my hand.  By far very unhappy about the service. I only come here for the tom yum and the curry and I'm not even sure I'll even come back for that. Very very displeased.
author: Carolyn M.

description:
This is by FAR been my favorite Thai place for the past few years. I've tried several dozens of Thai restaurants around the bay as well as on the east coast and honestly, none make my pad Thai as perfect.

Dishes to definitely get:

Pad Thai (my favorite is with shrimp)
Chan Pad Poop (it's sorta like pad Thai but a bit spicy and topped with crab meat)
Chicken Fried Rice (ask for extra cucumbers, I know I do!)
The cucumber salad
Minced pork with basil

Dessert:

Do NOT pass up the sticky rice with fresh mango. It really is well made, right down to the stickiness of the rice, the amount of coconut milk and the perfectly ripe mango's sliced around it.

The Thai iced tea but with a little less ice. Hate when they get all watered down.

The service here is usually pretty good and attentive, although watch out for the busy times such as dinner after 6:30pm and weekends. I suggest coming in for lunch or a weekday evening before 7pm.

Prices are about average for Thai, although since we first started going here, the prices have gone up twice on several of the dishes, no longer qualifying it as cheap eats.

Now go and try it already!!!
author: Petra S.

description:
Just another satisfied customer! The staff at Marnee is always friendly and their food is consistently delicious. 

Vegetarians: I would recommend the fresh roll (vegetarian style) and the woonsen vegetarian. Delicious silver noodles fried with egg and veggies. Be warned- you'll start to crave it endlessly.
author: Jasmine M.

description: Love Marnee thai!! I haven't had a bad experience with them yet, they are always nice, attentive, and make sure you have everything you need. Their Pad Thai is always a hit and you have to try their Yen Ta Four soup, the color may be an off putting pink but it is so0o good. Just the other day walked in to get my to go order and it was pouring outside and the food wasn't ready yet and they offered me a seat and a warm cup of tea! I will definitely be going back.
author: Lily S.

description: I had high expectations and left disappointed. Portions are smaller than other Thai joints. Asked for spicy and it was medium at best. Got the avocado shrimp salad and not only did they use ice berg instead of mixed greens, but they put in a measly count of three shrimps. Also had the corn fritters, veggie eggplant dish and green curry vegetables. The eggplant stood out but the rest was average. Service was rushed and unfriendly. Had a party of 4 and they sat us at a cramped area. We saw another setup that was less congested and asked if we could sit there. We were reprimanded with a sharp "No!" Later we saw why...they squeezed a party of 6 into that section. They simply could have explained that instead of barking at us.
author: Veggie S.

description: So good! Get the angel wings! They taste like someone killed an angel, cut off their wings, smothered them in magic, and fried them in sex. Surprisingly not a gay bar.
author: Mark W.

description:
Was there with my friend and my overall experience was fine, not bad, but nothing really special. We ordered a  Panang Beef and a noodle plate( which I forgot the name but is like a wide rice noodle plate) 

Well,  Panang Beef came with many chunks of beef and actually tasted not bad, but what I am really unsatisfied is the portion of sauce. I could barely see any sauce of this plate, which should be a curry plate and supposed to come with a bowl of curry sauce. My friend even asked me " is this really a curry plate?" when she saw this. So if you like the way I eat curry-- pour a large spoon of curry sauce over the white rice, stir and mix them together and EAT! Then you probably don't want to order this dish, since you can barely spoon any sauce.

As to the noodle plate, like what I said before, not bad.
author: Jia-Ying X.

description: Ordered to-go here because my go-to spot Pagan is closed on Mondays. $27 for 1 jasmin rice, pumpkin curry and tom kha (the container was only filled 3/4 way to top). Both items were super salty and not flavorful... definitely not worth the price for a meh meal.
author: Natalie L.

description:
MMmmmmm Angel Wings...

I've been a fan of Marnee Thai for awhile now. I've dined at this location and the one located on 9th and Irving as well but this one is my favorite (frankly because it's SLIGHTLY larger). Also, It's because of their damn Angel Wings [http://s3yelp4-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/ccajWGzpzlFAAnTcXc9WsQ/l.jpg] that keeps me coming back! You haven't had Asian style chicken wings until you had some at Marnee Thai, trust me!

Aside from my regular order of their delectable wings, a group of friends and I ordered:

Mango and Soft-shelled Crab salad -- [http://s3yelp4-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/SkEVGHXHXRDQDlOL5bmgQQ/l.jpg]
