Our first choice was to order a Papaya salad, but they were out.. so this was what we got. This was also one of the daily specials they were offering so what the hey. I'm not gonna go too in depth on a salad because my carnivorous mentality can't judge one so in a nutshell: it was some mixed tossed greens, [raw-tasting] mangoes, and pounded on the dressing. The soft-shelled crab however hit dead center; crispy, crunchy, lightly fried, perfect.

Roasted Duck Red Curry -- [http://s3yelp1-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/q02hRBhJFpD1MDNQXZUxzg/l.jpg]
I'm a huge fan of roasted duck! [It runs through my Chinese veins!] If it weren't so expensive, I'd trade my diet of beef for duck any day! The red curry (which was more orange rather) was pretty good. Nice portions of roasted duck is always a major bonus (and a must!), the curry had a hint of spiciness to it for a surprising kick, and there were chops of pineapple for a interesting sweetness to it as well. 

Tom Yum Soup -- [http://s3yelp3-a.akamaihd.net/bphoto/fiXOaPiKYk2e4PGsdnCBNA/l.jpg]
This one is a tricky one to judge.. For the ones of you reading this that KNOW how a Tom Yum soup is suppose to taste, than you will be disappointed. However, for those who are new to it, this might run up your alley. Overall, the soup wasn't overwhelming sour as with other Tom Yum soups I've drank and was loaded with plump whole shrimp, and all the components of a chicken noodle soup (minus the noodles). Personally, I'm not much of a sour eater (I like it spicy) so this was for me, but I know this didn't swing well with my friends that KNEW real Tom Yum. 


Okay! 
Clearly, the food is great, however, the service is what's going to take Marnee Thai down a peg. In short, our female server was ridiculously rude. She rushed us to make an order (even though it wasn't busy). We asked for more water during our meal (because the food is spicy!) but our request was ignored. And with her apathetic expression, she just seemed like she didn't want to be there. 

On the other hand, the male gentlemen was the completely opposite! Incredibly friendly, patient, and was the one to pour us some more water without even asking. He even took away our plates away with a smile -- true customer service right there.
author: Albert L.

description:
Yes! I am a fan of authentic Thai Cuisine!
I finally found my favorite thai restaurant in the bay area. I am in love with sunset district. Good milk tea and little hidden gems like Marnee. My friend and I came here on a Monday night for dinner. There was not a wait, but you can tell from the crowd that this place is definitely a hit. 

Family style is always the thing to do if you are Asian or getting dinner with a SO. We chose 2 items:
1) Avocado Shrimp Salad-the Best asian salad ever! The creamy avocado and complimented the tart mango so well. The iceberg lettuce and the delicious fish sauce, everything about this dish is pure perfection. I have dreams about this salad, I wouldn't drive 40 minutes for this salad. But it will be the dish every time I visit Marnee. Genius for a delicious creation! 

2) Yellow Curry with rice, who can say no to curry. From the platting to the pallette, my eyes and tongue was happy. Rice was soft, curry was creamy and spicy. Absolutely no complaints! 

Definitely delicious, and will not disappoint. Did I mention, it there are candles? Super romantic!
author: Phuong V.

description:
Based on my great experience with the other location, I decided to try out this location, and while the food is just as great, we had a weird run-in with our waitress.  I'd go back again but I prefer other location.

First thing you notice when you walk in is that the decor is set up like a Thai river hut.  Nice touch, or fire hazard?  Your call.

The pad see ew with chicken was really good, "make you want to come back" good.  

But we had a weird run-in with the waitress on rice.  My girlfriend ordered one serving rice.  The waitress brought out a fair amount of rice, and then we shared as I ate some of her dish.

The waitress then charged us for two rice.  We had a little communication difficulty but it seemed as though we got charged for sharing rice, which is ridiculous - of all the things to be stingy on, rice should not be at the top of your list.

Thankfully the waitress removed a rice, but she made it clear that if we order rice again in future, we'll have to pay for each person to eat.  Which is fine, IF we order two servings of rice.  If we order one serving of rice, then it shouldn't matter how many people eat,  just like we weren't double charged for sharing our entrees.

Anyway I'd still recommend you to check out, but just be careful if you intend to share a serving of rice - apparently it's kind of a big deal here.
author: Charlie B.

description:
Great Thai food! I've had the opportunity to eat lots fo Thai food since college and I have to say this is one of the top three places I've eaten Thai--ever!

Started out with angel wings and they were yummy though not as spicy as I hoped.
Shared eggplant tofu, chicken curry, and vegetarian pad thai with a friend. All were very good. Only complaint was that the eggplant dish was a bit stingy on the tofu. You also have to order rice by portion (does not come with entrees). I always find that really annoying at Thai/Chinese food places. Seriously. Include Rice.

Service wasn't amazing but was definitely friendly and attentive. Once we ordered, food came out really fast! I'll be back!
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Marnee Thai is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING.  If I could rate them higher than 5 stars I would.  My boyfriend and I recently vacationed in San Francisco and liked it so much we ate there twice in a week's time span.  We never ever do that but we made and exception for Marnee Thai.

The atmosphere is great, the prices are fair, the service is excellent and of course, the food is some of the best Thai I've ever eaten (though I'm admittedly no Thai afficionado, everything tasted fresh and well-spiced).  For appetizers we ate the thai potstickers and coconut corn cakes (both specials, both amazing).  For entrees, my bf had the basa filet cooked spicy and the banana curry (I think this was a special).  I had the pumpkin curry and praram phak.  

Two thumbs up, would highly reccommend!!
author: Kate R.

description:
The first time we came here, we ordered their CHAN PAD POO without the crab meat and their PAD THAI vegetarian.  Unfortunately the waiter neglected to tell us that these two dishes are basically the same just with different toppings.  Thankfully it was really good.  I'm not usually a fan of pad thai so the fact that I LOVED it really says something about this dish.  I can see why so many people would come here.

I'll definitely be coming back and trying more dishes.
author: Victoria W.

description: Stopped on for a quick bite- the atmosphere is way nicer on the inside then looks on the outside. We (my boyfriend and I) shared hot tea, spring rolls, #47 noodle dish, and rice. Everything was delicious but if I had to order again I would do something with more flavor than the pad Thai- there were so many options that looked great!
author: Jessie V.

description: Good Thai in the middle of 'central' sunset... great service. Consistently very good - but nothing outrageous for thai food. Perfect weeknight or working weekend go-to Thai food.
author: Melanie M.

description:
Packed, very loud, a really fun owner; so, why four stars? The food is outstanding, service good and very entertaining.

Make a reservation and most of all be on time and have your whole group there or they most likely will not seat you until the whole group has arrived.
author: Gary J.

description:
Good restaurant. Very good food! I went to eat there several times and was never disappointed for the food. I was, however, disappointed for the waiting time. I am not talking when the restaurant is busy but sunday afternoon when there is not much going on. They also forgot my order once. So, I am taking off the star because i know they can do better service.

I eat there very often and would recommend to everyone!
author: Ashish N.

description:
I have eaten at so many Thai restaurants in the Bay Area and Marnee is by far one of the most consistent in their flavors.

Came here two days on the roll the past weekend. My friend was intrigued by the special sign that announced Thai Potstickers with a green curry filling. The potstickets were slightly crispy outside with a green curry pork filling. Chopped fresh basils on top give the dumplings an extra kick, along with the spice and the curry.

Over two days we tried different entrees that are staples on any Thai menu. Gai Kaprow (Sauteed basil chicken) here at Marnee is cooked dry, the minced chicken absorbing the essence of the sauce simmered in fresh basil, chili paste scallions, and red chili pepper. It's the perfect dish to be accompanied with rice.

Suteed Eggplant with Chicken is cooked with shredded chicken in soy  sauce, bean sauce, and garlic. It's a welcoming diversion from chili and basil. This is a good non-spicy dish. Asparagus Chicken has a generous portion of crispy asparagus cooked in a sweet chili sauce.

The Thai Chicken Green Curry is one of my favorites at Marnee. The coconut milk gives the curry a fine creamy texture, complete from fresh lime juice and gives an aroma long has reached my nose before the dish is set down on the table. Top with sprigs of fresh basil, green curry is the spiciest curry and it's absolutely delicious.

Marnee is pricey compared to regular Thai places, but the food is always tasty. Service is friendly and attentive. We usually have one starter, a Thai ices tea each and no dessert. The check came to $20 per person.

Definitely my favorite place for Thai.
author: Matt Y.

description:
Capable but pedestrian Thai food. 
The pad see ew was good but had none of the wok-fired rich taste of Ler Ros'. 
The curry was good but didn't have the deep flavors of perfectly done curries. 
Good in a pinch but not crave-worthy.
author: Jocelyn L.

description: So yummy! The staff is not the friendliest, but the food is really good. The decor is also lovely. It feels as if you are inside a traditional Thai hut, very cool. Can't wait to come back!
author: Sonia G.

description: Came here a few times with friends and I LOVEEEE and always order their avocado salad and pad kee Mao..?..their service is always super nice and welcoming!
author: Kaman C.

description:
My ex-BF was Thai, so believe me, after 9 years I knew what good Thai food should taste like. This place is legit. 

From the pad thai to the yellow curry to the pad kee mao - wow. The flavors and spices were spot on. 

The only fly in the ointment was lackadaisical service - very disappointing, honestly. They weren't packed with diners - they really weren't. But it seemed as though me and my 2 nephews weren't very important to them. 

But the ultimate question is this- would I go again? Absolutely. Top of the charts, with lovely decor and a nicely-done menu (at very reasonable prices, I might add). Go and enjoy!
author: Mark N.

description:
Ordered 10, 23 , 64. Very busy Saturday eve. No reservation and they found a spot for us.
Authentic atmosphere, not quiet, but great personalities for the CS personnel.
Food was delicious. Place was packed. Older crowd, seemed like many Thai families were there. Another great sign.
Will come again!
author: el z.

description:
I made a takeout order on the phone. They said 15 min, we arrived in 20, and still had to wait 5-10 minutes.

However they were very sweet and apologetic about it, and while I was waiting several members of the staff came by to check on me and ask if I needed anything.

* Mango friend rice $10.80 - 4 stars

Rice: On the looser, non-sticky side. Overall the ratio of rice to everything else was a little high, though the fact that the everything else was really good kind of made up for it.

Chicken: Incredible. Tender. Good quality.

Eggs: Soft and heavenly.

Mango: Somehow all the mango chunks ended up on the left side of the takeout box where my boyfriend was eating out of and he got most of it =(. The few pieces I had, though, were sweet and ripe. He thought they weren't sweet enough, but he's used to the super sweet ones from India.

Veggies: The chives were crunchy and super fresh. Onions sweet & with a good crisp.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
When my wife and I were still dating we had our first major fight and she decided to just be the bigger person and surprise me with my first experience here. I don't remember what we fought about but I do remember this day. I didn't even know where we were going as she drove that evening and I was still acting like a Jack-a-- in the passenger seat. 

I felt like such an idiot when I realized she was taking me out to dinner. Well needless to say I married her for a lot of reasons but "make-up eating" is definitely on top of the list. 

So why the long story? Well because it was my first time here and every time since then has been a great time. It has gotten busier and busier but it couldn't stay a secret for too long. I've hit the gong here many a time. This is where I first decided that Tom Yum is my favorite soup. But the real stars here are the Angel Wings. They don't get better anywhere. These are simply the best Angel Wings on earth. 

The lady that owns this place is a nice little lady. That first night we were there she spent some time with me teaching me how to hit the gong. She said I needed to hit the gong because it was my first time. I have had everything on this menu several times. I have never had any complaints. Everything is delicious. 

I've never been to Thailand but I'm willing to bet I don't have to go there to experience the best Angel Wings. 

Be prepared for a wait. Come here with people you want to hang out with. Space is limited and if it's your birthday let them know. Make a good wish before you hit that gong!
author: Ryan C.

description:
Former partner in crime used to talk about this place all the time and she was usually spot on with her dining recommendations.

Although we never made it there together, I did pop in today for lunch and she wasn't kidding.  This place is deelish!!

We shared the following:

1- Singha (LOVE that beer).
2- Fresh Egg Rolls.
3- Pad Thai.
4- Pad Kee Mao (medium spicy, just in case).

I'll be adding this place to my faves list on Irving Street, along with Happy Bakery, Sunrise Deli, Nick's Tacos, Irving Pizza and Yum Yum Fish.
author: Anthony D.

description: Not too bad for a lunch as they have a cheaper lunch menu and it was not very packed. Service was fine and the food was good. Great interior design.
author: C. L.

description: My favorite Thai place in SF hands down. Love the way the Proprietor takes your order then yells it over the din of a full restaurant to the kitchen. Very tasty American Thai food, not really so much spicy, (unless requested) as flavorful. If you like Thai food, you will not be disappointed with Marnee Thai!
author: Jonathan R.

description: We always come to Marnee Thai when we visit San Francisco, sometimes we come more than once in a visit, both lunch and dinner are very good.  Also, it is very quiet - you can have a peaceful conversation.  We have never gone there that most of the tables were not taken - a sure sign that the place is well liked with a good reputation. We particularly like the curries.
author: Bob P.

description: Been going to this neighborhood gem for years. Food is consistently excellent best Thai food in the Bay Area. May is even more charming and the aura reading is as intriguing as the food she serves is delicious. If you like Thai you will love Marnee Thai. Be prepared to get hooked.
author: Pamela F.

description:
A top notch Thai restaurant that has been awarded tons of "best of SF" awards.

The food is delicious, but I'm not going to lie, upon visiting, we learned out hours later that their sister location had been shut down due to some sort of health/cleanliness concern, so this was a bit worrisome, but this location (the only I can speak of) is clean and well kempt.

The papaya salad is very good here

Chick pad see ewe is a bit on the drier side (not necessarily a bad thing) and has tons of flavors and portion side

Seafood green curry is fantastic

Sticky rice with mango is a must

I'm a fan.
author: Chuck N.

description: I've been eating there for years. The only drawback is how crowded it gets, and that's because the food is so good. There are times that I order my food to go. Sometimes it isn't ready anywhere near when they said it would be, so as I wait, I get ticked off (that's a nice way to put it). But when I get home and open the containers, any bad feelings I have are immediately gone. So I'll just keep going back for more. Everyone who works there is very nice, but dealing with the crowd at dinnertime, they commonly work in a frenzied state. Be patient, it's worth it.
author: Gary S.

description:
A bizarrely wonderful experience.

I lived a few blocks from this place and would pass by without even giving it a second glance, but my cousin told me this place was excellent. 

He also warned me that the owner was psychic. 

Was greeted by the owner, dressed in all black, which made her stand out next to the others who were wearing big-shouldered blue blazers. She brought out a chair for an older woman, gave her a glass of water, and patted her - really sweet.

We sat down next to another couple. The owner noticed a stain on the white cloth, pointed it out to the person sitting there, and reprimanded her. It was scary.

The owner then moved us to better seats since we were next to the front door - she might've called me son too. I felt loved.

My friend dropped her spoon towards the end of the meal (which by the way was really amazing), tried picking it up but was yelled at by the owner for trying.

We paid, tipped well, and walked out quietly, more than satisfied.
author: Steven M.

description:
NEGATIVE 10 EXPERIENCE: We drove all the way from Santa Cruz for our special Valentine's Day to ride our bikes in Golden Gate Park. After we revved up our appetites on the hills with the stunning views, we headed for this restaurant. I recalled many times I was unable to try it out, due the daunting long lines out the door. I rejoiced as the line was much shorter & the older woman in the lacey top kept coming out tracking us. The line was moving quickly. After about 15 minutes or so, we were seated in a middle, cramped space, sitting with strangers with no real privacy.  We ordered our drinks, the lady in the lace top suggested we try coconut cakes & pretty much ordered them for us, Hmmmm. We felt was cramped in and then our drinks were served hot (soda). Our pot stickers were some of the best we have ever had, delicately flavored and perfect! This was the best part of our meal! And then, I took an adventure to get the hor mok, a steamed seafood custard, only served on weekend, that I had read about on the Internet. It came out rather quickly to my surprise, only to be cold, and then what I realized later, was frozen in the middle. It had a kind of a thawed out strange texture and stale taste. It certainly was not freshly made! Much later I wondered had it been micro waved and/or thawed out and warmed up somehow for assembly line type service.  Was I in a fast food joint was an afterthought? I was trying to eat it as best I could, but had to stop. And then, my boyfriend got the red curry with prawn, thinking he wasn't being too adventurous, too" authentic." And then, the string beans had a strange thawed out frozen strange texture, & it was in the form of a thin soupy sauce. (He had not ordered soup!!). And then, he noticed a strange flavor, and then the prawns were rubbery, not even fresh. Even the brown rice was dry and flavorless like cardboard, stale and dry, not freshly made!  We could not be mistaken about the rice!!! We know what rice tastes like!  It all seemed like frozen food that was micro waved! We did not realize this until we left completely disappointed at this "Zagat" rated restaurant.  And then, they forgot the pretty much forcibly ordered coconut pancakes, which I had hoped would save the day!
But these also made my stomach upset. I tried one and had to quit, thinking that the oil it was cooked in was possibly rancid. I went from my original feeling of wanting to venture out into a more authentic experience, to realize I had gotten some frozen dinners at a restaurant that was pushing its customers in and out quickly!  We thought we would be adventurous, but this experience had ruined my spirit for a long time to come and we vowed to stick with our tried and true dishes. What I eventually determined that the food was not prepared in a fresh manner, nor was it true to the traditions of most Thai and San Francisco food preparation standards.

We wrote a letter finally after many calls requesting our money back. We were too polite to ask then and there as we should have.  Our food was inedible. I spoke with the manager Ms. Jen multiple times (3-4 times.) She promised her manager Mr. Chai would call me back. He never did and then he finally did and yelled at me, admitted the food was not freshly prepared and blamed it on a busy day! (It was not THAT BUSY). He blamed for me not asking for a refund then and there & still refused to refund me out money, even though I had called multiple times and they didn't return my calls.  He caused me of eating the food and then wanting my money back  (Not true, I still have the entire dish which I took home in the fridge, yuk!) This man has no customer service skills for this ZAGAT RATED place...Hmmm...
author: M M.

description:
This place has excellent Thai food, a cool interior, quick service, and a modest pricing. I discovered Marnee Thai when I went to high school in San Francisco and I still commute back a ways to eat there with family or friends from time to time. It's well worth it. The restaurant is a little small, but their service is often so efficient that most people don't have to wait at all.

The pad see ew and pad thai are always piping hot, super fresh, and served in great portions every time I go. It's a really good place for sharing dishes family style.

1 word summary: "GREATNESS."
author: Stephen D.

description: This is the best restaurant ever! I have a family of six and they always manage to seat us! Just a time saver you should make a reservation or it will be a long wait. Their Pad Thai's are delicious! Also I suggest the Western Tofu dish it is so yummy! Costumer service is amazing! Also a big shoutout to one of the workers she is so sweet I don't remember her name but she said that she is 70 but she look 60. Love this place go here
author: Sophia B.

description:
I'm Thai and I'm very picky about my Thai food. Marnee Thai is @Dmagicp approved! This spot is authentic, not just the food, but the decoration, and staff as well. 

Let's talk food. The food here is exceptional. Bold flavor, great combination of textures and sweet to spicy taste palatable for any food lover.

Must Try:

- Avocado Salad w/ Prawns
- Green Papaya Salad (I like mine with their fish sauce!)
- Tom Ka Soup
- Red Pumpkin Curry w/ tofu (surprisingly good)
- Angel Wings
- Kang Ka Ree (yellow curry) can't go wrong with this one
- Prawns And Scallop Pad Phong Karee

Their garlic chili fish sauce is good! I add it to almost everything, just not my sticky rice and mango.

Speaking of sticky rice and mango! You have to try this for dessert. When I come to Thai restaurants I like to see how their fried banana and ice ream and their sticky rice and mango are. I know it's at the end of your meal, but you can tell how authentic a Thai restaurant is from their dessert...and yellow curry/tom ka soup. I grew up on this dessert and it's close to how mama made for me as a child. Save room because you won't regret it. 

The service is always good here. Their bathrooms are always clean, weird, but I notice these things. It get busy on weekends here, sometimes I like to call in my order. 

This is one of my favorite Thai restaurnts in SF! Enjoy!


If you eat good food, then you will never have to eat bad food again - @DmagicP
author: Dennis P.

description:
Marnee Thai, you complete me. You're such a go-to Thai place and your green curry never ceases to impress me. You're like the curry to my rice-based life. 

Update, their tom yum is delicious too. You can ask to add some fat noodles to make it a more filling soup. The fat noodles (no idea what they're called) seem to be rice based and also cooked to Asian perfection. 

Marnee Thai, your Thai food is receiving an eternal A+++++ with a halo on top.
author: Jolene L.

description:
Pad Thai is the best here.  I've tasted pad thai's at other places,and this is always consistently good.

The pad prik pao has tender pieces of chicken breast in a sweet, spicy, salty, sauce, with not so overpowering fillers of vegetables.  Good balance of meat and veggies.

The service is friendly (I just didn't appreciate that the delivery came during lunch time and they kept opening the door and passing back and forth by our table with big boxes - at least I saw that the veggies were fresh).

The coconut corn cakes (a specialty appetizer) was delicious.  They are mini corn cakes with sweet kombocha squash.

Service has always been friendly in my few times here - I frequent the other location closer to me more. 

The decor is very setting to the Thai theme with bamboo walls and Thai decor.
author: JJAMZ C.

description: I went here again after not visiting for several years. This used to be one of my favorite Thai places but it has changed. The food is still decent but it is all premade so nothing is made to order like before. I was not able to adjust the spice level on my curry and I asked to substitute a curry so I could have the veggies from another curry (I have done this at about three other Thai places without issue) but I was told it is already mixed so they couldn't do it. Also only a select number of curries can be made vegetarian because they are already mixed. Luckily I do have their cook book so I can make their yummy curry exactly how I want it. I won't be back here.
author: Melissa L.

description: This location is a bit better than its sister location on 9th.  The only difference with this one is that it is a little more posh with carpeting & no open kitchen.  The spicy angle wings are excellent with crispy Thai basil, tender chicken wings that are crispy & not greasless with a wonderful termerek sauce.  The red snapper with curry muose in a bannana leaf (forget the Thai name for this) is excellent with a perfectly tender juicy marinaded red snapper wserved in layers with a smooth spicy curry sauce in a wonderful bannana leaf.  The bannana blossom salad is wonderful with romane, jumbo shrimp, bannana blossoms (the Thai equivilent to artichoke hearts,) peanuts, & toasted coconut in a sweet & savery dressing.  The pad ki mao with chicken is another great bet with delicate rice noodles, tender chicken, fresh green beans, soy sauce, & Thai chili.  For dessert, the fried bannanas with coconut ice cream are crispy & greasless with a lite badder, the bannanas being perfectly ripe & done for that matter; instead of done though a bit under ripe like at the other location; the coconut ice cream is smooth, cool, refreshing, & coconuty.  I will definitely be back to try more things, especially, their creative specials.  So, for excellent traditional & creative Thai food at reasonable prices with friendly service in a traditional atmosphere, Marnei cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys.
author: Brian S.

description: Some of the best Thai food I have had! You can also get whole coconuts to drink. The inside is decorated nice and the staff wear formal Thai outfits which add to the charm. Portions are a bit smaller than what is usually expect for the price but flavors are excellent!
author: B S.

description:
After reading hundreds of reviews it seemed like the place to check out.

I went one afternoon during lunch hour. I reviewed the lunch special menu and it didn't seem like that excellent of a good deal. I got their tom yum, which was good... just didnt give me the "wow" factor. My dad got their eggplant curry which was actually really good. We had their summer rolls as well, which was also pretty good.

Idk, I guess I dont have major "complaints" about this place, I just wasn't very impressed at all. Because my boyfriend loves thai food, we have experienced many different restaurants and compare them to each other. 

Maybe it was that it was lunch hour and the beginning of the day? Maybe it was the fact that the waitress seemed that she just wanted us to order and be in and out? Maybe it was a bad timing and have to try it again?

Whatever it is, I haven't been back since and have found other really good thai places. I'm debating on giving it another try--possibly during the dinner hour?
author: Julia D.

description: Its unfortunate that it has come to this. This place has been my neighborhood spot for the last 15 years.  Recently I made a quick lunch pick up order, upon arrival at home i received a call from restaurant stating that they forgot part of my order.  This has happened multiple times before.  I requested for a refund after multiple calls back and forth they agreed to refund.  Its been a month later and as usual no refund.  I decided to make another pick up order, same order taker pretended not to recognize me, so I brought it up she initially claimed that she doesn't know what I'm talking about.  Then she remembered me and stated that she refunded my order.  I produced a credit statement showing no refund and told them to go F them self's.  These scumbags are notorious for overcharging / trying to charge for shrimps vs chicken, anything possible to screw you out of money.  Always check your credit card statement, not to be trusted.
author: Eugene Y.

description:
We tried the mango fried rice with shrimp and the pad prew wharn. The fried rice was good but for the price there were only 5 medium sized shrimp and tiny bits of mango. The pad prew wharn was better, the sweet and sour sauce was very good and there was a decent amount of chicken and vegetables-sadly more mango in this dish than in the mango fried rice.

The place is very small and they should really take out a few tables so people aren't crammed next to one another uncomfortably. The servers were all nice, but they rush customers out way too fast.
author: C K.

description:
Marnee Thai in a nutshell :: Food = Awesome.  Service = Nightmare     

Marnee is a nightmare. Be prepared to get slammed in the back by her GIANT rump as she slides between the aisles. Feels like you are eating in the mess hall of a Thai submarine with a disgruntled overfed bull. 

The food is really really good and the value is right. You can't go wrong with the anything on the menu.

Personally, I prefer not to be abused while I enjoy my dinner but what do I know.

Recommend going at an off time if ever.

And that's the straight dope.

Eat at your own risk... you've been warned.
author: Christopher L.

description: With all the great reviews I was excited to try this place. My sister and I grabbed a quick dinner here over the weekend and as always we ordered basil chicken and pad sa ew, since those are pretty basic thai dishes. Basil chicken was swimming in a pool of oil. It was also on the sweeter side and no thai chili in it at all but a few slivers of jalapeño, not authentic at all. I know thai chilies can sometimes be pricier but this place charges a little more than your average thai restaurant. The pad sa ew lacked flavor. I guess my hunt for good thai food continues!
author: Julie C.

description:
Three and a half if I could! My boyfriend and I always get takeout from here - you get a good amount of food for a fair price and they usually have food ready within 10 - 15 mins. Their pad thai is actually really, really good - not oily at all like it can be in other places. I wouldn't suggest getting the curry and noodle lunch special though. You don't get that many noodles and the curry is a bit watery (the spiciness is on point though!). I guess I wouldn't crave Marnee in particular but I'd definitely be more than happy to come here in if I wanted Thai.

I've never actually ate in but it seems like they have tables open despite being small. Take out for two during lunch comes out to about $20 with tip.
author: Alli Q.

description:
This review is for 9/7/2014 Sunday.

Pre- birthday dinner with my family. There were 8 of us, brother called ahead to make a reservation. Our table was ready when we got there. This was my first time at this location. The one on 9th is great as well! Although this location is a lot smaller, it was still packed, and we got all of our food correct and the wait was not long.

All the dishes we ordered were very very tasty! Pad thai, pineapple fried rice, appetizers, the duck, the vegestables! It was all delicious!

When we were almost done eating, the waitress asked if we wanted dessert? My brother says it's her bithday! Waitress said ok!

About 15 mins later, all the lights go off, and there a loud bang, i'm so embarrassed i'm not sure what the instrument is called that they used. Anyway...everyone in the restaurant starts to sing Happy Birthday to me, and wish me a great and healthy future. That was really awesome of them! It was a night to not forget!

I will definitely recommend this location to others as well!
author: Coraline J.

description:
DRY!!!!

We ordered the usual Chicken Panang Curry, Beef, Pork you name it.  We were starving like crazy especially after the ladies just finished the Nike SF marathon.  A little disappointed in the food , but the customer service was very friendly, but they need to get Chef Ramsey back there for that day.  I guess the other Marnee Thai restaurant location was probably the better half since this location was lacking everything hardcore.  

So we went next door to a chinese fast food/Dim Sum shop and satisfied our hunger there right after this place.
author: Anthony E.

description:
NEVER in my life did I think I'd ever walk out of a restaurant angry.. but it happened here at Marnee Thai. We walk in and it's extremely loud, cramped, and full of people. We get seated quickly but are way too close for comfort against other tables & customers surrounding us. No matter where you were placed in the restaurant, it looked like this would be the case. As we're sitting and waiting to be get our orders taken, it was difficult to hear each other over the host and waitresses screaming and other customers yelling their conversations. We continue to wait for another 20mins... and still nobody takes our order. Another couple gets seated after us and next to us, and gets their order taken before us. We walk out.

I don't care if there's any hype around this place. The general prices were a bit more expensive than usual for Thai food, and the environment was just downright unpleasant. Sorry Marnee Thai, but Chabaa Thai 2 blocks down the street wins by a longshot.
author: Andrew T.

description:
Just like every good Yelp story, I've heard nothing, but good things about this place from my friends. I came here with two out of towners hoping that it wouldn't suck since I've read so highly about it. Even though three of us were seated in a really tight corner table for two, the food made up for the discomfort of our seating arrangement.  

TIP: Small restaurant, so don't come If you like your space. 

Arrived: 6pm-ish | Wait time: None

This is what I got:
Prawn Pad Thai ($9) | Do yourself a favor and order it...just....Just do it.
BBQ Chicken ($11.50) | Delicious, but not too adventurous. Try something new :)
Panang Beef ($10) | The beef was so soft and the bold flavor went well with the rice.
author: Brian T.

description:
Okay, who HASN'T been to Marnee Thai??  Raise your hand.

If you really did raise your hand, shame on you!  This place has been around for decades and has been winning awards since the 90's.  Hands down, my favorite Thai restaurant and one of my favorite places to eat overall.  So much so that I used to come once a week!  (But since my food truck habit is thinning out my wallet, my visits have sadly diminished.)

My "regular" is the PAD KAPROW (chopped chicken sauteed with fresh chili garlic and Thai basil) and the beef PAD SE EW (fried rice noodles with soy bean, broccoli and egg).  Served with rice, I feel like if I was Thai I'd say, "Just like how Mom used to cook."  I also recommend their roasted boneless duck served with spinach and house sauce, and the spicy angel wings.  Finish the meal with a fried banana and ice cream or the mango with sticky rice, then wash it all down with a Thai ice tea or coffee.  Yummers all around.

A couple things to note...there is a 2nd location on 9th Street, but for whatever reason I think the Irving one is better.  Parking is a drag unless you're like me and are usually blessed with good parking karma.  The serving sizes are pretty decent so unless you have a large enough party, it's pretty easy to over order.  But then that just means you've got leftovers to enjoy at home!  Yee haw!!
author: Joe M.

description: One of the best thai food in sf. Not a total 5 star because food might get too flavory and oily. But overall, its a bomb and a must try if you love thai food. Go for the angel wings and the spicy noodle with crab(forgot the name), go for the panang curry too. Don't forget the sea bass with hot chili  at the top! Recommended!
author: Bonnie W.

description:
This is my Auntie and Uncle's favourite Thai spots, and they hooked me in =D  One of my favourite dishes is the spicy angle wings.  What I love about them, is their unique spicy taste that cannot be replicated at other Thai restaurants I have been to... I've looked for another dish like this especially since I don't live in the Bay Area anymore.  Of course, I am a big fan of the curry dishes, but the spicy angle wings are truely unique!

Interesting, this spot also has a location not to far away from this site, but I love the Irving St. location best.  The place is small, but cozy.  Always you will find fresh flowers and friendly service which also makes this spot unique!!!
author: Sandie L.

description:
I've heard a lot of great things about Marnee Thai and may have went in with expectations set to high. The outer sunset location is fairly small but they really decorated the restaurant with a lot of thai elements. They sat the two of us at a table up against a wall and somehow forced a third chair. The legs of the extra chair got in our way and probably should have just been moved out.

We started off with the Summer Rolls which are essentially vietnamese spring rolls. They were pretty good and a healthier alternative to fried imperial rolls. I always order Pad Sew Ew at Thai restaurants and i thought they made it well. I love it with hot sauce - so good! The Red Curry with Chicken was only so-so. The coconut milk gives it a nice creamy and slightly sweet flavor. I just personally prefer more savory curries.
author: Samantha L.

description: Really really solid Thai.  Probably the best pad thai I've had around here, and I really enjoyed their chicken wings. If only I could get those wings at happy hour at some bar with a soccer game on, I'd be happy...!
author: Kazu O.

description:
I'm whatever about Thai but this place was so authentic that it was such a pleasant dinner. The decoration, atmosphere and ambiance just added to the experience! The staff is really friendly and tries to sit you down fast but they are also a very small place.

We got Pad Thai and it was just something standard and it was the best Pad Thai i've probably ever had. It did not taste like your average Pad Thai, it was good. Also tried a yellow curry which was great too! A little on the spicier side with a thinner sauce, needed 2 rice bowls for 2 people (keep in mind, eating with a guy).

A little pricey for what we ordered, like $12 a plate average. but you'll see a lot of people coming in for to-go orders. It's a great place to try!
author: Lauren W.

description: It's been a while since I've had thai food, and I heard this place is legit.  We started with an appetizer that my thai friend had introduced me to a while ago, the Miang Kum.  The Miang Kum is basically this plate of little toppings (roasted peanuts, red onions, dried shrimp, ect), that you wrap in a spinach leaf.  This was good, but I felt it was too expensive for what it was.  Guessing they have a huge mark up on this.  Thank goodness we had another appetizer, the Angel Wings.  These wings are so good; I wish I could just order them at any random bar.  It's really the great garlic sauce that makes it.  For the entrees we got the duck curry and the pad thai (two things you really can't go wrong with).  Personally the pad thai was my favorite, and I felt that there was a fair portion here.  Definitely want to come back!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
I really hate giving negative reviews, but man, this was a real disappointment. I guess I don't feel TOO bad, considering Marnee was fairly busy when we got there on a Saturday evening, so here it goes...

I'm baffled at any restaurant that calls a dish a curry if there's no actual sauce. I ordered the chicken satay and panang beef, and my compatriot ordered spicy pork. The chicken satay was acceptable but I wish the peanut sauce had more flavor and the chicken had a little more char. The panang curry, however, legitimately offended me. Chunks of overcooked beef hanging out on a plate with little to no sauce, and certainly no semblance of the coconut milk it was purported to have been cooked in. Maybe a lack of sauce or vegetables is fine for some folks (who don't have an intuitive understanding of Asian cuisines) but hey, I'm pretty a traditional gal. That dish shouldn't have even been listed under "curries." What part of that was I supposed to put on top of my rice? Yeah, a real disappointment. 

In addition, the phrase "where's the fire?" has never been more applicable to the workers in a restaurant. I'm not one to complain about poor service if the food makes up for it, but our server was literally taking our orders as she ran past our table. Like, would it kill you to pause for two seconds, lady? I mean, I get it, I worked food service too and things get busy. But there's something seriously the problem if I could use my experience with ordering as an example of the Doppler effect to a 7th grade classroom. 

So. Just like, whatever, Marnee Thai. Whatever.
author: Raka R.

description:
I'm currently in San Francisco on a second honeymoon with my husband, and being half Thai we decided to try this place on a whim (we drove by randomly and saw it).

Amazed!!! I love homemade thai food and remember the old days of eating my mom's cooking, and this place just sent a wave nostalgia through me. It's authentic and doesn't taste like American watered down version of food (ex. Panda Express for Chinese food).

I got the Chad Pan Poo and will probably go back to get it at least once more before going back home to southern california. What a great find!
author: Joella M.

description:
Malyssa C invited us out to lunch in the city. She said we had to try the spicy angel wings. Since it was a Federal Holiday, we had no job, we went along for the grub crawl!

Five of us walked in and got a table. We only ordered the tom yum soup and spicy angel wings. The server didn't even bat an eye and said "No problem! If you want anything else, let us know. Take your time!" 

I was surprised at how nice she was our entire visit. Our order was no more than what we placed along with hot tea and Thai iced teas, and they treated us no different than tables that ordered a ton of food. 

Tom yum soup was a great. It was delicious way to start. I've never had big quarters of tomato in the soup, but it was perfect. 

Now the spicy angel wings! Topped with fried basil and equally as delicious as our soup! The server brought out white rice and said this would compliment the spicy angel wings and it did! You can eat the rice with just the sauce and fried basil! Must order again next time!

Service was amazing! Will come again. (Note: Open the door gently or it bangs against the wall and everyone in the restaurant will stare at you!)
author: Anne T.

description:
My favorite Thai restaurant in the BAY AREA! I'm from San Jose and I would definitely make the trip to SF for this place!

Had the famous Angel Wings and let me tell you they did not disappoint at all! They're crunch, the sauce has a nice zing to it and the meat is tender. Order a side of rice and you are all set.

Ordered the basil chicken and the Pad Kee Mao, both were better than any I've had at any other place. 

Service is also really attentive and we had no problem getting a table on a Thursday night! 

I'm craving some Thai food just from writing this review.
author: Erick C.

description:
This place is Okay, everything is pretty good here, and they're one of the few restaurants that are open later in SF. 
Sad they don't' have boat noodle, but we settled for Tom Ka. 
angel wings were okay. Flavorful and sweet.
crab with noodle was very delicious, a little bland to my tasting though. (as i compare it to my thai restaurant in sac with the most delicious thai crab noodle ever)
author: Ames A.

description:
I met a friend and some new friends here for dinner the other night - looooooved it!!  Each time I go to a new Thai restaurant, I have their pad see ew as my standard comparison amongst Thai restaurants.  This was the *best* pad see ew I've had!! - and I've had a LOT of pad see ew!  The flat noodles were cooked perfectly and the dish was fully flavorful yet nice and light.  Heart Marnee Thai at the 2225 Irving location!!  

We also had seafood soup (tasty with a punch of spice), fish (nicely cooked, yummy), pumpkin curry (I'm a *fan*!) - mmmm!!  The service was great and attentive just enough.  Location is great.  Heart!!  I will definitely be back!!
author: Maile N.

description:
I was eating Thai food before volunteering for a local fashion show. A gorgeous model started talking to me about Marnee Thai and highly recommended it. & I'm glad he did because I probably would've passed by this place without giving it a chance. 

The inside of the restaurant is small but elegantly decorated. I was pleased with the extra amount of effort put into the ambiance (same prices as competitors but better decor, +1!) 

I really enjoyed the green papaya salad($8.25) and spice angel wings($7.95). Good proportions and perfect amount of spicy for my liking. The pad see ew was SO good, I loved it. The servings of the entree dishes were a little smaller when compared to other places I've been but it was worth it. 

The staff was very efficient in clearing out dishes and refill out waters, which I highly appreciate. They were very polite and friendly. 

Well, I'm off to meet more models and get restaurant recommendations!
author: Tiffany P.

description: Every time I visit San Francisco, this place is at the top of my list. Often eating there more than once per visit. Both locations are excellent, very consistent. The fried soft shell crab atop green mango salad is divine. Corn fritters are to die for.
author: Suzy R.

description:
went here on a Friday night , place was very small and all the tables were full. ordered pork pad kee mao, spicy angel wings, tom yum soup and green mango salad.

the pad kee mao, I don't remember it to be this "tomatoey saucey". I've had the pad kee mao many times before but in the other location. this time, it tasted like it had tomatoe sauce even the noodles were drenched in what looked like tomato sauce. no good! 

green mango salad I thought was too sweet. 

spicy angel wings were good, nice and crunchy and had moderate spicy which was good. 
tom yum was ok.
author: Steve S.

description: Super delicious food! Also, the staff is very friendly and efficient. We were seated immediately, food came quickly, and the host was very welcoming. Would definitely recommend for authentic Thai food
author: Maggie L.

description:
about 3.5 

Spicy Angels wings - sweet and savory but not spicy

Hotcakes- gummy rice flour sizzling in small skillet, with canned corn kernels, a small dice of taro and coconut milk over top - sweet and savory, more of a dessert for me, loved the gummy texture - my guess a great take on street food. 

Green Curry - hmmmm I like my chicken stewing in green curry until it's falling apart and the Japanese eggplant was okay. Overall I would have liked this dish to stew a bit longer so the sliced chicken breasts could get more tender and the eggplant added later (too mushy) the heat was nice though. 

Service was curt and no nonsense, I love that in a family run restaurant with a matriarch keeping everyone in check. 

I may go back to explore the menu further. I saw a sign for green curry pot stickers that sounds really interesting.
author: Jade W.

description:
The seating in here can be a little squished. But if you're looking for good Thai food COME HERE. 

Albeit there are usually people waiting outside for a table. It is worth the wait. I wouldn't suggest large groups (more that 4) coming because it is very cramped. 

My last experience was not at all good. The place was so busy and their were only like 2 waiters that things took a really long time to come. But I wouldn't judge them on that one experience because of all the other GOOD times I have had. 

FOOD:
Goong Sarong (prawns in a blanket): an appetizer with no bacon! it was disappointing to say the least.
Spicy Angel Wings: also an appetizer but these were quite delicious. They ask you how spicy you want them to be. 
Pad kaprow: I always love a good pork one. I warn you that this doesn't come with rice and you have to pay to get a bowl. 
Chan Pad Poo: Soooo goood. I'm not usually a fan of crab meat but this was actually divine. 
Pad Se ew: again a delicious entree. It's a little on the blander side... not necessarily bland but it doesn't have the same BAM that the other dishes have. 

The prices aren't unreasonable at all. (($10-13)
The portions aren't huge but just the right size.
author: Kimberly Y.

description:
Had an awesome dinner here last night with my family. We ate on the early side but the restaurant was still crowded when we got there. Luckily (because it was freezing outside!) there was a table leaving right as we arrived so we were seated immediately. Note: there's no place to wait inside.

We ordered the tom yum soup, pumpkin curry with chicken, green curry (can't remember the name but it was #25 on the menu), and the pad see ew noddles. We later realized that was not enough food for the 4 of us and also ordered vegetables with tofu in peanut sauce.

Everything was delicious. DELICIOUS. The pumpkin curry was seriously amazing. I mean, I love pumpkin curry but this was beyond great. The green curry was a little spicy for my personal taste, but I'm beginning to realize that I'm really just a wimp. I loved the veggies in peanut sauce, although that portion in particular was especially small.

Service was curt, bordering on rude and I was thinking about deducting a star, but really, the food makes up for it. Also, we had hot tea and the guy in charge of refilling our cups was perfectly friendly and came by often, so I think the problem is restricted to the one woman who takes your order.

Prices were fairly reasonable. I seriously cannot wait to come back, or more likely order takeout from this place.
author: Rachel E.

description:
They don't need my review. Food is solid, service is great. Why me y -1 star? La has better thai food:p. 
but this is my go to place for sure.
author: jasmin t.

description:
GOLDEN TRIANGLES (Thai Samosas): Crispy on the outside, with a pumpkin, potato, curry filling (7.95) - Crispy on the outside and mushy on the inside. the pumpkin or squash on the inside made it sweet and yummy with the sweet chili sauce. 

SPICY ANGEL WINGS: Deep fried chicken wings sautéed with our signature chili-garlic sauce, topped with crispy basil (7.95) -  Crispy and perfectly cooked on the inside. The sauce was spicy to ppl that don't eat spicy food. It just had a minor kick for me. You also get a strong garlic taste to it.  Worth getting.

SEASONAL HOMEMADE HOTCAKE: Grilled rice coconut cakes w/ corn, green onions, pumpkin (price unknown): May recommended this dish to me and I did not regret getting it! I just wished I got it after my meal cause of the sweetness from the pumpkin, coconut milk and corn, it made the dish feel like a dessert dish. It was sooo good! I would come back just for this! Don't eat it too fast as it is on a hot plate and is piping hot.

GREEN CURRY POTSTICKERS (price unknown): This was soo good! SOOO GOOD! Loved the drizzle of green curry over the potstickers and the fresh basil sprinkled on top. The whole thing was a paired perfectly together.  

PAD SE - EW Pan-fried wide rice noodles with soy bean, broccoli and egg. Choice of chicken, beef or pork (9.95): Not enough broccoli. I think there was only two pieces and that was it. I also recalled ordering beef, but got chicken.... oh wells. It was more on the garlic-y side than the balance of garlic and sweetness. The noodles was a little overcooked. Not the best dish I had at this place.

KANG KA REE (Yellow Curry) Chicken (9.95): Who doesn't love yellow curry?! It was perfect over rice. I have had better yellow curry at other places, but this was pretty decent. 

Overall, food was good. I give this place a 3.5 stars, but I am being nice and rounded up to 4 stars. The service was a bit slow but I do not blame them cause it was really busy that night. May was awesome and very caring from the moment we stepped into the restaurant.
author: Erica T.

description:
What a great experience it was to go to Marnee Thai. My sister had been raving about the food and decor so we decided to check it out.

The restaurant itself is quite small, but when you walk through the doors you feel like you've been transported to a small straw house filled with the bustling sounds of a great family meal. We arrived with 4 of our party of 5 and we were sat, so long as we were planning on ordering something before our fifth arrived.

We quickly worked our way through the majority of the appetizers. The first was the recommended Thai Cupcake/Muffin/Delicious mystery that was made in a cast iron pan with 8 little cups of goodness. The Miang Kum which are leaves you fill with spices, vegetables and shrimp were flavor explosions. Then of course is the Angel Wings which everyone at the table agreed were made in crack-sauce. Very delicious and addictive. Members of the party were then putting the sauce on all the other dishes.

After our fifth arrived we had our entrees which included Chan Pad Poo (chock full of crab meat) and panang beef (one of the best beef curries I have ever had).

We had a great time at Marnee Thai and it was definitely some of the best Thai I have had in the city. Definitely recommend it.
author: Ben B.

description:
*Lights turn off suddenly and the room goes pitch black.

Omgg. what's going on?? Oh shiett, did I accidentally hit the light switch with my big ass purse? Is there a blackout? Gawdd I hope not. More importantly, CAN WE STILL EAT??!! I'm freaking starving!!

BONGGGGGGGG... BONGGGGGG... BONGGGGGGG!!!! The head mistress (I'm gonna call her mama Thai) of the joint has this fierce look on her face and bongs the whole room silent. The other lady is holding a candle. Is it seance time?? I stood there in a stupor.. whats about to happen?? "Haaaaaaappyyy birthday to you...." Ohhhhhhh... its someones birthday. The whole restaurant busted out in chorus, and the bday Lola stood up and pageant waved to everyone like Miss America. Geez lady who you think you is!!?? She was cute still. 

Eating here is like eating at home. Mama Thai will take your order by memory, bark and yell (all up in yo face) to the other workers in her embarrassingly loud tongue, interrupt you, encourage you to try one of the specials on the wall, and tell you she loves you.

On one occasion, she pissed off a loud Irish guy who dropped a million F bombs, cursing his way through dinner because he didn't get his food in a timely manner. She apologized and said, "Sorry honey. I love you." He was not having it, whined like a 7 yr old boy and called bulls*&$. Still she professed her love to him incessantly. 
. 
Oh Marnee, how I love thee.

Dinner AND A SHOW??!!

Yes, please!!! =)
author: Angela W.

description: Good pork belly the sauce in it was very good. I also had the samosas as an appetizer but they were not good at all. The filling was very dry and chewy. Soda comes in a can. Easy street parking.
author: Chris B.

description:
Good food 

BUT...

...turrible (Charles Barkley voice) service. I know it was busy but c'mon dude. 1 hour to wait for my food?!? I was ready to flip a table over in that dorm room. We were seated waaaaay before probably 5 other parties and they received their food 15 times faster. We didn't even have utensils. Our order had to be taken twice. We ask for water and they forget right away. 3 times they've said that our food is coming right up. As I watch other people get their food, I'm thinking to myself, "Hey bro, I'd be happy with any food right now. They could give me a slice of Wonder Bread and some peaches, and I'll make the jam myself." I wanted to run to the kitchen, put on a white hat, and make a bowl of Lucky Charms. I wanted to run down the street, grab a king size Snicker, run back to the restaurant, and put it on my plate. 

I could've done alllll of that before my food came. They didn't even say sorry or hook a brotha up with a healthy serving of roti with ice cream. 

1 HOUR wait for my food. I should've stole some plates and the candle on my table to make my wait worthwhile.
author: Ro R.

description: Great meals. Fast service. Liked the atmosphere. Came because of the yelp ratings... Didn't disappoint.
author: Lauren R.

description:
My friend and I were craving Thai food, so she recommended coming here. They take reservations, but do not rely on that. Just make sure to be present and ready to sit down. This place gets crowded. The hostess (probably the owner) and waiter were characters. It made the entire dining experience memorable in a good way.

The food was so tasty! You must try these dishes out:
-Coconut hotcakes
-Pad Ma Kuer (eggplant with chicken, bell peppers and thai basil)
-Pad Thai
-Pumpkin Curry

Have these with a cup of hot tea to complement your food.

Yummy!
author: Ron M.

description:
NO!  Didnt you guys read J S 's review?  He is right- it's like being at your crazy mother-in-law's house if she can cook.  Amazing food, but NOT worth the stress.

Was having lunch meeting with a coworker last week.  Her leftovers looked and smelled SO DELICIOUS.  I was all jealous and asked her where she got it?  She said Marnee Thai.  I'm all "WHAT????"  as I know her to be a reasonable person who would never eat at a place with abusive staff.

Her response 'Oh yeah, you mean the Insano-Witch thing, right?  Food's great tho.  So I call and ask if she's there or expected to be there...If they say 'yes' I order to go. Otherwise I eat there...it's a nice place and the curry's amazing."

I agree- the curry is out of this world.  I wonder if they deliver? I have not yet asked coworker how she phrases her question during the Insano-Witch fact-finding phone call.  She is a very polite person.  I'll admit it's kind of a game for me to try to figure this out without asking.


5 stars for the food.  But really I can only give one star because my experiences eating here have been so incredibly awful. When I figure out how to gracefully ask if the rude lady  is there, I might be willing to up the stars....
author: El B.

description:
Marnee Thai was one of the best Thai places I have ever been to. It's got great service, fair prices, and good food. While it's not the biggest restaurant, because it's so small, your food comes out quickly.(though I will agree that large parties are hard to seat here). The thai waitress we had was great and she really did a good job recommending items to us.

My girlfriend and I shared a penang beef curry and pork pad nor mai. Both were excellent. The curry didn't come with much sauce, but it came with 2-3x as much meat as most curries. The pad nor mai was delicious(I'm a huge fan of bamboo sprouts) and it's a pretty reasonable serving.

My only complaint was that you have to pay for rice separately, but it's good jasmine rice, so I can't really complain. 

All in all, I would definitely come back.
author: Dawei L.

description:
Why does it take almost 15 minutes for the waitress to say hello and get water? As soon as we were about to get up and leave, she comes so we sit back down. 

I order basil chicken which is what I always get when I go to a thai restuarant, could barely taste the basil..I'm so confused because everyone raved about this place an it could've been an isolated experience but nevertheless I'm still dissappointed. My hubby got some kind of basa crispy fish entree, which he really enjoyed. The reason I at least gave it any stars at all. (and my yummy thai iced tea)

The waitress came and asked if we wanted rice with our dish, of course, because both of our dishes are traditionally served with rice.  A little upset after getting the bill because we got charged four additional dollars for it, and there wasn't even that much and this place is not even that fancy. I felt jipped!

The big dealbreaker for this restuarant was the customer service, we came at a time when it was starting to get busier, we say like 4 or 5 of the people that worked there eating, I mean come on' people, there hungry customers...I don't like that. I wouldn't mind if it was slow, but still it's weird and you can only hope they wash their hands when they're done scarfing down dinner in your face. That's just a tidbit. I digress

So far I still love Lalita Thai in the Civic Center area, the customer service is way better there. I really won't be coming back here, unless I'm drug here against my will.
author: Brandi W.

description: This place is great! Always so welcoming here, although the line is always out the door at night...
author: Kevin D.

description:
The Roasted Duck Rice Noodles without soup (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pYk2UZ_AUGWO4s8YFepRHQ?select=cvmidBUx7hqFtHFXeDINTg) was magnificent, and it was quite possibly one of the best Thai noodle dishes I've had anywhere.  Over a bed of bean sprouts a mountain of chewy, soft rice noodles was added then topped with a generous portion of boneless roast duck, roasted garlic, fresh green onions and cilantro and crushed, toasted peanuts.  What an absolute taste sensation this was.

You can't really tell from looking through the giant glass windows, but the interior is pretty nice with rattan walls and a steeple ceiling using the same rattan material.  Lots of hanging plants descends from the ceiling, and very delightful Thai trinkets decorate the walls and hang from the ceiling as well.  Beautiful Thai orchids sit on each tabletop and there are several pots of these beauties on display near the front entrance.

The service was slightly spotty, but both of the ladies who work the dining room were very friendly.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
I've tried King of Thai... didn't like it. Osha Thai.... overpriced food that is not good. I am really picky about Thai/Indian/Burmese because i can eat it at home and you know what they say, mom's food is always the best !! However, Marnee Thai....Definitely shocked me, it is one of the best place to get Thai food in San Francisco. 

From the looks of this tiny little restaurant from outside, you might be thinking to yourself "this place looks a little sketchy". However, the interior is like a total opposite from the outside. The inside is a nice and warm little hut with beautiful dim lighting. Also, the people working there were all wearing traditional dress/robe. It felt warm and close to home.

My friends got seated right away and we were greeted quickly with water. We ordered lots of food share and let me tell you, they were the best Thai food i had besides home. 

FOOD: 

Samosa ( curry w/ Potatoes wrapped in flour, deep fried ) - It was nasty for me, my friends thought otherwise. The curry was too sweet for me, I like my curry spicy because that is how my mom always make Samosa. 

Angel Wings (Spiced fried chicken wings) - delicious, the best thing i ate that night. the wings were covered in sauce and you can still feel the crunchiness of the skin when you bite into it. The flavor was so rich, it was sweet and spicy at the same time. one of a kind. 

Thai Style Fried Rice - I got it with beef but you can get it with chicken and i think pork. It wasn't like any other fried rice i had at other Thai Restaurants which tasted awful. one they brought it out, i can tell it was good just by the smell of it. The rice was good. The beef was even better, It was not chewy at all.( Most restaurants don't know how to cook beef, trust me) The only little bad thing was i wish the beef was a little bit on the raw side. Then it would be perfect!

Pad Thai - it was good but a little on the sour side. 

Pad Se Ew- Good, but it is kind of just like beef chow fun. 

Service - Great and friendly, they always came and refill our waters and asked us how things are doing. 

The only bad thing about this place is it is too small, it is bad if you are with 8 or more friends. I would love to come back to this place to try what they have to offer.
author: Daniel L.

description:
The food was GREAT. Fabulous. Staff was friendly.

Was there hair in our food? Yes. Was there a cockroach on the table next to us? Yes. 

I don't mean to be nit-picky but when situations like this have happened at other restaurants, they usually pick up part of the tab, or throw in a free dessert to smooth things over a bit. Neither happened.

While I love good food, I don't think I'll ever go back because the hair and cockroach incident was pretty gross.
author: Elise G.

description:
I usually come here when I want some nice Thai food.  Panang Beef is always good, which is what I usually order if I can't decide what else to pick from their extensive menu.  The beef is always tender and the sauce delicious.  The last time I came here, I also tried the Pad Ma Kuer with chicken, which has a sweet sauce with eggplants.
This place is nice and cozy, very cozy, since some tables are just so close together.
author: Karen L.

description: Maybe it's what we ordered, but it was extremely pedestrian, boring and even Panda would have been a better choice. Green tea was a teabag in a small cup of warm water
author: Carla B.

description:
Came here with Kwoky L and Christian H while visiting SF. They had seen Marnee Thai featured on a TV show and heard great things. 

When we arrived shortly after 6pm and they were nearly packed already, I figured they would be good. Then I looked around and counted the number of Caucasians on one hand and realized this was an Asian-approved authentic spot. 

We had the following dishes to share: 

Avocado salad with soft shell crab and mango -- great size and no skimping on the crab. The soft shell crab was the right texture, and did not become soggy from the salad. The dressing was light and flavorful. Great starter. 

Coconut hot cakes with corn -- my first time trying these as recommended by the owner. Somewhat savory, somewhat sweet. They come in little portions (7 per order) and come out piping hot. I enjoyed the homemade chili sauce on top of these. I would have liked the texture of these to be a little more consistent -- almost felt undercooked inside even though it was crispy on the outside. 

Miang kam (spinach leaves with dried shrimp, peanuts, ginger, lime, coconut, sauce) -- a rare find on a North American Thai menu. A fun bit of work putting together these bite-sized snacks. 

Hong lay pork stew with pineapple -- this was okay. Instead of my typical red curry chicken or chili basil beef, I gave in to trying something new. I found it to be more sweet than savory due to the pineapple. 

Pad prig pao pork -- this was okay. Flavors were nice, but would have been nice to have this a little more saucy. 
  
Brown rice -- hearty and wild. I really liked this. $2 for a small bowl. 

Mango sticky rice -- pretty good. 

Thai iced tea -- best I've had in years. 

Prices were okay, service was good. The place is crowded and loud, and the owner is an entertaining saleswoman.
author: Meana K.

description:
Yelp giveth and yelp taketh away.... 

I don't understand the 4 start rating for this place. We ordered Thai Red curry and Thai Fried rice and were suggested to order Spicy Tofu with peanut sauce and nothing was good. 

The Spicy Tofu appetizer would pass off as a dessert. Too sweet.( I wouldn't have ordered it if it is not for the waiter's strong recommendation)
The  Fried rice was bland 
The Red curry tofu was watery and bland

The steamed rice was the only positive. It was kind of disappointing that in the spice tray, they just threw a few fresh jalapenos in vinegar and call it one of the condiments.

The one thing I liked is the waiting staff... very efficient and friendly. The small glasses that they served water in  never ran empty and we had a nice conversations with the owner of the place after the meal....
author: Ravi C.

description: I'll make this  short and clear. Bad service. Angel wings: sauce ok, but overcooked, too dry. We ordered a curry and noodle dish, neither of them are worth the price. Will not come back.
author: Celine C.

description: I am disappointed with the service and food at this restaurant. We came in for lunch on a weekday and was glad to see that it was not busy and was seated immediately.   I am not sure if our waiter was having a bad day but he didn't have a positive attitude from the time he took our order to bringing us food.  Didn't even bother to check on us at least one time.  The only dish that were decent was Chad pad koo and mango with sticky rice.  The soup was bland.  Eggplant dish  was over cooked.  Mango salad with soft shell crab was plain.  Wild bass with garlic and pepper  portion was small and bit overpriced. White rice was cold.  Lastly,  we ordered two dessert and only one came and come to find out, he only put in only one order.  There are
author: Vincent G.

description:
The poorest customer service ever. On a freezing cold night the servers wanted to put us near the door. When there were plenty of open seats one would think that your paying customers would come first. However they proceeded to say it was the only table available. Who sticks a child near a door when every time someone opens it, a cold breeze comes in. 

Bunch of A-holes. Needless to say I told the F this I'm out!
author: Adam Y.

description:
Today I fell in love...in love with Marnee Thai that is! 

Marnee Thai is a neighborhood gem that is located in the Outer Sunset district of San Francisco. This restaurant is a frequent favorite of my cousin and her boyfriend. I was so happy to finally dine here! If you love Thai food and are in the SF area, this restaurant is a must! 

My cousin and I ordered the Pad Thai and Pad See Ew. I was extremely happy with both dishes as they were cooked to perfection! I have tried about a million pad thai dishes at different restaurants and I must say that the pad thai at Marnee Thai is probably one of the best I've ever had!

And the thing I love most is that this restaurant is decorated like the inside of a Thailand hut. Even the walls are made out of straw! Very ethnic decor and ambiance!

Oh yea, unlimited tea. Yay!! Definitely, LOVE AT FIRST BITE! ;)
author: Viennelyn C.

description:
A pretty small restaurant, so it was a bit hard to walk to the table. When my mom, sister and I first got there, the manager (I think?) tried sitting us at a 2-top table with my little sister sitting on a chair in the aisle where the servers walk. Um, isn't that a bit dangerous? Especially with hot food.

But after another table left, she let us move to a bigger table. 

The manager kept touching my sister's hair &that made her feel a bit uncomfortable, and she did it quite a few times throughout the night. She was also talking pretty loud to all of the employees, I know Asians talk loud, but I didn't think she had to be thaaaat loud. 

But overall, the food was good! 
We ordered the satay chicken skewers for an appetizer &I ordered Pad Thai. This place has a better tasting Pad Thai than many other Thai restaurants.
author: Sabrina S.

description:
O.M.G. The smallest restaurant that I've ever been to. Street parking was relatively easy considering it was a Saturday night in SF!

We called to make reservations because we felt it'd be jam packed..made reservations for a party of 4 for 7 but weren't seated until 7:30 even though our party arrived. They won't seat you until everyone is here and yes, they do take reservations!

Let's get down to business:
1. Imperial rolls - deep-fried spring rolls similar to those at viet pho places. 
2. Spicy angel wings - we were recommended to get this by the waitress. It was very crispy, which I liked. I thought the sauce that they fried it in was a bit oversalted though.
3. kang keaw w chicken - you can't go to a thai restaurant without ordering curry! I always get the green curry with chicken + white rice. The menu said there was eggplant but only a few pieces of eggplant was added
4. pad thai - nom nom nom, pad thai that's not watery. I hate the soggy ones.
5. wild-caught sea bass with garlic and black pepper sauce - the waitress highly recommended the sea bass and it was cooked pretty well, but the garlic and pepper sauce was a tad bit oversalted. 
6. mango with sticky rice 
7. Don't really recall the dish but there was beef and chicken on skewers with a yellow sauce drizzled on top and a peanut sauce-type dip. The chicken was cooked to perfection....even though it was white meat, it was still succulent and not dry at all, very impressed. The beef was good too, but I was way too full to enjoy and eat much more by the end of the meal when this dish came along.
author: Lisa Z.

description:
I went to this restaurant just last week. The food was good but the service was really disappointing. Me and my friend were told to take a seat at a table at the corner. Me and my friend then started to wait for our water, which took them about 20 minutes to get. The waiting was not the main problem I had but it was the fact that one of their waitresses asked for more tips than what I gave her. I think I was pretty fair and I guess some people are just really greedy. 

In short, just go to their other branch on 9th Ave.
author: Wingsee F.

description:
My fiance and I were very excited to try this place after reading all the reviews on yelp and seeing the high praise Marnee Thai got on Check Please Bay Area. I must say however, that it didn't live up to the hype. Maybe it was the time we went, or what we ordered but we were both expecting an amazing experience.

We ordered:
Spicy Angel Wings -- this dish was gooey, sticky, crispy and sweet like honey, but not as spicy as I anticipated since "spicy" is part of the dish's name.  I felt that the sauce that it came in was a little too thick and overpowering. I had burnt finger tips from handling this hot (temperature-wise) dish.  The meat was tender but again, I think the sauce really overpowered any chicken flavor. 
 
Simmered Pork Randang Curry -- tender pork with lots of flavor. The sauce or curry was scarce and a little runny for my liking though since I like to pour sauce all over my rice.

Mango Fried Rice with Chicken -- came with big chunks of chicken, mango and eggs. I thought this dish alone didn't have much flavor. It lacked sweetness from the mango and any real depth. I had to add some of the sauce they had on their table to give it any flavor.  

Dessert:
Roti with coconut ice cream -- SOOOOOOOO freakin' delicious! It got the right textures of crisp, gooey softness, and firmness. It was not overly sweet. It had great coconut flavor which mixed well with the sweetness of the condensed milk drizzled over the roti. I wanted this one all to myself AND order another. If it were based on this dessert alone, I would've happily given Marnee Thai 4 stars!

Service was OK. It took them a few minutes to get us menus and take our drink orders. They refilled our waters when they got low without us having to ask. However, they brought out the food too quickly. We were still working on our hot chicken wings when they brought out our other two dishes which were initially steaming but had cooled off considerably when we finally got to them.

 I wonder if Marnee Thai has a back door since other reviewers have commented on them taking their trash out through the front door. While we dined there, a delivery man brought in all the restaurant's produce through their front door using a "borrowed" shopping cart which I thought was quite odd.
author: b p.

description:
My party and I were planning to go to a different restaurant, Yummy Yummy, but it was closed when we got there. Since we didn't want to drive far to go elsewhere, we were looking for a nearby restaurant that was good. So we ended up at Marnee Thai.

You should order:
Soft Shelled Crab Mango Salad
Angel Chicken
Pad Thai (or one of the other dishes that sounds like Pad Thai)

For these 3 dishes and 2 Thai Iced Teas, the bill was $41. I'd say the prices are fair and the service was great. The atmosphere is good since it feels like you're in a nice hut and the servers are dressed up in what I am guessing are traditional Thai outfits.

This is probably one of my favorite Thai restaurants and I'm indifferent about Thai food in general. So if you're iffy about Thai food and trying to decide on this place, I'd recommend just trying it.
author: Marlon T.

description: I got the spicy angel wings per yelp recommendations and they were just okay. The flavor was a little weird for me. Also got the pineapple fried rice and it had zero flavor. Asked them make it spicy and it didn't have any kick to here. It was $24 total for two things, definitely not worth it.
author: Tanya Y.

description:
When the restaurant has endorsement from every single travel, web, and restaurant rater out there you expect some darn good cooking and i must say that my experience at marnee thai was really forgettable. i came here on a tuesday evening so i'm really hoping that it was the chef's day off because the food just wasn't all that spectacular.

The decor is charming with it's thatched roof, it made me feel like i was in the tropics and not some cold windy day in sf.

We ordered the angel wings, pad thai, and for the life of me I can't remember what my hubs ordered.

The angel wings were  not spectacular, they were not stuffed, they just tasted like fried chicken wings that I would get at So's or San Tang but not as good.

As for the pad thai, it was bland and had a strong ketchup type taste which I usually akin to those take out places you used to order thai food from back in college.

My hubs said he liked it so that's why i'm giving this place a 2.
