I've had their angel wings, pad thai, pad see yew, and tom yom soup. Ahhh, so delicious. Why can't all Thai places be this flavorful?

The service can be variable, but the food makes up for it, if it's not excellent. One time, when I went with my sister, there was even a lady that took orders but also told fortunes/readings while interacting with you. She was a bit rambunctious, but a treat to encounter. I've only seen here once since then, but she made eating there more fun and makes up hope to see her again some day.

The only drawback is that it's in SF and not SJ :(.
author: Susan Y.

description:
Yea....about this place.

It's always been good of course, but dang is it spicy!

When I'm sick all I want is some thai soup- Tom Kha Gai, it's comforting and always makes me feel better.
                    .................well unless its so incredibly spicy that it burns your mouth in an uncomfortable way and leaves a stinging sensation that won't go away until you decide to consume loads of straight salt to numb the pain. 

Yea no thanks. I couldn't figure out what was in it that was causing the intensely unpleasant spiciness...but so not cool Marnee, not cool. 
I actually had to go to the bathroom the second time I tasted the mean spice and wash my mouth out. Five bites later (of the entire bowl of soup) I gave up and pushed it aside. And I like spicy food usually! Geez.

Boo, now I need to find a new comfort food :(
author: Sonya D.

description:
Never disappoints!  

Favorite meal: Pad Thai, Satay Wraps, Imperial Rolls w/ Mango and Sticky Rice for dessert!
author: Jackie L.

description: Bad service, made my me and my friends change tables repeatedly. Took forever with our service. Ask where our food was, and the waiter cut off my friend that was talking and said "it's coming" then left. Most likely not coming back.
author: Hubert N.

description:
Cleaniness: 5 star 
Services: 5 star (1. the boss lady had the whole restaurant sang a happybirthday song to one of the customers. SWEET!!  2. The server were attentive and refilled our tea often)
Food:  4 star 
Penang Beef -- Beef was tender, Curry was flavorful and would love it a little more spicer)
Spicy Beef Salad -- Good flavor but lack of the exotic basil, lime flavor I was looking for.
Tom Yum Soup w/ Prawn -- Soooooooooooo good!!!

I came in for dinner around 7 and was crowded. So plan ahead!
author: Racerboy B.

description:
Chicken Wings to die for, best in bay, and maybe even the world.

Crab Pad Thai also delicious!
author: Will C.

description: Good Thai food. Great Flavors. Had their pad Thai, shrimp fried rice and chicken skewer. I would say the pad Thai was the best of the three but nothing extraordinary. The chicken has great Flavors but you can tell its cheap chicken, not quality ingredients. But not bad overall.
author: Carrie T.

description:
This is probably the best Thai food I've had in the city. I love the lady who owns the place. After we placed our order, she said "you're gonna love my food!" and we did. We ordered the angel wings with tofu, which were so delicious. A little messy to eat, but the mix of tangy and sweet and spicy was perfect. They were fried perfectly and weren't too greasy at all. We also ordered the pad chan poo, which was like pad thai, but with crab and egg. The noodles were lighter and less oily, but still flavorful. The crab and egg also worked really well together. We also got the yellow curry with prawns and scallops, which was a great deal better than the typical Thai curry. It tasted lighter and had some unique undertones due to the seafood.

It's a cute and cozy restaurant and the service is pretty good. I would definitely come back here again and try some of their other dishes!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
My FAV dish here is the pad kee mao. It's like the pad see yew, but spicier, has tomatoes, and they use tomato in the sauce.

Ive tried many dishes here (listed below) and all of them are delicious:

Papaya salad
Crispy egg rolls
Pad see yew
Pad Thai
Pineapple fried rice
Eggplant 

Just all around solid Thai food. Very delicious and tasty.
author: Rosie W.

description:
In comparison to other Thai places, this gets 3.75 stars, rounded up. 

Anyway.

OUTER SUNSET FTW!

I love Irving Street, west of 19th Avenue.  So many little eateries.  Pretty much every other establishment is a restaurant.  

One of the many tasty restaurants on this stretch of "New Chinatown" is Marnee Thai. I came here for dinner a few nights ago, and I've been here a few times before, and from what I recall, it's always tasty.  

If Chef Siriyarn is the master of the kitchen, then Mrs. Siriyarn is certainly the heart of the restaurant.  She is such a presence, and it definitely reminds me of my (and maybe your) momma in all the expected ways - slightly annoying and in-your-face during implementation, but always well-intentioned and got your best interests at heart.  

It's a very nice, comfortable space (+1 for good atmosphere), very low-key and laid-back.  We sat down, and Mrs. Siriyarn gives us our menus.  She talks up a couple items and then leaves to give us time to decide.  There was a sea bass special that looked AMAZING with some type of mousse curry (That's what I recall, I could be wrong), and I was all over that, but then I read the fine print and saw that they only had it during weekends.  

BOO.

So, I decided to go for the Woonsen Vegetarian, a silver noodle dish with vegetables, and my foodmate ordered the spicy pad thai with crab.  At this point, Mrs. Siriyarn sat down next to us (something I've never seen before) to take our orders.  I was a little taken aback that she just sat down so physically close to us and just kinda leans closely in, it seemed odd but at the same time, like I mentioned before, she's got a warm, momma presence, so you're okay with it.

The service was fast, the food came, and we dug in.  My foodmate's dish was spicy but delicious.  My own dish was a bit on the bland side, and I actually didn't enjoy it too much, but I think it was my own fault for ordering the wrong thing.  All my other experiences were fine. 

At several points during the meal, Mrs. Siriyarn would pop up next to us (stealthy!) to check on us.  One time, my foodmate and I were having an especially personal conversation, and she popped up next to me - totally freaked me out!  Just like momma.  I kept in perspective that Momma Siriyarn's just being a momma, so we dealt with it, even though I was definitely caught off guard.  

So, yeah, this place gets 3.75 stars rounded up because:
+ Better and tastier than the other 1490134 Thai places in the City
+ Outer Sunset = Sweet location
+ Comfy atmosphere, classy
+ Fast service
+ Momma Siriyarn, bein' all up in yo face, but warm and momma-like at the same time

Final word:  I dig. Food, momma, and all.
author: Vivian C.

description:
We ordered 2 entrees TO-GO and waited here. Although we got them after the promised time, their service was pathetic. We ordered 2 brown rice - It was put in just one box. Also when I asked for an extra fork/spoon, the lady server remained unresponsive and finally handed it over to me with reluctance. Another bizarre thing about the restaurant - one of the servers was eating in the customer table and was also serving customers by the side! The proportion of veggies in an entree was uneven - They had filled the take away box with cheap veggies.

The Thai red curry entree was good. That is why I have given 3 stars.
author: B N.

description:
I dined with my dad on a Sunday afternoon at approximately 1pm.  After watching the episode on Check, Please! Bay Area, I really wanted to try this place.  I've had Thai food before at King of Thai,  I wanted to compare the taste, flavors, service, and atmosphere.  When we arrived, it was just us two and another couple.  By the time our food arrived at our table and when we left, all the seats were filled.

To start off, we ordered the Coconut Hotcakes and loved it very much.  It's 7 pieces of sizzling rice flour cakes with coconut milk, taro, and topped with corn ($7.95).  Highly recommended!

Next, we ordered the traditional Pad Thai with shrimp and the Beef Fried Rice.  Both are delicious, the flavors are good and but not really for the price ($9.50 each).

The service wasn't all there.  When we ordered our food, we asked for the Hotcakes but the waiter went into the kitchen to see if they had it.  Instead of coming out of the kitchen whether or not they had it, he greeted customers coming in and seated them and then told us that they had hotcakes.  Instead of taking our complete order, he'd interrupt by seating other customers coming in.  There were two other waitresses working, so I was wondering why did they not seat customers so that our waiter could finish taking our order.  A waiter/waitress should focus on the customers on hand and have the others greet/take care of other customers.

The service was okay, our glasses were full even when we did not ask.  When we asked for the check, one of the waitresses took my credit card before providing me the bill. Luckily, the bill was correct.

The funny part is that just as I was placing my card and my copy into my wallet before I got up from my seat, the waitress said, "Bye! Bye! Thank you!"  I chuckled thinking, "At least let me get up from my seat first before thanking us."
author: Allen C.

description: Nice spot for Thai food. The special appetizer (coconut cakes) comes served in a cast iron skillet with 7 bite sized cakes! Very nice treat to try at least once. This spot is crowded, get ready to squeeze in for a tasty meal.
author: K R.

description:
Date/Time:  Sunday - 7:30pm
Occasion:   Dinner with a GF
Party of:  Two
Ordered:  Angel wings, Chan pad poo noodle, and Prig khing (string beans)
Total incl gratuity: $36

I consulted my trusty yelp app to determine what we would order.  The angel wings definitely struck a chord with many yelpers so we gave it a whirl.  A delicious, though messy, choice appetizer.  Deep-fried with a chili-garlic sauce smothered over the wings and finally topped with crisply fried basil.  The wings were served piping hot and each wing was rather sizeable.

The noodle we ordered was just as delicious.  An ever-so "healthy-for-the heart" combination of rice noodle, crab meat, and egg.  We ordered medium spiciness, I could have ordered up a notch for that extra kick.  The string beans were a good choice for our vegetable for the night.  I feel like you can never go wrong with string beans. They were flavorful and sauteed to the proper crispness, served with tofu and baby corn.

The service is interesting.  The main "momma" server had a very boisterous personality.  The place is rather small so they focus on getting you in, served, then out.  Food-wise: a solid choice when you're in the mood for Thai food.
author: Jess C.

description:
Chicken Fried Rice! Woot woot! So yummy, so clean. 
The place is super busy on weekends, but take out is about a 10 minute wait.
author: Harper C.

description: This is officially my favorite Thai restaurant in the Bay area.  The food is excellent.  I never appreciated Pad Thai till now.  The flavors are subtle, never overpowering.  I can't wait to try the other items on their menu.  btw, don't forget to bring quarters for the metered street parking.
author: Janice T.

description:
Okay, I think I'm ready to write my review for the BEST Thai restaurant in the city. You can drive by a billion times and never take notice of this gem on Irving.

Golden Triangles (Thai Samosas): Crispy on the outside, curried potato chunks on the inside. The absolute perfect few bites to wet your palette. These delicious triangles come with the perfect dipping sauce, too.

Pad Kee Mao with Pork: The pork LOOKS dry, but it really isn't. Perfect amount of spice for this delicate dish. I ate everything that was edible on this plate, including the garnish. Yeah, it was that delicious.

Tom Yum Soup with noodles: The best part about this dish is that they have this item on the special lunch menu and it's cheap and very pleasing. It's the perfect sourness. You can taste the lemongrass and all the other herbs that went into this soup.

Mango with Sticky Rice: OH. MY. GAHHHH. This is the best ending to a meal. They will never serve an under-ripe mango because each time I've ordered this dish, the mangoes have been sinfully sweet. The coldness of the fruit balances out the warm sticky rice topped with a coconut milk sauce. I can probably just have the coconut milk sauce by itself, it's so yummy. The sticky rice is perfectly made.

Service is great. Everyone is extremely helpful and nice. The restaurant is a bit small, but I've never had to wait for a table before. I have no idea how they do it. And I have no idea why they are never busy. But this place is definitely a place to try. DELICIOUS!
author: Maggie H.

description: Although Osha is my favourite Thai place in SF, Marnee came as a close second. Their food are always consistent and come with reasonable price. Once I came by just when they open at 11:30AM and the server were having lunch but was still friendly and serve really fast. I definitely recommend this place and also parking is such a breeze, esp at night, plenty of free street parking.
author: May N.

description:
Let me just start off by saying that I may not be the biggest fan of Thai food... but I'm pretty open minded.

Marnee Thai did not impress. Came here with my sister and brother-in-law, and so we ordered plenty of dishes to share around the table. Some things I can remember - Angel Wings, Spicy Duck, Green Papaya Salad, some sort of Curry.. there was more but the experience was so mediocre that I can't bother to remember.

I think overall the food was just too flavorful for me, even with a side of rice.

Also, the service here: you either love it, or you hate it.  I can't stand being called "honey", so I hated it.
author: Munnie T.

description: The food was good. I came for the "Angel Wings", those wings are addictive.  I ordered a few other dishes but was not impressed. Maybe I did not order the right things. I felt the service here was off. There were a few charges added to my bill that luckily I caught. I was told by a few locals that the 9th Ave location is the better restaurant. The parking is easier at this location.
author: Infodiva B.

description:
When I came to visit here, we had a green bean/beef dish, green curry, and pad thai.  Out of these three dishes, the green curry was the best tasting.

I will say that although it tasted good, none of them stood out...

till I had their pad see yu.  I loved it.

Would I come back when I visit SF?  I think so.
author: Andrew L.

description: After ordering and waiting 25 min, we discovered that the waitress forgot to put in our order. She implored us not to leave when we indicated politely that were very displeased. Food was good but nothing outstanding. The bill came without a discount of any
author: Christopher K.

description:
Attempting to go to my favorite restaurants in sunset, both were close on Wednesday... boo hoo.  So I saw Marnee Thai and it has four stars so I had to try it out.

I ordered Pad Kee Mao, it is consist of wide rice noodles pan fried with chili, garlic, tomato, and Thai basil on a bed of lettuce, with a choice of chicken beef or pork.  It smelled really good and I was happy to see a lot of chicken in the noodles.  The Thai basil was good and I think they could have added a bit more.  The noodles seem like it was too much gravy as I like it drier.

On the other hand also order Kang Ka Reed which is Thai yellow curry.  It has coconut milk, turmeric, fresh herbs and spices with Yukon potatoes.  The Curry sauce was really good, very flavorful and I could taste the herbs and spices.  The potatoes were really good and soft.  

Overall, I would like to try something else maybe considering the fried rice stuff.  The Kang Ka Ree is definitely really good and would order that again.  The service was good and refilled our waters when it was low.  The water is fusion lemon water.  You may see some lemon pulp in your cup and think that it's dirty, but it's not its lemon pulp.

**parking**

it is only available to park street and please feed meter to avoid a ticket =)
Cash or credit
author: Kenneth Y.

description: Loved this place until one day I went in to pickup my order and saw a cockroach crawling on the wall. I walked out. They did tell me that they sprayed the night before but I just can't stomach it. It's a shame cause the food was really good.
author: Mex B.

description: The BBQ chicken is good, ask for extra sauce, but beware of eating leftovers. Twice I brought home leftover curry, put it in the refrigerator immediately, and both times I got sick after I ate it.  For that, I'm giving this restaurant 3 stars, and maybe I won't go back.
author: E F.

description:
Marc A.- read his review
After B2B, Robert S., Shauna S., Marc A., and myself
Run to find food
Now we create a big ruckus 
Eating away the thai food
Enjoyed the company of the fellow yelpers I'd met!

Seriously, what do 4 crazy Yelpers do after a 12K? We create chaos and go to a highly reviewed restaurant. We stick giant Yelp stickers on our foreheads and demand for food! No, no... not all of that happened. But I don't think the servers cared what we were doing or who we were because they were just throwing down rice on our plates with a sense of rush. o.O

I always order pad thai at any thai restaurant.. haha It was ok here. I really liked Marc A.'s PUMPKIN CURRY!!! It just had a hint of sweetness!! Yum!!!
author: CeCe C.

description: I came in with a group of 4 on a Friday night and the place was packed! The restaurant was unusually small with tables packed right next to each other and parking was limited outside. We waited roughly 20 minutes but got seated right when a table cleared up. I didn't understand what was so popular about this Thai place but right when I tried the food, my expectations were definitely met. The food was delicious and very authentic! My friends and I shared the pad see yew, pad thai, yellow curry, and the spicy angel wings (everyone must try the wings!) Prices were average but overall, I was satisfied and there were no leftovers!
author: Tracy C.

description:
Walked in with my best friend before the whole dinner rush and had to wait five minutes to be seated since the cook and waiter has their backs to the door since they were eating. So it took then a while. The outside looks shady and the inside looks like I'm inside a straw hut/shack. 

The waitress wasn't that bad. Quick to get our orders but slightly mistook a coke for a Thai iced tea. 

I had order a Thai iced coffee and man I could barely taste the coffee since it was so sugary. For food, I had order my all time gavotte dish, Pad Thai. Now how can you go wrong with pad Thai...but man was I wrong. The pad Thai was way too sweet compared to what I have had in the past.

Would I come back here if I was craving Thai. Nah.
author: Maile W.

description:
We got here a little after the restaurant opened for lunch so we got seated really quickly. We had the Satay Wraps for an appetizer. It was like making your own chicken fajita but on a lettuce leaf and with Thai ingredients. We ordered the Pad Kee Mao. I thought the dish had the right amount of spiciness and I also liked flavor that the basil gave to the dish. We also had the roasted duck. The duck and spinach went well together and had a very good flavor. The duck was really moist and tender. We also ordered the Panang Beef. The curry sauce was very tasty but the beef was kind of on the tough side. I had a Thai ice tea. There wasn't really anything special about it.   

The interior decoration is really nice. The restaurant can get really packed. I think the tables are too close together. Service was pretty good.
author: Alexander L.

description:
Love when visitors come-get to explore the city and venture to many new spots in the city! 

An old friend and I ventured to 2225 Irving the other night for what was no doubt a tasty Thai experience! 

Stuffed our faces with Egg Rolls, Golden Triangles (highly recommend starting with BTW), Chan Pan Poo (crab with noodles) and the Pork Belly special. Everything tasted great and the service was amazing! 

See myself back there in the hear future!
author: Antonia L.

description:
Marnee Thai has gotten better with my 2nd visit here. Today, girlfriend and I came here for lunch at around 1pm. It must have been our lucky day because we immediately found parking on irving despite the fact that it is always packed to the brim on weekends. 

To sum up this update: quick seating, service with a smile to our every request, and EVEN BETTER beef pad see ew than previous visits. I would say that this is the best pad see ew in the bay bar none. The flavor is unbeatable. Unlike most places where each ingredient of an entree tastes exactly the same, the pad see ew here has a distinct flavor to each and every ingredient, allowing for every bite to be as refreshing as the next, from the egg to the beef to the noodles. Quite frankly, it is fantastic.

 The chicken pad thai that my girlfriend ordered was also good, and deserving of rave reviews, though I am not as big of a fan as she is when it comes to this entree. Coffee was good, and not over priced, only $1.00. 

Pad see ew was ~9$, pad thai was around 8$, and the coffee was 1$.

Marnee Thai is a great place to eat. they also do take out. a definite must try for fans of great service and good food. 5 stars.
author: simon k.

description: Was not a fan of their yellow curry or service. Both very poor. Will not be coming back.  Not sure why this place is rated so high.
author: Hanna R.

description:
First things first. I know almost nothing about Thai food. Not really my field of expertise. But a coworker who lives up the street loves this place, and he took me to lunch.

I had a pad-thai noodle thing, and it was great. Good flavors, good ingredients. And he ordered us 2 iced tea type drinks, they were delicious. 

The prices seemed really reasonable, the staff was nice, and the decor really hit it (check out the indoor "roof", makes you feel like you're IN Thailand!)

5 for 5!
author: Michael D.

description: Extremely rude! I went to pick up an order of noodles and the lady yelled at me to go to the hallway! No i will not go to the hallway! She talked to me as if i was some pet!
author: Katelyn L.

description:
I had the pleasure of being taken to Marnee's for some Thai Food. It happens to be one of my bf's favorite Thai spots in SF and didn't disappoint. We enjoyed two specials of the day--pork meatballs on sticks, a thai lettuce wrap dish and the main entree was roasted duck on top of a bed of spinach. The food was great and the service was fantastic as well. 
Gotta love great food and good atmosphere!
author: Lynn C.

description:
Marnee thai is my choice for thai food in SF.  The corn cakes are amazing.  And so is everything else.  I have tried Pad See Ew and Drunken Man Noodles with Tofu, all perfect.

If you're ever in the Sunset, go to....no.  Let me rephrase that.  GO to the Sunset to try Marnee Thai.
author: Raman S.

description: Love the setting of this place. We went in the middle of the day on sunday so it wasn't very crowded. Loved their red curry and pad thai. The thai iced tea was nothing special, probably wouldn't order it again. Angel wings were really good too! Would come back here if I'm in the mood for good thai food! Place is a little small though so I wouldn't bring groups larger then 5.
author: Ayesha P.

description:
This has to be my most favorite thai place in the bay area. The other favorite being in NY, but Marnee Thai definitely is a goodie. 

I've tried several different dishes and I can't say I've been disappointed by any of them. All I really have to say is - YUMMY IN MY TUMMY!
author: Jeanette Y.

description:
When I first walked in I immediately said, "I've been here before." Of course, when we were deciding where to eat for lunch, I hadn't recognized the place but I did remember that decor. And so I'm still happy to report that they still remain at four stars, even though it has been 3 years.

We decided to keep it simple since my BF hasn't been there before. The Thai potstickers had a delicious taste to them (thanks to the sauce they were in) -- I couldn't quite place what it was, but it had a hint of lemongrass. We ordered the pad se-ew and the pumpkin curry, both were delicious with a perfect level of spiciness to it. I had the Thai iced coffee and it was just so good, a great complement to the dish (but let's be real, coffee is complementary to everything).
author: Shauna S.

description: BEST THAI IN SF. I've been here so many times and every time it never dissapoints!! The spicy angel wings (appetizer) are the best wings I've ever had. They're spicy but not too spicy and have so much garlic (but in a tasteful way)!! Every dish I've had there is amazing. The owner is a sweet lady that makes you feel welcomed. GO THERE! and try the angel wings...you won't be dissapointed!
author: Allison V.

description: I like their pumpkin curry...yum...chicken wings used to be better..but the sauce is always great
author: Sandra S.

description:
The food here is delicious, but service was bleh.

I got the Chan Pad Poo, which was a dish very similar to the Pad Thai but with crab meat and egg. It was delicious and they gave me such a big plate! I was only able to finish half of it. The angel wings were very delicious, I love the spicy sauce.

Service for our table started out well. The waiter was very polite and apologized for the long wait. But later, we had a waitress with short hair that came out with our food. She handed a plate of food to my friend, but my friend said that it wasn't his but was our friend on the other end of the table. The waitress frowned at him and said "JUST HOLD IT" and so he did and she walked off. 

Now for something that did not directly affected us, but we thought was extremely rude(I am not basing my rating on this). The same short hair waitress reserved a table for 6 guests, I guess the guests did not count their little baby as a guest so there was not enough room. The guest already put their baby in the booster chair, and where trying to find a way to fit everyone at the table. But I guess the guests realized it was not possible and were going to leave. The waitress then GRABS the baby and handed it to the parent. My friends and I just watched in shock.... Okay. The End.

Food is great. Hopefully you won't get the same waitress that I got.
author: Alicia W.

description:
Miang kum - must try! I went with my sister who ordered everything (she's the local plus she's the reason I was exposed to so many culinary delights as a poor student!). When a plate of green leaves arrived and what looked like a sprinkling of toppings (peanuts, lime, dried shrimp, ginger, onion and toasted) I thought, "where's the rest??!!"

The server was super nice and put everything together for me after being told it was my first time. 

He also said it was his favorite dish.

I totally know why now!

One bite appetizer packed full of flavor!! never had a Thai restaurant experience like this. Will definitely be missing this when I go back home.
author: Po On Y.

description:
I usually try the pad thai when I go to a Thai restaurant I have never been to before, just to compare. But this time, I had a take-out order to split with my sister and she ordered chicken pad see ew. Initially, it looks like a Chinese chow fun dish that is usually way cheaper! But then I eat half of it and am really craving some more!

The chicken pad see ew is somewhat sweeter than the chow fun that I always get, and way less oily. The chicken was cooked just right, tender and not dry. The noodles were nice and not all stuck together. It was just great tasting food and I definitely enjoyed it.
author: Wilson T.

description:
excellent food - 3 delicious meals with appetizers - all expertly prepared.

wish i could have eaten it somewhere else!

next time - take out

Hostesses/waiters screaming in your ear, crowds packed in bumping and shoving all around - really unpleasant - couldn't wait to get out!

But the food?  Fantastic
author: C S.

description: Crab fried rice is delicious. I thought their pad thai was just standard. The seating inside is a bit cramped so I usually order to go. The service is pretty good especially for how understaffed during peak hours they seem to be, but all in all the food is of quality.
author: Marvin R.

description: If I could, 1/4 stars. The service was terrible, the lady demanded tip, I never received my fork and the portions were so small, my stomach caved in. Never return here and they seriously could use an attitude change. They even made someone who ordered to go wait 30 minutes.
author: Michael T.

description:
I came here with my sorority big sis for lunch. I was pleasantly surprised at the ambience when I walked into the restaurant. Nicely decorated. Reminded me of Thailand (I've really only seen pictures from my brother & sister-in-law's honeymoon). They really put time in designing the restaurant, which I think is really cool. Cozy little hole in the wall place. 

We ordered the Chicken Yellow Curry which was absolutely delish! We also got the Pad Thai with Chicken which was yummy as well :) Happy stomachs, haha! 

Service was good. Friendly staff.

Luckily, we found metered parking in front. There's metered parking on Irving. During "rush hours," you have to get lucky to find parking. There's also residential parking on the perpendicular streets, but usually they're already taken. Go figure, haha. 

Definitely would recommend Marnee Thai. A definite good change from the usual King of Thai.
author: Jessica A.

description:
I love this place for its romantic ambiance and decor.This is my favorite Thai restaurant in SF. There's always a long waiting though. The place is small and always busy.

No doubt the food is delish, Thai being my favorite cuisine for a year now!!! For me the current obsession has been the duck fried rice or Panang curry. 

A special mention to the owner of this place. The lady's funny !! She makes funny conversations with her customers :) All smiles n no hard feelings.

The only complain i have is that this place closes too early by 10 :( So not convenient for nocturnals like us as every time have to end up in Chabaa thai , the place next to this, which remains open till 11!! 

I recommend all to go to the Outer sunset restaurant compared to its Inner Sunset sister place, as here one can enjoy the charming interior along with good food!
author: Payal B.

description:
Marnee Thai never ever fails me! I love their Chan Pad Poo (noodles with a chili pasted, crab, tomato and egg), Pad Kee Mao (I like it with duck), their Satay, Fish Cake, Angel Wings.... everything!

If you've never had silver noodle salad, I high reccommend that as well (get it with prawns!)

Marne Thai is the best Thai/Siamese food in the city and it is truly a hidden gem on the bustling Irving St!
author: Tiffany U.

description: The food was fantastic and our meal was made even more memorable by the elderly hostess (owner?) who came to our table several times to make predictions about our future success, relationships, and happiness! Go with buddies and order the angel wings, you won't be disappointed.
author: Molly J.

description: We ordered take out and it was excellent.  Great for kids and adults.   We ordered pad shrimp pad thai,  tofu pad see ew, pork pumpkin yellow curry (still a little too spicy for my kids).  I really like the curry because there was a lot of pork in it that was thinly sliced and tender.  At most other thai places, I think they skimp on meat and its usually very dry.  We also ordered chan pad poo (crab noodles still too spicy for my kids)  Its vinegary and has jalapeños in it.  It was very similar to pad thai so I would not order this dish again if I was already ordering pad thai.  Pad kaprow (ground chicken) was everyones favorite, angel wings (too spicy for my kids), and papaya salad.  Very good assortment and portions.
author: Jamie W.

description: We called in a reservation, though I'm not sure they ever get written down. The place is just too chaotic for that. For the Friday after Christmas, it was packed beyond imagination. People were spilling onto the street, camping three (or more) at tiny two top tables, it was loud and totally CRAZY and it was INCREDIBLE!!!!!!! It was a total scene and, if you don't like that, don't go. At least not on a busy night. Mae is a true force of nature. She owns and runs Marnee Thai as her home, shouting orders to the kitchen, from across the room, she goes to every table to check on you and tell you what to order and, in our case, gave hairdo advice to one of our group, telling her to "take down her hair, like mine and you look even prettier!!!". Then there's the food which is totally ridiculous. Our party of 4 was all vegan and almost everything on the huge menu was available to us. Friends had said this was the best Thai in SF and we agree. It's also the most FUN Thai restaurant ever!!!! Can't wait to go again.
author: Michael N.

description: This place is jumping off on Sunday afternoon (4ish) the food is great. Pineapple fried rice is off the HOOK! For the $ IT A GREAT lil gem in the Sunset
author: Mario S.

description:
Coming here, you really get the feel that you're going to leave having experienced a a meal that's a little more authentic than at other restaurants.  I don't know if its the food or just the vibe...or the plants and hut like paneling on the walls...you just KNOW it's gonna be authentic.  Yeah, I don't know...but it's SOMETHING.

Every good restaurant has a signature dish they become known for, and the Angel Wings here is that very dish.  Like they were ripped off the back of a real angel, these fried little suckers with their chili sauce can almost give San Tung's wings a run for the money...almost.  Just as good is their Chan Pad Poo dish...where half of the dish's appeal is just saying the name while ordering (how mature am I?).

I just hope I don't burn for the wings off an angel's back comment...I was only kidding!
author: Mike L.

description:
Came here with a friend, she said it was good, but i was skeptical because right when we got there, the lady at the door was kind of rude (owner). But when we seated, the lady was pretty nice afterwards, kind of weird, but it was okay, it was because it was busy. 
We ordered those mini pancakes (which were good), the mango salad and another dish (i forgot the name). All 3 dishes were so good, i was surprised, probably one of the best places to eat Thai food. I will be back for sure, but kind of scared that i might get yelled at by the owner :(. 
I would give this place 5 stars but the owner made me subtract one.
author: Q W.

description: The food is great with lots of vegetarian options! Next time I will go on a weeknight. It has to be better than the 45 minute wait for a table for two on a Saturday around 2pm.
author: Maria H.

description: I am new to the area, so I am in food heaven with all my exploring. We found Marnee Thai on Yelp, and we were not disappointed. The customer service could have been MUCH better, but with food like that.. Who cares. For apps we ordered angel wings, avocado salad with prawns, and chicken satay. AMAZING! For our entrees we had tom yum soup with prawns, curry chicken and banana curry with duck. Everything was delish. I only wish there was more rice for all that yummy curry! I was stuffed, but everyone wanted dessert, so we went with fried banana with honey, mango and sticky rice, and roti with coconut ice cream. The roti took a little long to come out, but everything was amazing as we expected. I am really excited to try this place again!!
author: Marlene J.

description: What can I say? Sawadee?  That's all I know, but when it comes to Marnee Thai, it's all soo yummy. Don't come in too hungry because you will over order and before you know it, your table will be full of so much good food. It was raining and cold out, so we started out with Tom Ka and it was a perfect starter. We enjoyed the Pad Kee Mao with off the menu suggestion of asparagus with pork. It was oh so delicious. I had the Thai tea with my meal, and I have to say i still want to have some for home. Still on the search for Thai tea. Maybe i will just have to go back.
author: john k.

description:
Marnee Thai is quite magical. Firstly, if you're staring at this restaurant from the outside, you would never expect the inside restaurant to be a full blown hut. Stepping into this restaurant is like stepping into a whole different country. Not only is the entire restaurant a bamboo hut, but also the servers are dressed in traditional Thai clothing while mysterious Thai music is being played from secretly hidden speakers. Secondly, the rice is served in this mysterious metal container. And well the first thing that came to mind when that mysterious container was placed on my table was definitely Indiana Jones.

My expectation:
http://www.grrl.com/eyeballsoup.jpg
http://images.wikia.com/indianajones/images/b/b4/EyeballSoup.jpg

The reality:
http://beverlys.net/photos/2007/BlueMountains/Day1/SaiBoa4.jpg

Sneaky. Sneaky. Marnee Thai really had me fooled with that mysterious metal rice container. Anyway aside from that, the food here is delicious. You've definitely got to try their Panang Beef and Kang Ka Ree.
author: Ally C.

description:
Went here on a date with my sweetie about 1-2 weeks ago...  The waiting area is pretty much the doorway...  this can be problematic if there are already a lot of people waiting or you are in a large group.  The first thing I noticed aside from the lovely orchids in front, was the way the interior was decorated.  The wall and the ceiling are lined with bamboo.  Instantly you feel like you've been transported to some quaint but busy tropical area.  It's kinda neat...

We ordered the papaya salad and I think it was spicy.  I didn't care for it too much.  Also we ordered what I think was Pad Ma Kuer with pork and that was too spicy for me and smelled weird.

The green curry was ok from what i remember but nothing spectacular.  The owner lady is super nice but she was taking a bunch of photos with staff while there were still a lot of customers around which I thought kind of odd but whatever.

She is funny too.  When my date went to use the restroom, she told me he was a "hard worker."  At first I thought maybe she knew him but she said she could "read people."  LOL.  Nice lady.
author: Hello.kitty.kat S.

description:
Oh how I love Thai food and Marnee Thai is no exception. Their Pad Thai is my favorite ever! Add some shrimp and I'm in heaven. The vegetarian samosas are so crispy on the outside and soft and wonderful on the inside. It's surprising that their curries aren't so greasy. I re-heated my leftovers this afternoon for lunch and there wasn't that usual gross separation. It was almost better today then when I ate there! 

The restaurant is tiny but the service staff is VERY friendly and quick. Don't come starving in case there's a bit of wait - but it's oh so worth it!
author: Erin L.

description:
We had a reservation on a Friday evening. When we arrived we had to wait a half an hour before sitting down. WHich was OK I suppose as we got to peruse and think about the menu and read all the accolades and awards  on the wall. This location is run by a matron named May, she is a bit of a psychic and will gladly analyze your tendencies, strong  vibes and so on. She is very nice and entertaining, assuming you like that sort of thing. She runs the joint with a loud voice and persuasive service.
Service was attentive but not great. 

We did order a lot of items for a group of five.

Appetizers:
We started with the Spicy Angel Wings which was one of the best dishes we had there.
Green Mango Salad with Soft Shell Crab - which was a really good &  interesting evening specialty.
Tom Kha ( SOUP) hot and sour with coconut - Good and traditional.
Classic  dried shrimp , peanuts , sauce, onion, limes  etc  all wrapped in spinach leaves- Presentation was weak taste was very good-

Entrees:
Pad Thai - I place a  expectational  on this dish for Thai food- if you do not do this one really well you will have a tough time convincing me on any other item, and this did not cut it.

It was Just okay,  nothing special.  No limes, I have seen too many places cutting corners on the limes for this dish. I think it is essential. We ordered two (one shrimp, one chicken) The shrimp came first, but before the chicken came...
The waiter mixed up our order for lamb and gave us another table's order instead of ours ( noodles w/ Duck) . When we brought it up, they just said they would just not give us the chicken pad thai to cancel the mess-up out. That was not fair because now we didn't get our lamb dish OR our pad Thai dish.  We ended up having to order our original dish again.
But the duck dish we received was tasty! what ever it was.

Praram Phak - A peanut curry dish - the curry was too thin, and the vegetables were lacking in flavor.
Pumpkin Curry - The curry was too thin, and the dish was overall bland.
for a Thai place they need ramp up the flavor on the curries.

Panang Beef; It had the cumin & the flavors were there.

Dessert:
Fried Banana and Ice Cream - good but not melting in your mouth great like I have had at other Thai restaurants.

At the end of the night, they charged us for 2 more beers and 3 more ice teas than we actually ordered. When we pointed this out to them, they revised the check, but the revised check still had 1 ice tea and 1 beer more than we ordered. They got it right on the third try (originally the check was $166, and that was lowered to $140 when we got the correct check).For 5 the price is fine, especially with beer-.

We have visited many Thai places, and love Thai food, but this one was a real disappointment in terms of food and messy in terms of service. You have to say good but not great,
We even saw this reviewed on Channel 9's  "Check Please!"
There is better Thai out there in S.F. I see on YELP this place  is overwhelmingly popular , but I do not agree.
I'd try Thep Phanom for food ,  Khan Toke for ambiance.
I guess we'll have to give them another chance on a weekday or something , but it won't be for a while.
author: Aaron Z.

description:
One of my first Thai spots to try out since my transplant to the Bay a few months ago. I was interested with my friend's pick as she said this is her favorite Thai spot. I wasn't sure how her Thai preferences were, so I just went with the flow. Checking out the Yelp reviews, it was pretty decent so I was excited.
We were driving and were able to find parking in front. 
The decor of the place is pretty cute. It's as if you're inside a straw hut. What a great touch and lends into the whole dining experience. It's a small space, but has pretty good turn over of patrons. You can't help but be hungry from the smell of the food cooking in the kitchen. As my stomach grumbled, I peeked around at other tables and everything looked yummy. The service was also pretty nice. 
On to the food! We decided to go family style and order a bunch of dishes.To start off, the angel wings that was highly recommended. Can't skip on them 'cuase they're succulent! Then we shared a big bowl of chicken Tom Ka which had a nice lingering spice to it. Not the best I've had, but it was pretty good for starters. The table also ordered beef Pad see ewe, the sauteed prawns and chicken curry. Everything was good. I wouldn't say spectacular, but maybe I'll have to try more dishes. It's a hike to come all the way out here from my place, but its a good place to eat with a group of people. Prices were not bad and portions were great for sharing.
author: Dee D.

description:
Went back...2 years later.  The chan pad poo was delicious (crab with noodles, egg and green onion).  The mango sticky rice was great too.

We decided to order the panang curry with beef...or what I thought was curry, but was more like stewed beef and no curry.  Not really a fan of that.  

The lady with the short hair took our orders and was pretty pushy about appetizers and dessert.  I mean, it's cool if she asked once, but she repeatedly kept interrupting me while I gave my food orders to ask about appetizer (and then later, dessert even though I had already ordered it in the beginning!).  No means no!!!!!  Sigh.
author: Cheryl L.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised by Marnee Thai. I'd heard from a few people that it was overrated while some people highly recommended it...so of course, I wasn't sure exactly what to expect. 

We ordered standard Pad Thai, but also their specialty curry potstickers and a tofu stir-fry sorta deal and everything was really tasty! We also ordered the coconut yam? I think? Appetizer...the waitress told us it was a traditional kind of street food in Thailand and it was really tasty! 

The only kinda negative thing I have to say is the restaurant is pretty tiny and our table was incredibly cramped. Other than that, I would definitely consider coming back!
author: Alison N.

description:
My BFF lives in the Outer Sunset, so Marnee Thai is near her digs. She likes Thai food, so naturally, if I'm in the city and she feels like Thai, this is were we inevitably end up. 

Food at Marnee is really good, but Thai food doesn't seem to agree with my stomach. I love how it tastes but I always get stomach aches after eating it. I'm not sure if it's the coconut milk or the oil.
author: Amy D.

description:
Dear Marnee Thai,

After a handful of pleasant experiences prior to this year, I must admit I was thoroughly disappointed yesterday.

Smaller entrees + unjustified higher prices + painfully unattentive staff = no reason to return here.

Here's the low down:  Our empty dishes sat for almost half hour and our water glasses saw the bottom as we patiently waited for someone to take note.  We were a table of 3 and the restaurant was nearly empty (2 other tables of 2).  Staff (4 servers visible) were at most points sitting enjoying their overflowing plates while we were surprised how small each entree we ordered was.  OK, simple math - 7 people dining, 4 employees... bad service shouldn't even be an issue but it was.  After the soup, 3 entrees and tiny portion of mango rice, we ordered more.  We came there to eat, enjoy and feel satisfied.  We ate, we didn't enjoy and we weren't exactly satisfied.

No owner or manager was present (yes I discreetly asked) and when I mentioned to our waited that it was my Mother's birthday dinner and I actually chose to dine there out of several other fantastic options, my disappointment was met with confused looks shot over from the other waitress listening to our hallway conversation.  Suddenly we had water and the service became almost annoyingly overbearing for the last 5 minutes.  They obviously were trying hard but we felt like it was a little too late. You guys should consider that everyone who walks in your door is money. This thing called customer service: it starts from the first moment, not the last.

1 star because it's obligatory and 1/2 extra star for them trying to redeem their aloofness with a birthday song and gong for Mom.  

Rounded up to a 2 star experience though you're off my list because dropping over $70 (*without any drinks, mind you) on Thai food wasn't worth it here. I like to spend my money and not feel roped.

Go elsewhere folks. Think Osha * Khan toke * Yukol on Lombard
author: Athena S.

description:
Highly recommend this place!!! We had the 
spicy wings- finger licking good!
Spicy Beef Salad- Tasty and beef tasted very soft and flavorful
Pad Kee?- Flat rice noodles with chili and thai basil and tomatoes- good
For dessert we ordered the ROTI with icecream- OMG!!!  THE BOMB!

Service- Very attentive and super friendly and funny.  Also all the food didnt all come out at once like most Asian restaurants.
author: Jangalina J.

description: Incredible Thai Food! I recommend that you get the Pad Kee Mow (Spicy Basil Pad Thai) and the Tom Kha (Coconut & Lemongrass Soup). You're going to love this Place!
author: Avery J.

description:
The review is not for the food but for the service. 

This place gets a good amount of footfall everyday and i understand that they have to service tables quite fast and turnaround. But there is a point were it seems that the waiters are so busy that they cant wait to explain to customer about the dish. 

When asked 3 times to a waiter what is the difference between number one pad dish and other and what kind of sauces would be used in which of them , the only answer i get is  "It is different".."what more can i get for you ?"....and again asking the same and again the same answer...and again .......Of course it is different that why there are two dishes on menu. 

the food was on decent side.
author: Y U.

description:
Top Thai place in San Francisco! I have been to both location and they are both very good. The location on Irving is pretty interesting with a bamboo roof. 

Food:
Angel Wings- Amazing!
Scallop and Shrimp egg curry- Delicious
Duck Fried Rice- SOOOOO GOOD
author: Elliot T.

description:
Pretty delicious. The owner is a little loud, but provides all the entertainment in the world. She will tell you to order two of everything you order if you have a large party, even though you don't want two of everything. She will also yell your order back to the kitchen staff, and suggest which kind of meat you want, even if you already chose your desired meet. It's  tasty, decently priced, open a little later than other restaurants, and makes for an easy night out. 

+ tasty
+ portions
+ quaint
author: Tammy T.

description:
We were actually on our way to PPQ (Pho on 19th/Irving) last night and it was suuuuper busy as usual so instead we took a stroll down  to Marnee Thai.  We made a good decision.  

I love Thai food to begin with but its hard to find one with great food and great service.  I loved our waitress.  She made sure we didn't have too much meat, too much rice and made sure we ate our vegetables! LOL  Thanks again for recommending the morning glory with our meal. 

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.  If you're bringing a big group, I would probably call in advance because you will be rubbing elbows with other people because of the coziness of this place BUT that just makes this place extra special.  I hate so many people getting introduced to others last night and people networking while they dined.

We had the Tom Yum soup, Chicken Pad Thai, Morning glory vegetables with pork cutlets and some other stuff Roy ordered which i forgot but was OMG good!  I want to go again.
author: Myke Y.

description:
This place has been here for years!! But over the years the quality and inconstancy has made food just mediocre.  Is it because they opened another sister location? 

I ordered for lunch:
Pad kra pow
Pad Thai
pad sew w/ seafood
And some kind of coconut rice cakes.  

My co workers and I usually kill our lunch.  But today we only ate 20% of it.  That says a lot.  I think king if Thai would have been better and I don't even like them....
author: hannah t.

description:
My go to Thai place, I frequent this location at least once a month to satisfy K's cravings of course.  It is my go-to Thai food that isn't in the TL/Civic Center.  Easy parking, great location but small place.  They split up the folks from the Sunset with their 9th Ave location and this location.  I've been to both but I prefer this one.  The place is very small, they try to squeeze as many tables as they can into the place and that can make for some close quarters when trying to eat some nights but the food is worth it!

We always basically get the same thing when we come here.  K loves Garlic pork, with basil and tons of garlic flavor, the pork is usually tender but its really for that burst of flavor.  Great Thai taste.  I usually go between the Pad See Ew, a Thai classic and their Chan Pad Poo which is rice noodles with crab meat, mmmm, just a lil spice.  I feel like no matter what you get here, the food will be awesome.  I know its a place for many regulars and their takeout business is huge! so they must be doing something right.

You have to deal with hit and miss service sometimes but for their prices and their food, its worth the service as well as the tight quarters.  

Marnee Thai has had my business consistently for the past year and will continue to get it for years to come.
author: Brian C.

description:
Many, many moons ago, I frequented Marnee Thai on at least a bi-weekly basis and remember loving it. But, apparently, as with my love for the boy that I went to Marnee Thai with went away, so has my love for their food. . . 

After a super long hiatus of grubbing on what I had previously thought was one of the most awesome Thai places in town, I returned for a casual meal with 2 friends and my new beau (ok not so new, but new relative to the boy I no longer love).  Sadly, the quality of the food has gone down hill, and now they're just a mediocre Thai place that's just as good as, but no better than the King of Thai restaurants. 

The angel wings, once the highlight of my meal, are no longer smothered in the oh-so-delicious sauce. Sure it's tossed in the sauce, but it's nothing like before, when there was so much sauce that any holes between the succulent wings were covered.  Now there's not enough sauce, and they're just plain old wings. 

The Pad Kee Mao was also a disappointment. It was overly sweet. Where's the spice? Where's the kick? Marnee Thai is still a Thai place afterall, right? 

Then there was the bland bland Thai Fried Rice. Again, no spice, no kick :( The only tasty thing was the pineapples, which I'm sure came from a can. 

Sigh . . . I'll mourn the loss of Marnee Thai longer than I did the lost love for that boy, who I really didn't love that much, but that's besides the point. 

I guess, the positive point to end of was that their Roti with Coconut Ice Cream is still superb. Soft, crunchy, not chewy roti drizzled in condensed milk served with a creamy scoop of coconut ice cream. I usually skip dessert, but I can't pass up this goodness. They still get 5 stars for that dessert, everything else I could do without.
author: Christina L.

description:
I went to Marnee Thai while visiting San Francisco this past Sunday evening with my boyfriend. We were meeting my sister and her family, but we got there early and held a table while we waited. We were lucky to get there when we did (at 6PM) because we only had to wait for about 3 minutes to be seated; shortly thereafter, there was a line out the door!

We sat down and ordered appetizers while we waited. We had the chicken satay wraps and the summer rolls. The summer rolls were delicious, but they had more rice noodle in them that I would have liked (usually I like more vegetable); however, they were fresh and tasty overall. The satay was great--it was unique in that they were wraps (served with big leaves of butter lettuce, bean sprouts and cold rice noodles), which made it fun!

When my sister arrived, it turned out that she had brought more people than expected, so we had to change tables in this very crowded restaurant. The head waitress accommodated us, but not without letting us know what an inconvenience it was. She was a bit abrasive, but had complete control over the situation, which we appreciated.

When the waitress took our order, it was a bit chaotic (to say the least). We had some questions, but she didn't give us time to ask them; instead, we were rushed through and some of us were even passed over as she skipped immediately to the table next to us. It was pretty odd, and left us dazed and confused.

For additional appetizers, our group shared the coconut hot cakes, which had been recommended to us by a friend of my sister's. They looked like deviled eggs and came hot off the griddle, topped with some corn kernels, ham, and some sauce. They were pretty tasty, but nothing to write home about.

While we were waiting for our entrees (and the line outside was growing longer), we saw May (Marnee) enter the restaurant and take complete control. She walked from table to table like she owned the place, and indeed! She does! Quite a presence.

Our food arrived in a completely arbitrary order--obviously they just brought it out as it was ready. There was no room on the table for all the dishes, and we were already squeezed so tight into our table that it was not that pleasant. Meanwhile, Marnee was taking orders and yelling to her staff across the room. Again, we were a bit bewildered!

The food itself was okay. I had the chicken larb gai salad, which I almost always order when I go to Thai restaurants, and it was not the best I've had. The mint/cilantro/lime flavors were delicious, but the ground chicken meat was not the best quality. My beau had the pad see ew, which he says was uninspired. The other members of our party seemed to enjoy their roast duck and sea bass, but I didn't get a good description from them because the atmosphere was not at all conducive to conversation.

We were stuffed and ready to go (in fact, one of our waitresses was bringing us the bill), when Marnee/May alit on our table like hawk. She told us that her roti dessert was amazing, and insisted that we order it. In fact, it was impossible to refuse; what a businesswoman! The dessert was just fried dough with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. I didn't care for it and it tasted like oil, but the 12 year old in our group scarfed it down.

Finally, we squeezed our way out of our tight table configuration. Obviously the place is popular, because it was brimming with enthusiastic diners, but I'm not sure what all the fuss is about. Perhaps if it had been less chaotic it would have been a more pleasant experience, but this was a bit much. We were afraid to ask questions and felt forced to order a dessert that we didn't want, and unable to order the things we did want. However, if you do go, make sure to either make a reservation or go a bit early.

(Also, the bathroom was absolutely disgusting; the floor and the toilet seat wwere completely wet, and I don't really want to know what they were wet from, and the garbage can was overflowing with paper towels. So beware.)
author: Kate S.

description: I honestly never get tired of Marnee Thai. This is a solid Thai place. Try the Angel Tofu, pumpkin curry, and basic noodle/rice dishes. It's all good. I wasn't a big fan of pumpkin curry before, but Marnee makes it taste so good. Their pad thai or pad see ew are great basic dishes to try as well.
author: Joanne K.

description:
Had a pretty good experience here. This place is tiny and home-y. The servers come to you very little and let you be. 
I've had a lot of Thai food lately and it's hard to say which is best but the pad thai is pretty amazing here. I got it with shrimps but next time I will get it with chicken.
author: T L.

description: Angel wings is so delicious and tasty that we ordered 3 portions. We ordered pad siew with beef, sea bass with coconut,pad nor mai,green curry pork,tom yam soup with seafood. Pad siew is great too. We paid 120 excluding tips for party of 6.
author: Elvi W.

description:
I just went to this place with a few friends last night. It has to be one of the best Thai restaurants in the city, hands down. I ordered the prawn and scallop from Chef's suggestion and I was very happy. Other main entries my friends ordered were also very tasty. For the appetizer, you just have to try the spicy angel wing. It is comparable to angel wings in Shun Tong Restaurant and are among the best in Bay Area. 

In addition to the food, the service were really good. The big mama waitress were very conversational and gave us some good recommendations. All in all, this is the kind of place I will repeat over and over again as well as they hold the same level of food quality and customer service. 

You cannot say you have
author: Jun W.

description: I haven't lived in San Francisco since 2001 and I still miss Marnee's Miang Kum like you wouldn't believe.
author: Lisa H.

description: Place reeked of dog. Like there was literally a heavy stench  of dog. I'm allergic to dogs, 3 minutes in I can feel my allergies kicking in, why is there a heavy stench of dog here when theres no dog? Ridiculous.
author: Dean S.

description:
Three of us went to Marnee on Irving last night. Well, that was a wrong night to eat in the avenues. It was a hot evening and people just poured out from GG park after watching a band.

Let's start with positive notes. 
* The wait was about 30 mn even though there was a long line. Luckily, we came early. The hostess tried very hard to sit everyone. There was a couple who had a reservation. They were going to walk away but the hostess talked them into staying. 
* Nice gesture: My sister just had a surgery, They brought out a chair for her to sit.
* The drinks and the food came pretty quickly. 
* Service was fine considering the chaos. 
* The hostess came to our table and took our order within a few mn.  I did not have a chance to study the menu so I felt a bit rushed.
* She made some recommendations to help us out.

Negative notes. 
* Even though people had reservations, those who were there before us and did not have reservations got seated before us. 
* If you want a quiet dinner, don't go to Marnee whether the one on Irving or on 9th as they are always busy.
* They forgot one of our appetizers
* I returned my plate as it was not quite clean. Never got a replacement.
* My husband did not get a napkin. They brought paper napkin when we asked for one.
* The place was so small, after people sat around us, there was no space for the waiters or waitresses to pass through so a few things got passed over to us over people. 
* We are Asian. We eat out almost every weekend. We have been to many Thai restaurants from SF to the Peninsula which is where we live. I remember enjoying the food at Marnee on 9th more than last night. I don't think I had anything last night that I would come back for. That's why I gave a two stars meaning exactly what it says "Meh, I've experienced better."

I am glad they are busy. When we left, there was a line of people waiting. They are accommodating and working very hard. That was definitely quite a night for us.
author: Nga C.

description:
Good ol' Marnee Thai.  One of my favorite places to eat in SF.  I'll remember this place for three good reasons:  1) being just a block away from where I lived, you could smell the fantastic aroma of basil, chilies and garlic as soon as you stepped outside. 2) shoving Defense Secretary Leon Panetta away from the door after four repeated "excuse me" (the guy is a jerk and I didn't care who he was!). 3) most important, consistently serving up some of the finest Thai dishes I've ever had.  Chef Chai's cooking is Da Bomb!  

If you don't mind the owner...I think her name is May - yelling at the workers, telling you what to order and trying to read your palm, then you're good.  BTW, she told me that I'd have many lovers and be married multiple times.  Gulp!  Anyway, my favorites there:

Spicy chicken w. Thai basil
Yen ta four soup
Po tak soup
Roasted duck noodles
Kao rad kang w. pork
Pad thai -- best in SF!
Imperial rolls
Kang keaw w. pork
Basa fish w. mushroom and Thai herbs
Mango w. sticky rice
Pad prig khing w. pork
Beef satay
Tod mun -- excellent!
Beef salad
Kang ka ree w. chicken

Yum!  Yes, I dealt with the long lines to eat at this place quite often.  The prices for the quality of the dishes were very reasonable and I always felt the service there was good although I'm aware they've often received mixed reviews.  And there are a couple of dishes I think were a tad better at other places - Osha Thai and Thep Phenam come to mind.  But I still think the overall quality of the food here is the best.  

Most of the locals have tried this place.  I think it will be a wonderful discovery and pleasant experience for visitors!  Just be sure not to let May tell you what to order unless you ask.  And don't let her read your palm.  You might not want to know what she has to tell you. :)
author: Andrew K.

description: My pad kee mao was just not fried enough and ended up being a little mushy. the flavor was there but the texture was off. I still plan on returning though to try some of the other things tho, both because it's close and i've been told it's really good.
author: Misha T.

description:
They have two branches. Go to the one where Mrs. Marnee works.
Obviously the restaurant is named after her. 

Marnee is a jolly character. It is fun to talk to her. She claims she also reads faces. She talks about her life in the US, etc. 

We went there after watching the restaurant being reviewed on KQED's Check Please Bay Area. The one item that stood out from the review on CPBA was the:
"Homemade Hotcakes (seasonal/9th Avenue location only) *     $7.95
Grilled rice coconut cakes served fresh off the griddle topped with coconut cream, fresh corn, green onions and pumpkin" 

While it says "9th Ave" only - that is not true. I went to the Irving Street location and did get it there. 

But they do run out of it on occasions. One time I went there, they had run out of it. So I had to make a second trip there. And boy was it worth the trip!!

Other dishes (entrees) were good too, but make a trip to Marnee for two things:
Meet Mrs Marnee and have the homemade hotcakes! 

Totally unique dish - havent seen being served at any other thai restaurant. It is neither too sweet nor spicy. Can be had as an appetizer or as a light dessert. The combination of rice, coconut, corn, onions and pumpkin is a delicious result!
author: Aniket D.

description: We had reservations, but still had to wait about 25 min. Crowded place at night, though it was a Sat night. Service was a bit rushed but quick--make sure to mention all that you want because the servers don't waste time moving on to the next tables if they sense any hesitation. Food was good, but not impressive.
author: Cindy L.

description:
Marnee Thai NEVER fails to impress & satisfy :)

Tried the red curry w/ beef and pineapple fried rice for the first time. Boy, that curry packs a PUNCH. Be ready to drink loooooooots of water!

(Pictures added)
author: Miss H.

description:
Came here yesterday with some family from out of town and OMG...the best Thai food I've had in SF so far! The servers were so nice too. Even though they were packed and we didn't have reservations, they were still nice enough to not only take us in, but also split the checks as requested. 

The food was so delicious! I got the Pad Si Ew with chicken and shrimp, and I don't remember anything else everyone else got but it was damn good! Our server was so nice to explain everything to us and did not rush us at all even though the restaurant was jam packed. Excellent all the way through!
author: Maya B.

description: Wow, great find a few blocks from Golden Gate Park. Extremely flavorful food and fair price. Get there a little early for dinner or be prepared to wait outside for a little while. There's a reason this place is packed. Will definitely be back.
author: Mike S.

description:
This is some of the best Thai food I've eaten, and Thai is possibly my favorite cuisine. It's certainly my go-to, whether it's a road trip pit stop or whipping up a quick pad thai for dinner. After visiting Thailand for a few weeks with my wife two summers ago, we've been on the lookout for places that provide some of the regional varieties that we had around the country, and Marnee delivers on that. 

Having just gotten the keys for our new house on 23rd, I wanted to grab some takeout in the new neighborhood. Thai being our goto, and with the great ratings Marnee gets on Yelp, it was a no-brainer to give them a try. I saw some shout-outs for the spicy angel wings, so I ordered some of those, and the pad nor mai sounded a lot like the spicy ground chicken street food that we love. I finished it off with some Mussamun  curry. It was all piping hot when we opened it up in our empty living room, and it smelled delicious. 

The wings were still too hot to touch, but I risked singed fingers to give them a try -- they were sweet, too sweet for my wife's taste in fact, and reasonably spicy. I thought they were delicious, but I was hoping for a bit more kick. 

The pad nor mai was nothing like the dish we were expecting, but it was fantastic all the same! We were expecting something more like Burma Superstar's mint chicken, but this had bigger chunks of chicken and lots of bamboo shoots -- and the perfect mix of chiles, garlic and basil to tie it together.

My favorite dish was the Mussamun curry -- the potatoes give it an earthiness that mixes well with the coconut curry. They nailed this dish so well that I might have trouble ordering anything else from them in the future.

The only drawback was that they took a bit longer than expected to finish my order. Fortunately, I wasn't in any hurry, so I got to hang out in the back of the restaurant and watch the line cooks prepare the dishes.
author: Joel Y.

description:
My favorite thai dish ever, among many, is the spicy beef salad so I had to order. It didnt taste the same as all of the other beef salad's at first, but it grew on me and ended up being quite tasty.

Their pad thai (a good measuring stick for comparing restaurants i suppose) was not impressive to me. My pad thai tasted somewhat burnt & was a little dry. I later found out in reading reviews after coming here that their pad thai is famous. 

i am hoping to go back and try more dishes, esp. all of the ones my friend has raved about. the food was good and i dont doubt the rest will be as well. the chef is famous, cook book & all so i will go back and indulge.
author: Stella C.

description: Great food, even better service.  I'll definitely be making this place a regular stop.
author: Jon I.

description:
The food is good, but not exceptional.  The decor is fabulous, though, as is Marnee, the female co-owner...she's like "Mom", telling you what to order, occassionally bringing you freebies to try, and generally making you feel comfortable.  She'll yell at someone in the kitchen, then turn smiling to you to gently take your order...she's quite a force of nature!

The prices are a little high for Thai food in San Francisco, and honestly I've had better flavors at other Thai restaurants in the city...but if you live in the Sunset (or Inner Sunset, where they have another location), it's certainly worth checking out!  

I would recommend trying the lamb curry or the pumpkin curry.  If you get their fried rice, you will be disappointed.  And if you can, call in advance to make a reservation, otherwise you might arrive to find Marnee Thai very crowded!
author: Amy L.

description: Marnee Thai is out of this world delicious! It's a small place and VERY busy. We arrived just as the tables were filling up. Sorry, I don't remember what time it was. By the time we left the place was overflowing. And it's obvious why. I ordered spinach, plain ol' spinach. It was oh so tasty. I don't remember what my two friends got, but we all shared and each taste was better than the next. The menu is huge and on top of the menu they had @ ten specials. I will most definitely be back... over and over!
author: Scott N.

description:
I've been here previously and both times it has been pretty good Thai food but this is a really small place! The waiters are really attentive and my glass of water was never empty for long.

Angel wings were good, but I always thought they were usually stuffed wings. Regardless they were good.

I had the pad param (chicken with spinach with a curry peanut butter sauce) perfect consistency on everything. Some places have the spinach too watery or not enough sauce or the chicken is dry. This place is perfect.

There is usually a wait, luckily the moment we walked in there was a table for us.

I don't understand that only one woman, I'm assuming its the owner that takes the orders? No trust in the other waiters? More of a homely personal feel? I dunno? It was kind of weird that she would yell across the room to tell the order and the only one taking the orders.
author: Brendan L.

description:
I love their food.
Service has always been good to me.
It's a little pricy, and sometimes it's hard to find parking but it's worth it.
The restaurant is small, so they make do with what they've got.


4 stars until Kasadit gets back from from Riverside, calls me his "packin' Asian club goddess" and takes me to eat at Cici's AND here.
Hi Kas. :D *waves*
author: Susy C.

description:
My family and I have been going here for years. Aside from my mom's cooking, this is the only place that has Thai food that I really like. It's small but has food that you can't compare with even fancy places. It's authentic and can satisfy any palate. There is one dish they have that I haven't been able to find anywhere else it's some kind of spring roll... Sorry! I know that may not be helpful but I only know the name for it in Thai. Either way, it's an appetizer and is a sort of spring roll that comes with the best tamarind sauce. 

If you like Thai food, this place isn't pricy and has Thai food better than other popular places like King of Thai and Osha. Two thumbs up!
author: Kathryn B.

description:
The food was wonderful. I went there with my friends. The hostess, a really enthusiastic woman recommended most of the dishes we ordered. The dishes were fantastic. I loved their curry dishes and the best thing we ordered were the Hot Angel Wings. If you decide to go here, Angel wings are a must. Every time I go to Marnee Thai I order the wings. Other than the Angel Wings the other dishes are rather small, making this restaurant quite pricey for the amount of food they give you. Two dishes I would recommend are the Hot Angel Wings and the Pad Kee Mao Duck. The restaurant is quite cramped, but there is another Marnee Thai on 9th and Irving that is more spacious.

What I recommend: 

-- Spicy Angel Wings
-- Pad Kee Mao Duck
author: Andrew W.

description:
most disgusting service!! if you plan to eat light, just dont go there as y'll never get your  order. when we went they served ppl who came 30 mins later, before us. 
very ordinary food, way better places in SF!!
avoid this stinkhole!!
author: Santosh B.

description:
We went here after getting several rave reviews from friends and associates.  "It tastes just like we remember in Bangkok." was one comment.  Well, I just cannot give the food anything more than "barely OK" and it didn't taste like food in Bangkok to me.

We had Panang Beef, Green Mango Salad with Prawns, Duck Stir-fried with Basil and Corn Cakes.  The Corn Cakes were soggy and too soft.  The Mango wasn't green, but ripe and combined with the slightly sweet dressing made the dish way too sweet.  The Duck just didn't have much flavor and the Panang, well, it didn't taste very good at all.  The Panang sauce was thin and runny to boot.

I will say that the staff was very pleasant and service was good.
author: Rick H.

description:
angel waaaaaangs with fried tofu. DO IT.

coconutty hotcakes appetizer is a wonderful way to start off a meal. savory and sweet, scorchingly hot and delicious.

pad thai is mmkayyy.

pad see ew is delightful; great comfort food.

lamb curry  was delish with rice, good balance of all the necessary flavors.

i love love love the service here. legit thai hospitality, always a joy to dine in. i got my future dished out to me by one of the older ladies who waitresses here (and apparently is a professional psychic too, or so she told our table) which added to a fun dining experience. 

will definitely be back for duck red curry, fried rice, stir-fried eggplant, and tom yum soup among other dishes.
author: Eliza D.

description: We live nearby and do take out and eat in. My husband and I love the Thai food that we have tried. The ambiance is o.k. and we love the Pad Thai, the Imperial Rolls( only three for the price). We love the various curries. My favorite is the green curry with plenty of chicken and eggplant, tasty! It is small place so it is noisy and chaotic so we don't usually eat in. The food is great, though, and we love the Thai Ice Tea. We will order the food again.
author: Donna C.

description: Been here 4 times and I've never been disappointed. The portions are large and the food is always perfect. I highly recommend their curries, specifically yellow curry with either lamb or chicken. Their thai styled fried rice and curry appetizer dishes are also very good and full in flavor. I've had the thai styled fried rice with duck and pineapple and with crab. Great for smaller groups- 4 or less. There is a good amount of seating but you can expect it to be rather full often. The waitresses will be rather busy, but they will tend to your needs promptly. I love the mango w/ sticky rice dessert, but I wouldn't get it here again simply because the mangoes were slightly sour and tasted very preserved. I love the ambiance of this place, very traditional thai styled, nothing fancy and very cozy. Everything is well-priced and I would definitely recommend this place to others.
author: Veronica L.

description: I always order their duck. the light curry shrimp mango fried rice. is very good here.we also order the calamari . I like the food here better than the one on 9th.
author: Nellie J.

description: It's a pretty small restaurant.  For a restaurant in the city, it's pretty reasonable.  They have a list of specials every day, though many are listed all the time, like the avocado salad.  Which is pretty good.  It's similar to green papaya salad but with avocado.  The Cha Pad Poo was alright.  I like that it wasn't filled with imitation crab but had real crab, though the sauce tasted like it was heinz ketchup based.  Not really my thing.  The pineapple fried rice was decent.
author: Bryan P.

description:
I loved my food (roast pork and sausage over rice with gravy), good prices, very friendly service, and cool decor (looks and feels like youre inside a little hut in thailand, + the xmas lights)

the place was a little busy around lunch time, but the food still was good and came out quick. hands down, this lunch rice plate deal was one of the best thai dishes ive had so far. i think it was the gravy that put it all together. i know it all sounds very simple, but it left me confused in the most wonderful way. must of hit one of those comfort food triggers in my brain.
author: David D.

description: My favorite Thai place in the area. The dishes I've tried have been really good. The restaurant's traditional decor is nice and clean. The service is quick and friendly. Especially the owner, who walks around with a big smile on her face and greets customers coming and going. We ordered the mango salad with prawns, tom yum soup with prawns, and the pad nor mai w/ sliced chicken. Everything was delicious, only suggested improvement is that the Mango slad was served with only 3 pieces of shrimp in it. (Yes...I counted only because I payed extra for them to be added in). Will be back!
author: Neeners H.

description: The spicy angel wing is a must try! Super crispy and flavorful!! Their crispy bass with garlic sauce was delicious as well. The staff was very friendly and gave us great recommendation with the order. We will definitely come back.
author: Yen N.

description:
