This restaurant is a hot mess.  It's overcrowded and loud - making for a stressful dining experience.  I waited 20 minutes to be seated; 30 minutes to get water, another 20 get my order taken, and 30 minutes for all the food to come out.  On top of that, I felt insanely guilty because of a  precious old couple sitting next to me that had been waiting for even longer - just to receive the wrong order and get yelled at by the overbearing manager... so I couldn't even enjoy my food after waiting nearly two hours.

Never again Marnee Thai, Never Again!  You're not even worth taking-out!
author: Maulie D.

description: The pricing is a tiny bit on the high side, but you get what you pay for.  The food is excellent. I had the sea bass special, and I was absolutely impressed.  The curry plates were top notch as well.  I was perfectly happy with opening up my wallet for the quality.  The only cons: parking is bad, the place is cramped (small place and good food = tight squeeze) and they are a bit understaffed.  These problems can be mitigated if you find a less busy time to go.
author: Winston C.

description: The service overall it was great and all of the servers were dressed in authentic Thai clothing. Enough about that it was really about the food which was great. We had the soup Tom Ka, banana curry with duck, avocado and shrimp salad yum yum yum  and the chicken satay... There was so much more on the menu I wish I could fit in my stomach but I can't. So I guess I'll be making another trip back.
author: Krystal T.

description:
I went here with a friend yesterday around 2 on a pretty unpleasant rainy day and there were still about 3-4 tables sitting. the place is rather small but the decorations on the wall and how the overall restaurant is oriented was really cute! 

We ordered the Angel Wings, Green Curry (we also had rice and they charged us $3 per person) and the Pad Kee Mao 

I didn't know about the angel wings until I heard all the raving reviews about them on Yelp. We ordered it and it was definitely amazing. The sauce is kind of sweet with a lot of garlic-y tastes ,but it's not overpoweringly garlic-y or sweet. I don't know how to describe the sweetness because it's definitely not honey. The sauce is really thick but it compliments the wings greatly. (i've also had san tung wings before and i think these are less sweet than ST's because the sugar on ST's is like .. encrusted on the wings but i LOVE BOTH!) 

the green curry came with eggplant, which I loved. we had chicken with it and the chicken was delectable! it wasn't rough and it tasted like real chicken breast. There were a lot of different flavors involved with the curry and I think that makes the dish very yummy and authentic. however, I do think it was a bit on the salty side but the waitresses were very good on keeping our water glasses filled. 

we also ordered the pad kee mao and it came out in this offputting coloring that I didn't really recognize. it was a very bright orange and I don't know if its because I haven't had that much pad kee mao but the ones I've had before are usually light yellow/brown. but this one was very evidently orange. it was also a bit wet but I really liked the fact that they put it on top of a bed of lettuce. the lettuce served as a good palate cleanser which I liked :) 
though thai food isn't really like heavy or anything, after eating this meal, with all the different flavors mixed in my mouth, I was really glad there was some crisp lettuce mixed in to bring in some acidic? i dont know if this is the right word, but to just balance the flavors i was eating. 

my friend would give this place 5 stars just for the wings but overall, i'd give it a 4 because it was very good thai food. one of the best restaurants in the city.
author: Sandra L.

description:
Very good food, although two things weren't so great: 1) the service was kind of spotty (they brought the wrong dish a couple times) and 2) it was a little too crowded (tables could have been a little more spaced out).  However, I have to give Marnee Thai four stars because of the great food.

I had the lemonade (very fresh!), the green curry, which had a nice amount of spicy-ness; just enough so that you can taste the more subtle flavors in the dish.  I also tried the Pad Kaprow, which was nice and a bit sweet and spicy, and the corn cake appetizer (very sweet, greasy, yummy).  For dessert we had my favorite--mango and sticky rice; this one was bigger than any other place I've been and could easily be shared among three people.  When they gave us the check they included green tea candies, which were also very yummy.  I appreciate good choices all the way down to the last detail.

On top of yummy food, 1) they were able to seat us a half hour earlier than our 7:30 reservation (we arrived sooner than we thought we would), 2) the prices can't be beat, 3) the decor is great, 4) the staff is very friendly, and 5) parking isn't that difficult (unlike other spots in the Sunset).  I'll definitely come back for more.
author: Cassidy P.

description:
Best thai food I ever did have.

I'm really happy this place is in my neighborhood, it's always good to have a great thai restaurant within walking distance of where you live. The Chan Pad Poo is easily the best dish on the menu and i'll never not order it when I come in. Angel Wings are nice and sticky, and you can get it in tofu. I normally NEVER eat tofu, but I will eat Marnee tofu. 
Coconut hot cakes are great and the wait staff even pops them out of their pan right at your table. If you've watched Check Please Bay Area, they recommend the panang pork. I hadn't ordered it before I watched the episode they did at Marnee Thai, and it is everything they say it is. It's so tender and has a good balance of sauce to meat. 

Get mango with black sticky rice for dessert!!
author: Catface G.

description:
Rude services (1 star), but good food (4 star). We were rushed to order and were given an attitude when we said we needed couple of more minutes to decide. Then they over charged us and said we ordered rice when we didn't. 

I have been a customer of Marnee Thai since early 2000s. Let's just say, I won't be going back.
author: Rong S.

description: This place has the best Thai food around. Period!
author: Jill T.

description: Food here is amazing! Not much space unfortunately but a great place for a dinner date. I love the angel wings, red curry chicken and crab fried rice. Once, a little problem was a hair in my rice. I glanced at the lady who seemed to be in charge, and she IMMEDIATELY came to the table and brought me another dish. Typically this would've been a negative for me, but since the food was incredibly  bomb, i didn't mind... The staff is extremely pleasant and even though I live on the other side of the bay, I will drive to SF just to eat here!
author: Brandon R.

description: First time at this location and although the food was excellent, I was disappointed we had to ask for their lunch menu.  Every time we eat at the 9th Ave location they automatically give you both the lunch and dinner menu's.  I also felt like the waitress kept pushing higher priced dishes even after I placed our order.  I will return to the 9th Ave location instead of this place.
author: Monica B.

description: I love love love this place... My favorite is the seasonal hot cake... It come in 8 pieces... Sooo good
author: Sedina S.

description:
Heard great things about Marnee Thai and I had been to the second location before, so I was excited about coming to the original location. The restaurant is a little too cramped. Even skinny people can't squeeze in between the cracks. 

The food was good, but halfway through our meal, the table next to us complained that they found 3 strands of hair in their food. The woman (who I assumed was the owner) kept insisting that all her cooks wore hats and that they did not have such fine hair. She agreed to take the charge off the bill, but kept reiterating that she did not know how the hair got there and can't be her staff. 

The portions are not big, but enough to be full. We ordered the Harmok, potstickers, fresh spring rolls and the Tom Kha soup, all of which were tasty. We decided to take the mango with sticky rice to go. Upon arriving at home, I open up the box and what do I find?! Yes, a strand of hair in the coconut sauce for the rice. 

Bottom line, although the food was good, it is not the most convenient location and the hygiene needs some work. Although the staff was attentive, the owner is WAY too pushy. If I am already here eating at your restaurant, you don't have to tell me that every dish is wonderful and delicious. The hairs and the owner definitely left much to be desired....probability of returning is slim...
author: Alicia L.

description:
An oldie but a goodie.

I've been coming to Marnee Thai for as long as I could remember for good Thai food.  It's been YEARS and I'm still a loyal customer. 

Beware: service can be a little slow, the restaurant can be a little cramped, but the food will not disappoint, ever. 

Angel wings. Papaya salad. Pad thai. Yellow curry. Duck fried rice. Roti dessert with ice cream.  My go to's and they are SO delicious and extremely affordable! 

Great memories, great food, great friends. 

This isn't an Osha Thai or King of Thai - it's a local spot. Keep that in mind!
author: Lisa L.

description: You will not be seated if one member of your party is missing. Seriously, you do not wanna argue with the lady. I give 5 stars regardless of how she is, I still like their food. There were 5 of us one time, and honestly some of us don't eat much so we were thingking to just get 3 dishes and share. She clearly pointed out that we needed to get 5 different dishes and so we did. I think we got Garlic Sauce Snapper, Stir fried egg plant, Fried rice, Pad thai and I forgot the other one. The garlic fish is the best.
author: Lovetoeat A.

description:
The dishes here are very consistent and rarely disappoint.  The only deterrent may be the wait and/or the parking.  But, go during lunch, for fewer crowds.  

My favorite dishes are the Spicy Angel Wings, Corn Cakes, Chan Pad Poo, and the Mango with Sticky Rice.  Also good is the Pad Prig Khing, the pork with green beans.  I have not seen another Thai restaurant in SF or the Bay Area, which serves this type of Angel Wings or the Chan Pad Poo.  The Angel Wings are chicken wings deep fried and marinated with lots and lots of garlic and basil in a sweet spicy sauce; goes great with steamed rice.  The Corn Cakes are flat, deep fried corn fritters, served with a cucumber salad and a sweet spicy dressing.  The Chan Pad Poo is noodles with egg and crabmeat, with just the right amount of spiciness.  I converted over to this dish from Pad Thai.  And the Mango with Sticky Rice here is so good, better than most.

I tend to stick with the tried and true.  I have sampled other dishes, but not as often, and cannot remember them all.   But, they were very good overall.
author: CE Y.

description:
Wow, it's been a long time since I wrote my first review of this place back in 2006. So long that I don't remember eating there! What happened? Why didn't I come back? Probably because I lived in a different part of the city and didn't venture out to the sunset? 

Well, now that I am calling the neighborhood home again, we decided to give Marnee Thai a shot. This was our second time ordering take-out. We have yet to eat-in the restaurant.

We ordered a lot of different dishes this time: 

--papaya salad
--summer rolls (basically spring rolls with a different name)
--green curry dumplings (I'm gluten-intolerant; my husband ate these)
--pad kee mao (sp?)
--pumkin curry 
--panang beef curry (I didn't eat this, as it looked thickened with flour)
--mussaman curry  (I also didn't eat this)

As I mentioned, I'm gluten-intolerant so I ate the items that I felt comfortable eating. I"m pretty sure the food was not 100% gluten free but for the most part, no issues.  The papaya salad was a great starter and not too sweet or sticky, as I've had at other places. The summer rolls are great. I had a tiny bit of peanut sauce (although it's usually not gluten-free) and it was yum. The summer rolls come in 2's and are fairly large. Each roll is about twice as long as spring/summer rolls I have seen elsewhere!

The pumpkin curry was delicious! My absolute favorite. I've had it elsewhere and this is as good or better here. I love that they add peas to the curry. I didn't expect it to come with tofu. The tofu is fried which also is not my favorite, but it was ok. (I'm not sure if their fried tofu is gluten free? but I chanced it...)

I also chanced it and had the Pad Kee Mao since they were rice noodles. It's possible the spicy sauce they use may contain gluten. It was delicious but I may stick to curries in the future to be safe.

My husband enjoyed the other dishes also. We will definitely be back. Wish they delivered for those lazy nights, but it's not so bad picking up. The only problem is that it is usually very crowded on Friday nights, so try to order early or come when you know the food will already be done. Otherwise you will be waiting in a small space by the door where tons of people are coming in and going out.  The service is not as friendly either as I saw for people dining in...the girl who worked there had me wait in the drafty hallway by the kitchen.  That is why I'm knocking off one star.
author: Rosie S.

description:
I always think of this place when I think "delicious thai food." 

Try the corn cake appetizer! It's crunchy (fried) and fresh with bits of corn. It comes with a small cucumber salad that, I think, goes perfectly well with the fried cakes. Mouth-watering. Other suggestions: mango fried rice, BBQ chicken (pricey though). 

Pros:
-flavorful food!
-somewhat sophisticated-looking thai food
-decorated atmosphere (the walls look like straw but out-of-modern context)

Cons:
-a dollar or two more than normal thai food you would find at King of Thai ($7and up range)
-little parking and little restaurant. 

Okay, this may not always be true, but this restaurant has fresh lemon slices in the iced water so that tells me it cares about FLAVOR.
author: Glo Y.

description: Three stars for amazing food. No stars for terrible service. I have never had this problem at the 9th place but at 24th they need to get their stuff together. I have had 3 different waitresses ordering the same thing multiple times while yelling at other customers. For a place this established, this is unbelievable.
author: Alexander O.

description:
How do I preface the, Marnee Thai review?

I'm not inclined to write reviews about places I've been to on dates (because (a) humble bragging, although "so in" for 2013, is obnoxious, and (b) just plain old bragging about dates is tacky).  Like, what the fuck is wrong with you, Yelpers of America?  Someone takes you out for a nice night, and you rip the establishment a new one on a website because, why?  (You want to get invited to Yelp Elite parties, and must accumulate records of your gastronomy to do so?  You need people to vote that what you ordered is "cool" and validate your disdain for something you experienced?  You have an urge to let it be known you're still here, still dining about town, still having opinions worth sharing?)  I think dissecting your date on the Internet, and on a site as impersonal and pessimistic as Yelp can be, is the epitome of criticism, commercialism, and our addiction to attention on social media.  And on a more personal level: don't you want to maintain some semblance of privacy in what should be some of your best, more intimate endeavors?  I just... I don't understand.  Like I said, it's tacky.

Yikes... Cool story already, bro.  I'm not sure where that rant came from.  Forgive me, Marnee Thai.  You deserve better, and nothing but the sweetest of reviews.

But I suppose in the city of bandwagoning (say hello to my Giants shirt, Spring 2013), I'll jump on here, take a turn for hypocrisy, and talk about a place where dates may've been had, and explain why I want to talk about it on Yelp.  

What I want to say is: Marnee Thai is a pretty nice place for a date.  Hear me out: I'm specifically thinking about a date for the couple who has been seeing each other for a little bit.  Things are getting comfortable, but still exciting.  You're beginning to introduce each other to friends.  You're spending more time together.  You're still learning.  Go on.  

You want to have a dinner together, and are content to go out to the Sunset (not necessarily known for its night life?) for a quiet, quality meal and time together.  You know you might have to wait to be seated, which might mean standing very, very close to each other near the doorway.  The dining room is pretty small, so there's going to be more closeness to come once seated (and the question: will you be that couple who sits side-by-side (don't) or across from each other?).  You can bring your own wine too, which is such a date-y thing to do.  Look at that, it's already shaping up to be a good date night.    

What's special here is the woman who runs the place (I want to say her name is May, and not just because that rhymes; but forgive me, for I don't actually remember?).  She'll come to your table and make you feel like family.  And just like a wise aunt, she'll let you know what she thinks about the prospect of your budding relationship.  She'll make you believe her kind words, because she's a kind woman who is excellent at reading people.  Or so she says.  Or so she leads you to believe.  Or so you want to believe, because you just like it here in the warm little dining room of Marnee Thai so much.  It feels like a rite of passage in a new relationship to experience such a special interaction with a stranger.  She lights up the place, and leaves you with a warm little buzz (or it's from the wine you brought, maybe - but she'll definitely contribute to your fond experience here).

I'm not saying you have to go.  I'm just saying...  think about it.  And we know the food is great.  Maybe later you don't have to regurgitate what you ordered later and comment on the service; just let it live on as a precious little memory, eh?

Speaking of: on the food front, while I tend to think people are completely capable of ordering for themselves, I do want to rave about one item in particular.  The soft-shell crab green mango salad.  It's heavenly.  Since you're already on a date yourself, let your taste buds in on the action, and experience the love of this dish.  I think I can promise, you won't regret it.  Shit, if you do want to come on here and gush about its magnificence yourself, go for it.  Let this, all of this, come from a place of love, a place of raves, not rants, a place of building up, not breaking down.  

May the force be with you, young lovers.
author: Keeks K.

description:
Since hearing lots of good things about this place, I finally decided to try it out a couple months ago. I have been to this restaurant about 2 times now. The first time was pretty nice, we got a red curry with duck, samosas, pad thai, brown rice. Everything was pretty good and I was content. 

However the SECOND time I went there, it was pretty disappointing , service was very slow and cups of water smelled and tasted like bleach. Disgusting. We ordered 2 pad thais, 1 other seafood noodle and one curry with seafood with brown rice.

They bought my dish with white rice and I kindly told them to fix it, but the server was rude, grabbed the plate and came back to tell me that they had no more brown rice. She didnt even offer make sure if it was okay for the customer. Then we waited for second pad thai to come for like 30 minutes, but it never came. The server said it was coming, but then still it didnt arrive- had to ask again and turns out they only put in one order of pad thai. By then everyone had already gotten their dishes so we just canceled the order. My family was irritated.

The pad thai was a little too sweet, and the other dish supposedly cooked with crab tasted identical, and the green curry this time with seafood was horrible, I got a whole bowl  of just red bell peppers and bamboo shoots with like one piece of  meat. Sad sad sad....

The place is pretty cramped. The service can be slow and depending on the your server could be iffy. The food is pricy , but normal range for thai food. The presentation was the food was pretty, but that did not make up for the bad bad bad bamboo shoot watery curry I had. 
Overrated or maybe I just came on a bad day? 
Well either way, due to this ugh experience I don't think I will be coming back again...
author: Alice T.

description:
Thank you Marnee Thai for creating an addiction.  I watched the review on Bay Area Check Please and with a follow up endorsement from my dad I was on my way.

Ridiculously delicious.  I'm a picky eater and this is one of the few places I'd feel comfortable out of my comfort zone.  In fact, when I left I said I wanted to go back & be more adventurous.

Still, what I'd really like is to have one of their cooks follow me around all day making fresh hotcakes so I could happily gorge on them allllll day.  Those things are like little rounds of comforty-food heaven.

I had pictures, but apparently my camera swallowed them -- even the photos of their food are too yummy to leave left overs.
author: Shannon K.

description:
I love the pad see ew at Marnee Thai.  Their angel wings are great and all of the soups I've ever had there were very tasty.  

Very pleasant staff and clean place.  Highly recommend for lunch or dinner.  My parents visit from LA once in a while and they always want to eat at their "favorite" Thai place up here in SF.
author: Shauna L.

description:
This is the 2nd time I've been here on 2 different visits to San Francisco, and somehow, I'm always "just in the neighborhood" and hit up Marnee.

This is a pretty solid Thai place that earns 4 stars for me. The 1st time, I had a seafood curry of some sort with fish, and me and my dining partner shared the appetizers of chicken wings. (This was my "pre-pescatarian" diet that I'm currently on." The curry was perfect, and warmed the heart (and the sweat glands) with a zing of spice. The wings, OMG, were divine. You will have to ask for extra napkins and then a few more because WOW are those suckers covered in the delicious Thai-something glaze. The thai iced tea was good, sweet, and I wanted more of it.

This time around, there were 5 in our group and they seated us promptly for our 8pm reservation. [Tip: make a reservation - they honor them and will save you time.] We decided to go family style this time and ordered 5 dishes for the table. I can't comment on the beef-stir fry (#41, I think) or the pork dish from the special menu, but I did enjoy the shrimp pad thai, pumpkin tofu curry, and the seafood curry.

The pad thai was fairly standard, but in my opinion overly sweet and low in shrimp content. A few extra peanuts and a few more Thai-spices could have made this pad thai better. I go off on a limb and say you should try something else on their menu before resorting for their pad thai.

The pumpkin tofu curry was delicious. Do know that it's Asian pumpkin, not carve -it-on-your-porch-in-October pumpkin, which makes sense, but I didn't realize that after a long week. We ordered it mild (yellow) because the spice-tolerance in my group is low, but I would have preferred at least medium to give more of a delicious kick. The tofu was great, and the curry, poured over rice, made for a savory combination.

The seafood curry was pretty good as well, with large pieces of shrimp, scallops, and egg. While the curry was good, I thought the egg, which was probably thrown-in too early, created a strange texture of liquid-y curry + small fine chunks of egg. Flavour was great though!

Overall, this is a solidly "Thai-rrific" four-star Thai place.  Make a reservation, come hungry, leave satisfied, and try the candy they give you once to see if you like it. It's a strange taste that lasted only 3 seconds in my mouth before it spent the rest of its life in my napkin.
author: Eric H.

description: The food does not taste like the way I remember. Pad seew had no flavor. It seemed like it was not cooked to order, but had been sitting in a heating pan until they scooped out. The angel wings were also dry and hard.
author: Carrie W.

description:
This location on Irving is the original Marnee Thai restaurant, and my favorite of the two.  The thatched walls and ceiling really did make me feel like I was transported somewhere tropical, and the fact that it was a rare hot night in the Sunset certainly helped with that.  The best way to cool off on a night such as this?  How about with a cool, fresh young coconut?  Delicious soft meat and full to the brim with water...YUM!  (It's served with both a straw and spoon so you can get all the goodness out.)

Service was attentive and quick, and the food was delicious.  It's been a while since I was there so I can't remember our exact dishes, but my dad and I left fully stuffed and with leftovers too!

Hint: Either arrive early or make a reservation, or else be prepared to wait a while for a table in this small restaurant.
author: Lindsay B.

description: I have been going to Marnee Thai for years. It was the place that I introduced people to for real authentic Thai food (after I got back from a trip to Thailand in 2000).  In the past 18 months that I have gone there: 1) we were moved (thought this was just part of the experience, no big deal); 2) the food wasn't so great; 3) food was very good but it was so loud with the hostess constrantly screaming to the back and to her wait staff, that we all felt on edge. Now (as long as it doesn't have the same dismal health ratings as its 9th Ave location, which got shut down b/c  the violations were so bad), I will only do take out because, while the food is still good, I want a non-stressful eating experience.
author: MissyE X.

description: TERRIBLE SERVICE!!  Sat down and waited 10 minutes before getting our menus and water. Night and day comparison to the 9th avenue location. That location has awesome service and quality food!  Don't know what happened to the 24th avenue location. Did management fall asleep??
author: An S.

description: Best Thai food I've ever had. Everything tasted like it was made with some heart and soul. The waitress was happy to be there, and offered her honest opinion.
author: Matt K.

description:
I'm torn and will rate it 2.5.

Here's the good stuff:

Great friendly attentive service.

Homemade hotcakes - really unique and delicious coconut rice floor cakes. You can taste the coconut milk and pumpkin.

Pad Prig Khing - string beans, hot chili paste with beef. Good seasoning. Beef was tendor. Spicy level just like we asked for.


Not so great stuff:

Pad Se-Ew - a staple dish that I feel is pretty standard so I was put off when it was on the salty side and had broccoli, I know it says it on the menu, but traditionally it would have been chinese broccoli which does make it taste different.

Pad Kee Mao - tomato based and very oily. We ordered it with duck and basically got a lot of skin and fat. Disappointing.


High expectations cause the reviews are highly rated, and left feeling like I have been to better, more authentic Thai places. Not sure if it was the hype or that some of the dishes fell under par. 

Worth trying it for yourself...
author: Michele H.

description:
Delicious food. I never leave dissatisfied. The service is excellent, and the atmosphere is just right, not overly casual, not pretentious. I tend to often wish I was at Marnee when I eat Thai elsewhere.

Final note: I'm not a vegetarian, but I appreciate that I can substitute just about any meat meal with tofu/veggies.
author: Abe D.

description:
Driving down Irving what to eat, what to eat?  San Tung?  No!  That line's too long!  Irving Cafe & Deli?  No, I want more than just a bahn mi sandwich.

Marnee Thai it is!

We arrived at the beginning of the dinner rush on a Sunday and were immediately seated.  Before we could crack open our menus the waitress flew over to our table and asked us if we already knew what we wanted.  Mind you, my toushie hadn't event hit the seat of the chair yet.  But I quickly ordered the Angel Wings and let her know that we'll need a few minutes to decide on the meal.

Water on the table and approximately 5 minutes later, we put in our order:  Beef Thai Salad, BBQ Chicken, Pad Thai and Brown Rice.

Five minutes after we ordered our meal, the Angel Wings arrived.  Ooo-weee, these are hella good and spicy.  Don't plan on wearing a white shirt here, folks, you may end up wearing your meal.  But the wings here are excellent!

I didn't care for the beef thai salad much, it was too salty and it was swimming in "marinade".  The lettuce was wilted from all the vinegar that it sat in.

The BBQ chicken was ok.  It tasted like it was sitting out for a little bit of time before they brought it to our table...a bit chewy.

The Pad Thai was excellent!

Next time I come back...it's angel wings and pad thai...that's it!
author: Rochelle D.

description: The food is pretty good, the owner lady care for you to eat enough...  she keep saying it is not enough... it is not enough... it did not annoy me much but the food was pretty good, there is a long wait for it and the place is always pack, not a really long wait though so I am please with the place, and will go back again.
author: Z G.

description: One of the best Thai places in SF, if not the best.  Red curry is amazing - not spicy or too sweet.  Get it with anything.  I love their Tofu Praram which is the peanut over Fried Tofu.  Its amazing.  My family loves the minced pork with chili sauce over rice - its the best.
author: Phil T.

description: Consistently good. My goto neighborhood Thai place.
author: Anthony W.

description: Marnee Thai is a great place for you to have some Thai food. The interior is beautiful and pleasant and they have really good food. The prices are reasonable as they are not that expensive. You should definitely come and have some of their delicious food. I myself am a fan of Thai Iced Tea and must tell you that Marnee's Thai Iced Tea is one of the best I have ever had. Look out for specials of the day as well. They should be good! : )
author: Ena M.

description: So delighted to see that this place is still here after 30 years.  We lived in the Sunset then and ate here often.  It was our "go to" Thai in the Sunset.  Food is delicious.  Small space, but fabulous food.
author: Manya B.

description:
Some of the best Thai food I've tried in the Bay Area.  I came here with my friends to celebrate my move-in to a new apartment and we ordered:

-Pad Thai (I usually hate ordering the stereotypical dish at an ethnic restaurant, but majority ruled)
-Eggplant w/ Chicken
-Pad Prik Khing J
-Green Curry w/ Chicken
-Mango w/ Sticky Rice

Everything was delicious, especially the eggplant!  Gah, I would walk back there for that eggplant.  I knocked off a star since first we were reproached by the owner for trying to split the tab on 3 cards even though we met their minimum of $15.00 per card and then she stood right behind us, breathing down our necks, as we wrote down how much we were going to tip.  Why don't we Asians understand the concept of personal space?

Aside from that little unpleasantry, it was a perfectly nice meal.
author: Jen L.

description:
The one outstanding part that plays back in my mind during my visit, is the unfortunate experience of ungentle service persons. I think I caught a few pieces of rice, soup, and food bits on myself as they hastily served our delicious order.

They've got the thailand-hut decor down to the tee, and separating themselves from the rest of the thai pack would be their angel wings and pad thai. Both flavorful and enough in their right to stand alone in a lunch platter. Their tom yum soup though was more sour than I usually fair, but an overall experience I'm willing to come back again.

Ah almost forgot. I saw a cockroach in the bathroom.
author: Alfred Y.

description: Food was excellent! The Angel Wings are like heaven in your mouth. We ordered a various amount of dishes, and the waiters and waitresses are always asking if you need more tea and water. Very nice food in an average looking restaurant.
author: Kevin C.

description: This acclaimed restaurant (I go to the one on Irving) serves an appetizer called Miang Kum.  I can't find it anywhere else.  You're served two plates, one has perfect spinach leaves and a bowl of a sweet sauce and the other has little piles of tiny cubes of ginger, red onion, lime wedges, dry roasted peanuts and toasted coconut.  You take pinches of each item and put it on a spinach leaf, roll it up, pop it into your mouth, flavor explosion ensues!  For non-vegetarians, there's also dried shrimp.
author: Pat P.

description:
I've been to the Marnee on 9th before, but I now favor this location. Best Thai I've had in the US. 

Went on a Wednesday night with a party of 7. Good thing we had reservations - the place was packed. Pretty quiet though - the bamboo panneled walls absorb sound and allow for normal conversation volume. 

We got some great recommendations from the hostess/owner. It was obvious that she takes great pride in the food there. She made it her personal mission to see that each of us enjoyed our food (which was easily accomplished, because the food was DELICIOUS).

Get the pad garlic - strong (almost to the extent that it was spicy) garlic kick. We had it with pork. The chicken wings are super yummy too! We had a great appetizer of coconut hotcakes, which our server dished to us from a piping hot griddle. They were little coconut pancakes filled with a lightly sweet coconut custard and sprinkled with corn. Breakfasty in the best possible way.

Spice levels are true to description. Medium is medium, hot is HOT!

Will definitely be back for more.
author: caitlin m.

description:
3.75
A little more pricier Siamese Street (in stockton) equivalent in sf.

The various dishes we got were the (sorry that I dont have names) pumpkin curry, pad thai, the thick beef flat noodles, the white sour soap, the spicy beef broccoli, the papaya salad, the pineapple fried rice, and the chicken and vegetables. Of all of these, the pad thai, thick beef flat noodles, the pumpkin curry, and the pineapple fried rice were notable. The rest were normal and forgettable. Both noodle dishes were kinda small portioned but tasted very good and flavorful. The pineapple fried rice was typical but they did a good job not to overcook the rice and pineapple. The pumpkin curry was creamy and had a good blend of spices. 

Bottomline: the prices are a tad more expensive than what I would like to pay for thai food but its a good eat and would recommend it as a good thai place to others
author: Robert Y.

description:
I came here to celebrate a family birthday and it was not a disappointment.  In fact, every time I'm here the food is awesome!  I always order the same dishes since I know they'll all be delicious.

Starting off with the Appetizers:

* Spicy Angel Wings - Deep fried chicken wings and drumsticks glazed with a chili-garlic sauce are totally heavenly!  You can adjust the spiciness to your liking, but any way you prefer, the flavor is so good!  The fried crispy basil leaves are a nice complement to the dish.

* Beef Satay - Thinly sliced pieces of tasty, marinated beef on a skewer which can be topped with the flavorful peanut sauce.  No complaints for being greasy since the beef is lean and tender.  A favorite!

Entrees:

* Pad Thai - The best Pad Thai I've ever tasted.  The noodles are just the right chewy consistency and the flavor is perfect with it's level of sweetness.  Again, no puddles of grease here.

* Pad Kaprow - You have a choice of chicken minced pork, roasted duck or prawns/calamari.  I always order the minced pork that's sauteed with fresh chili garlic and Thai basil.  The flavor is so distinct and blends so perfectly with the white rice.  Another favorite of mine!

Dessert:

* Roti with Ice Cream - A thin deep fried piece of dough shaped like a flat disk that's drizzled generously with a sugary sauce and topped with a delicious scoop of coconut ice cream.  The dough is fried to a chewy consistency and when enjoyed with a bit of the ice cream . . . heaven!

Marnee Thai is always a great choice for Thai food.  The prices are reasonable, the location has adequate parking and the food is delicious.  The service can be a little rushed at times because they get busy, so be sure to make reservations especially on the weekends.  I've also tried the other location which is just as good.
author: Karen L.

description:
Pros:

This is definitely my favorite place in the bay to get Thai food. The food is authentic and it taste so good! I love how the cups are mix and match. Thats how you know its authentic! The place has a really Thai feeling to it and the waiter/waitress even dress in Thai clothing so that's pretty dope. 

Cons:
The service is pretty good but it could be better. Also it's a pretty small restaurant so going there with a big group of friends or someone that's 300 pounds or above isn't probably a good idea!

Overall this place is legit!
author: Sotheara Y.

description:
Running around the city for half a day for the Great Urban Race had me and the bf starvin' like Marvin! We mindlessly drove around without a real destination or idea of what to eat. Somehow we found parking on Irving St. (score!) near a Japanese restaurant, but I decided to Yelp it first. I couldn't find the name of the restaurant (it wasn't really visible from the street), but Marnee Thai came up with great reviews, and it was just down the block. 

I loved the interior decor! Walls were decorated floor-to-ceiling, wall-to-wall with bamboo-like material. It made you feel like you were in a cozy hut. Wait staff were well-dressed with their Thai-style dresses or shirts. I almost felt bad coming in here with sweaty workout clothes =(. But they welcomed us with a smile and seated us right away. 

We started with the Angel Wings substituted with tofu. Wow! If their special sweet and spicy sauce can make tofu taste this good, I can only imagine what the chicken wings taste like! And the decorative fried basil was a nice touch.

The rest of our meal came out almost immediately. We ordered the chicken with string beans in chili paste and sauteed eggplant with tofu (the bf LOVES fried tofu. Actually, he likes anything fried!), both of which were indicated as spicy on the menu.

The chicken with string beans was cooked just right with slightly crunchy string beans and bite-size chicken slices. The chili paste gave the dish a great flavor, but made it a little oily. The eggplant dish was tasty as well. However, neither dish had any spice to them! Maybe I wasn't loud or clear enough when I told the fast-speaking waitress "spicy." Or maybe I missed something she said when she was taking our order? I forget - my rumbling stomach was starting to take over my body, who knows what I said.

As we finished our meal, the place was starting to fill up at 7pm on a Saturday night. It's a small restaurant and the tables are so close together you might as well be sharing your meal with your neighboring diners. But the food is authentic and worth the coziness. Just make sure you speak up when you indicate "spicy" for your dish.
author: Kimberly S.

description:
This quaint little place located in the Outer Sunset is an excellent choice if you're in the mood for some good Thai food.  I don't think this is a secret though since there always seems to be a wait for a table...But I've never had to wait more than 15 min or so.

I personally like the Inner Sunset location on 9th more...but I just went to the Irving location last night so I feel obligated to go with what's freshest in the old hippocampus.  Decor of the Irving location is very cozy and warm with bamboo walls and Christmas lights aplenty...Tables are pretty close together...But hey we're all family right?  Staff is super friendly and the service was quick.  Chicken satay was yummy as usual...Red Curry was actually only ok (their Panang is a much better bet)...Pad-See-Ew was particularly gratifying on the taste buds...Polished everything off with a nice mango sticky rice.

All in all, very good dinner.  Marnee Thai...so good they had to have 2 locations within a 5 min drive of each other...check 'em both out!
author: Justin L.

description:
I like this location better than the 9th Avenue one. I seem to find parking spots here easier. Although the 19th Avene location is much newer than the Irving location I still find the Irving location much more pleasurable to dine in. Beef Rendang and their Thai Ice tea is to die for. 

I really like the decor.They try to bring the Thai flavor to the place and I like it. This is a cozy place so seating can be tight sometimes and lunch/dinner can be very busy with about a 15 minute wait. 

The staff are well trained and knowledgeable about the food. They are very polite without being overbearing.

If you're lucky on of these days you will get your fortune read by the lady owner.
author: Janet D.

description:
My friend who has visited Thailand said she won't eat Thai food in the US. However, she gave thumbs up to Marnee Thai. Nuff said, right?

Also, don't be put off by May, the co-owner/Big Lady Who Runs the Show.

She might yell at you a little, but don't take it personally, she's just trying to keep business going. 

And watch out! She will assess your personality in less than 10 seconds and offer you a palm reading.

She's part of the experience. Leave your tight-ass self at the door and enjoy her attitude if she's working when you are having your meal.
author: Sara G.

description: An authentic Thai restaurant. I had the avocado salad and the Chan pad poo. It was delicious, though i wished the Chan pad poo was less sweet. Thai restaurant that actually has Thai servers.
author: Alyssa Z.

description:
BEWARE SMALLL PORTIONS!!! The food is pretty amazing, but the portions are sooo small! I really wish they had more food, even for lunch (which is the same portion size as dinner) I was barely full. So if I had gone there for dinner, it would not have been even close to filling. I ordered the Pad Kee Mao with roast duck (roast duck is $1 extra). It was spicy, garlic flavored, and quite good. They really got me on this dish though because under the noodles, where I expected more noodles, there was a bed of shredded lettuce! Did I pay $9.95 for half a plate of shredded lettuce and half a plate of noodles???? Hell to the no! I paid for a full plate of noodles, but nonetheless, it was what I was stuck with. So I settled, left with my stomach still hungry and my wallet more empty. 

Overall, great food, small small portions.
author: Kevin L.

description:
I felt like I've met a warlord! Food was average and the atmosphere is too noisy, but please let me point out that it is not the customers that are noisy; IT'S THE FREAK-EN OWNER! You could see/hear her yelling across the room placing orders and telling staff to do this and that! My friends came here on a Sat. night and of course there was a wait; we got out seats in 15mins later. We waited for quiet some time for someone to take our orders, but the waiters would not take our orders and said: "you need to order from that lady (I assume 'that lady' is the owner?)" 

Our meals finally came and yup we are hungry! By the time when my friend was about to take a bite of her curry and scoop the rice out of the rice bowl; the owner came by and took her bowl and start yelling at the waiter that gave my friend her rice bowl. The owner then take this rice pot (it seems like left over rice from the table before us and just slap the rice onto my friends plate! UM... NO THANK YOU! WE ARE NEVER COMING TO THIS PLACE AGAIN!!!
author: A L.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE!!

I have been here several times now and each time has lived up to my expectations. I usually don't order salads at restaurants because I feel like they are a waste of money but boy do i love the salads at Marnee Thai! The soft shell crab & green mango salad is yummy, the squid salad is not as great, and the avocado salad is BOMB!!! Their roasted duck red curry is also really good and I rarely ever order curry. Also, their pad thai hits the spot. 

A lot of reviews mention the Angel Wings but they just can't beat San Tung's dry wings. The owner recommended the meatballs for an appetizer but we felt that it was like the meatballs used in noodle soups. Weird.  We have also tried the crab noodle dish and it is really good! I ordered dessert only once and got the mango sticky rice dessert. The mango used was not sweet but the sticky rice was delicious so it made up for it.

A lot of good dishes at this place and I highly recommend getting a salad to share as a starter! The wait may be a bit long at times and sometimes the food takes a while, but it's worth it.
author: Syd T.

description:
I've heard some many good reviews about Marnee Thai but never taste it for myself. I finally made it here last week and i am impressed with the taste of their food.

We ordered the spicy angel wings and the corn cakes for appetizer. The angel wings were not bad even if it's over night. (i had leftovers) the corn cake was somewhat strange to me, they were like rice crispy to me. 

for the main dish we had the Chan Pad Poo. It's the same noodle used for pad thai stir fried  with crab meat and it's a bit spicy. I am not a fan of the pad thai, but this dish is good because it's not sweet tasting like Pad Thai. We also for the Pad Phed with sliced beef. It's sauteed with some veggies and fresh chili, garlic and Thai basil. It has a nice spice to it and it's perfect with rice. 

I have to try their curry next time because i LOVE curry!
author: Jenny G.

description:
YUMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM....their angel tofu is a must!! And the pad thai and pad see you are amazing. The yellow curry was very good as well. I also, had the tom yum soup...yum!!!

Everything was an amazing goo of yumminess. YUM!
author: Judy Y.

description:
I've only ever taken food to go from here but what I've had was pretty good.

The yellow curry was delicious.  It was viscous and warm and had a delightful coconut aroma spiraling around pieces of chicken and chunks of potato.  Delicious over brown rice.  

Their chicken satay isn't bad either.  I like the peanut sauce though it sort of just tastes like warmed up salty peanut butter.  

Though the food was good, the prices were high.  They don't include rice with the curry so you have to order it separately.  The brown rice costs $2.00 extra.  Also, though the chicken satay (6 skewers) is just an appetizer, it makes for a full meal (you'd also have to buy rice).

Food was pretty yummy but prices were a little too high.  A-OK in my book plus maybe half a star.  Might need to eat inside one of these days..
author: Kimiko Q.

description:
I'd actually give them 4 1/2 stars, but anyway. I love the food here, after coming countless times, it's safe to say that the food is always delicious. I tend to be pretty predictable when I come here; I usually come to Marnee for a curry fix. I've tried a variety of the curries and I've enjoyed them all for the most part, any complaints would be too little meat in a couple that I've had. The green curry is great if you want something spicy, red if you want something mild, and the yellow is great for a heartier feel. It's nice that they have 3 different meat choices (beef, pork or chicken), a choice for prawns, and a vegetarian option (generally tofu, which is still delicious), so at least with the curries, you could have it go pretty much your way. 

Generally when I go with my family or a group of friends we order the chicken satay (the peanut sauce is TO DIE FOR) and another appetizer, usually the Golden Triangles which are like samosas filled with a curried sweet potato mixture, which are also amazing. 

The service is friendly, and pretty vigilant (filling your water glass when it runs low, or promptly coming over if signaled). The pricing is reasonable for the portions, and the food is generally very good. Highly recommended.

One thing though, if you have peanut allergies, I wouldn't recommend coming here. A LOT of dishes seem to have peanuts in them.
author: Hanling C.

description:
I was excited to come to Marnee Thai after reading all the reviews and to see pictures of the decor. I loved how they captured the ambiance of Thailand so well. 

I came here with a group of 10 pretty late night and I was happy that they could accomodate. The lady who served us was not a happy camper that night. I think she was even the manager. She was rude to us and I was not pleased when she told us there was an $8 minimum per person. Some of my friends wanted to share a dish and she rudely told us "no, $8 minimum per person". I always feel discriminated when coming to restaurants with big groups. It is not uncommon that I get bad service with large groups. Either that, or she was just milking us for more money. 

Anyhow, we got our food and luckily it was good, but not sure I'll return. It was nothing out of the ordinary to me. I've found places with food just as good for a cheaper price. However, Marnee Thai does offer different dishes that you won't find at other places. However, the new dishes are of no interest to me so I'll just stick to my Thai spot, Thai Time.
author: Connie C.

description: Right around the GG Park in a very asian neighborhood (not sure of the name). It boasts of several awards and sure lives up to it. We started off with the seasonal Fresh Egg Rolls and then I got the Pad Cha Talay. The Pad Cha Talay was really good! The only thing annoying about this place... the repeating music (bleeeckh)!
author: Ruzan B.

description:
i dont know what the hype is about, i've had better thai food. the larb salad i order was way too dry and bland. it's just to aimed towards non-asian tastebuds in my opinion. 

i swear all the michelin guided restaurants i've been to aren't good! im so disappointed. :(
author: Christine L.

description: I've worked in the food industry for five years. I didn't even have to eat here to understand the atmosphere. I came here with a party of 8. The staff gave us a table for 6 and wouldn't accommodate and give us another table so that everyone could fit. The place had very few customers and plenty of extra tables. They told us they were busy and was being difficult with us. My family is a patient group, but we're not pushovers. I don't write reviews in a biased way, but this was just awful. Guess they weren't craving $300 worth of business in one sitting.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Best Thai food in the city! Here's the low down. Great food, reasonable service, and a bit too crowded and cramped. 

I loved the duck curry, the pad thai, the pad se-ew and the green papaya salad with soft shell crab. All four were outstanding. The hotcakes, made of coconut milk and steamed were unlike anything I had ever eaten but they were yummy!

I loved the mango with sticky rice and the fried banana. We got the banana with honey. It was the perfect end to a great meal.

My real only regret was that the place was a little small and we were definitely really tightly packed in. But I will be back for sure!
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
How the heck did I pass this resturaunt by so many times??

Compared to other thai restaurants, you almost get the real thai experience. Rather than having walls, you feel like you're eating in a hut. The Angel wings are absolutely delicious, fried and marinated to perfection. I ordered the green shrimp curry and rice. My my my, it was delicious! I will defintely be coming back soon!
author: Brenda C.

description:
Cheerfully garbed cheerful staff.

Tasty roast duck.

Cozy.
author: Inigo M.

description: This is the benefit of living in the sunset. Truly tasteful and tasty. All the favorites you will see in most Thai restaurants but with excellent flavor and never greasy. Super friendly staff.
author: Matt H.

description:
Probably the most authentic Thai food I've tasted since I was in Thailand.

Eating here with a bunch of people is always a good bet, because it allows you to try a lot of dishes.  Things that were good: green curry, duck noodles, spring rolls, imperial rolls and spicy angel wings.  Things that were so-so: Soft shell crab green papaya salad, chicken fried riceand panang beef.

The food was good, but most of all I liked the owner.  She is funny, sassy and a total Mama bear at heart that likes to make sure you are fed and happy!
author: Nadiyah S.

description:
Marnee Thai is one of my favorite Thai restaurants in the city.  We come here so often that we've become a little tired of it. We've tried almost every item on the menu. My recommendations would have to be the Angel Wings, Beef Salad, Samosa, and Green Curry. The portions are good and the food taste authentic. There are currently two locations, both close in proximity of each other. I prefer the one on 23rd since their kitchen is in the back; away from the tables.  Also, I like the authentic Thai décor. Feels like your dining in a hut in Thailand. One drawback is the wait list. If you come early, there will be plenty of seats available. If you dine around 7pm, expect to wait ...outside since the restaurant is small. With that said, this place is not ideal for groups of 5 or more. 

The Good: Angel wings, Food is consistently good
The Bad: Waiting list
author: Yan W.

description:
I love Irving St. because they have a great variety of restaurants and places for snacks. Originally David L. and I were headed for Perilla, but apparently they're only open for lunch...It was a Wednesday I believe, so San Tung was also closed. Anyway...

The restaurant is very tiny like most other places in SF, but we were seated fairly quick. It was a full house on a weekday night, but the capacity was probably only like 15-20 people at most. 

Saw that their popular dish was the spicy angel wings and had to order that. The flavor was pretty good, could definitely taste the fish sauce if you're not fond of that...It was topped with fried basil leaves which David L. enjoyed. Wasn't spicy though. Also ordered yellow chicken curry and asked them to make it very hot, and white rice. Yellow curry was good, it had the usual onions, carrots and potatoes. Their added thai chilies were nice and spicy! Theres also a jar of fish sauce and peppers there for you to add more. Yum yum!

We only ordered two dishes, but it was enough to fill us up and for about $15?
author: Stine H.

description: delicious Thai food, and friendly service. This place has a big menu too, sure to have something for everyone. We were looking for a place in the Sunset open for a late dinner, and Marnee Thai did not disappoint.
author: Laurent L.

description: This place is small but the hidden menu offers some delicious authentic flavors that may not be for everyone. Especially the papaya salad with the crab. Yummy...
author: T L.

description:
I'm not going to miss many things about the Sunset. This is one of the few places I will treasure and sadly crave from across the bay. 

Marnee Thai is consistently good in terms of everything, from service to flavor to affordability (sp?)...you get the point. I always get one of their vegetarian curry dishes, all of which are great. I also tried the Chan Pad Poo last night (rice noodles with dungeness crab, green onions, and egg), which was outstanding. The portion sizes are controlled but certainly filling, as I have leftovers to eat today. 

Also, do it right and get the fried banana with ice cream and Thai iced coffee for dessert.
author: Rachel F.

description: The prices were fair. The food was hella good too. Everything was worth the wait. The waitresses were very nice and accommodating. Highly recommended!
author: Nika Xin P.

description: Crazy good Thai food!
author: Mari L.

description: We love Marnee Thai and go to both the Irving St. and 9th Ave. restaurants when we go to San Francisco.  We went to the Irving St. restaurant yesterday and we're very disappointed in the service and a little disappointed in the food.  We noticed that food was served first to people who came in after us.  The waitress took our order, then theirs.  So she turned in the last order before the previous order.  We did not order anything that took long to prepare.  The avocado salad that we ordered came after the several dishes served to the other table.  One dish that we ordered was stir fried beef with stringbeans, not spicy, and the waitress said okay.   It was spicy and so so.  We know the roti dessert takes time so we ordered while we were still eating our meal but we still waited 15 minutes after we finished eating. When I was ready to cancel, the waitress said it takes time.  I obviously knew that, that's why I ordered early.  Don't know if the kitchen was slow or if it was a waitress problem.  It definitely did not live up to past experiences.  We have driven up from the peninsula with out of town guests but after yesterday's experience we'll look for another restaurant.  Next time we'll to to the 9th Avenue site and hope that it has maintained its quality and service.
author: Marlene H.

description:
I would have given Marnee 5 stars because the food was freaking delicious, but that is until I read the reviews regarding their rat infestation problem! I'm glad to say my experience at Marnee was vermin free- thank goodness. However, reading those reviews did taint my experience because I'm starting to question their health inspections.  

Anyway, I did enjoy my food and it's possibly the best tasting Thai place I've tried so far in the city. I ordered the Pad Nor Mai which is a spicy meat dish (chicken, or pork) with Thai basil, onions, green peppers, etc It's listed under the "chef's suggestions" and I would definitely recommend this dish for folks who like their meals a tad bit spicy. Get it with a side order of rice! The service was pretty good, nothing to write home about but definitely miles ahead when compared to other Asian eateries.
author: Mey S.

description:
I haven't had Thai food in a while, so this was a wake up call that tells me I need to get some more Thai food. I ordered 2 Fried Rices (Mango Fried Rice and Pineapple Fried Rice). The Mango wasn't very sweet, but the pineapple was sweet. 
Ate in the day time.
Plenty of seats.
Good portion food.
The atmosphere is good.
author: James T.

description: I tried out the dish I try every time I hit a new Thai restaurant: vegetarian Pad Thai. And damn if it wasn't good! The last place I tried in SF had had me convinced that there wasn't ever going to be a place as good as Sam Cafe in Merced, CA, Marnee Thai has disproved that. The pad thai here was at least almost as good, if not as good as Sam Malathong's pad thai. The one thing I missed was having the option of different levels of spice.
author: Alexandra R.

description:
Went there with my friends.. loved the food.. great atmosphere, good service. 

Tofu dishes were just awesome. Ordered yellow curry chicken.. just amazing.. Loved it.. can't' wait to go again..

Make reservation! It is super busy.
author: Avi S.

description:
This place is famous for their Pad Thai and  Hot Chicken Wings.  I agree that they are the most tasty two dishes here.  Another special one is the Tom Yum Goong - it's like what you have in Thailand.  They provide great customer service here as well.

The owner won many excellent cooking awards both in Thailand and in the US.
author: Cholada C.

description:
OK. so i have a favorite thai restaurant that i go to and that i can trust to serve me good food each and every time. i was trying to like you Marnee, i really was... you get kudos for service by the main lady who's always serving us (i think she kept saying that she was on Eye on the Bay), and kudos for transforming the inside to a thai house.

but as far as food goes, you're probably number 3. tastewise and serving size, you still can't beat my number 1. 

the smaller portions threw me off, and the saltiness of some of your dishes made me ask for water a few too many times. and i wish you gave me spicy, instead of me drenching my food in spice.

Marnee, you get a bronze for 3rd place.
author: Summer R.

description:
I recommend the angel wing appetizer its perfectly marinated and it had just enough crisp in every bite. Everything else we got tasted delish I couldn't stop eating.

The best thing about this place are the people that run it, 5 stars for service.
author: Ann M.

description:
We've been going to Marnee since we moved to the Bay Area 6 years ago. It's still our favorite Thai restaurant after all these years. Although we don't get to go here as often as we did since moving to the East Bay, we always try to pass by whenever we are in the city. 

There are 2 locations: one on Irving and 23rd and the other on 9th. Both have small dining areas and are always packed, so make reservations before you go. We usually go to the one on 23rd; we like the authentic setting and the food seems a little better. We usually get the tom yum goong soup, green papaya salad, the angel wings, the pumpkin curry and the basa filet. The filet is our favorite -- you can order it with tamarind curry or with fresh garlic and pepper. Doesn't matter which one -- they're both good.  

The service is warm and efficient, but really, the food is the sole reason why people line up and squeeze into Marnee!
author: Dawne L.

description:
I occasionally used hear a yellow pages commercial on the radio alluding to this restaurant over a year ago when driving to work. A few months ago i was visiting a group of friends in the city and we decided to check this place out.  We went during the dinner rush on a wednesday night, we waited no more than 10 minutes and were promptly seated.  

     The service was really good, however I didn't think the food here really set itself apart from the many thai restaurants that I have been to (i've been to a lot). We ordered chicken pad thai, red curry, pad eggplant, and spicy angel wings as an appetizer.  All the dishes were good, but I didn't really understand how this place has received so many rave reviews on here about being so delicious and tasty.  It was mediocre.  
     I do give a thumbs up for the spicy angel wings though, it seems that with many thai restaurants there is an inconsistency in their angel wings.  Some thai restaurants serve the stuffed chicken wings and name it angel wings, however the angel wings here are the style that i love. Fried then stirred in a sweet and spicy sauce with a load of minced garlic and topped off with fried basil leaves.  Very tasty. 
   All in all, the service here was very good which is why i gave this place 3 stars, I wouldn't mind giving this place another try, maybe i'll heed to the advice of fellow yelpers on what dishes to order next time.
author: Elway K.

description:
I don't know why I never wrote a review about Marnee Thai!? This place is actually the first place I've ever had Thai food. I ordered the pad thai and the fish or crab cakes, and then my life changed. Now thai food is definitely one of my favorite cuisines. 

The pad thai is the best here. Get pineapple fried rice and their ANGEL WINGS. You won't regret it.
author: Amy X.

description:
This used to be one of my favorite Thai restaurants in San Francisco. However, after the waitress frantically killed a COCKROACH on our table... I don't think I'll be going there again. I know that restaurants have their share of... problems, but... I don't want to see cockroaches running around the dinner table, especially AFTER we were finished eating. Was it hanging out on the bottom of one of our plates? Did it catch a ride on the waitress? Seriously, where the heck did it come from?! GROSS. Offering a free dessert doesn't make it right either. We paid our bill and left.

Also, I agree with a previous yelper about the pushy and loud owner. There were 4 of us in my party. We ordered iced coffees, 2 appetizers and 3 entrees, thinking it was plenty of food. However the owner insisted that we order another dish. W-T-H! I was more than a little annoyed with her. 

It was a terrible way to start the meal, and the cockroach running around the table was just the cherry on top. Needless to say, I won't be going there again.
author: Irene C.

description:
This place has the best Thai food in the area. Their green mango salad is really good. What I liked the most was the curry and their stir fry dishes in their house chili sauce. I have to say, since my trip to Southeast Asia and having a taste of many curry and stir fry dishes, Marnee Thai is the only one that brings me back to those flavors. I've had both red and green curries so far, and both are very flavorful. It's also has a good portion of meat and veggies so it's not just a order of curry sauce. Unlike many Thai restaurants, they have a very good selection of stir fry dishes, curries, and noodles.

I will definitely be coming back here when I'm in the city.
author: Stephy Y.

description:
It's no use, I'm giving up!  There's just no satisfying Thai place in the Bay Area.  Fly to Vegas or Honolulu, the cooks in those places are actually Thai and more importantly, know what Thai food tastes like.

It's not that complicated.  Once you have the ingredients, which all these bay area returants have easy access to, making thai food that's tastes like thai food is a snap.

I'm Thai as you may have guessed with family in the resturant biz in D.C. and Bangkok.  

I'll have Marnee 4.5 stars for the pad thai but my rave review ends there.  Nothing else here was deserving 4 stars.  

I'll come back and try more of their noodle dishes but that's it.

Opal (of Opal Thai truck in Hawaii - SF native), please come back!  What happenned to all your buds in SF, couldn't you at least leave 'em your recipe for pad thai, for the sake of teaching future American Thai kids like mine what Thai food is suppose to taste like!
author: Surai J.

description:
I was underwhelmed, but perhaps it was because my expectations were too high based on the reviews. 

I ordered papaya salad, pad kee mao, and some other not so inspiring dishes. The reason I didn't order anything more inspiring, was because the menu wasn't all that interesting.   I think we ended throwing away the Pad Kee Mao. The noodles didn't have the greatest texture, there weren't many ingredients in the dish, and it just tasted like stewed tomatos over noodles.  It wasn't THAT bad to justify throwing it away, however we couldn't finish it, and as a leftover, it just wasn't enticing enough to pull out of the fridge to eat the next day.  
It is not better or worse than your typical SF Thai restaurant, which is why I am giving it a 3.
author: Jeremy R.

description:
aaaAAAAaaaaAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHLLLLLRIGHTY Then.
Here goes:
First my party of 5 made a reservation a half hour before heading out to the restaurant. We got there about 8:00 for our reservation at 8:05. The place was totally full, and we had to wait a half an hour before sitting down. Service was attentive but not good (read on). So then onto the food:

Appetizers:
We started with the Spicy Angel Wings which was the best dish all night.
Green Mango Salad- which was a solid interesting mango/prawn combination. 
Tom Kha - Again, solid, but nothing memorable. 

Entrees: 
Pad Thai - Just okay, again, nothing special.  We ordered two (one shrimp, one chicken) The shrimp came first, but before the chicken came...
The waiter mixed up our order for lamb and gave us another table's order instead of ours. When we brought it up, they just said they would just not give us the chicken pad thai to cancel the mess-up out. We didnt think that was fair because now we didnt get our lamb dish OR our pad Thai dish.  We ended up having to order our original dish again. 
But the duck dish we received was tasty!
Praram Phak - A peanut curry dish whos curry was too thin, and whos vegetables were lacking in flavor.
Pumpkin Curry - Again, the curry was too thin, and the dish was overall bland.

Dessert:
Fried Banana and Ice Cream - the banana was not hard, not soft as it should be in my opinion, and the ice cream lacking in flavor. 

At the end of the night, they charged us for 2 more beers and 3 more ice teas than we actually ordered. When we pointed this out to them, they revised the check, but the revised check still had 1 ice tea and 1 beer more than we ordered. They got it right on the third try (originally the check was $166, and that was lowered to $140 when we got the correct check).

I've been to quite a few Thai places, and I love Thai food, but this one was sub par in terms of food and messy in terms of service. Maybe it was a bad night, which excuses the service problems, but the food, well that doesnt really change from night to night. Im sorry Marnee I wanted to like you (I mean, they have photos of the top Chef with Iron Chef Marimoto!) but I would not return. I'm sorry but there is better Thai out there in S.F. I really dont know how they got the awards they did.
author: nathan z.

description:
food 5/5 
service 3/5
decor/atmosphere 4/5

If the food here is really it's only redeeming quality. The different dishes and curry types (green, yellow, red) were absolutely delicious. The red and yellow are slightly spicy and green is spicier but still considered mild. Over all, if you don't like spicy, don't come here. On the specials menu, everything is mildly spicy. The things on the regular menu actually labeled "spicy" means it is super spicy. Our waiter was very nice but not really attentive. He actually took food to the wrong table twice and gave the wrong tab (did not happen to us though). We had to flag him down, but he had a good attitude. I think there were only 2 waiters for the whole place, but still...I would come here again for the food though. And the price is good. Around $15 per person and had a bit of leftovers too.
author: Cecile S.

description:
love... the angel wings
love... the soft shell crab salad
love... the beef salad
love... the sea bass special (curry sauce)
love... the pad kra pow
love... the pad thai
love... the pad kee mao
love... the panang beef
love... ordering everything "spicy"
love... the motherly waddling manager
love... not having onion breath ALLLLLLLLLLLL night!!!

please marnee thai... give your sliced red onions a 10 min cold shower. your customers (and my girlfriend) will be thankful that you took that "bite" off the onions and that their breath isn't hummin all day. besides that, keep it up!
author: Brian L.

description:
Great Thai place. Super cozy and small so expect a line. Just make a reservation a half hour before heading there.

Food: 9
Service:10 (especially when the psychic May is there)
Ambiance: 9 (for a thai place)

Make sure to try the Spicy angel wings with Tofu.
author: Omar K.

description:
This just became my favorite Thai place.  After having lived in northern Thailand for over three years I have long searched for a Thai restaurant in the U.S. that serves a lot of the dishes that I miss and do it without losing the flavor.  Marnee Thai has done that and more.

THE FOOD

Some of the unique dishes you MUST try are the Morning Glory (it's vegan too!).  That was a staple while I lived in Thailand and was absolutely delicious last night.  There are actually some ascetic Buddhist monks who live on only morning glory... or so I'm told.  Not sure how they do that...

Also the Kao Pote Tawt (corn fritters -- also vegan) are hard to find elsewhere and were pretty good.  They didn't have as much flavor as I remember but they were nice and crispy so they must have hot oil.

Next are the "kah-nome kroke".  I can't remember what they called them on the menu... maybe coconut and rice crispy patties / pancakes or something like that?  They don't look exactly like they do in Thailand but they definitely nailed the flavor.  These are little coconut fritters with green onions, corn and coconut cream served on top.  They consist of flour, sugar, and coconut, so they're basically like a dessert.  The Thais usually eat them as a snack in the morning.  These are also vegan, by the way.

The soy protein salad (make sure to tell them no fish sauce if you want it vegan) was very tasty.  We also ordered the vegetarian samosas (vegan), which are not Thai but were very good.  I've not seen either of these dishes at other Thai restaurants.

The Hanglay curry is not vegan (might be able to be made so -- I didn't ask) but is an authentic northern Thai dish that I've not seen anywhere else.  If you want to try something different, this is a good one to try.

Finally, another one for the non-vegans, is the Haw Mok.  This is a delicious egg / coconut / meat and curry souffle served inside a banana leaf.  It's pretty incredible and hard to find at other Thai places.


EVERYTHING ELSE

They take reservations and large parties (we had 9 in ours).

The seating is pretty tight.  It's a small little restaurant and everyone is packed together pretty tight.  I didn't mind, but if you are claustrophobic or are looking for something a little more quiet and private, this is not the place.

The owner is probably one of the highlights of this place.  She is loud and definitely let's you know she runs the show, but she's also very sweet.  We did a birthday party and she got everyone in the restaurant to sing for our friend.  We gave one of our cupcakes to the spirit of the restaurant as good luck, at her recommendation, which brought back fond memories of doing this in Thailand.

She also told all of our fortunes.  She seemed to have a pretty good knack for reading personalities or at least telling an entertaining story.  It made for a great night.  I highly recommend this place.
author: Peter O.

description:
The food was amazing but May, the hostess, was even better! She picked me out from the table and gave me a reading that was dead on! The service and food was amazing! 

May is meant to have her own tv show. Oprah move over, May is in town!
author: Jenny P.

description: I love this place!  Best Thai I have had in the city.  Every time I go to MT, I order the Tom Yum w/Prawns and BBQ chicken.. and then try other sturff.. :) Pretty typical of the food I had in Bangkok when I lived there years ago.. Yum yum!
author: David H.

description: Very good service and the food was spot on.  Small spot but inviting and decorated with an authentic feel.  Tom Yum soup was great; could have eaten a few bowls!  Will be back for sure!
author: Saleem T.

description:
So I haven't been to the newer (closer to me) Marnee Thai on 9th, but I made it a point to trek it out to the orig for my encounter. And really, this place is GOOD... wait, GREAT. 

Love the inside bamboo-hut lining they've got going on. P'May is funny and really sweet. Always giving every guest personal attention. Everyone there is actually kind. Their interactions remind me of my family. Not to mention the food is on point. Like a fancied up mama's home cookin'. They even have homemade hor mauk(?) on certain weekends which is super hard to find. My dad LOOOVES that dish and it surprised me that they serve it. Try the duck red curry. One of my faves there.
author: Yui K.

description: Service has much improved. We've have been coming back for our special lunches and dinners. Food more consistent. They no longer pressure customers to order more. Dinner time can still get pretty packed but staff and kitchen handle it all in stride. After eating here 27 years, have to say it is one of our favorites.
author: jane f.

description:
The food here is delicious!  My BF and I ordered the Imperial rolls, yellow curry and pad see ew (it's misspelled, I know, sorry).  Unfortunately (or maybe fortunately) they brought us the chicken wing which although were incorrect were pretty fantastic.  They were sweet and tangy and crispy.  Very delicious.  But please, bring us the correct appetizer next time.  

The yellow curry was good, I would've liked for it to have been a tad bit spicier.  The pad see ew was great too.  I feel sometimes this dish is made either too too dry or too too wet, but Marnee nailed it.  

Service was great, except for the appetizer mix up.
author: Lesliegh H.

description:
The angel wings here are really good!

I ordered the pad see ew once and some type of other noodle another type.

They both tasted great!

Although the portions for that one of type, I think it was silver clear noodles?, was kind of small for the price...
author: Tiffany L.

description:
I really don't know why is this place is always so busy.  First of all, this is not the best Thai food i ever had, there are many others in the city that taste equally good or much better.  Second, the service is just ridiculously rude and despite their business longevity, they still haven't master a good management and customer services skill.

Things that bothers me:

1. super bossy boss lady,  apparently this is a common thing ppl feel, i am not the only one.  Boss lady always recommend WAY too much then you really need, having  their customers to "over-order" is common good strategy,  but somehow "Boss-marnee thai" is super good and never shy about speak-out in this area!   And if you are too nice and are the kind who tend to easily get manipulated, you will end up having left over of today's dinner, tomorrow's lunch and dinner. So be careful!!

2. reservation means NOTHING, don't bother, and always be prepared to be ignored walk-in.  And many times, they will swap you around so that they can accommodate other guests (so they can seat more ppl, maximize their profit!) i personally think they put way too much seats in the restaurant, the the space is so tight, i sometimes actually feel sorry of "boss-manee thai", cuz for her to walk/ and serve through the restarant must be  a close to a "mission impossible "!!  I just cannot see how would be possible for her NOT to knock down couple of things on the table here and there.

3. Make sure you are SUPER familiar and STUDY their dishes,  if you ordered something, and it came out to be wrong.  you either take it or be prepared to take her rudeness....  And make sure NOT to touch the dish before returning, if you suspect dish is wrong, but accidentally touched it, then its your fault!!!  b/c Lady boss would asked you" why you touch it???"  i do not know that's her motive for asking that stupid question:  first of all how the hell  would you know this is not right, if you didn't try it.  and secondly, why are you so "mad" and rude about the wrong dish if you are the ones made mistake?  should you be apologetic about it instead of asking me such a rude question?   are you gonna serve this to someone else if i haven't touched it???? is that why?? 


Anyways..... bye bye marnee thai.. good luck with your sucking service...i am going somewhere else!!!
author: Jasmin Y.

description:
Always heard rave reviews of this place so one late evening I was lucky enough to be in their neighborhood at closing  time but they let me in anyway. I was so grateful as I was both hungry and had this place on my list of restaurants to try. The owner, I assume, an overbearing woman, recommended the summer rolls even before I sat down and I was not given a menu (remember it was 10pm) so I ordered my favorite Thai dish Pad Thai with chicken.
