Way too much food for one person but felt obliged to agree to her suggestion as I was putting them out being it was closing time. The restaurant was still full and people seemed to be enjoying the ambience: young, trendy and very SF.

The summer rolls were not so special to write home about, mostly cucumber, bean sprouts, lettuce, not sure there was any shrimp in them as I did not see any. Maybe it was a vegetarian roll. The Pad Thai was definitely not the best I've had. As a matter of fact the chicken was very dry and tough. Very disappointed. Noodles, sauces, good. 

The older lady was talking to her helpers in Thai language the whole time I was sitting at my table eating.  It was both distracting and rude. Certainly not necessary or called for. Let people eat and talk in peace. No shouting to employees in a foreign language. Kind of disconcerting.
author: Robin L.

description:
I discovered this place on my last trip to San Francisco last year -- and it was SO good that I had to return again this year and had my boyfriend order the same thing: pad-kee-mow bedt (spicy noodles with duck).  

It tasted just as well as I remembered it to be, and the service was very prompt.  I'm notorious for asking for constant refills at restaurants (hey, a girl has got to get her 8 cups of water in someway!), but the waiters and waitresses here were on point about it.  The food came out fast as well.

I also tried something new last weekend -- I ordered their duck salad and it was okay.  There was too much of the toasted rice powder and that took away from the salad.  

However, I would definitely return back to this place for the spicy noodles with duck.  :)
author: Penny S.

description:
Tried this location today after taking a few years to recover from my experience at the other branch ... Long & short of it is both times beef was of markedly poor quality -- bordering on dubious ... Makes me wonder what it is that others are praising here ...

If you're in Inner Sunset location, Soi Gow one block away has better quality food for less ... In Mid Sunset location, you are surrounded by other Asian choices ...

Sometimes I wonder why low beef quality is considered acceptable in SF ... For example in Vancouver BC even a low to mid level Asian restaurant will always serve excellent beef ...

My advice -- go elsewhere
author: madam n.

description:
This is my momma's favorite Thai place in SF.  So of course, I've been coming here for years.  (Personally Jitlada in J-Town will always be my favorite, but I digress).  My mom's motto, at a restaurant, seems to be the more the merrier, because she always more than enough food.  And with Marnee's teeny-tiny tables, the plates overrunneth.  

The Spicy Angel Wings and Pad Thai are always a must when we dine here, and they NEVER disappoint.  I'm practically licking the plate clean afterward.  

This last visit we also enjoyed the Green Papaya Salad - which was divine, the Green Curry with chicken - also yummy, and Basa Fillet with garlic and black pepper sauce (you get a choice of sauces), which was very tasty, but the fillet was too small for my liking.  Although we were stuffed, my family always makes room for dessert, and we had the white sticky rice with mango - I could eat this by the gallon.

It's best to enjoy the food and try not to have too personal a conversation, since the tables are practically on top of each other.  You can hear everything your neighbors are discussing.  There was only three of us that night, and we were seated at a 4 person table by the wall.  The servers at Marnee Thai seem to have a system of going and crossing, since there are really only two aisles from which they can walk through to get to their tables.  Regardless, service was friendly and efficient.

I would give this restaurant a 5-star if it weren't for the occasional claustrophobia I feel when I dine here, or the fact that when you have to wait for a table, the space is very limited and you're regulated to standing outside, usually in very cold weather.  Parking in this area is limited, but if you don't mind a little bit of a stroll, you'll usually find something on a side street.
author: mariel v.

description: This place is AWESOME! The hot sauce- OMG! I think my bf and I finish the whole jar when we are there. Angel wings (we get tofu only) are so tasty. Pad Thai, Pad See Ew- always a good choice. And I dont know who the woman is who works there- but she is the best. She always tells you about a "deal" or some better version of what you just ordered for "only 1 dollar more." Trust her- she knows what she is talking about!
author: Zelason B.

description: Wow! So happy I discovered this place! Great food!!!!
author: Chelsea D.

description:
I've had Marnee Thai at the 9th Ave Inner sunset location and decided to give this location a try.  I know food isn't bad here but the service SUCKS like no other.  Let me say it again.  IT SUCKS!!!!!  

We walked in and wanted a table for 2.  The lady told us 5 minutes so we decided to wait.  A group of 3 walked in and the lady immediately seated them.  I asked really nicely that we came here first but the lady said "there are 2 of you, they have 3 so you have to wait for a table for a smaller table." Ok I'm fine with that I guess.  I walk outside to make a quick phone call, and a pair walked in.  Coincidentally, a pair just finished. Another lady was now taking the seating calls and immediately seated the pair that walked in after.  UH...I was here first!  That's what I told that lady, and she said "No, you just walked in right now.  They were here first."  WTF??  That's all I can say. POOR Service.  They should have a better system for seating people.

My friend really wanted Thai food and I'm pretty darn patient so we waited again. It was 15 minutes passed and they promised us 5 but what the hell?  I was quite annoyed and starving at that point but I was willing to give it another shot. What made this situation worst was that there were two empty tables.  They were not 2 seaters but seated 4.   They were not HUGE tables either so I didn't see why they wouldn't just give it to us. 20 minutes and going, more people came in.  They seated everyone but US!  The Thai lady keeps claiming that a table for two was going to open up soon but I looked and those people didn't even get their food yet!!!  Now, THAT really got me going and we just left the place.  Didn't get to eat there, but that's okay because I'm never going back.  They don't deserve my precious penny with that kind of shitty attitude and the poor management.

Yes, sorry...I am just venting about the place, but I think everyone deserves better service than that.
author: Shirley T.

description:
Marnee Thai was delicious!  My meal had the perfect amount of spice, the atmosphere was welcoming and the Thai ice tea was awesome. 

The only reason I can't give 5 stars was the delayed service.  While we were sat right away, it took almost 10 minutes for someone to get our order for drinks and food.

I'll definitely be going back!
author: Ashley J.

description:
I've tried many Thai places now, and Marnee Thai is not the best and not the worst. I'd say it's a bit better than the King of Thai Noodle chains, but still lacking when compared with Siam Kitchen. 

I tried the pad thai, pad see ewe, yellow curry with chicken, mango fried rice and homemade hotcakes. 

Pad thai: I don't really enjoy pad thai anywhere else except at Siam Kitchen because every other single place I've tried, including Marnee Thai, makes it overly sweet and sour and wet (as in too much sauce). Whereas at Siam Kitchen, pad thai is flavorful, not dry and not wet, and just excellent.

Pad see ewe: The pad see ewe was done really well. The noodles were just the right texture (not too chewy and not too soft) and the flavor was right. The only thing I would suggest is to not bother ordering it with any meat and just get vegetarian. I ordered it with 'pork' but basically just got two pieces of it; they put a lot of tofu in there. 

Yellow curry with chicken: My favorite dish out of the four that I ordered. Because it was a mild curry it was just the right spicyness and the flavor was spot on. 

Mango Fried rice: Nothing that we couldn't all make at home. Just add mango and tomatoes. 

Homemade hotcakes: These are the things that were so highly reviewed on Check Please. Cute little things and good coconut and corn flavor, but not worth the price. It was basically $1 for each bite. 

Overall: I was just content, but wish their portions were bigger. The flavors are good here but the price is a bit high for me for the portions they give. I would get take-out if I were in the neighborhood and in the mood for Thai.
author: Iknowasianfood C.

description:
Recommended by a neighborhood local, I was incredibly pleased with my take out.  First, I was greeted pleasantly (not always the case in this neighborhood), and given some hot tea while I choose from the menu.  I picked:

Potstickers with Green Curry
Chicken Satay wraps with spicy peanut sauce
Pad Kee Mow with chicken

The potstickers were quite literally inhaled.  The green curry sauce was honestly the best I've ever had.  I wanted to roll around in it and drink my way out.  SO SO SO GOOD.  The Chicken was nice high quality with beautiful butter lettuce wraps and a non-standard spicy peanut sauce.  The noodles in the Pad Kee were delicious and not overcooked.

I will return.
author: Goddess B.

description: The calamari salad was awesome.  The delicate flavor of the squid combined with the spicy lime dressing and bold flavor of the mint was incredible.
author: Rex C.

description: Awesome Thai food, you get items which are not available in typical thai joints. We ordered Angel wings which were awesome( which we liked better than Sun Tung wings) , Roaster Duck salad it was great tasting but got soggy in take out. Po Tak, too sour for my taste but my wife loved it, and Chan Pad Poo, really good noodles though I had to spice them up!
author: Manoj Y.

description:
Had a friend recommend this place to me today, as I was hungry and in the hood. 
I was one of only two non- Thai persons there. 
That should let you know how amazing it was. 

I had hot tea and medium pumpkin curry with fresh tofu. 
It was divine. 

The service was attentive and speedy. 
Highly, highly recommend.
author: A. H.

description:
parking is cramped on this part of irving.

so i complained before about the other marnee thai on 9th ave.  they charge 4 dollars extra for onions.

so i thought i'd give this place a try.  

the food here is JUST DELICIOUS!  AWESOME!  just like on 9th ave.  It should get 4 or 5 stars.

I asked for onions, they didn't charge me...but for to go...like at the other location.

I get there the place is packed, the food tastes great like the other one...AND the container is SMALLER!  So you get the onions without the 4 dollar charge but the OVERALL Amount is smaller.  

Now if i can find a place that serves food this great with the right proportions and price.
author: Bing D.

description:
spicy angel wings, pad kee mao, pad see ew, and their stir fried crab noodles are amazing. (sorry forgot what the crab one was called!) 

service is definitely lacking, but I still come here often for my thai fix because their food is just that amazing. 

don't go on a busy night with a huge group (friday / saturday) because they are a tiny hole in the wall and get really busy. 

the decor is amazing. looks like you're eating in a dark hut, dimly lit by tealight candles and fresh orchids at every table. 

overall, the food is amazing and describing it wouldn't do it any justice. You just HAVE to try it. :D
author: jennifer f.

description: Pad Kee Mao is the best!!! I've been here three times and will continue to come back!!! 2nd time they sort of skimped me by filling up my to-go container with lettuce under the noodles! But the food is spectacular!!
author: Jardel M.

description: I LOVE THAI FOOD but for some reason I don't like Marnee Thai. Their Pad Kee Mao is made with ketchup as well as their Pad Thai (which I think is weird). It leaves that weird sour/tangy taste from the ketchup in your mouth. I only go here when my friends want to go or that one time I was desperate for food and didn't want to walk around trying to find a place to eat. Service here is good but  honestly not my favorite Thai place in SF. I've tried their other location near Golden Gate Park and that one in my opinion is way better than the Irving location.
author: Nancy Y.

description:
Their food is absolutely delicious but the dining experience is a bit excruciating. This is primarily because of the hostess, who must be an owner or at least a relative. I can't imagine why that venue would keep her otherwise. 

She was loud and annoying, literally yelling across the small room constantly at the waiters as she sat like a huge glittering lump on her hostess chair, which unfortunately was close to my table. I assume she was giving them instructions but yelling in a language i don't know doesn't cancel out its intrusiveness. She acted as our waitress part of the time and we had to ask three times for water and twice for tea. Don't get me started on her TMI about the 14 medications she takes. I don't care; I'm on a date and we're paying for dinner. 

The hostess tried the trick that Chinese restaurants in tourist areas often do. As she was taking our order, she said 'you love so-and-so hot plate, you should try' and we said politely 'that sounds nice but no thanks' and she repeated 'everybody like, you try' and we again nodded 'no' politely. Sure enough, so-and-so hot plate was the first dish that arrived and since we had ordered four other dishes, we firmly sent it back. She made certain to mention that she didn't know how she accidentally rung up that hot plate, oh my, but of course she was upselling the meal and relying on our American politeness to 'swallow' the bill. I heard her chat up two tables surrounding us with the same schtick.

Service was reasonably paced but not consistent. Two groups seated after us got their food served before us. The tables are packed together, which isn't unusual for SF, but the prices are reasonable so i'm okay with them trying to maximize their space. I will mention that the hostess tried to get groups of two to 'share' a four-top, which was unusual and no one agreed to it.

Towards the end of our meal, as i squeezed past the other tables towards the restroom, i saw the hostess sitting at a table by the cashier. She was shoveling food into her mouth and talking open mouthed and waving her hands as the wait staff scurried quietly around her. Suddenly i remembered the mother from the movie Wild at Heart. Stick a dark wig and Asian features on that character and you've got this hostess.

I suggest that you take out from this location -- the food is truly yummy -- or go to the Marnee Thai at 9th & Irving in Inner Sunset. That venue is almost a Five Star rating because the amazing food has a notable absence of crazy lady flavor. When i arrived at this Marnee Thai last week, i realized that i had been here a few years back and wondered to my boyfriend why i hadn't returned. Well... i remember now.
author: debbie r.

description:
Came here again, but this time food tasted different.  

Pad Kee Mao is not the same as the Pad Kee Mao from King of Thai (which is one of my fav) 

Green Curry was soooooo spicy that 3 people cant even finish it. 

my friend wanted the fried banana with ice cream (BORING!!!) so i recommended the Roti with ice cream and she fell in love.  

Other than the curry being wayyyyyy to spicy and pad kee mao doesnt taste or look anything like the typical ones i've usually order. i still love this place ;)
author: Anna W.

description:
I love this place!

Best Thai food I ever had in the Bay Area and the service is great.  I can't pick any one item to recommend, because everything I have had is delicious.  The servers can make recommendations - and whatever they recommend is fresh and extrodinary.
author: Le T.

description:
I come here now and then, and so far I've been pretty satisfied with the food.  Today, i guess I got here around the time they opened since I was the first one to be seated.  I always order the Spicy Angel Wings here and it's probably the reason I keep coming back.  

The service was really good.  The waitress checked in every so often to make sure everything was okay and refill tea.  

It seems like there are a lot of regulars as well.  Not long after we sat down, there were more people coming in and they seemed to know a lot of them.
author: Rachelle T.

description:
Seems to me like some others have also felt the wrath of the angry boss lady. Like I always say there is always some other place that taste just as good, if not better, and comes with good service. We left without eating because they gave our reserved table away. We were on time. They messed up and tried to blame us. No need to argue we will just eat elsewhere. 

Next time please do not do these things:
1. Its rude to ignore us when we come in the door and tend to people standing behind us. 
2. Don't take a reservation sign off a table and give it to people that are walk ins.
3. Don't blame us for your booking mistakes. That in no way saves you but further angers customers.
author: Sylvia V.

description:
I use to live in San Francisco and Marnee Thai was my "go to" Thai food in the city.  I'm here for the weekend so as soon as I landed I had a craving for Thai food.  My friends and I went from SFO airport to Marnee Thai.

It's just as I remembered - the decor was kitsch - the service lacking and the SURPRISE for the night was the food was not a good as I remembered.  The crab and mango salad was great to begin the meal - the mango salad was refreshing with fresh julienned mangoes and great dressing.  The green curry chicken was bland and yes spicy but again - BLAND.  The Pad Thai was overcooked with noodles soggy and stuck together and didn't have a lot of flavor.  I was surprised.  

The little Thai place I loved is now mediocre and no longer fabulous.  Marnee Thai was a 4 star for the food and 2.5 for service but now food and service 2 stars.  I'll give you 2.5 stars for the memories of great food.
author: Rox P.

description:
Absolutely my favorite Thai restaurant in San Francisco.  I've tried several different Thai restaurants across California and this spot still remains #1 in my heart.  

The food is amazing! Although they are smaller portioned than what most Thai restaurants would serve, the food is just amazing.  My favorite is the mango salad and the Tom Yum soup!  

The place is a bit smaller than most restaurants, but it is almost always packed with people when I go in the evenings.  The wait for a table isn't too bad if your group isn't too huge.  Once you get a table, you are elbow to elbow with your neighbors.  

The service is good.  They will come to you when called and always provides what you need. The owner, this joly lady, reads fortunes from time to time.  I love her because she's always willing to make sure everyone is happy and content with the food.  She's one of those owners who goes around talking to the customers.  

Will always come here!
author: Reb R.

description: The food was delicious! I really like this place because they showcase different ideas. For example, we had the pumpkin samosa, which are amazing and edamame  potstickers with green curry, now why didn't I think of that recipe. They also have traditional entrees like the red curry and pad thai, excellent. This place made my taste buds dance...
author: Ashley C.

description:
My lazy ass is way overdue for this review (hey that rhymes!).  

Found out aboot this place on Yelp and decided to take my parents there when they came to visit.  My girlfriend at the time introduced me to Thai food and I never looked back!

First things first, this place is SMALL.  I think my room back at SFSU was almost the same size.  Luckily it wasn't too busy and we were seated immediately.

We started with some Thai ice TEAS, Fresh ROLLS, IMPERIAL rolls, and the SPICY ANGEL WINGS.  All were fresh tasting and the sauces they came with were awesome.

For the main dish I kept it simple and had the PAD THAI.  It came to my table with steam emanating from its goodness like a fat turd on cold grass.  Now this was my second time having Thai food and those noodles still rank as the best Thai I've had.  This place is no joke.

MANGO AND STICKY RICE=Best contribution Thai people have done for the world.  Much more important than Bangkok hookers and Muay Thai dahahah.

The service wasn't the best since we had a very young girl who might have been new to serving and the English language, but it wasn't bad either.  In the end it's all aboot the food.  

See you on the opposite side of the tracks!
author: Eddy A.

description:
This is my favorite Thai restaurant and I love the food here! 
It is a little pricey but its' worth it. 
My boyfriend & I usually get some curry & the curry is delicious. 
I love their satay chicken w/ peanut sauce!!
they have this appetizer that you wrap with a leaf in peanuts, lemon, dried coconut shreds, some other stuff. I was surprised this small appetizer was around $10 but it was yummy. A little odd with lemon but it tastes great!
I love the fried tofu w/ sweet sauce, the Angel wings were alright but I prefer Osha's Angel wings. 
Definitely recommended :)
author: Carmen L.

description:
Came here on a Saturday around 6:30pm and it was obnoxiously crowded.   Thank goodness we were only a party of two and were seated almost right away.

It's true that this place is wayyyyyy too crowded.  To the point that I am sure it is a fire hazard.  Servers can barely squeeze through.  I would say this restaurant can seat 30 comfortably but somehow it looks and feel as though they have squeezed 50+ people. I had to sit so close to my table that my ribs were pushing up against it.  My husband was not comfortable either since he could not stretch his legs.

On to the food.  We ordered Angel wings, crab fried rice & Pad Kee Mao.

Angel Wings - pretty good.  About 7 pieces.  Saucy, good texture, good flavor.

Crab fried rice - too salty for me.  Tasted very basic.  Didn't think there was anything special or insanely delicious.

Pad Kee Mao - tomato based.  Very different from King of Thai.  Husband thought it tasted like it was cooked with ketchup.  I thought it was fine.  Again not a dish to really rave about.

Another note: there is only 1 person (who i assume is the owner) taking orders.  Trying to flag someone down to take our order, bag up our left overs, and get the check was a bit of a hassle.

I would give this restaurant another try.  Hoping i can select another dish on the menu which will convince me to raise my rating.
author: Terry D.

description:
6 of us:

Thai iced tea - yummy
Spicy Angel Wings - I likey. Pretty saucy, and I like them more than Santung wings, though people think they are similar.
Corn Cakes - crunchy, corny (haha!) what could go wrong? fried well, too!
Tom Ka soup - has this curry like taste, sour, spicy, good!
Pad Thai - good larger pieces of egg and plenty of shrimp. pretty yummy and usually i'm not a huge fan of pad thai
Chan Pad Poo - sorta like Pad Thai but with crab. I liked it with crab.
Panang Beef - chunks of beef, but a bit on the dry side (the only thing less than average for us)
Green Curry with Chicken - was good, too!

Service was good. Food great as usual. We were full. Well-fed. A little cramped, but otherwise, I'll be back!

+ they give you tamarind candies when they give you the check!

too bad there was no room for dessert. i heard the roti with ice cream is good. when will there be room for dessert?! when?! you tell me. i guess i just have to control myself next time and eat less.
author: Anita C.

description: Marnee Thai is up their on my list of favorite Thai restaurants in SF. The hospitality and environment give off a more traditional feel than other places that are just trying to be trendy. All the workers here are pleasant and personable. The yellow curry was fresh and served up a la carte and not too overly doused in coconut milk. The pad thai was awesome as well. I liked the fact that the peanuts and such were off to the side rather than sitting atop. Overall definitely a top choice if you are in Sunset district and looking for a more traditional style of Thai without all the sassafras.
author: Elijah A.

description:
Love, love, love their Spicy Angel Wings!  

Great family-run place.

Parking is a b*tch.
author: Derek N.

description:
After seeing the reviews on Bay Area Check please, we decided to check it out. Being a "yelper", I read many reviews - positive & not so positive. We had reservations for 6 at 7pm. We sat at 7:20 thanks to May. She and her staffed worked very hard to accommodate the standing room only crowd. 
May suggested and redirected our order and she's free to do so for me anytime I go back. We were very kind to her and she was very kind to us. She got the entire place to sing happy birthday to me during rush hour. May is a class act and this place deserves 5 stars on food and customer service. I don't know what the negative comments are about regarding the attitude of staff - I suspect that you get what you give. Go Marnee and May!
author: David P.

description:
One of my favorite Thai restaurants in the city. Everything here is so flavorful. Highly recommended!

Their angel wing are delicious!  You MUST try it! No seriously. You'll thank me later. One of my favorite dishes to order is their "Chan Pad Poo." Its a spicy noodle dish with crab meat, eggs, and green onions ($8.25)! Its soooo good! If you like crab, then you might like this dish. I absolutely LOVE it! I always order it when I'm craving Thai food for lunch. Their Pad Thai is also very good and flavorful.

I came here today and decided to try their green curry (around $8). I ordered it with shrimp. Everytime I order shrimp, I always count how many I get. I'm sure you do that too! =P  Anyways, there were 6 total.  It was good but very spicy! It was so spicy my entire mouth was burning! Luckily, I had my Thai ice tea! Next time I'm asking for mild. I know, i know, I'm such a wuss. 

But forreal...Come here and try their angel wings. I promise you'll fall in love with them. =)
author: B B.

description:
Went for dinner with a friend. We got the Pad kee mao and the avacado salad (with no prawns). The noodles were so-so, had a really strong tomato taste to it, normally its more of a basil/chili/garlic taste. The avacado salad was really good! It was pretty sweet, so make sure to order something savory with it, to cut thorugh all the sweetness.
The service was really good, super friendly staff. The place was packed! We went on a Monday night, and stayed for a couple hours chatting, the place was busy the whole time!
author: Bijoli S.

description:
Marnee Thai

My friend and I were initially going to try out the Korean bbq near here, but they are closed on Tuesdays so we decided on Marnee Thai since we had Chabaa already. And note to all this is the second time I have been here but the review is based on my most recent visit considering the last time I was here was 5-6 years ago.

Luckily when we came in we were seated immediately. The place settings here include a spoon and fork, so my friend asked for chopsticks. I find it kind of odd that they only had a place setting of only a spoon and fork, usually they had chopsticks as well. Not a big deal since we got the chopsticks. The waitress gave us water with lime inside, very refreshing, however it did take them a while to refill my water.

We started out with Golden Triangles, which contained pumpkin, potato, and curry in a skin very similar to fried wontons or samosas. It tasted very much like samosas (which is one of my favorite Indian food appetizers). It was on the spicy side but I didn't care because it tasted delicious. I am not a huge fan of spicy foods but I made this an exception and if I come back this will definitely be on my appetizer list.

I ordered Pad Se-Ew, in my opinion it seemed more flavorful here than at other Thai restaurants I have been to. Also I like that they put regular broccoli in it rather than Chinese broccoli. My friend ordered Chan Pad Poo, yes weird name but it was actually pretty good, it contained crab and he ordered it a little spicy ( too spicy for me so I only had a little). 

Our eating experience was very good, our palates were definitely satisfied. However like I said before the water wasn't refilled as quickly as I would have liked, by the time the appetizers came I was almost finished with my water and it took them until after I was serving seconds on my entrée when they gave me more water. They weren't even busy, so I don't know why they lagged on the water. That is basically why I am not giving this restaurant  5 stars. Aside from that the food is awesome and I do plan on coming back, but I am bringing my own filled water bottle next time.
author: Mandi S.

description:
I stumbled into this place based on Yelp "nearby" search on Valentine's Day when I foolishly decided to go out to eat. Every restaurant was packed, but it was only 6pm, so I ended up squeezing into Marnee. Squeezing indeed, since the tables are about a foot away from each other.

The decor was festival and the specials menu was tempting. We ended up ordering Thai dishes we had never heard of before and it was such a good choice! If you're out to try some Thai that isn't the typical pad thai or pineapple fried rice, definitely come try Marnee.
author: Wendy T.

description: I thnk this is the best Thai food in SF, been coming here for over 10 years, the service is great, the food is excellent and I have never been dissapointed, the 9th and Irving location can be a little noisy, but the food quality is the same. I love the coconut cakes they make in an ebeiskiver pan, I wish I had the recipe. Love every dish, they always have cripsy fried tofu, not soggy like at some places and their pumpkin curry is so good. So glad this gem is in the city.
author: Gen W.

description:
Alright.  I went here with big family... so space is kinda small.

Food price seemd a bit more.  

and the owner, she reminded me of a "mother" type figure...

But food was great!  Service was great! And once I got to know the owner, I understood why she was that way.  She would make space for people waiting and if people left, she would go after them!!!  

She's really nice and I gotta admit... this was one of the better places I've been too.  Very good all around.
author: Roger A.

description: Very good food and very cheap prices. The mango rice was excellent and we also tried 2 of the curries, both of which were very good. Shrimp was also very good size and very good quality. Definitely try it if you're in the area.
author: Tamara M.

description:
Larb Salad, Garlic Pork, Panang Curry, and Phad See Ew plus rice. We had 4 dishes for 3 people and it was way too much food. All of it was delicious, but the motherly lady that runs this place definitely upsold us! :) Anyway, we arrived here on a Sunday night at around 7PM and we had to wait about 30-35 minutes. The place was definitely packed and groups of people were trying to cut in front of me since I was by myself. My hunger prevailed and no one cut in front of me. :)

The food was  was really flavorful and delicious, but the service wasn't that great because it was so crowded and it's definitely pricey for Thai. I think we ended up spending over $50 for 4 dishes (keep in mind though that the garlic pork was the suggestion of the hostess/maybe owner/waitress and it was one of the pricier dishes on the menu).

I come here whenever I am desiring a solid Thai spot to eat. It's worth the wait and the price, just not an every week type of thing. :)
author: Jenny B.

description:
Everything here was fantastic and oh do I love Thai food.

We ordered the Tom Yum Soup, Chan Pad Poo, Gai Samoon Prai, Pumpkin Yellow Curry, Sea Bass Fillet with the Garlic and Black Pepper Sauce. We also topped off our lunch with an order of the Fried Bananas with Coconut Ice Cream. 

Wow what did we not order? 

Everything was seriously delicious and affordable. I walked away super satisfied and happy. I can't wait to come back and eat more.
author: Zona P.

description: With all of the high praises of other reviewers, you'd think this place walked on water.  While better than your average Thai restaurant, I think that this place is just 3 stars.  Where this place does excel is the the charismatic owner who walks the room and has perfected the Thai/Asian up-sell and sweet talk.  Those not from the culture may easily fall for this but sorry my eyes are wide open.  The model is the same as the House of Nanking, another Asian restaurant, that understands that proper use of customer service can increase your bill by another 25%.  So not a bad place, but the food was not that superb that it would make me make a special drive.
author: Laurence H.

description:
After roaming around J-town's Cherry Blossom Festival and hanging out at Baker Beach my companions and I had built up an appetite.  Sadly we were too late to get our Ike's Place sandwich fix but thanks to a quick call to a co-worker, he highly recommended Marnee Thai so off we went.  Upon entering, the place was packed (a definite sign in my book that the food is going to be good) and the intimate setting and decor made you feel you were in another country. 

We ordered the following: 

Green Curry Chicken Potsticker - different and so tasty
Tom Kha Kai - great balance of sour, spicy, and sweet
Chicken Fried Rice - had big pieces of chicken and egg
Chicken Pad-See-Ew - really good (hard to mess this one up)
Shrimp and Scallop with curry - Highly recommended.

During our meal we chatted up with Marnee, the owner.  She suggested the shrimp and scallop dish to us since most of our order was with chicken.  We were glad we took her advice as we all enjoyed that dish the most.  She sat at the table next to us as the dinner crowd was thinning out.  Marnee was a delight to chat with and I appreciated the fact that she interacted with her customers and knew most of them personally.  She made our visit really enjoyable and the food is sensational. I will definitely return for sure and next time I'll probably buy her cookbook.
author: Grace C.

description:
This place was Michelin recommended and I found it good but not amaaaaaazing.  I've had a lot of thai food in my day and wasn't too impressed by this place.  Also, what also brought the ratings down was the service.  Most thai restaurants are very attentive but this lacked that luxury and they also didn't do a very good job at taking our orders.  It felt rushed and we had to ask several times for napkins.  There weren't any at our table.  When they brought over the napkins they only brought two and there were three of us.  We  had to wait another 5 or 10 minutes to get someone's attention.  If the restaurant was extremely busy I could kind of understand but they weren't. 

One thing I did like a lot was their softshell crab and mango salad.  That was yummy.

If the service was better maybe I would think differently about this place.  Service is always a factor in whether or not I would consider going back to a place.  If that is lacking, then I have to say... ummmm maybe I would go again.  More than likely I will choose somewhere else.
author: Marita S.

description:
This is probably my 3rd visit to Marnee Thai and it was an excellent experience. Mamma san (for lack of a better name) was an excellent, but loud, host. The service was prompt (minus an untimely angel wings order), the restaurant was small and very cosy, and dinner was overall a good experience. Now on to the food...

Tonight we started with the green curry potstickers which were a surprisingly good combination. This was followed with a prawn and scallop yellow curry which was my dish of the night. The yellow curry had a nice sweetness and complexity to it. 

We also tried the garlic seabass that was fried, covered with fried garlic and served over a bed of bok choy. The duck curry and mango fried rice were also good but nothing mind blowing.

I also heard the angel wings were a must have here, but in my opinion both San Tung and Porno have better wings.

Over all, Marnee is a SF staple for Thai food and I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Byron C.

description: I am in love with their yellow pumpkin & beef curry! But their red chicken curry is a so so because the chicken is too rough and overcook!
author: Rebegi G.

description:
Great thai food. 
Great atmosphere.
Great waiter service. 

My favorite dishes from this place include their duck fried rice, pad see ew (sorry for the spelling errors, don't know the proper way to spell it) with chicken, and their green curry with chicken.

I like that none of their dishes are especially oily, salty, or sweet. It gives me a little taste of Thailand, which I definitely miss visiting now. Their portion sizes are fitting. Their food quality is also kept up. This is a place I always visit with friends and family. Love it.

Definitely would recommend this place.
Obviously would return myself as well (:
author: Kelly C.

description: Perhaps theres better Thai food out there, but I've yet to find it. This small scale restaurant in the Outer Sunset has never disappointed. The Chan Pad Poo is one of my favorite Thai dishes, the spicy Angel Wings are wonderful, really everything has been great over the many times I've dined in or had take out from here.
author: Colin F.

description: The main courses we ordered were not bad, but probably would have gotten 3 stars except for the Angel Wings were very tasty and were definitely the star of the meal.
author: Gyasi K.

description:
The food was definitely amazing!! I would certainly go again just for the food alone, but the environment was a little crazy. I'm used to waiting in line for food, especially during rush hours, but once I was seated after I made a quick phone reservation, my friend and I waited for who knows how long. The wait didn't bother me too much, but once multiple tables who came after us began getting their food (similar to what we ordered), I began to question if they even got our order at all. Not only was everything quite cramped, but one of the workers was yelling throughout while blocking the only way to the kitchen. There definitely needs to be some tables removed, as they couldn't manage to properly seat and take care of all the customers. Even we were missing utensils while the couple next to us were missing plates. 
Overall, the food is great, but during busy hours, definitely not the place I would recommend (maybe unless you order takeout- but be wary of the wait)
author: Diane S.

description:
I came here last night for dinner before heading out to a party. It was my first time here and a friend recommended it. The food was awesome. I tried the spicy angel wings for appetizer and the pad kee mao as an entree. Both dishes were fantastic. The spicy angel wings was very saucy. There were a lot of garlic and basil in it. The title says spicy but it was not spicy at all. It also has an option where you can add tofu to it. I recommend doing that. The pad kee mao was very yummy. There were chunks of crab meat in it and it was a bit spicy. I loved how they added garlic to it. I think anything with garlic makes the food taste better. 

The owner of the restaurant was very nice. She came to our table a couple of times to talk to us. She made the 1st time experience memorable.
author: Joyce L.

description: Ive been going here since I can remember. It can be great or good but never bad. I love the Crab Noodles.
author: Mario A.

description:
okay, I've been back twice now and they haven't played the offending song. In fact, the music for the most part was very much in the background, which was great. They did play what sounded like the cousin of the offending song, but it was okay. Maybe I am just sensitive.

Food was awesome as usual. Tried the new coconut cake which is somewhere between an appetizer and dessert, it was good. And lately I can't go without ordering the mango & sticky rice which is heavenly.
author: Audrey H.

description:
I like the food but had a weird experience the first time I came here--the waitress scolded my friend for not ordering food. She told him she would let it go this time but that it's not appropriate to come to a "dinner house" (her words) and only order a drink.

His drink was a few dollars and he was with 3 other people who were all getting food.

Also, the next day I found a piece of wood in my leftovers. Obviously I've continued coming here because the food is good and cheap, so neither of these things are dealbreakers.

It's also super crowded/loud if that is a problem for you.
author: Amanda V.

description:
One of my favorite Thai food places to go to! I love everything about this place. I've had almost everything too. 

The pad thai, spicy angel wings, papaya salad, yellow curry, you name it! I love this place for it's genuineness, it's delicious food, and home-y feel. I always feel welcomed when eating here because the lady (I'm not sure if she's the manager or not) but she always makes sure all the customers are enjoying their meal, not only me. i've brought my family here, and they love it too. 

The portions are really generous as well. I can never finish all my food unless I'm on a hunger strike and haven't eaten for days.

anyways, happy eating! :)
author: Liberty C.

description: May the manager or owner? She was very nice and recommended a lot of dishes when we were ordering.  We had about 12 dishes and 4 adults 3 kids.  So we had a good overall taste of the staple thai stuff.  It was okay, pretty good at most.  My favorite was duck red curry, I asked for super duper spicy and it was just a little bit spicy but still my favorite.  Angel wings and the hot cakes were something May said its most popular and we must try it.  I liked the flavor of the angel wings, but after a few pieces that sweetness and saltiness was too overpowering also the hotcakes, i don't think i can eat more than one of those little silver dollar sized cakes that is a mixture of corn, coconut, pumpkin and rice cake, so sweet and just too much.  I think its more for the american taste bud that loves the more flavor in things.  i'm chinese, i cook and all asian food should be a light tasty umami experience, not heavy flavors like "orange chicken" which is fried, then sauteed in a wok with heavy sauces, that's more american style and it works here in america i guess.
author: Kevin L.

description:
We've been here couple of times.  Their Spicy Angel Wings are so delicious, I was scraping the sauce off with the wing bones.  My husband got the 5 spice pork over rice and I had fried chicken over rice.  They were both good.

This location is very small and the intereior space is tight.  If you have a large group of people, call in for reservation if they take it.
author: Chris R.

description:
Came here with a group of about 10 people for dinner. Overall the food was okay. Service was below average(one lady owner/waitress was yelling at different people all the time, also they turned down my simple request regarding the salad dressing, see below)

Plus:
some interesting dishes that other thai restaurants don't normally serve.

Minus:
The owner/waitress didn't allow me to have the dressing/sauce on the side for the pork salad. To me this was unacceptable. I have dietary restriction that was why I requested that. I don't believe they use the sauce to marinade or cook the meat so why not have the customers choose NOT to mix the sauce??

My thai friend who was also at the dinner said the food wasn't really that authentic. I myself found some dishes too sweet. Customers should watch out for their seafood related dishes(sea bass)which can be quite pricey given the relatively small portion.
author: kat c.

description:
I've always had a good experience at this restaurant; good Thai food, the quality of Thai food was good, good service, good prices. BUT until one day, where I wanted to bring a good friend here for his first time to try it out.  We had to wait in line for a while, sure no problem because it's a good Thai place, the owner of the restaurant who is a Thai woman, took the service to an unacceptable level with my expectations of service as a customer. And might I add that I strongly believe she is a gold digger? (just money hungry to pry from customers who are well off/loaded/rich/upper class, whatever you want to call it. Trust me, I can tell, but not sure if anyone else can, but hey maybe that's business, but very unprofessional and disrespectful), when I come from a middle class background. She basically gives more attention and better service to "them".

  This was about literally 3-5 years ago and I will never forget it because it was so insulting to my friend and I. So we waited in line for a while, about 30 mins I believe, we were a group of two and we were next and that's what the owner told us.

  There was a group of four "farangs" (white person or foreigners in Thai, not being racist, but just putting my point out here) behind us, but my friend and I were first. A table for four suddenly opens up; so for a first come first serve basis, they seated the farangs behind us first instead of my friend and I. That was a total slap to my face because we were told we were next, but the "farangs" behind us got ahead of us. Sure, maybe it was maybe more efficient in terms of it being busy, but don't tell us we are next if you are going to sit a group behind us first when we could have sat at the table of four. Maybe you could have gave the other 2 seats to another group of 2. 

  So my good friend who was disrespected from that unexpected move, we ended up just eating at the KFC/Taco Bell on 20th and Irving instead. I not only lost face, but my friend did not get a chance to try out the food from this restaurant.

  From then on, I decided to take my money and dine at the other Marnee Thai on 9th and Irving after. Always had good and better experience there than this restaurant.
author: Pudgy G.

description:
Place is wonderful.  Previous reviews were spot on in that this offers a huge selection of excellent Thai dishes at a very reasonable price.  The decor is charming and simple, really brought back memories of being in Thailand.  The papaya and calamari salads were excellent as was the soup.

This is the closest thing I've found to traditional Thai food in the Bay Area.  If they could get fresh Mangosteen, I'd be there every day!
author: Cr G.

description: We went here for the first time a few nights ago based on yelp reviews and a friend's recommendation. They were slammed even thought it was a Tuesday night, so we wound up waiting about 15 minutes for a seat (the place is pretty tiny/cramped). I had the coconut cakes and the mango fried rice, and both were quite good. Also, thai iced tea was great, which is key to my enjoyment of thai food. Service was fast and efficient; not overly friendly, but seemed about right given the crowd that they were working with.
author: Pat M.

description:
YES this place has the best thai foods around SF. I usually order the pad see eww or the typical pad thai. so yumm..fairly priced and food came out fast too.

ive been here twice and both times, i was pleased and full!
author: Cali L.

description:
Okay, the food is pretty good.  The owners are super nice and friendly, but the wait is mind-boggling.  The first time we went there, it was around 9PM and the waiting for seats part doesn't last long.  It's quite misleading because once you sit down, and order, the food take FOREVER to get to you.  
The first time, we got a whole variety of things.  We of course had to get the angel wings from other Yelp recommendations.  They were pretty good, but my family and I reached a consensus that we much prefer the wings from San Tung....There was a bit too much sauce on these Angel wings to be eaten as a mere appetizer.  I also got the corn fritters, which were pretty good but not as crispy as I had hoped for.  

The second time, my friend and I ordered a mere three dishes for takeout, thinking we would have a set time to wait, pick the food up and go home to eat in comfort.  Well, we ordered, and they told us it would take about 15 minutes.  So we went to wait in my car.  After about a safe 20 minutes, we went back in for the food, and they completely ignored us standing there for a good extra 25 to 30 minutes.  Even when they gave us the food, there was no apology in any way shape or form for making us wait for so much longer than they had told us. It was rather infuriating.  I got the green papaya salad with soft shell crab, and we also got fried rice and pad thai.  Albeit the food was pretty good, the wait and the rude service from the employees were - in my opinion - completely not worth it.
author: Jane K.

description:
One of my favorite Thai restaurants of all time! I discovered this gem when I lived in the Sunset (close enough to walk there). I moved away & made it a point to eat there when I could get up to the city. I even brought my brother who was visiting from Washington DC to this place on New Years Eve a few back. Everything is super yummy--the basa, pumpkin, fried rice, satay...

It's crowded, but not bothersome--they always accomodated my group that includes a stroller. Don't go during peak weekend dinner hours & you should be fine.
author: Ashlee F.

description:
My first Yelp review :)!!!

I called ahead to see just how busy they were on a Saturday night. I should've known from the get go it was going to be packed. I put the reservation for 7:30pm under my friend Tiffany's name since my name isn't always pronounceable. I actually made a reservation for both Marnee Thai locations to play it safe.

Parking was beyond impossible at the 9th Avenue restaurant so we headed over to this one. There was a crowd outside but we went to find the hostess since we had a reservation. The hostess thought I said Stephanie instead of Tiffany when making the reservation. She thought we stopped by 10-15 minutes earlier and "went for a walk" so we were next to get seated HA. She told us it was going to be a 10 minute wait which turned into almost half an hour. The restaurant is pretty small so I'm actually surprised that we didn't have to wait longer!

Anyway, my friend and I basically figured out what we were gonna order while waiting so we can hurry up the process. We were starving! We ordered the chicken satay, chicken red curry, chicken pad see ew and thai style fried rice w/ prawns & pineapple. We hadn't made a decision on what meat we wanted w/ our fried rice and the hostess said "You ordered too much chicken! Too much koko! Have some shrimp!" so that's why we got the prawns haha.

Everything was delicious! Of course, we ordered wayyyyy too much food but we were able to enjoy a little bit of everything and it was good! The pad see ew was a little spicier than I would've liked, but still good nonetheless.

The only downside was when I ordered my drink. They give you sodas by the can w/ a cup of nice. I got a 7-Up and it semi-exploded when I opened it leaving my side of the table all sticky.

All in all, I'd come here again. I'll just try to go on a day that's not so busy next time.
author: Justine O.

description:
I have to be very honest.  Marnee Thai 3 years ago gave me FOOD POISOINING. I ended up in ER at Stanford. It may have been the seafood and rice and were old.  
During the night at 2am I drove myself to Stanford Med. Center ER.  They indicated it was food poisoing and gav
author: Razz T.

description: I love coming to this place. I've been coming here on and off for about three years now. Their food still amazingly tastes the same still. I find this to be one of the best Thai restaurants in the city, though I'll admit I haven't tried many... The two dishes I always get here are the angel wings, and the mango fried rice. Thai iced tea is really good here too. I believe the restaurant is family owned, and their staff is always very friendly.
author: Derek T.

description: Good Thai Food.Good service.Ate here on my wife's birthday and they even sang Hpy Bday to her along with the other customers.Nice!
author: Ed B.

description:
When we walked in, the 1st thing I smelled was the hot & sour soup. I had really want curry, but the smell was so good that I had to order it. They also had summer specials so we decided on the avocado salad with chicken as an appetizer. We wanted a final veggie dish so we ordered the Pad man kuer. The waiters & waitresses were very attentive and friendly even though it was extremely busy and crowded.

Avocado salad: very refreshing and opens the appetite. Little bit tart like the Vietnamese papaya salad.
Po tak (seafood spicy & sour soup): spicy but tasted as good as it smelled. Full of flavor that explodes in your mouth.
Pad man kuer (egg plant): lots of egg plant and tender. No tender chewy pieces.

Definitely would come back.
author: Kitty K.

description: Great Curry! We have been there a few times and food is consistently great. Small restaurant.
author: LJ E.

description: One of my favorite Thai places! It's a small place and it gets crowded so make sure you get here before the rush or reserve. All of their plates are tasty and offers that quality, authentic taste.
author: Vic C.

description: This place gets a perfect score & was truly perfect in all categories. This was probably one of the best Thai dinners we've had, and we usually love the Thai food in our hometown of Fremont, CA. First of all, the service was great, fast, & frequent. We did not have to wait to be seated (called in advance to make sure there was seating available) or for any request. The decor is great the inside is like a thatched hut. The food was outstanding This restaurant had unique items such as the coconut hotcakes which are small bite sized items that are incredibly delicious &  slightly sweet. The acovado salad was also a unique item not usually found at Thai restaurants. We also had the panang protein, the pad se-ew, and the spicy ma kuer, along with steamed rice and Thai iced tea. All vegetarian of course. We'd come back here when we visit this part of SF or our good friends there.
author: Mihir M.

description:
If this review were purely for the food, Id easily hand out 4.5 stars. No question the food is good, this particular location has a cozy interior as well. 

I guess the reason for the overall 3 stars is cos of the rambunctious lady who Im assuming was the owner. She seemed to be in a hurry to get us to order and did not have a very hospitable demeanor. I was mildly offended with the way she was interacting with us and at some point a patron at the next table leaned over and said, "Im a regular here, and she does not mean badly". Well that allowed me to not take things personally, but when I go to a restaurant, Im looking for a somewhat different experience. Oh one other detail, though Im told there is usually a line out the door, this time the were almost at capacity, but its not like there were people waiting to get seated while we were taking our own sweet time.
author: Vivek N.

description: Got take out from here last night and thoroughly enjoyed it. The samosas were yummy. Like Indian samosas but had a yellow curry flavor to it. The Thai Fried Rice and Pad See Ew were healthy portions and delish. The penang beef and pad ka gram (not sure of name. Basically chicken in a peanut sauce on a bed of spinach) were amazing. The food was ready quickly and the people were friendly. Can't find 1 thing to improve based on this experience which is saying a lot for me.  On second thought...there is one potential item. I can see how parking can be a hassle given that there is only street parking available.
author: Sunil R.

description: The tom yum soup was unbearably salty as if they accidently threw the whole salt shaker in there. I was disappointed by the soup and did not have any more after the first couple of sips. I ordered the duck red curry but they brought over shrimp curry instead so we sent it back. The duck red curry was good and so was the fish dish (forget what it was called). The waitress came to our table at a certain point and tried to empty the soup in the serving bowel into one of our bowls. I was thinking WTF. We ended up telling her it was ok, that she did not have to do that. It was strange, my only explanation is that they were running short on soup serving bowls. Too many things gone wrong. I like the location on 9th a lot better. I don't think I will come back to this one.
author: Helen L.

description:
Best Thai I've had so far.

Small cozy place.  Real excellent service.  Delicious food.  Portions are just right.

Pad Thai with silver noodles are too die for.  And their BBQ chicken was juicy and flavorful.  The tom yum soup was the best I've ever had.  

If you haven't tried, do so sometime in your life.  It'll make you smile!
author: Chai S.

description:
Was looking for some good Asian cuisine while hanging out at ucsf. Our wonderful nurse, Emily from pedi-cardiac ICU suggested this place. 

3 words - IT WAS GOOOOOOOOD
3 more words - WE LOVED IT

We went simple not knowing what we were venturing into...lol. I ordered crab fried rice. Hands down THE best I have EVER HAD. FRESH, LIGHT and ALL AROUND DELICIOUS!

Highly recommend them. Customer service was great as well.
author: Dymples T.

description:
the place is really nice, and if you go quite late, at the end of evening, you will enjoy much more music and silent around you.
staff is so friendly and they all take care about you explaining plates and recipes.

what you shouldn't miss is crab noodles (spicy is better!) and thai tea. anyway, everything is so good, but i love thai food so that's why! :-)

prices are honest and sometimes surprising, considering quality.

so definitely a suggested restaurant for you all!
author: Davide milidolo R.

description: My first time here was 5 years ago on a first date.  The place was dim because there was light outside, but I don't remember anything about the food or what it looked like inside.  But I knew it was small.  I guess being rated the best Thai restaurant in San Francisco really makes it legitimately good!  The decor is exotic but homely because it gives a busy-bustling feel, everyone sits closely together, and there isn't a huge stench from curry and asian sauces.  Speaking of which, nothing was super salty, which could be good.  We ordered the Spicy Angel Chicken as an appetizer (best dish we had, good chili-sauce, not super sweet like the sweet chili sauce on most fried chicken wings out there), Pad Thai (noodles were chewy and the sauce and salt was just right), Red Curry with chicken (it didn't taste like curry because the viscosity was lighter than most, and it didn't have the herbal/curry aroma--it seemed watered down by coco juice instead of coconut milk...i'm not sure but that's my inference), and a beef dish which my friends said was gamy, having a more lamby texture (they couldn't finish it). They also serve wine which I thought was a little silly, but the crowd finished their bottles.  I would rate this place a more upscale Thai restaurant, nice for a table-for-two.
author: Janet T.

description: This place is a go to for thai food. There are several other thai places along iriving, but this is my first pick. There isn't as much as a wait here as there is at the 9th & irving location. Everyone is nice and the food is really good. This is definitely a smaller location. The prince is average, around 8-11$ per entree.
author: Kristin S.

description:
Marnee Thai is my FAVORITE Thai restaurant!! Linda N. took me here 8 years ago and I have yet to go somewhere that beats them. This spot on Irving is their original location. They have a second location that is farther up Irving on 9th Ave. This particular location is super cozy and when you walk in, you feel like you're in an adorable straw hut. There are orchids on each table and is super clean with white tablecloth and white cloth napkins. 

They've won numerous awards for their Pad Thai in Pad Thai cook offs and competitions. That is my favorite entree here. The Angel Wings appetizer is probably the most juicy and saucy I've had. (I'm drooling thinking of them right now. *wipe wipe*) Their green curry and green mango salad is super yum too. They have different desserts but their coconut ice cream on top of their Thai pancake that has condensed milk drizzled over it is something I always have to leave room for.  Remember to order their creamy Thai ice tea to wash it all down. The servers here are all dressed in traditional Thai clothing. They all know what customer service is and are very friendly and attentive.

If you're looking for a drool worthy thai restaurant, reasonable prices, and traditional warm Thai hospitality~~ Marnee Thai is the place to go.
author: Rie P.

description:
My wife and I saw the review of Marnee Thai on "Check Please Bay Area" last weekend.  With a friend needing a ride to SFO we decided to give it a go and meet another friend at Marnee Thai for dinner.  First impression was "Wow!  This place is crowded!"  Even though we had a reservation we still had a group of ladies that were seated before us, sans reservation.  Whatever, its all good we are not in a rush.

We sat down and began the process of figuring out what we want.  I love Thai food but I am hardly an expert and really could not tell you this from that if you asked.  But in my defense I do eat alot of Thai food and know what I like and always willing to try something different.  We orderd the hot cakes, yellow curry with chicken, pad thai and green beans.  All were really good to awesome!  The two that stood out to me were the hot cakes because they totally rocked and the pad thai because it was surprisingly not to my liking being very sweet and one dimentional.  Otherwise it was a great visit.  Even the baby liked it there!  He ate some of the potatoes in the yellow curry (his first ethnic food by the way) and we was totally infatuated with the boss lady.  I think she is Marnee but I failed to ask her.  

We will most definately be back to explore more of the menu and share this place with some of our friends.
author: Tyler A.

description: The food here is decent and the owner is really nice and sweet. She makes sure that you like what you order and even recommends dishes. My fave dish here has to be the Chan Pad Poo. It's not my go-to Thai restaurant though.
author: Fallon P.

description:
In my quest to find really flavorful Thai food like I'm used to getting in Honolulu, I took the recommendation of a friend to drive into the sunset to try Marnee Thai. I love the atmosphere with lots of bamboo and woven mat decor on the walls and ceilings. It seemed very traditional, as opposed to the super modern designs in places like Osha.

The food was better than most Thai restaurants that I've tried in SF, but still, there wasn't enough flavor in the curry and basil dishes that we ordered. I wanted a surprising 'POW' in my month when I take that first bite. Instead, I just got a 'well, that's nice'. 

Also, there isn't any sticky rice served. That's just sad! The green papaya salad was okay, but try ordering it vegetarian. Otherwise, it's served with those little dried shrimp that have a very overpowering flavor.

So, I'll try Marnee Thai again and see if there is something that will go pow in my mouth. I'll let you know what I find.
author: Rex D.

description:
I'm really convinced that great Thai food doesn't exist in "Thai" restaurants here for the same reason that great Japanese food usually doesn't come from the corner sushi shop.  It's not an issue of authenticity or ethnicity.  For sure, the people who staff Marnee are Thai; either that or my Thai dining companion was speaking Pig Latin to them and not his native tongue.  

The main reason Thai food isn't usually great is because it's hard to do right.  As I've noted in other reviews, people expect French food to be hard and expensive.  But Thai, Indian, Chinese, Japanese, etc. etc., well those gotta be available at some random corner joint, executed to your grandmother's tastes, perfectly, and for el cheap-o to boot.  Because they're, uh, "ethnic" and somehow simpler and not up to the standards of Fine Western Dining.

As usual, the laws of physics apply.

If you get a green curry with random bits of mystery chicken meat in it, guess what?  It's not exactly up to the standards of an indigenous, regional, insanely-fresh cuisine.  It's tasty enough.  I've had amazing Thai green curry before; its flavor should be "bright," like the ingredients were just discovered that morning under some rock, and yet magically they became one.  Marnee's isn't that.  At least it's spicy and rich.  But the chicken is unlovely bits of odd white meat.  Is there some law that asian restaurants can't roast chicken whole, every day, break it down, and serve it to order?  Oh wait, only Zuni Cafe is expected to make great chicken.  See above about our collective expectations.

Beef with string beans:  meh.  Sweet-ish, gritty sauce, and more mystery meat of a cut undetermined and unknown to all.

Mixed seafood with "fresh" green peppercorns.  This one I quite liked, the sauce was a dousing of oily red spiciness, but each bit of seafood was tender and not overcooked and, best of all, identifiable.  It certainly seemed like the fish was fresh.  Given our extreme proximity to great seafood, that's not much to ask.

Avocado salad with green papaya, shrimp.  Room temperature shrimp (jury is out on that one), a mush of sloppily prepped vegetables, nice seasoning.  No real texture.

Marnee was touted by my Thai friend as the best in the area, but I suspect that is damning it with faint praise.  The food is certainly edible.  It's not fine cooking though and, frankly, we won't great Thai food in the area until we change our outlooks a bit.  Most of us don't know what great Thai food is but I suspect that, like obscenity, "we'll know it when we see it."
author: J W.

description: I absolutely love Marnee Thai,  it's my favorite type of food, so I have tried lots of places and my meals here are always fresh and delicious.  My family comes here often, there may be a bit of a wait sometimes, but all in all, one of the best Thai restaurants in the city!
author: Monica L.

description:
Wow! This place is packed during dinner! Luckily, my friends and I only had to wait 10-15 mins to get seated. We arrived at 7 with a few couples and people waiting outside. I thought the wait would be at least 45 minutes, however the lady seated us pretty quick after seating all the people before us.

This place won sooo many awards for their food. I haven't tried many of their dishes, however their food is great! I LOVE THEIR ANGEL WINGS! 

I agree with all the reviews on the busy and crowded atmosphere. However, I felt the service wasn't that bad. They help you serve your rice when they bring you the rice pot, and they're constantly refilling our water. The lady checked up on each table and asked about the food and how we're doing.

Despite the long wait, I definitely recommend to try Marnee Thai. The taste of thai food isn't the typical thai food you get at other thai restaurants.
author: Thomas Y.

description:
Terrible Experience!!!  I ate there fifteen years ago and the waitress was so rude I refused to return there.  Unfortunately last week I ordered take out there and though I'd give it another chance.  The time to wait for our food was twice as long as we were quoted and when we got home we discovered they got our order wrong.  We called to tell them about it and all they could do was repeatedly ask what we ordered.  We ate the food and it was miserable.  We ended up giving it to the dog.  
Poor dog!
author: mixedtofu y.

description:
It's mid-afternoon on a Thursday.  Even though only four other patrons are joining us for lunch today, the volume level is nevertheless quite high.  Plates and glassware are clattering as they are stacked for the evening crowd, and the chefs are chopping and cavorting as they prep the kitchen for the Marnee Thai main event:  The Dinner Rush.

We started with Thai pot stickers that are out-of-this-world lovely. Next came a generous salad, quite nice even if the dressing was a touch overpowering.  No biggie...we ate it all.  Our entree was fresh seabass with curry and Thai basil over brown rice. Good and recommended. Now what can you say about brown rice? I know it's a commodity...but Marnee's might be the best brown rice I've ever sampled. 

The venue is baseline...defintely a destination to fill a food craving rather than the full dining ambience. Marnee Thai is on board for a repeat visit. I won't be fighting through the crowd or stalking a parking spot or standing in a queue to gain admittance. Rather next time I'll likely slip in again for late lunch or early dinner.  And after the potstickers I'll be trying some of Marnee Thai's more exotic selections.
author: K P.

description: My favorite Thai restaurant in the city. Never had a bad meal here. The angel wings, mango salad and Tom Yum are the best!
author: Lana B.

description:
-For lunch-
It's not as crowded. 

Well, the service usually sucks but damn. A waiter gave us menus and I was looking at the lunch specials. It was past the lunch hour already, so this lady walks over, and literally GRABS THE MENU OUT OF MY HANDS and says "Sorry, Lunch time over". What the eff. That was hella rude. 

You just went from 4 stars to 2. 

-For dinner-
The wait is always long, even if you have reservations. But their food makes up for it.

The food is delicious, but pricey. Their thai iced tea is too sweet. The service sucks sometimes because they're so busy.

 I like how that old lady wears a bright pink dress.

Anyway. The food totally deserves 4 stars, but sometimes with the wait and the rude service, I'd rather not come here.
author: Christina X.

description: Best Thai food I've had in a long time!!!! Excellent mango shrimp salad, summer rolls, and green curry! Deff will come back my next trip! Excellent fast service! A million stars!
author: Katie D.

description:
Its been years since i've gone to Marnee Thai, I think the last time I was here was when I was still going to school...the only I remember from that time was the Angel Wings..they burned the hell out of me...they were so spicy back then. Either that, or I just had a low tolerance for spicy.

But anyhow though, fast forward it a bit. Now I've never really enjoyed Thai cuisine all that much and its partially because of that time I got food poisoning from it..(review on Yukol) So from that point on, Ive never really trusted eating Thai food..i know its a horrible and wrong reason to shun out a cuisine but I just couldn't help it.

My lady though loves Thai food, she even has a friend who owns a Thai Restaurant. So after dodging the idea of eating Thai food for so long, I finally loosened up and start trying Thai again.

Anyways, so we finally decided to come here and now I wish I had started eating Thai sooner. We ordered the Angel Wings which were not spicy and was very tasty. A lot of garlic but still good. We also had the basa filet, now this comes in your choice of 3 styles of sauces. I dont remember what sauce we had but when I post up the pictures you will know. That was incredibly good, I could just eat that with rice and call it a day...and last but not least we had the duck pineapple fried rice. Marnee Thai did not skimp out on the duck and the pineapples had flavor to it. Usually most places that have pineapple fried rice, their pineapple always ends up with little or no flavor..just a bland fruit.

Overall we were very pleased with this place, especially me and I guess thanks to Marnee Thai I can really stop being so weary about getting food poisoning from a Thai restaurant.
author: phillip w.

description:
I had been to the other location before my Yelping days, but this review will be for this location since I was just here. After being told we'd have a 45-60 min wait at both Nopa and Nopalita, my friend and I were too hungry to wait and decided to come here. We were seated immediately and quickly put our order in. I went to wash my hands and minutes later our order if crispy sweet and hot Angel Wings arrived. I remember this as the standout dish from my last visit, and it did not disappoint. Crumbled, crunchy (fried?) basil leaves sit atop a 6 pack of saucey wings. 

Our entrees followed just as soon as we finished the wings. We shared a special which was a red curry pork dish with perfectly steamed broccoli. The curry was not spicy at all, but very thick and chock full 'o flavor. The pork was tender enough to cut with your fork and again fresh basil made its presence felt. Very nice serving for $10. Our noodle dish was the classic Pad See Ew. I've had better and worse. It was good, no complaints, but I almost wish we had gone for something a tad more 'out there' as the menu has a good deal of items I've never seen or heard of before. 

All in all, Marnee is a very solid Thai choice. The atmosphere is a tad cramped (we sat next to two college aged valley type bimbos that were all "like OMG" using their 'outdoor' voices) but the food is spot on, and the service is polite and attentive.
author: John L.

description:
This is the original Marnee Thai.  The one on 9th is the second venue.  In my opinion, this one, like most originals, is the better of the two.  Plus, if you are easily entertained, this is the location where you will find the overweight owner brusquely shouting in Thai to her staff.  She is an uproarious hoot, but not everyone thinks so, as you can tell from a skimming of the reviews.

The restaurant is a modest, cozy size, a no-pressure type of place where friends and family can get together and eat family style with ease.

The food here is delicious.  All of the curries are great, especially the green curry (with beef, chicken, pork, or prawns), yellow curry with chicken (you can get it with lamb or prawns, too), red curry with roasted duck, and Mussamun chicken curry.  They also provide the option of having the curries vegetarian using vegetable soy protein.  The pad thai, green papaya salad, and Thai fried rice are also very tasty.  They are known for their angel wings, which are spicy, garlicky tender specimens deep-fried to a crisp.  The basa filet is a chef specialty and pretty much a homerun.  For dessert, definitely get the wonderful roti.  The coconut ice cream and Thai iced teas are also delightful delectables.

Service can get slow, but Marnee Thai is usually a full house.  And, of course, the caricature of an owner is not everyone's speed.  I am in the friendly camp.
author: Dee C.

description: Good food great staff and close to home....my one addiction is the coconut sweet rice w/ fresh mango for dessert, they also had a soft shell crab salad on special which was yummy lolz
author: jonathan h.

description:
Can't find a single flaw with this place... except that they should expand! I really love the interior of the place, and I'm not one to notice these things usually...

The food's delicious (love the yellow and mussamun (sp?) curry, pad-see-ew especially) and the service is pretty awesome. I know there's been some bad reviews about the service, but that's really confusing to me... every time I've been here, they're always quick to order and ask if we need anything, and check in. They're so friendly and nice, and they seem to fill up your water after each sip. What amuses me is sometimes there's a lady who will ask "how is everything" then keep walking without waiting for a response, lol, like she has just been programmed to say that.

Price is decent too. I'd say it's a toss-up between this place and Chabaa, which is just a block away... just from my habit, I think I'd still go to Chabaa though. Also it's less crowded at Chabaa. Yup! Yum yum.
author: Daphne L.

description:
Came in for lunch. Decent prices. Pleasantly surprised by the quality of a food. Will definately come back again and again. 

OH and cleanest restroom ever.
author: Jordan P.

description:
Screw King of Thai! This is the best Thai food in the city.

Angel Wings (spicy chicken wings) are hella good! You need to try it out. I always get the Chan Pad Poo here. It's like a crab noodle I believe. It's soo good. Highly recommended! I've also tried the green curry and fried rice and it's also very tasty. Go get your Thai food here!
author: Vivian L.

description: When the little Thai woman tells you what to get, get it.  Don't ask questions, don't disagree, don't even think about it.  Just do it.  This is the best Thai food I've found in San Francisco - they've earned their excellent reputation.  We had an avocado salad the last time we were there that I've been craving ever since.  My sister-in-law loved it too, and stopped by on her two hour drive to the airport the other day, just for the avocado salad.
author: Cori D.

description:
Good service and good food. 

BUT they lost our credit card, and still made us pay for the meal. Not cool.
author: Jeff F.

description: Just ate here last night. It was delicious! We had the seasonal hotcakes to start.  They were delightful! The smooth texture and delicate coconut flavor ...mmmm...delicious!  I then had the veggie pad thai which had an ok amount of veggies (would have like just a bit more) and an excellent flavor.  My friend had the green curry and loved it as well, the brown rice was particularly good.  The atmosphere was great, very welcoming.  Bonus: left overs were scrumptious today too.
author: Jennifer W.

description: This place has the best Thai food I've ever had. I had the spicy angel wings, chan paw poo and sticky mango rice for dessert. The spices were spot on, and portions were relatively large. Very authentic Thai cuisine, at really good prices.
author: Eric L.

description:
I really didn't want to write this review since I've always really enjoyed Marnee Thai in the past, but I had a horrifying and completely unacceptable experience here last week that will ensure that I will never eat at this location again.  

We were in the middle of a delicious meal when my bf noticed that the kitchen staff was freaking out about something near the wall by us.  We both looked over and saw that there were MICE behind the rafters!  You could see their noses and their feet peeking out from behind the rafters and you could see them moving the rafters as they frantically ran along the walls and ceiling.  Then they started shrieking and squeaking loudly, at which point Marnee strategically turned up the music in hopes of drowning out the noise.  We were HORRIFIED.  What's worse is that throughout this ordeal, they did not close the restaurant!  They simply put "reserved" signs closest to the action and allowed people to come in and be seated a little further away so as not to interrupt business for the night.  We, for obvious reasons, lost our appetites and asked them to pack up the rest of our meal (which was unfortunately most of it, since this all happened pretty soon after we were seated).  We were not comped in any way, nor did the staff apologize or in any way acknowledge what had happened.  

We threw out our leftovers the next day and the bf did a google search to see if there was any record of what had happened.
