Apparently, if you go to the SF Department of Health website, you can see the health inspection scores of any restaurant in the city and what they have been cited for.  I'm going to warn you in advance that you will not like what you see for most places.  It's time San Francisco makes restaurants display their grades in their windows like LA so things like this don't happen as easily and so that restaurants actually have to close while dealing with their vermin problems.  People get sick from this!

It's safe to say that I'm NEVER going back to this location of Marnee Thai.  

P.S.  Please reference Wini H.'s review also, since she was apparently there the same night.
author: Julie S.

description: Had a very traumatizing experience here! The owner of the place kept pressuring us to order more food despite the amount of dishes that we already ordered. There were two people in the restaurant who were harassing the waitress so the owner yelled at them and they were arguing to a point where it was getting dramatic. People started leaving without finishing their meals. Yet we all still had to pay full price regardless this incident. Food was ok but really not worth the atmosphere. If you really want to eat their food, I suggest going to the other location. Unless you do not mind eating while hearing screaming voice from owner to the kitchen or possibly some customers.
author: Pinkglitters G.

description:
Pretty decent for the price. Reasonable quality and quantity. Slightly pricey, but its common in this location.

Can try it once, you might like it a lot :)
author: Aussfchi R.

description:
FINALLY A THAI PLACE I CAN EAT AT! yes yes yes!!!!! 

Their portions are a little small, but the food was DELICIOUS!! 

Their service is a little hectic so I totally would recommend you to get it to go, and it doesn't matter what time you go, it's aways slow!! 

one complaint: their curry was tasty but it wasn't as dense like I am used to, and their chicken wings weren't anything special.... however, the next day it was better... questionable.......
author: Nina M.

description: I don't understand the fascination with this place. By the experience I have of Thai food, this is okay. I'd say most things just don't have enough flavor. But the main reason I give one star is because of the BAD SERVICE. The lady made us move from the seat we were in just because that fit the people that had reserved a spot. She should have kept the reservation into  consideration before she sat us down. Apart from that the service is very brief. I've come here 4 times and whenever I need something I need to stand out to get their attention. The main woman seems polite but that's because she says thank you and please after every sentence, even if it's not needed.
author: Sergio G.

description:
Marnee Thai has the best authentic Thai food, hands down!  Their service is great as well. I swear, they filled my water and my tea cups every 5 minutes!

 Dishes you MUST order:

ANGEL WINGS- i see why they call them angel wings; its like you died and went to heaven, they are SO good. literally to die for! its under appetizers on the menu, but i like to eat them with rice and the rest of my main dishes. the sauce they use for this dish is kind of sweet and garlic-y. just take my word for it and try it!

TOM YUM SOUP- this soup is very sour, spicy and refreshing. a great addition to your meal. i like the soup with shrimp.

PAD SEE EU- my favorite noodle dish! once i tried this i said good bye to pad thai, although that dish is great too. i guess i just really enjoy the FAT noodles and the flavor. 

Basically, anything you order here is going to be great! I highly recommend this place if you want REAL authentic Thai food.
author: Jackilyn B.

description:
If you like to enjoy your meal with background chants of thai spoken word, then this is the place to go!  Their choice of music is so peculiar. 

The food is mediocre. The highlight of our meal was the fried chicken- perfectly marinated with garlic and house special spices. With the accompanied sweet dipping sauce, the chicken was delicious! Though at nearly $10 for 1/4 chicken, it better be. 

The mango fried rice was too salty and without a hint of mango flavor.  Boo =( I had to order a separate order of steam rice to accompany the fried chicken instead.

I actually prefer Chabaa right down the street.
author: Shirley W.

description: So good!! We decided to eat here after seeing all the wonderful reviews. The angel wings are amazing as was every other item we ordered. The whole red snapper was delightful with tons of flavor & what a presentation.  Fried banana with coconut icecream & mango with sticky rice were the perfect ending to a perfect dinner. The service was very friendly & helpful. Price was very reasonable. We will definately make the drive to eat here again.
author: Katie R.

description:
Horrible experience at Marnee Thai tonight.  As we were eating, we heard the sounds of mice or rats squeeking and scurrying above in the bamboo rafters.  At first I thought it was just the sounds of birds coming from the music they had playing, but after hearing it throughout the whole stay there we realized that it was definitely vermin practicing backflips and somersaults for the next rat-lympics.  No amount of music you play can drown out those noises.  We became quite paranoid that one of them won't stick their landing and fall through the ceiling into our plates.  When they finally traveled down to the bamboo walls right by our heads, we packed up and got the hell out of Marnee Thai.  We informed the waiter about the situation but no words of apology were returned.  When we got home I realized that I didn't want to eat anything that may be contaminated so into the trash went the food.  Sorry Marnee Thai...I'm trying to have a nice meal at a clean restaurant and not a theme park so please get rid of Mickey, Jerry, and Speedy Gonzales. 

Two other rat reviews:  http://www.yelp.com/biz/marnee-thai-san-francisco?q=rats
author: LittleBird 8.

description:
Birthday dinners are always a difficult thing to figure out. You want good food, but you don't want to go to all the usual places because, after all, you only get one birthday per year and that shouldn't be wasted on the usual.

This was our dilemma when trying to choose a restaurant for the BF's Mom's birthday dinner. After hearing about Marnee Thai earlier in the week on "Check Please," the 4 of us abandoned all East Bay plans, and ventured wayyyy out into the Sunset  to check it out.

Though traffic made us late, we still got there *just* in the nick of time (6:45pm on Friday). Right after we were seated a line seemed to magically appear in front of this tiny Irving St. restaurant. 

Pros:  The OMFG-Amazing Food

Between the 4 of us we had 8 different dishes, and not a SINGLE ONE was bad! The Angel Wings are no joke, and the Chilean Sea Bass with Garlic Pepper sauce was a force to be reckoned with! I ordered a yellow curry that was made with shrimp & scallops, and for once it did not have potatoes in it!! The Avocado Salad was also really really nice cool and refreshing with a solid spicy kick from behind. The 4 of us split a fried banana with coconut ice cream, and it was heavenly. If summer had a taste this, my friends, would be it.

Cons:   The Atmosphere/Service

Ok, so, we were a tad late for our reservation but we had still called in advance to warn them. Of all the empty tables in the house, the waitress had us sit at the 4-top RIGHT next to the bustling kitchen door. She also denied all of our requests to push 2 2-top tables together so that we could have a better ambiance. Best part? When the restaurant got busier they definitely pushed tables together for other people. 

Sitting next to the cashier & kitchen area was extremely loud, and towards the end of our meal another waitress actually pushed a 2-top (with 2 people seated & eating) so close to us that we might as well all been at the same table! Now, we're a pretty flexible group, but the couple who got shoved underneath our elbows were not happy with the experience.

Also, we were all pleased that our food came out so quickly, but we couldn't help but feel like we were being rushed by the wait staff because the restaurant was so busy. I was shocked that they served us our check along with the dessert without asking if there was anything else that we wanted. 

Overall: 

I give this one 3 stars, yes the food was absolutely beyond amazing but the overall atmosphere was a bit overwhelming. I honestly think I would have given Marnee Thai a better rating had I not had to tuck my elbows and squeeze out of the way whenever a new order came up. Maybe give it a try on a weeknight??
author: Caty K.

description: Outside of Thailand, the best thaifood I've ever had.  Most of the other patrons are Thai which is a good sign.  You will hate yourself if you don't try: angel wings, hot cakes and hormok (sp?).  Damn.  Fit for foodies.  Quick and pleasant service.
author: Ottis M.

description:
Once again, another review for a restaurant that already has too many reviews, but I love to be superfluous.  
Marnee is the old standby for our lazy takeout needs.  We just call them up, order our yummy and consistent food, and they say 20 minutes.  For some strange reason, no matter how long we wait to go and pick it up, we still have to wait at least 5 minutes when we get there, which is awkward (there is no place to wait, so you are just waiting in everyone's way).  Even if we give them an extra 5 or 10 minutes. Oh well, no one is perfect.

Disclaimer: 
Sadly, I've never eaten in at the restaurant, so seated service does not apply to this review.
author: Cami B.

description:
It seems like Marnee Thai is no longer "the place" for Thai, as everyone's going gaga over Lers Ros and its crispy pork belly and uncommon dishes. But Lers Ros, while perhaps slightly more authentic, just isn't that good.

Marnee Thai is. All of the ingredients are fresh, and you can really taste all of the herbs in every bite. Everything Thai food should be, and extremely affordable too.
author: Mark A.

description:
When I want to eat Thai food, and I mean really eat THAI food, i find myself at Marnee Thai. I have not had any better Thai food in SF. this place is so good that you can't help but want to order everything and eat it all in one sittng. It is that GOOD! mmmm... yum

Mae, the owner and her husband and son's run the restaurant. If you're there on a night that she's working, she's shouting out orders across the room, greeting you warmly, trying to accomodate every guest. It's an intimate setting and they do so well that they opened up a second location less than ten minutes away. I feel like I'm in her kitchen at her house and every time I come she always remembers me. Love it!

I always get the angel wings, which are garlicky, sticky and delicious. Pad thai, green beans, tom yum soup, green curry, papaya salad and whatever special of the day they have, which is always good. I don't think I've ever had a bad meal here. I'm craving angel wings right now!

One of the best things about this place though, is the dessert. You can not leave without eating roti with ice cream. I'm gonna say this out loud: DO NOT SHARE YOUR DESSERT. hehe... it is that good. This roti is a specialty of Mae's. She was taught the recipe and will not be giving away the secret anytime soon. I beg her everytime I go. There is no where else that you can get this dessert. If you come here for anything, at least get the Roti. It's warm, sweet, sticky and slightly crispy with great coconut ice cream. Sometimes you can't eat just one. 

My family and I are notorious for placing to go orders of 5 roti's at a time. When I come here with my family we all are so full from the great food and still manage to order a Roti each to devour. mmmmm.... I'm gonna go order one right now! 

Note, they do not really take reservations, so make sure to give yourself ample time to wait for a table or just go early. 

I can't wait to go back... it's been too long.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
Food was good and it has taken me many years to write this. A weird waitress approached my table and it was my wedding anniversary. She looked me straight in the eye an said, "don't hurt this man"..'He truly loves you".  Unfortunately, I had already decided to throw in the towel on the marriage. It upset me so much that she said that. I couldn't eat. I never returned.
I divorced my husband a year later.
author: Liee T.

description:
Ordered take out...  Take my advice and never do it.

Horrible. I heard the words "Sorry" at least 20 time...?  

I ordered my food at 8:00pm, and after confirming it would take 15 minutes, I came back in 20.  Half my order was already on the line and I could see it.  Obviously by the 8:30 mark  I was visibly distressed.  The Wait staff was alright; walking by and reaffirming my food would be out soon.  However they were sadly misinformed.  I received my food at 8:45, three times past the expected timeframe.

I explained myself and had expected a solid restaurant would do something to appease an already paid customer but they in fact kept saying "Sorry".

All I received were excuses, with no reasons and no care from the line manager.  Don't get me wrong, they serve tasty food.  Their service though through this experience and others merit them a one-star rating.
author: Venkat P.

description:
Umm...I think Marnee Thai was wayyyyy hyped up for me. After hearing Marnee Thai got this award, got that award, got 4 stars on Yelp, etc., I was hoping for a really good meal. Damn you expectations!

We waited for about 15 minutes for a party of 4 and upon being seated, we stared at the menu to decide what we want. Usually, we're pretty quick about things but this time around, it took us a bit longer to decide. Why? I'm not sure, nothing really stood out to us but we finally settled for...

IMPERIAL ROLLS
Please go to PPQ up a few blocks for it! These were just okay, but definitely hit the spot if you're craving some sort of fried goodness. 

KANG DANG (Red Curry) w/ Beef
DANGGGGGGGGG this dish was SPICY!! It states that it was a medium spice and normally I can stand curry spices but O M GEE, after a few bites with rice, I couldn't eat this dish anymore. Cooked well, but I think I should have stuck w/ the yellow curry (mild).

BBQ PORK
I'm sorry, this was really really dry. It just tasted like an over cooked pork chop cut into 7 or 8 pieces. Nothing to it, so I don't suggest ordering it.

PAD KEE MAO (Noodle Dish) w/ chicken
This dish stated that it was spicy but when it came out, it tasted like ketchup noodles. YAY for me since I like ketchup but it was a let down since I was expecting a not so sweet and tangy noodle dish.

PAD PRIG KHING w/chicken
Green beans and chicken. This dish was really good but on the oily side since it is cooked with a spicy chili paste. If you can look past it, I would definitely recommend to order this and eat it with rice! 

MANGO STICKY RICE
I think Mandalay makes a better mango sticky rice but I think it's all about preference here. The sticky rice here at Marnee Thai is more separated, and not as gooey and stuck together as the one at Mandalay. The mangoes were soft and sweet, so that's a plus. White coconut sauce was poured on top of the sticky rice so this gave it an extra kick to it. I despise coconut but this was actually okay in my book.

Overall, I wouldn't say Marnee Thai is the best Thai Restaurant I've been to but it definitely doesn't suck. I would revisit Marnee Thai for some green beans and mango sticky rice!
author: Heidi C.

description:
YUCK !
Went here based on the reviews. I eat thai food from the east coast to the west coast, and this is some of the worst. Tofu dishes not good and the service was strange. We got there when they opened and after our waitress sat us she went to a table in the back with all the other staff and started eating. We were just looking at each other while the whole wait staff  ate.  Did not understand why they would open their doors if they were just going to sit down and eat. Combine that with food that was very marginal, not good experience. Bye Bye Marnee Thai.
author: Try O.

description: We usually go the the Marnee Thai on 9th - however our GPS led us here instead. The staff was gracious and the food delicious. It takes a while to get everything to the table, yet it is well worth the wait. We had veggie Pad Thai, Thai basil chicken, and green curry chicken. And then, mango and sticky rice and fried banana and ice cream for dessert. It was all quite good and very reasonably priced - with plenty to take home for another day. Now we have this location to add to our favorites list for trips to the city.
author: Grand A.

description: Their yellow curry with duck and brown rice!! Hits the spot every single time!
author: Karen H.

description: I ate here for the first time on Thursday night and then again on Saturday night, both times the food was delicious. Try to PadSeEw and for appetizers corn fritters which were so crispy and tasty! May the owner is a hilarious woman who is also a psychic. It was my friend's Bay party on Sat and she proceeded to tell our fortunes. She told me that I "look like a girl on the outside but inside I'm really like a boy!" lol, my friends thought that was a really good description of my personality, she also said my other friend will likely marry a chubby girl. lol, all in good fun, The restaurant gets crowded on the weekends but they try to move people in and out fast, it doesn't really matter if you gave a reservation, you will still wait.
author: Betty P.

description:
This place it s amazing.  Best Thai in SF period.

As soon as I walked into the restaurant we were blessed with a very warm welcome. 

This was my first visit to Marnee Thai and I'll be coming back fo sho!

5 points to point out:

1. Food was amazing and unique.  
2. Service was excellent
3. Very cozy place to share with friends and family
4. Prices are very reasonable for the quality
5. May is AMAZING

Can't wait to come back again!
author: Meinoh K.

description:
I receive an email and I have instant homework --- Out of Town Friends in for a weekend wedding and want to get together for a tasty meal ((((())))) Someplace casual and semi-good for a young child and infant (((()))) time for yelp fishing, fish, fish, fish, then a hit, THAI ((())) memory synapses kick in and a voice reminds me that 'Marnee Thai is my all time favorite Thai restaurant, Hands Down!  
Quick dialing and reservations for 6 big people and 2 small - done!
Quick texting to past voice on favs to order - done!
Quick response from past voice on 'must haves' - received!

Expected nightmare or difficult parking - no sweat, front door spaces available at 6:30 pm 
Table ready for us....so far, so good.
Restaurant 90% full on Thurs nite.

Okay - the 'Must Haves' (ALL CAPS FOR THOSE ON MOBILE OR THOSE WHO FORGOT TO BRING READING GLASSES TO DINNER)

#4 MIANG KUM - SPINACH WRAP APPETIZERS - tasty, fun and an excellent synthesis of flavors and tastes.
#6 SPICY ANGEL WINGS - SIGNATURE APPETIZER - not that spicy but really good.
#23 KANG KA REE - YELLOW CURRY W/ CHICKEN - tasty and plenty of curry sauce for your rice.
#28 PAD GINGER - FISH AND GINGER sauteed with dried fungus and soy.
#43 BASA FILLET - WHITE BONELESS FISH - topped with minced garlic & black pepper sauce - healthy portion!
#46 PAD THAI - THE BEST I'VE HAD - all dishes are presented with care and not sloppy....almost picture perfect.
#62 PRIG KHING - VEGGIES - stringbeans sauteed with small dicey tofu - tasty
****leave room for ROTI WITH ICE CREAM & MANGO W/ STICKY RICE - great combo of sweet with a hint of savory in the rice.

All in all, great food, great service, semi authentic ambiance and by the time we were done, 100% full with four parties out the door.

Highly recommended for any out of towners or locals like me.
author: Randall F.

description:
The Thai know how to do it right.

God, I miss Thailand. I loved it there. The people are humble, the food is delicious, the weather is great, there are elephants!!!, and there is so much vibrant culture there -- it's amazing.

And Marnee Thai is like taking a little tour to Thailand. When you first walk in, you will be surrounded by bamboo & little decorations on the wall. Like a little bungalow.  It's very cute. The tables are set up for 2 or 4 people so if you've got a big group - I recommend making reservations or you will be drooling and watching everyone else eat while you're waiting.

The servers here are very sweet & they all speak Thai. Like other Thai restaurants I've been to, I saw a waitress wearing an elegant, gold Thai dress & of course, I wanted one too. 

Our fabulous meal included:

Drinks - Sprite & Thai Ice Tea

Appetizer - fresh egg rolls - with cucumber, chicken, tofu, other veggies accompanied by a refreshing, peanut-like sauce

Entrees - pad ginger with duck [you can choose among beef, chicken or fish as well] & chicken curry. The pad ginger was excellent - a lot of flavor and texture. 
*Disclaimer - I don't like curry. When I was younger, I had clear braces & one day, I had curry, and well, my braces were curry-color. I got teased at school - that is traumatizing. Never again. [Even though I got rid of those barb-wired fences on my teeth]

Everything was under $40. Not bad for a little getaway to the next closest thing to Thailand.
author: Vanessa W.

description:
Thai Chicken Fried Rice + Pad Thai + 2 Thai Iced Teas = yummy good times! =)

Price was fairly decent and place was busy...I'd definitely come back for more food!
author: V M.

description: Wonderful and friendly. OK, it has been a while but I will finish this review. Not only was this place fun and delicious but the owner gave us each a personal reading and told my sister that she had 2 children. My sister said no, just 1 but we would like 2. She replied, right now, you have 2 right now. A week later my sister learned she was pregnant. Cool huh?
author: Lynn S.

description:
Came here for lunch on a Sunday and it was busy, but not too crowded. My friend and I ordered an appetizer (pork meatballs) and a lunch special (wide noodles with prawns) to share. 

The meatballs were ones that you get when you have hotpot, so that was sort of disappointing, but the sauce was delicious. The noodles were tasty as well, although it was spicy and I don't think the menu indicated that (so be careful!)

Overall, good experience, the staff was nice, good food, and decent prices.
author: Jenny L.

description:
=] Hands down my favorite restaurant (for the past 7 years). Thai food is one of my favorites, and Marnee Thai's pad thai is amaaazing. Their mango sticky rice and fried banana w/ice cream are good too. Wonderful ambiance, with their straw walls and ceiling (it's like being inside a little hut!). Service has always been friendly and accommodating too. If you love Thai food as much as I do, give Marnee Thai a try! 

*side note: They opened a new Marnee Thai on upper Irving (like 9th ave), but I still think the original's better! Stick to this one!
author: Diane G.

description: I used to love this place, it was a favorite restaurant of mine and I work nearby so I would come here often. However, after tonight, no more! I had dinner tonight with one of my friends and we were seated in the far corner at a small table. Among other mediocre dishes, we ordered Panang beef--which was TERRIBLE --meat was tough and stringy, and incidentally, lukewarm. However, the worst part was how INCREDIBLY RUDE the hostess/waitress was who took our order and brought us our bill. She was an older woman with very puffy hair; she seemed very friendly at first but apparently that was all a show, because after we counted out our money, she came up to the table and instead of taking the money, she said, in a hostile voice: "a lot of people have been waiting for your table, you need to get out but give me a credit card instead." (Mind you, we had only been in there a little over an hour, quietly eating. And Really? It takes more time to run a credit card than to give change from cash?!!) And what kind of customer service is it to tell your patrons that they need to "GET OUT"? I didn't need change, so I had her take the money, but in retrospect I should've removed the tip. I was so astonished by her outright hostility and meanness that I couldn't say a word. Damn.
author: Rosa m.

description:
The BESSST Thai food I've ever had!

Must order:
- Spicy Angel Wings
- Corn Flakes (If you only want to order one appetizer, corn flakes is a MUST!!)
- Pad Thai (Never can go wrong. A Thai restaurant isn't a Thai restaurant without good Pad Thai.)

If you don't know what to order and you want suggestions, there's an elder short lady (with a very humorous personality) that will run down the menu for you. She will tell you exactly what to order because she definitely knows what's good on the menu. She is very funny and sweet! Her selections did not disappoint us as alllll! I will definitely go here every time I visit SF!
author: Lisa S.

description:
I came here tonight to have dinner with a few of my girls, and we had a fabulous time!  I came in on a Monday night around 7:45pm and was seated almost immediately (a server told me to wait and went to water his other table...*still waiting*...then a lady came and pointed me towards a table).  We we were seated between two other tables (a bit tight) when the guests after me were seated in a more spacious area.  Okay so we ended up ordering: 
Tom Yum- spicy soup with mushroom, chicken, etc.. (Not that great. Sorry I've had better)
Pad Thai- with shrimp (Pretty good. Standard?)
#30 Some Chicken dish with chili, basil, garlic? (very tasty)
#39- Roasted Duck (I would pass on this next time...too saucy for my taste.  Duck didn't seem roasted..more like sauteed or something)

Anyway, they were kind enough to bring out a cake that my girlfriends had brought out to surprise me.  However, I don't think I would come back solely for the food.  The service staff were really nice so I may return if I'm in the  Sunset area.
author: Karen P.

description:
I can't wait to go back to this place. 

After hearing about this place from Check Please! Bay Area, I wanted to check it out myself. I am sooo glad I did. We ordered the following dishes: Imperial rolls, Mango Fried Rice, Pad Thai, Tom Yum, Pad Kaprow and BBQ Chicken. I must say, that I thoroughly enjoyed my meal.

The owner, May was very gracious and welcoming and her staff were very attentive. So far one of the best Thai restaurants I've been to in the Bay Area.

Cheers!
author: L R.

description: This is the best Thai food I have had yet!! The duck is the best!  If you aren't sure what to order ask the servers.. They will create a whole delicious meal for you
author: Katie S.

description:
YUMMM.

YUM
YUM YUM

Angel Wings, string beans, HUGE fish covered in light peanut sauce (i think it was a Snapper), more fish, and more DELISH stuff! 
I love this place! It's so delicious!

The interior is covered with interlacing bamboos! 
This is the place to go for effing awesome thai food! 
WILL BE COMING BACK FOR SURE! :)
author: Miss C.

description:
As Thai food goes, I couldn't really ask for more than Marnee Thai. Truth is, I don't jump for joy when it comes to Thai food. It's not that I don't like it, it just doesn't ever spring to mind when I'm wondering where I should eat tonight. But since moving to San Francisco, I have now eaten at Marnee Thai twice (yes, TWICE) and it's been a good decision each time... even if it wasn't really my decision.

The first visit was an all vegetarian affair with a bit of shrimp thrown into the mix. High quality papaya salad and tofu based curries. It was a decidedly spicy set of dishes.

On the return visit, we were on a quest for duck, and got it in the form red curry with roasted duck. But before we talk about duck, we started the evening with deep fried bacon wrapped shrimp. I don't generally associate bacon with Thai food, so let me say, they know how to make bacon. We mixed it up with green mango salad which wasn't nearly as spicy as the papaya salad... in fact, none of the dishes were very spicy this go 'round. 

The duck was, without a doubt, amazing. Sadly, the curry was filled with large tomato wedges and bell peppers, which really aren't my scene. The accompanying pineapple, on the other hand, really added a nice sweetness to the mix.

Next I want to try the takeout, which seems like a popular option for folks in the neighborhood. But until then, this place is five stars for anyone with Thai on the menu.
author: Sean K.

description: The best pad see ew I've ever had is here.  The thai fried rice is really good here as well.  The Tom Kha coconut soup wasn't the greatest though, a little too spicy for me.  The only thing I didn't really like is the green curry here though, it wasn't too flavorful for me.
author: Thomas N.

description:
The food here is excellent, but last night there were so many people and the woman acting as hostess, May, told us 20-30 mins and it ended up being an hour! And then once we sat down, my friend had a dirty napkin and they didn't get us menus - I had to reach behind me to get menus. I just feel they could've being busy much better than they did. But, overall, the food was great! My favorite thing last night was the angel wings. I would highly suggest those. I also got the sweet and sour which was really good.

I would definitely go to this place again, but probably not at 7pm on a Saturday night! This was posted on 7/18/10.

*************************************************************************************
I went here again for NYE 2010 with some friends and again, I love the food. My only comment to their food is if you like a thicker curry sauce, do not order curry here (pumpkin curry, etc) as it is a thin sauce. My favorite meal there is the Pad Prew Wharn. We also ordered 3 different types of dessert - Mango Sticky Rice, Fried Banana w/Coconut Ice Cream and Roti with ice cream. 

My only negative that I find about this place is the service - they are very slow and inattentive! Nevertheless, I would still go back b/c I love their food.

Take out is also a good option - when I lived in SF, I would get takeout from here about one time/two weeks.
author: A M.

description: Really good food and friendly service!  I haven't had a dish I didn't like.  Pad Thai-- awesome.  ALL soups, awesome.  They don't skimp on the meat, which is really nice.  This is one of my favorite thai places!
author: Shae H.

description:
My roommate grew up in this area and said this was her go-to spot when her family wanted to get thai food.  I went with her and four others on a trek across the park and were seated promptly as we arrived.  The restaurant itself was small and cozy.  The service was very friendly.  

Each of us decided to choose a dish to share family style:

Started with chicken and beef satay skewers.  It was a nice start for dinner but nothing mind blowing.
I went with #45 Pad Cha Talay.  delicious.
Yellow curry with chicken added a nice variety to the table.
Pad see ew is always a staple in our thai meals and you can't go wrong ordering it here.
We had a special called "morning glory" which was a veggie dish.  Not too bad, but I probably wouldn't order it again.
The pork dish was awesome!  I'm not gonna lie though, I don't remember which one it was =/

The friendly service was great, but a little disorganized.  I think we got asked by three different servers if there was anything else we wanted.  We sat there for a good 20 min. waiting for the check.  Other than that, it was a good night.

I'd come back!
author: Tom Y.

description:
At my "moving to SF" party, a friend  gave me a "Not for Tourists" guide to SF. On the plane ride here, my bf marked all the restaurants near my apt that sounded worth visiting. Marnee Thai on Irving was one of these. Last night, famished, we made our way to Marnee to try it out. Upon walking in, the amazing smell of Thai food enveloped us, and the place was packed, so much so that the only table left is the one next to the kitchen entrance, and we took it. The waitstaff is super friendly, all wearing authentic Siam clothing (I guess?) which says a lot considering the women's skirts are ankle length.

Decor- da bomb. The walls are covered in bamboo-esque wood, large embroidered hangings throughout the room, and fresh orchids on each table. The orchids alone made me love the place. On the back wall the daily specials are posted, but also provided on a menu on each table. We ordered the imperial rolls to start, and then I got the green curry (medium spice) with tofu and steamed rice for entree and my bf the pad kee mao with duck. Rolls were good, came with a spicy sauce to dip them in. 

Our entrees- I ate almost all of the pad kee mao. My curry wasn't really spicy OR sweet enough, considering the coconut milk, and the eggplant was a little too mushy for my taste. I've never ordered green curry before, so this is no fault of the restaurant and I'll stick to red/yellow in the future! The pad kee mao- so effing good. Perhaps this is because we got it with duck (da bomb) but the spiciness was just right for me. It came with sliced fresh tomatoes as well, a perfect contrast to the drunk noodles and duck. 

I was all ready to rate this as my go-to Thai restaurant in Sunset, however then the bill came. We were charged $1.50 for each scoop of steamed rice for my curry- a first in my 10+ years of eating Thai food. It escapes me as to how you are supposed to eat curry if not with rice to soak it up with? I was just shocked that rice wasn't included in the dish, and even more so that each tiny scoop was $1.50. I will revisit Marnee Thai, but will ask if rice is included in whatever I order. This is the only reason it's 3 starts, not 4.
author: Amaranta C.

description: Yum! One of the best Thai places I've encountered in SF.
author: Olivia P.

description:
This is a small, cute restaurant on Irving with a packed house on a Wednesday night.  Thankfully, our party was small, and so our wait time was short.  They did squeeze the three of us in a two-person table, but we were aiming for a small, intimate setting anyways.

Let's get down to business:

+ Spicy angel wings - as spicy as they can make it.  Deep fried chicken wings sautéed with chili-garlic sauce, top with crispy basils.  I think we had 9 pieces for $7.50.  Definitely not as good as San Tung, but maybe because they leave the crak out of this one.  It is finger lickin good though.

+ Pad garlic - Sliced pork sautéed with fresh garlic and black pepper for $9.50.  The portion looks small, but will fill you up like no other.  I like the flavor combinations.

+ Pad prig khing - actually, we were going to order this, but the waiter told us about the asparagus dish instead.  Go with what he says!

+ Chan pad poo - Spicy rice stick noodles, stir-fried with crab meat and egg in chili garlic sauce for $9.50.  This dish was taken as a recommendation from Yelp, and it was so worth it!  Think really, really good pad thai.  Yum.

- Kang keaw - Spicy green curry with chicken, coconut milk, long purple eggplant and basils for $8.95.  There was too much oil and too much eggplant for my taste, and not enough chicken.

Add three bottles of Singha, and we're good to go.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Let me just start out by saying that I usually don't even want Thai food.  It's just that most Thai restaurants are so average that I'd rather just skip the whole cuisine category altogether!   So, when I first came here, I was kind of skeptical, couldn't help it!!  But I've been sold...  I would even say that Marnee serves the best Thai that I can remember ever having.   I also really like the space and decor--it feels cozy and has a lot more character than most Thai places I've been to!

When we go, we tend to order the angel wings, larb (chicken) salad, the tom ka soup, and my fiance loves their pad thai (I'm not really into pad thai so much).  Have had very good experiences with their curries.  Actually last time we tried the panang beef curry (first time) and not surprisingly, it was excellent!!  

The only warning I have is one time we went with a larger group and got sort of pressured into ordering way more food than we needed.  Last time I went there was 5 of us and we ordered an appetizer, soup, salad and 3 main items and that was just enough.  Just an FYI.  For the most part, the service is efficient and friendly enough.
author: Yvette H.

description: Negative 3 stars, terrible service, food is salty and don't ever make reservations! They won't honor it when you get there.
author: A C.

description:
They have the BEST pad thai ever. Always stumped whenever I go to Thai restaurants, so I end up just ordering a pad thai with tofu. My friend knew one of the workers there, so we were given a complimentary fried banana with ice-cream after our meals :)

The greeter/owner lady here was very cordial. The wait here can take quite a while and the restaurant is a little tight with seating arrangements.
author: Tina C.

description:
this is the second best thai restaurant in sf! since i am a big fan of minced chicken, i normally get that along with their papaya salad. MUST TRY their their special fish sauce! 
why neg. 1 star? the restaurant is too small and the ms.penguin over here is so loud. idc if you're the owner or what, keep your voice down since its already hard to hear the person sitting across from me.
author: Rose P.

description:
Ever had a large Thai woman yell at you to hurry up and let her know how many are in your party, and then have a pot of rice unceremoniously plunked on your table and immediately scooped onto your plate, before you have the chance to tell them you don't want any rice?

No?

Go to Marnee Thai then.  You'll get to experience BOTH of those.

I love the food, but the service really scares me.  It's really cramped, and it's hard to really enjoy a meal when you're inches away from the next table.  My friend loved the pad thai, and the silver noodle salad was excellent.  My favorite Thai dish is the pad see ew, and of course it was delicious here as well.

The -1 star is for the price and the service.  But the food?  Delicious.  Of course you can certainly get the same quality food elsewhere and for cheaper, but who wouldn't want to sit in a little tiki hut and listen in on others' conversations?
author: Tori S.

description:
Marnee Thai is one of my favorite spots to eat when I go back home to San Francisco.  The green curry is sweet and spicy.  The pad sew ew (thick noodles) with beef is a bit greasy but it is definitely flavorful.  I always finish off the meal with my favorite thai dessert: roti and coconut ice cream.  This is one of the few places that actually serve the dessert.  

I agree with other reviews, noting that the restaurant is a bit pricey, but the servers are extremely nice.  The ambiance of the restaurant is also something that can be enjoyed, a small intimate setting.
author: Steph W.

description:
Shit, Chabaa or Marnee? I don't even know.

Being in Marnee made me feel like I was in another world. The ambiance was just so cute, like I had just traveled to Thailand. Service was lovely - constantly refilling our glasses of water, quick to take our orders and in my friend and I's case, still kind when we accidentally ordered the wrong dish & apologetically asked them to re-make it. 

But omg was it delicious. Pad thai superb. But the pad see ew (forgive my spelling) ahhh, it never gets old. Corn cakes too, just missing the really good sauce they offered with it in Chabaa. 

Can't wait for my next visit...maybe I'll try the location on 9th!
author: Steph W.

description:
So I give it 3.5 stars, and I will definitely order food from here again, especially since I live 4 blocks from here.  

Here's my review:
1. The lady who took my order over the phone was very nice.  

2. Food was tasty and they have very decent portion sizes.  I ordered the Pad Thai and it was yummy and plenty left over for tomorrow. The Praram Phak (Mixed vegetables with peanut/ coconut sauce) had a great flavor but wasn't hot, temperature wise.  

3. They quoted me 10 minutes when I called it in, and it was indeed ready very quickly.  

4. Bad: It smelled like a wet dog in there when I picked it up. Literally like a wet dog, so it makes me wonder if they have a dog in the back.  I will stick to ordering take-out, as there will be no dining in house for me. 

5. Reasonable pricing, $18.95 for my 2 items.
author: Courtney M.

description: I am disappointed at this place. I've been to the one on 9th and Irving and the quality of food is defintely uncomparable. We ordered the angel wings and it came out in less then 5 minutes...we were super excited but as we bite into the meat, realized its been cooked a while ago and was just heated because the meat was tough to chew and stale. Pad-thai was to sweet..as if there was to much brown sugar. Papaya salad was ok. Weirdest thing is its a Thai restuarant and they don't serve noodle soup for dinner. I was craving for noodle soup and told the waitress and she said they'll add $3 to the dish if I order it for dinner since its a lunch dish (and there was only 1 noodle soup dish she said they had which was the duct noodle soup), making this noodle soup 11 bucks and its not even worth it. There was no flavor, the broth was very plain and oily. I should have just gone across the street to Loi's Vietnamese Restuarant and get thier amazing pho for $6. Our waitress had to be flagged to refill our water eventhough it was a weekday at 4pm and there were 2 waitresses just walking or standing around. Will not come back to this location.
author: Sflady S.

description: Yumm this place is delicious! we ordered the green papaya salad, thom yum soup, best tom yum 've ever had..and the yellow curry, it was all very good but I loved the soup best of all:)
author: Al B.

description:
Mmm I love Marnee Thai! I've been here a few times and the food never disappoints =) It does get a little pricey for the portions and especially for a student... But the food is just so good...

Interestingly enough, I've never had to wait, but it always seems packed. One time, we came in and the waitress directed us to a reserved table without us even saying anything. I don't know if they just didn't come or something though. 

I always get curry here. Green is my favorite, but they all taste pretty much the same (they're all good). The thai fried rice is good too.. =) I haven't tried a lot of things on the menu, but the ones I've tried just keep making me come back. =) The thai ice tea is a little too sweet, but I mixed water into and it tasted fine. 

Overall, this place will not disappoint and keep you coming back for more =)
author: Evelyn C.

description:
What a little gem this place is! As you enter the restaurant, you are greeted by the sight and smells of the open kitchen beside you. Familiar and unfamiliar spices alike surround the team of chefs as they prepare gorgeous looking food. I knew I was in for a treat right away.

 The seating was packed pretty tightly, but it gave the already promising restaurant a very homey vibe. Plus, you were seated close enough to check out what other people were eating, which pleased my lingering curiosity. It did not help me decide what to order though, for the menu was pretty overwhelming. The seemingly endless choices do make decisions tough at first, but at least there is a lot of new things to come back to. Oh, and I will be back! The menu is full of authentic Thai dishes, which is refreshing to see in the wake of Americanized "ethnic" food. 

 We ended up ordering the Spicy angel wings, Tom Yum (with chicken), Kang Dang (with pork). The angel wings were exactly that, heavenly. The Tom Yum was also great, featuring some very explosive flavors along with a good spicy kick. The highlight though, was the Kang Dang. It was absolutely fantastic. It's one of those dishes that you have to describe how good it is and how much you are enjoying it to everyone around you with each and every bite. You must order this if you go, trust me. 

 This place was amazing, and it was easily the best Thai I've ever had. Reasonably priced, perfect portions, and great service.
author: Russell S.

description:
By far the best thai food in the city. I've never ordered anything bad from the menu. Some of my favorites include the pad see ew, pad thai, pumpkin curry and pad kaprow. 

Restaurant is a little cramped and they try to cram as many people in as possible, but its delicious. Service is so-so, but again the food makes up for that.
author: Meme R.

description:
Came here a few weeks back. The food was great, but the place was pretty cramped. Aside from that, the people serving us was really nice. Although it was the lunch hour, the service was friendly and accommodating. The food was definitely a notch over the regular King of Thai dishes I usually eat. And the decor is by far one of the nicest I've seen in a restaurant. They actually make the interior of the restaurant look as if it were inside a bamboo thatched hut. Very very nice. Just look at the pictures!
 
The only minus, beside the crowded seating, is the people who were sitting right next to us. It seems that the crowd of people who come here are either:
1. regulars
2. people who semi-live here (aka sf state students) who must bring their friends to introduce them to the splendors of thai food
3. Passer-bys who think it's a nice place to eat
4. Annoying trendy foodies/hipsters/asian-fetish/etc, who come into the restaurant and raise the decibel meter substantially. 

Me and my group were #3, while the people seated behind us were #4. Thankfully they left after 20 minutes, and we ate in silence. So that's the only minus, since the person who seated us should have been well aware that we wouldn't want to be seated next to a haggle of people who's into whatever is trendy and are incredibly loud. The only minus.
author: Clinton L.

description: Best mango sticky rice evarrr.  The other dishes are good but I don't have to get them here.  The mango sticky rice, I have to eat theirs.
author: Erika C.

description: Spicy angel wings! Nommmyyy .. perfectly crispy, full of flavor, both sweet and spicy. I like the sauce they use, since it's more like a paste. This allows the wings to retain their crispiness and just gives it a better overall consistency, in my opinion. The restaurant itself is quite small but has a very cozy feel to it. I will be back for you Marnee Thai!!
author: Malyssa C.

description:
This place was packed on a Sunday @ 6:30PM.

One of my favorite Thai Restaurants in SF and I'd definitely will be back!

Tom Yum w/ Chicken
Fish of the Day
Pad Thai w/ Shrimp.

All delicious!! thank you!
author: Emily L.

description:
This place is pretty overrated. The building itself is drafty and not very comfortable. The tables are crammed in and when it is full it is almost impossible not to bump into other tables. The staff is usually grumpy and seems generally annoyed at everyone and the world. 

Even so, we frequently come here because the food is good and it is a crowd pleaser. Of course, parking is always bad in that area, so that doesn't help.
author: Johannes G.

description:
Just as good as the other Marnee Thai http://www.yelp.com/biz/marnee-thai-san-francisco-2#hrid:Y2cwuQUkqpWFY625h9Ihfg - the added perk is better parking situation, albeit further from where we are.  Next time we'll drive the extra mile to go to this one instead.   

If you can only order one thing from their menu, go for the angel wings.  Won't fail.
author: Ange L.

description:
This is my very first review here on Yelp & I definitely have to give a big ups to Marnee Thai for filling my belly w/ delicious food for the past 5 years. My coworkers from Macy's took me here for my going away dinner in 2004 and boooooy was i glad they did! Ever since then I have been ultimately loyal to this cute, intimate hut-like restaurant. This is by far the BEST Thai food I have had in the city. A lot of their dishes are unique & can only be found there. 

The following are some of my favorite dishes:
-Angel wings w/ Tofu (must order 1 1/2 to get both mixed in.. they make tofu taste like chicken)
-Corn Cakes (for you vegetarians out there)
-Green Mango Salad (best green mango salad I've had EVER! If you're Filipino and love green mangos w/ bagaoong this dish has a similar taste & you'll love this salad)
-Green Curry
-BBQ Pork
-Roasted Duck Noodles
-Fried Roti w/ coconut ice cream (HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! This is the BEST BEST BEST dessert EVER! It's similar to a funnel cake, but light and airy perfectly paired w/ coconut ice cream)

Anyway, I haven't seen the owner lately, but make sure you know what you want, otherwise beware she may peer pressure you into ordering something you don't even want.
author: Krystel M.

description: Marnee Thai has the best Thai food ever!  You need to get in here and try it.
author: Christine P.

description:
cute and cozy little thai restaurant. the restaurant can get a bit loud sometimes when its a full house. the light setting makes it a bit intimate especially when everyone is sitting so close to each other. the host is super cute and nice! she always manage to keep me company by chitchatting with me til my table is ready.

 i love their softshell crab salad, it is bomb-dot-com if you like the citrus flavor in your dressing. i always get the angel wings when i go to marnee thai =) and i always get a thai ice tea.
author: Jo L.

description:
Amazing Thai food and friendly, fast service. Best I've had in SF!  The triangles with pumpkin, potato and curry were a delicious way to start.  Papaya salad had a great flavor but could've been a little spicier for my taste. 

Not sure of the names, but the # 41,herbs and lemongrass we tried with tofu and the #44 yellow curry w/prawns and scallops both were bursting with flavor.  And last but definitely not least was the mango sticky rice for dessert which melts in your mouth!
author: Ryan D.

description: Definitely the best Thai food!  Highly recommend the Spicy Angel Wings as well as the Spicy Angel Crispy Tofu, the Homemade Hotcakes and the Pad Thai!  Amazing!  Make sure to book a reservation because the place is pretty small.
author: Alex W.

description:
I loved it here.. I was actually brought here by an ex of mine for our first date... It was pretty busy for a Monday night.. Busy = Good!

It was really good too.. The service couldn't of been any better! They even talked to my date in Thai since he new how to speak it.. I was just sitting there looking like a dumb ass since I have no idea what the fuck they were saying!!

The food came out in like 5 minutes! That was probably the fastest entree I've had brought out to me ever!! Not a bad thing though.. Especially when you're not having a good conversation and want the dinner to end soon, it wouldn't be a bad thing.. (Not talking about me though)

I ordered the Pad Thai as usual.. You can't go wrong with Pad Thai! There was lots of ingredients in there.. I like it when they don't skimp on shrimp.. which they didn't.. My date had the Pad Se- Ew, Fried rice noodles broccoli, egg, and chicken? It looked a bit too greasy for my taste..

I would recommend this place hands down.. But parking is horrible since it is Irving!
author: Juliane N.

description:
I slapped myself around trying to decide whether I should give this place a 3 due to the pushy service and over-crowded dining area or a 5 for the delicious food. I slapped myself equally on both sides and decided on a 4.

"You sly dog, you caught me monologueing!"

Okay, here is how it went down...
Me: "We would like to get the Tom Yum chicken, Chilean Sea Bass with Garlic sauce, Yellow Curry with chicken, rice for three, and tea for three."
Owner: "One more dish!"
Ravi: "No, were fine with our order. The table is too small anyways for more food." (obviously, three peeps squeezed into a 2 1/2' X 2 1/2' table!)
Owner: "You 3 people and 2 are men! One more dish. You need noodle dish."
At this point, I'm about to cave and say, okay, give us the pad thai. But, my dear friend Ravi stood his ground.
"No. That's enough. If we need more later, we'll order more."
Owner really loudly walking away says *something in thai*

All of us: "WTF?"

The food was great, but it seems like the portions have been shrinking since we were last here. Its kinda like it was intentional to prove our order wasn't enough food. OR they decided to start ripping off their frequent customers. 

Come here if you are hungry and feeling a bit masochistic and need to be slapped around a bit and told what to eat.
author: Liz K.

description:
update 3/11/08: Just got takeout from Marnee and 2 of the dishes were so salty they were inedible...maybe too much fish sauce? If I weren't so lazy I'd take it back...downgrading to 3 stars.
***************
We had a great meal and a festive time at this hectic resto last night. Tables are packed in tight, the lights were turned off at one point and one of the owners came out banging a birthday gong, everyone broke out in song to wish the honoree a happy bday. Lots of families with well behaved but noisy kids, string of colored lights and faux bamboo (?) hut decor all added up to a good time. 
There were 4 of us, and we had that Spinach Appetizer where you fill a leaf with ginger, toasted coconut, onion, lime, roasted peanuts and dried shrimp-our out of town guests loved that one. The Pad Thai had really fresh noodles perfectly cooked, Red Duck Curry was delish as was the Coconut Chicken Soup. This all came to about $45 dollars and we were well filled up-seems like a good deal, right?
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
I can't give it five stars because of the size of the restaurant. The tables are too close to each other, but besides that, the food, service, and decor is amazing. Set like a bamboo hut, this restaurant has it all. The chicken salad, the beef with string beans, the pad thai, the curry chicken, the pork rice, and beef cube steak. I can't remember the names exactly, but you just have to take my word for it. 


If you can, dine in. Avoid the take-out. The line is worth the wait.
author: Stanley K.

description:
This used to be one of the best Thai restaurants in the city. In many cases it still is...(wait for it) as far as the food is concerned. I don't want to go all ballistic on the place, but service has gone WAY DOWN HILL! To quote from "Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels": "If the milk turns out to be sour, I ain't the kinda pussy to drink it." Whatever that means, but the quote applies to Marnee on Irving's service. 

On a recent night I ordered take out. Was having friends over and placed an order for pick-up. When I arrived the place was in chaos, resembling that of the Pequod's deck with Ahab shouting orders....even at customers as well as staff. (Thar she blows!) Tables were being shuffled around on what clearly was a busy night. Again, no problem. Picked up my order and checked it to find -as I was driving away- that one of the items was MISSING. "Thar she blows!!!" They quickly restored the order. However when I got home I found that one of the orders was really 1/2 an order. 

I called to simply inform them of what happened. After all, it was too late to turn around and go back. Here's what went down:

J: Hi. I seem to have gotten a half order of curry.
THAI: That's not possible! NO! NO! NO!
J: I'm just calling to let you know.
THAI: NOT POSSIBLE!!
J: Well also my order was missing Pad Thai. I had to go back and get it.
THAI: I maybe admit to that. But we ALWAYS give more curry. 
J: Well I'm looking at it and it's half an order.
THAI: Not possible. 
J: Hey I'm just telling you because you are one of my favorite Thai joints and I want to let you know.
THAI: My people have been with me for years. I trust. NOT POSSIBLE.
J: You don't understand. I just want to let you know. I'm not asking for anything.
THAI: NOT POSSIBLE. NO WAY!!!

There's only so far you can listen to a broken record. And we all know these are hard times, but a simple "I'm sorry about that. Thanks for informing us." would have been the correct response. 

As a result I'm only patronizing the 9th avenue location if I'm in that hood and only if "Thar She Blows" is NOT there!!!
author: Johnny C.

description:
I don't care what anybody says about this place. Best Thai in the city, hands down! It's right in my neighborhood and it's absolutely delicious! I love just about everything on the menu. You have to try the wings... to die for! 

Good atmosphere, cozy, friendly service, and usually pretty fast. 5 stars people! Let's go!
author: MJ T.

description:
Two stars just because I've been to their other location and I know what they are capable of. 

I called tonight to ask what their specials were, the waiter told me they had a lot and if I wanted to hear them to come in. Since I was planning on picking up a video at blockbuster anyway I let it slide. 

I got there and they had 4 "specials", What the hell! Anyway we ordered our food. I asked what thin rice stick noodle dishes he recommended, he named something and I went with it. He told us to come back in 20 min.

20 min later we were back. All the other people waiting for a pick up were forced to stand in the hallway because we were in their way. Everyones order was taking a long time, the staff even had trouble figuring out which dishes were for each person. 40 min later i was out of there.

Got home. My "thin" noodle dish was pad thai. It had congealed into a single mass from sitting so long. The food was cold and flavorless. I hate to write such a bad review, but my standards were pretty high from my previous experience at their 9th and Irving location.

On the way home we grabbed a menu from Chabaa. Never getting food to-go from Marnee again.
author: rachel c.

description:
I came here with some friends after Yelping the place.  

Out of this world:
Roti with Coconut ice cream: probably one of my top 10 dessert experiences!  The roti is like a doughey funnel cake and the ice cream has actual pieces of coconut in it.  Such a good pairing of textures and flavors!  I'm definitely coming back just for the dessert, frequently!

Angel wings:  These fried chicken wings are smothered in a sweet, spicy, garlicky sauce topped with fried basil leaves.  The sauce is what makes the dish amazing!  Be careful though, they serve the wings right off the pan so they are really hot!


Mediocre:
Green Mango Salad (too much fish sauce)
Green Curry (very average, nothing special)
author: Jen Y.

description:
Came here on a Friday night with two girlfriends after a recommendation by a friend who said that the food was delicious AND you might even get your fortune told...intriguing, right?

So off we went and it was definitely a good thing we made reservations-the place was packed!  We got the vegetarian Tom Ka soup (very tangy, pretty good), Green Pumpkin Curry with Tofu (just the right amount of spicyness, very good with rice, maybe too much tofu and not a lot of pumpkin), Vegetarian Pad Thai (a little too sweet for my taste, but still good), and the Beef with Green Beans (I can't comment on this dish since I don't eat beef...but my friends seemed to like it!).  And lastly we got the friend banana with coconut ice cream which was eh, just okay (we should have known after we got it and one of the ladies who worked there came by and said the other two desserts were better-why didn't our waiter tell us?!) 

I LOVE Thai food and Thai food in Thailand is just uncomparable.  I didn't exactly get the whole "ooh, I'm in Thailand" feel from this restaurant-it probably didn't help that we were seated by the window and I kind of felt like a fish in a bowl in that the people outside waiting for their tables were staring in...

And in case you were wondering, we didn't get our fortune read...we thought we knew who the lady was, but it was so busy we didn't want to risk agitating her by asking and then possibly getting a bad one...
author: Alvina W.

description:
OKay...I LOVE Marnee Thai. Yellow Curry w/ Chicken, imperial rolls with prawns...mmmmmm, so yummy. 

Here's the problem (other than their pushy and sometimes crazy wait staff): the SF department of health has their violations score listed as 73 (the last inspection was in September) - they were marked down for really really nasty stuff like food contamination and rodents (and I live down the street from there and know that this area has a bad rat problem). They continue to display their old score card which gives them a 94. This is just bad...especially the whole rodents thing. No one wants to eat rice that might well have had rats crawling through it the night before.

Marnee Thai should close for a week, rodent-proof their place, fix their contamination issues and then re-open and keep serving yummy food.
author: Laura G.

description:
This place has excellent food, and the interior, while weird, is slightly reminiscent of places my rich aunt and uncle would take me when I was a little kid, so it's cool.

Did I say the food was good?  The only reason I'm not giving this place five stars is that I can't say it's one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco.  It's close because of the quality of the food, but I haven't been here often enough to become enamored of it.
author: John S.

description: Fantastic food, really tastes like cooked with love. The boss is a quite interesting lady, she runs the restaurant with passion. Chicken in coconut sauce is just delicious, red Thai curry even contains fresh pineapple! We'll be back!
author: Anna K.

description:
I've heard so many good things about this place and since  one of my friends told me I should try the Tutti-melon Mango tart I thought why not come to Marnee Thai for lunch since its right on the next block and get yogurt afterwards. 

We were the first ones there since we came in when they just opened. This restaurant looks pretty nice. They had some kind of straw theme going on. When we got seated the waiter didn't even bother giving us menus. He walked by a couple of times and I KNOW he saw that we didn't have menus to look at and didn't even bother giving us any. I had to walk back to the front to get it myself. That was a a big WTF. Thanks for the the owner I believe for waiting on us. She was way better than the waiter. She was very sweet. 

We ordered the Spicy Angel Wings which reminded me a lot of San Tung's chicken wings. It wasn't as spicy as I thought it would be. But it was really really good. Really crunchy on the outside, hot and juicy in the inside. 

Bf got pad thai and I had the pad se ew. The portions are so big! The bf and I literally took 4 bites from our dish and had to bring it to go since we already had the wings too. I think for a dollar more than King of Thai our dishes were almost double the size. Too bad we weren't feeling adventurous today. We'll give other items on the menu the next time we come. And count on me coming back to try your thai iced tea Marnee Thai!
author: Tracy A.

description: Been coming here since the 80's when it opened.   I love the Chan Pad Poo variation of Pad thai.  They don't serve fish cake anymore so that was disappointing.   The curry is killer and the ambience is small, warm and crowded just like a good SF restaurant should be.
author: MJ J.

description:
A bit disappointing. I have no idea how the place gets an average of 4 stars. Did we get here on a bad day? 

First of all, the place is packed, you are edging against the chair of the people behind and next to you. First thought about that was "wow, this place must be good". 

Second, the portions are tiny and not very well balanced. The Tom Yum soup was less than enough for one person. Barely half of what I'm used to getting, while the price was higher than average. We also ordered Pad See Ew in part because of the Broccoli and it came with one (!) small floret of broccoli. We pointed it out to our waitress and she simply responded that we can order a side order of broccoli, which we did. There were also only a total of two blocks of tofu in the Pad See Ew. Perhaps the place offers more if you order meat, which would be paradoxical because it costs them more yet they charge the same for the tofu. There were also only a total of three blocks of tofu in the eggplant dish (number 55), so this seems to be standard here. However there were bits of beef and pork in it! Thanks for being respectful toward vegetarians, guys. Pointed it out by showing them the meat. All I got was a quick "sorry". 

Paid over $40 for the three small dishes. 

Summary: expensive, small portions, average quality Thai food with issues.
author: Olaf Z.

description: Very good food but a little pricey. Their fried things aren't too good but their papaya salad is exceptional. Service can be a little slow.
author: Steve L.

description: Mmmm, dont know what all the fuss is about. Good, but average Thai food --  great service.
author: Bobby J.

description:
Had dinner here with a friend after hearing another friend go on and on about their delicious roti dessert for several weeks. Guess what? He wasn't kidding! The roti, which the owner says is hard to find and she usually has to make herself so that it comes out just right, is perfectly crisp outside, soft inside, and not too sweet -- it's pure heaven when paired with their coconut ice cream.

Each dish we ordered was delicious and full of flavor, especially the red curry with roasted duck (also recommended: the stir-fry chicken with lemongrass and their pad thai noodles).

The service was excellent... our waiter kept refilling our water glasses and came by to check on often enough so that we didn't feel ignored, and not so much that we'd be annoyed by it.

Best of all, at the end of our meal, the boss lady chatted with us for a bit. She even read my face and said she could tell that I had a kind heart and that I'd have a prosperous life. 

A great meal AND a free fortune reading? Sweeeet! 

I'll definitely be back and bring all my friends to try their food.
author: Lulu H.

description: Excellent Food and Service. One of the best Thai restaurants in town!
author: Linda S.

description: No need to pad the review of this Thai restaurant.  It's great, go.  And splurge on everything from the yummy appetizers to the flavorful soups and the delicious desserts.
author: Russell C.

description: Ordered the seasonal hotcakes (pretty good, tastes like a dessert), angel wings (expected better since waiter recommended but wasn't bad), 5 different noodle dishes, and 1 rice curry dish. My friends and I did family style. I tend to like the savory noodle dishes more than the sweet ones but everything tasted excellent. We all inhaled the dishes since it was good. I have no complaints about this place!
author: Liwei Y.

description:
So I came here on a Sunday afternoon. Parking was hard, but it always seems to be hard in this area. When I first walked in, it was like walking into a hut! The decorations really nice, the tables are really clean, but the bathroom is a bit cramped and dirty. Other than that, it was a nice place. The restaurant doesn't have many seats, so expect a wait during busy times.

I shared a Pad Thai and Green Curry.  How was the Pad Thai? Good. I would rate it above average.  The Green Curry? Also good. It wasn't that spicy to the point where you don't taste anything. It was right, and I was able to taste the flavor. The service was nice, but maybe it was because we were the only ones in the restaurant.

The food here for lunch isn't that expensive, and I would definitely come here again. Just after I try more Thai places in the city.
author: Glen H.

description:
I absolutely adore this place!

I wasn't really sure what to expect walking up to the place. There is nothing special about the exterior at all. It's just a beautiful hole in the wall. My date and I were greeted by the owner.. who is a complete lunatic. ( I mean it in an endearing way) She was pretty much the entertainment for the night, wearing her pink tu tu looking outfit and screaming at everyone. She damn near asked us "HOW MANY!?" 6 times while we waited at the door. 

We ended up there pretty late on a Saturday night and it was crammed to the brim with people. We waited about 30 to 40 minutes to get a table... but when we did... it was 2- 2 tops separated by and inch. We were literally eating with another couple on our first date. Yeah, a little awkward.. but we took it in stride and enjoyed the night. 

I really couldn't tell you what I had to eat.. basil chicken with eggplant? yeah.. not really sure. I recall stealing food back and forth of the most amazing Thai I've personally had. Service to the table was fairly quick and the servers are decent. 

It's more atmosphere than service or detailed oriented.. but the food is killer. :)
author: Cheeks L.

description:
Me and my bf went there because A. I'm vegan and Thai is pretty basic B. His mom told us it was her favorite and C.It gets good reviews.

UNFORTUNATELY we went during dinner time, and we had to sit in the middle of the room next to people we didn't know, and we couldn't really have our own conversation. ALSO when we went to order the "main" lady--whoever she is--wasn't even paying attention to what we were ordering. Every time we tried to let her know what we wanted she wouldn't even look at us. This is important because I wanted her to make sure NO eggs and just Tofu. 

Maybe this is just a "Meat" place, but nothing was "great." It was ok, but I've had better for cheaper. 
PLEASE if anything--try to pay attention.
author: Ilex A.

description: One of the best Thai places in the city and a regular pit stop of mine when I'm craving for Thai food.  Had dinner here again with a girlfriend for the umpth time and all dishes we ordered were delicious:  Thai fried rice, vegetable yellow curry and chicken pad thai and of course can't leave without dessert - the yummy mango rice pudding!  I've also been to the other location on 9th and Irving but this one has more of a cozy feeling and a better ambiance.  Good service with warm welcome and owner always gives you the specials of the night!  Thank goodness for leftovers!
author: Elle H.

description: You know...I've been here s ago and remembered it to be waaaaay better.  Came back here two weeks ago and everything was just mediocre.  Nothing outstanding...I don't even remember what I ate...yeh...mediocre...
author: Patrick C.

description:
Decided to try this place after seeing reviews and their website. Went there for lunch and it wasn't what I expected. There place was empty but it took a little while for someone to come to our table; service was fine after that. 
Food was well seasoned and prepared. Drinks were fine, except for a limeade which tasted somewhat old.
Table space is tight, and restaurant needs better keeping. Decorations and bamboo walls were quite dusty.
author: B H.

description:
The Interior decorum is cute...basically your in a giant hut. Creative.
Prices are ok. But I did not like the food. They use waaaaay too much curry powder. I love curry, but my goodness that was inedible. The only reason I would go back is for their Pad See Yew and their Thai Fried Rice.
author: Judith F.

description:
All I can say is "Spicy Angel Wings" and "Pad Thai!"

If you haven't tried it, you're missing out! This place is worth it!!!
author: Stephen D.

description:
Crowded restaurant but worth a little wait.  We did not have reservations, showed at the height of dinner rush, and only waited about 10 minutes.  The owner waited on us and she has a great personality!

- Tom Ka (chicken) was very good. "Lot's of herbs to make you strong" she said.
- Calamari Pad Phed had lighter sauce and a the onions nicely balanced the chili spices; the favorite of the evening.
- Green curry is quite spicy; the large eggplant slices afford a nice texture.

Street parking is easy to find.

Overall, an enjoyable place to get good Thai food.
author: Adam W.

description:
Went here for dinner on Easter after finding out our first choice was closed (and that a parking spot was available right in front). I ordered the lamb curry; my friend ordered some sort of specialty chicken curry.

The food was just OK. Considering how far out we were in the Sunset, I'd certainly expect better. Our orders didn't arrive together, which wasn't a problem as we were sharing, but it was a good ten minutes before her curry arrived. She didn't think it was worth the wait.

Given that I had a better meal at the other location and that it's closer to me, I don't think I'll be returning here.
author: Timothy O.

description:
I've been one of Jen I's dates at Marnee Thai, and I've been that girl on the bus breakin a sweat hoping not to break her line of defense and watch that pad kee mow turn into BATHROOM NOW!!! Yet, I have fond memories of the place since I can remember going there before I even lived in SF.

Ok, enough about my distress. I swear, I can keep a meal down.

Good food, fast service but not for the faint of intestine. 

I believe their pad thai was savory not sweet (my preference) and the pad see ew delicious. On those days when I'm adventurous, it's the above mentioned or the tom kha soup.
author: Jessica P.

description: I love their coconut soup! This is the only place that makes the best thai coconut soup. Their beef mango fried rice and their angel wings are amazing.
author: Michelle C.

description: The angel wings are a must for chicken wing lovers! Crispy chicken wings covered in garlic sauce goodness topped off with deep fried basil. Mmm...mmm....good!
author: Marcia G.

description:
Quaint cozy ambiance with cool stars on the ceilings..i just want to go to Thailand. So difficult to choose between Marnee or Chabaa...thai food done right is just soooo good. 

I accidentally ordered the wrong dish, the pad kee mao instead of the pad see eww..and they kindly replaced my order quickly. I felt so bad, but they were super nice about it. I'm sorry, but these names all sound too similar..pad see kao eww mao...
Needless to say, all the dishes i've had here were bomb. Not too spicy and nothing overcooked like at other thai places. Everything was fresh, hot, juicy, and the proportions were as big as my face
author: Alexa M.

description:
Sadly the worst Thai food I've had. The Pad Kee Mao was was just sweet and spicy and very oily--with no other flavors. It seemed to be bottled sweet chili sauce as it's only flavor. Every other Pad Kee Mao has had veggies in it, usually tomato, broccoli or green beens and others. This had only unripe uncooked tomato. The tofu was over fried and just saturated in oil. This is easily the worst Pad Kee Mao I've encountered--was not savory, was not even cooked correctly. Bland, I asked for it spicy and it was, sadly that was the only flavor, I don't think it would've been edible if it wasn't spicy. 
The service was pretty good, but we were there at a dead time. Sad as one review they have posted says it's the best in the Bay area. I think I can name about 20 Thai places in Seattle that are better.
author: Bill K.

description:
Man, this place wasn't that great!

I've had plenty better Thai food with better preparation.  It's crampt and we always got the waiter scooch in between the tables action.  I don't even recall what I ate here... that's how unremarkable it was.  And they kept pressing their new cookbook here.  Signs on the door, under the glass table top, on the walls, etc.
author: Chris T.

description:
I give this place 3 stars for good food, but the service is not good and I've read about their health code issues.  

I'll start with the food.  It's quite tasty.  We got six different dishes for our party of six, including Pad Ma Kuer, Pad Prig Pao, Gai Samoon Prai, and Chad Pad Poo, etc.  Basically sums up to a curry taste, a peanut sauce taste, and noodles and rice.  All were really good and you can really taste all the spices and different flavors.  They use full twigs of peppercorn in some dishes which I thought was different.  

Service and health issues is a totally different story.  First off, it took us at least 3 or 4 times just to ask for water.  There were about 4 servers in there and the restaurant is tiny.  We were crammed right in the middle of the restaurant, my back literally up against someone else's back behind me.   When we asked for more rice, something weird happened.  First, they refilled our pot - but with just one scoop of rice for 6 people!  So of course, a minute later, we had to ask for another refill.  Instead of refilling our pot, they took a pot from another table they just served and dumped it on our table.  I was a little confused because I had never seen a restaurant give you a different rice bowl back from somewhere else.  What if someone had eaten out of it already, just a thought right?  I also noticed they took our old pot and switched it to somewhere else.  

Another thing I've noticed while just walking by is that they would take their garbage cans out, those dirty, disgusting, thai food smelling cans of garbage out through the FRONT of the restaurant, while people are still sitting at the tables eating.  I find that to be very disturbing.  Imagine sitting there eating, and they're wheeling all the garbage passed your table.  Sick.  

Anyway, I guess I'd go back for the food if I had to, but maybe a better option is to get it to go.  Maybe then I won't have to see where or how they're cooking it.  Plus, there was a never-ending line out the door on a Sunday night.
author: Stacey C.

description: Best Thai food in the Bay Area. Angel wings and spicy chicken is to die for.
author: Nathan M.

description: Cute little place that looks like a hut on the inside! The thai food is yummy and the owner is a heavy set little lady who's really loud. She's funny and cute though. It can get pretty packed here, so if you can't wait and must have thai food I suggest king of thai. Check it out at least once!
author: Wendy L.

description:
Relatively low prices for Thai, great service, great taste, great ambiance.

I went out on a date here; she dug it enough to ask to come here again. It is hard to say no to such a great place and scenario.
author: Haz O.

description: Where is the heat? The food is not spicy at all. The angel wings were too sweet I found. Service was ok. I have had better (and cheaper!) Thai food elsewhere. I don't understand what people are raving about. This place is average IMHO.
author: Lady S.

description:
When I used to live in the Inner Sunset area, my friends and I frequented the 9th Ave location a lot.  Yesterday I took my sister and mother to the original Marnee for dinner...  And it was the right choice!  Imagine how picky Chinese parents can be with eating out.  Then multiply that mentality by 100 since my mother is an amazing cook with a incredibly sharp palate...  An approving nod from her is like the gladiator getting to live.

For appetizer mom ordered the chicken satay.  I don't really eat satay in general, but mom loved those Southeast Asian BBQ delicacy.  She praised the dipping sauce for satay at Marnee.  Then of course, I had to get the Basa fillet.  I personally like the garlic version.  The fish was crunchy and absolutely garlicy to perfection.  We also had the green curry with beef.  Just spicy enough and very, very tasty (Osha Thai, come learn how to make green curry at Marnee, please).
