I am now all nostalgic for this neighborhood...  If you ever happen to be in the Sunset area and crave Thai, Marnee is the place for you.  

(So I took the green curry home.  All I can think about now is how I want to cook some Jasmine rice when I get home and pour that curry over for dinner tonight.  Ahhhh)
author: Jiajia C.

description:
I love this place a lot! It's the best Thai food in Irving. 
Today, It is a little disappointed at the Soft Shell Crab with green mango dish. If you liek green mango salad, don't try this. Get the normal one. The rest is good. Yummy!!
author: Happy R.

description:
So my friends wanted to eat here because they heard it was very good Thai food. Boy were they wrong! I know this place was featured on PBS and in a bunch of magazines saying it was the best Thai food in the city but I think they let it get into their heads.  Ive had better Thai food at King of Thai (and thats a freaking chain Thai food restaurant).  

First off Marnee (who Im assuming was the owner) took our order which was pretty cool. I wanted to order the Chicken pad see lew and my friends wanted the beef pad see lew but she insisted that we order the same meat. I just looked at her like WTF? 0_o Was she serious? They were that lazy that they couldnt make one beef and one chicken? We told her multiple times that we wanted one beef and one chicken until my friend and I decided just to get the same meat so she would go away. (Strike One!)

We ordered a bunch of appetizers and the one that had the best reviews on yelp were the angel wings.  When we ordered we made sure that we had one non spicy order and one spicy order since some of us didnt want any spicy food.  When the angel wings came they looked identical and we asked Marnee which one was spicy and which one wasnt spicy and she couldnt tell. -__-  She told us one thing and then looked again and changed her mind.  Us non-spicy people decided not to risk it at all. (Strike Two!!)

Strike Three had to be that the pad see lew was not good at all... I eat pad see lew a lot from King of Thai, which I know isnt the best Thai food place, and it was still better then this so-called "best Thai food in the city" restaurant.  (STRIKE THREE!!!)

This place only got 2 stars because of the decor.  Dont think I'll be coming back anytime soon.
author: Clayton M.

description: I am SO sick of Thai food.  It used to be my favorite food in the world and I kept eating and eating and eating it until I started to hate it.  However, I was not filled with contempt for the Thai cuisine while I was eating here.  I liked the decor and ambiance very much and I enjoyed the ethnic wear.  Portions are kind of small, but it's enough.
author: Vivian H.

description:
OH MY GOD. The best thai food eva!!  They have an amazing Pad Thai (mmm prawns 'n tofu!).  Often when i order Pad Thai, I am disappointed-I find that most places make it too sweet and it ends up tasting like they spread Kraft BBQ sauce on it (yes specifically Kraft brand). Not here. Harmonious blend of spices and what-the-hell-ever they  put in it. :)

The Po Tak soup...mmmmm. It's spicy, it's sour, it's sweet. It's fantastic. This soup has all kinds of seafood in it (shrimp, squid, crab, mussels, fish) and mushrooms in it. If you need your sinuses flushed, hell yah eat this soup. Nothing like fire in your nostrils.

If you're lucky, Marnee will actually be at one of the locations. She's hilarious.  She tells you your fortune (by way of thinly veiled insults) and predicts the weather.  She told one of my friends (whilst on a date with her boyfriend) to "Get rid of this guy, he's not the one for you, you find somebody better." Then she laughed, so I guess it was all okay...Anyway, she's a hoot.
author: MrsKimch I.

description:
This place is horrible. The food is OK, but I gave it one star because they are racist as hell. I was with a friend and put my name on a wait list and waited about 15 minutes (im asian). Two separate caucasian couples come in after us and clearly put their names after us. The lady doing calling the tables clearly look at our names, call me and my friend, we say "here" and then she calls the next person on the list, who is caucasian, and seats them first. I go what the hell? So I told the lady that we were here first and that our name was clearly before and she said, oh sorry, ok wait three minutes and we'll seat you at the next table. 10 minutes pass, and another table opens up... Should be my turn right? No. She asks the lovely caucasian group what their name's are, look on the list and seat them before us. I go over to her again, and she says "oh sorry, ok just two more minutes there's a table in the back opening up..." Seriously? table in the back? Is it because I am not the right race?

Anyway, If possible, caucasian, asian, african american or whatever, you guys shouldn't eat here. The food isn't that good, prices are high, and people who are racist against their own people is just a horrible thing that no one should support, or any racism at all especially at this day and age. There are plenty of other restaurants with better food and service.
author: Johnny B.

description:
I have to agree with everyone else on here - the angel wings are AMAZING!  Their corn cakes are also to die for and together they just may be the perfect meal.  

I really like this place better than their one on 9th in the Inner Sunset.  This is largely because of the woman that runs the place who is always running about and yelling to people and occasionally whips out a gong on someone's birthday.  It just adds a little flare to the dining experience.  

It does get crowded here for dinner on the weekends and you may find yourself squeezing into a table right next to another party, but trust me, the food is worth it.
author: Megan D.

description: I love the spicy angel wings! May is wonderful, she's friendly and she likes to read people.
author: Cynthia N.

description:
We eat out about 3-5 times a week. 

This place is where we go on a regular basis.  It's the best thai restaurant we've ever had....Bar none.  Been to high rated and reviewed places from Toronto, Chicago, Vancouver, and definitely all over Berkeley and SF.

I can honestly say, I didn't think very highly of thai cuisine until we started going to Marnai Thai.

We've been there like over 20 times in the last couple years.  Never a bad night (like some restaurants).

Every thai person I meet or a thai cuisine enthusiast, know about Marnee Thai and usually they agree w/ me that it's the best around.

If you can get past the loud obnoxious hostess and the cramped seating...the food is always fresh, hot, and impeccably seasoned.

We always get the Basa Fillet and the crab noodle dish...

dank.
author: Dank I.

description: This place has been around for a long time and my mom likes it  ...and well, if mom likes it and is willing to sit in a squishy dining room with minimal complaints, that says a lot.  One of the dishes we enjoy here is the Angel Wings- sweet and a bit of spice.  In fact, mom has made quite a name for herself at pot lucks bringing her own version of this dish.    .
author: Tony And Candace T.

description:
WE go there for the owner: she makes the place!!!!

favorite dishes: angel wings, avocado salad, the fried rolls, panang curry and so many others.
author: Anastasia M.

description: Avacado salad is hecka good. Fresh tasting Avacado. Has lots of onions so good if you are a Wierdo that likes
author: Timothy G.

description:
I hardly eat Thai food outside due to my background, but this place is alright. The service is kind of lousy, and the ambiance is nearly more than I can stand. The tables are so cramped together that there is never any intimacy or privacy. It's impossible not to eavesdrop on another conversation when the other person is literally right next to your ear talking. 

I find it horrible how they charge you $1 per cup of tea when tea is usually FREE at other restaurants. 

Marnee Thai is known to be one of the best Thai restaurants in the city, and they aren't afraid to post all the news articles and awards that they've won all over the establishment. One of the best, and they know it, which explains why they can feel free to charge whatever the hell they want for even the most simple things like tea, and get away with it. 

Their cook tends to be bipolar when it comes to portions. Sometimes you get a decent portion, and sometimes you get something that looks like a side dish. 

All in all, it's all mediocre for me.
author: Derrick L.

description:
I have to start out by confessing that I love King of Thai...!  So no Thai restaurant will hit the spot the way King of Thai does...but Marnee Thai is pretty close!  I go here when I actually want to sit down and have a nice conversation while eating good Thai food.  

A friend I went to Marnee Thai for lunch today and it was a pretty quiet afternoon.  At first we were seated at a table next to another couple having lunch...and it was just awkward!  What was even more awkward was the fact that there were plenty of open tables around the restaurant...so why the waitress placed us there, I do not know.  We asked to be moved.  Despite this weird seating situation, our waitress was really friendly during the rest of our time we were there.

The lunch menu had a good list of options at reasonable prices (about $8 per dish).  I went for the Pad Kee Mao with duck meat which I love because of the Thai basil they use it in.   My friend got the Thai Style Fried Rice with duck meat also.  You simply can't go wrong with duck meat at any Thai restaurant! Yuuuum! He also got a Thai Iced Tea there...which according to him was "too clear"...whatever that means.  However, both dishes were delicious! 

We didn't order the Angel Wings today...but I've had them before and they are AMAZING.  You can also have them make it with tofu which I think is just as good!
author: Helen V.

description: Recommended Dish: ..... Overpriced. Overrated. Maybe the night that I went the chef was just not performing, but my experience was nowhere close to 5 stars. The good part, the service, staff, and atmosphere were great. Our waitress was friendly, helpful, responsive, all in all wonderful. The restaurant itself is well decorated and very cute. But I was not impressed with the food at all. I have been to many a Thai restaurants and this was by far one of the worst in regards to taste. We ordered many common dishes, the Tom Yum Goong, Pad Thai, another 2 dishes with beef. The soup was too sour.  The beef was chewy and far from tender. I've definitely tasted better.
author: Ellen C.

description:
Been to marnee thai many times and they have alwasy hit the spot when we were in the mood for Thai food.

This last trip to Marnee thai was after B2B as my partners in crime below have already commented.

The food was very good as always, the pre food samosas were perfectly prepared packed as tight as can be with all the goodness that I expected unlike the last thai samosas I had which only contained a few peas or something. Marnee did us right with these.

The main dishes as we all ordered seperate were of course delicious which contained a green curry, pumpkin curry, pad se yew and some pad thai.

The curry's as always were delicious and suprisingly the pumpkin curry was really good. Thank you Marc for showing me that Thai restraunts have a pumpkin currty which I was very unaware of.  The green curry I ordered was pefectly made with the extra "thai spicy" as I like to order it.

My favorite of course was the  Pad Kee Mao with pork "thai spicy".  mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm it was good I could go for some right now.

the pad thai was good but I thought it lacked some flavor I did not have much of that.

as noted the service was pretty bad but considering the jam packed joint full of crazy costumed drunk patrons this can slide and it can make up for us drinking margaritas at our table. =p
author: Robert S.

description:
A great place to go on cold nights in the Sunset. The restaurant is warm and cozy, and the food is some of the best Thai I've had. Sometimes there's a bit of a wait, but it's worth it.

A tip for celiacs and other gluten-sensitive people: avoid the Pad Thai and  other noodle dishes, and stick with the curries. My wife (who is sensitive to gluten) ate the pad thai and got sick; either they're not real rice noodles, or they use the same wheat-laced Kikkoman soy sauce that everyone else does.
author: Dave M.

description:
I went to this place about ten years ago, so why Yelp them now?  For starters there was no--Yelp just word-of-mouth.  But boy am I happy that Yelp allows me released my anguish of the service I've experienced there.  

I first went there with a classmate as we were growing foodies and decided to explore the world of Thai food.  We frequent this little hole in the wall and was often greeted by the pig in the blanket who I think is the owner, I saw her picture in one of the newspaper article posted up in the entry way.  

As I take other people there and I noticed that the place had began to be more and more popular and resulted in longer wait time.  Sorry, my mistake for being responsible to spread the news.  Any who, it was quite alright as I do like to see a business that I liked succeed.    But I would never expect to be so discriminated by a restaurateur.  Yeah, you read right, discriminated.  I'm not going to pretend that it never happened because Ms. Piggy got me angry enough to never go back and don't mind sharing my experience with everyone I know--10 YEARS LATER.

What happened:  I have my share of 45mins - 1 hour wait time like many other paying customers just to have their overly salted and intense spicy dishes.  What can I say?  I have spicy food weakness that needs to be satisfied after discovery of Thai food.  I was very happy to eat their food since at that time it was they only thing I know as spicy goodness.  Little did I became to realized that Mz Silly Blanket Pig would soon practice service tactics based on two groups of customers.
 
Group A - parties who belongs to this group will be ignore and check will be handed to you prematurely.  How's the dessert?  If you get rushed out before you finish your meal, how can you get to dessert?  

Group B - parties who belongs to this group will get Ms. Prosciutto's full attention when she is there, get asked if they want dessert, can fully digest their food, check presented after dessert, butt kissed, and the full personal escort, waddle-style, to the door with a fake smile.  Ahhhhh, aren't you glad to be the elite?

Well, because of their decent food, I've tolerated it for a good five to six times just to make sure I'm not overly sensitive and blindsided that it's maybe just that they are so busy due to rapid success.  The last two times I have observed that race has a huge factor to her service treatment.  What broke the camel's back was when I brought my best friend (happened to be the same ethnicity) there to celebrate for something (this was about 10 years ago, can't remember what was it that we were celebrating) and upon what I didn't know was our last dish, the bill came in my face.  WTF?  Guess which group we were in? Not to mentioned Ms. Bacon's staff to give me my check before we were even half done?  Ugh!  

I was young hothead and in front of my beloved BFF, will not let this slide.  I motioned the Ms. Pig Shank over and gave her my most sophisticated glance and left side grin (and you know I'm pissed if I give you the left corner mouth grin!) while suppressing my urge to whack her with my right back hand (my stronger arm) and asking her, "Why did we get the bill before we were asked if we wanted dessert?"  

No answer, just a stupid grin and a "deer in the headlights" stare back.  Perhaps, it was the first time she had seen a different kind of Group A customer, so she did not know what to say to that.  Keep in mind, I've been tolerant and yet previously rather not do or say anything, but that was one of the few times I had to curb my curiosity.  But ah, yet, it was unanswered.  

So from that day on boys, girls, and you in-betweens, I had seek out other Thai restaurants.  I want to spend my hard earned money where I don't Feel disrespected and maltreated.  With that said, I do hope they change their way of business in terms of service in these two groups and I invite you to pay attention to how different groups are treated there.  Although it's been 10+ years and I hope they've improved.  I would like some updates since there is no way I will spend my time or a dime there again.  Needless to say, I will not support their new location either...you feel me?
author: Vanna S.

description: I'm not a huge fan of thai food but I am extremely glad I had the opportunity to eat at Marnee.  Apparently the restaurant has won many awards for their great food and we were not disappointed.  I had the yellow noodles in yellow curry while my girlfriend had the chicken satay wraps.  Both items were amazing and the portions were huge!  I was also really impressed that the restaurant was able/willing to accommodate a large group late on a Saturday night!
author: Tony L.

description: Good place, lots of turn around which usually means they have a fresh inventory of ingredients.  two locations near each other and great food and prices.
author: Brian S.

description:
Spicy Angel Wings!!  They spice me up and make me feel like flying everytime.  

Other authentic dishes are very tasty too.  Curry is OK, I personally like them a bit sweeter and not so rich.  Deserts give pleasant surprises.

Parking could be tough, but that's typical in Sunset area.  It's worth the trouble to dine here.

Side note:  Though the ambient is dark, don't expect a romantic dinner here.  Tables are packed, and the wait could still be 30-45 min.  They don't have the cleanest table clothes or chairs, and they play the same CD over and over again like J.Y.W. says.
author: Alex T.

description:
I Love the Chan Pad Poo and Angel Wings....

note: if you order for pick up, you usually get twice as much food. =)

update: 
Went there the other night and saw a roach crawling up the wall- actually my husband saw it first and nudged me. I shrieked so loud the waitress sweeping the floor looks up and I told her.."excuse me there's a roach." She shrugs her shoulders and goes...oh tell her and points to the owner who is in the middle of taking an order. I'm like wtf? another waitress approaches us and goes, what happened- I told her there was a roach crawling up the wall and I pointed, she looked up and goes...no that's not a roach. Okay double WTF! My husband and I look at her and told her "NO, that was a ROACH and said even the other waitress saw it!" The other waitress just stood there like, uhhh......the owner finally walked over and whispered to us.."I'm sorry" and asked us what kind of dessert we wanted. The dessert was on the house, but after the roach incident- I couldn't wait to go. 

I love this place and have been going here for a couple of years, so I don't think I'll say I would never go there again- but I'd definitely order for pick up to avoid the "creepy crawlers"
author: I LOVE ME SOME G.

description: We found this one by chance as we were driving on Irving--it was the only one for blocks that was packed with people!  So trusting the herd mentality, we found a parking spot and joined the crowd.  We had a spicy tofu dish, the chicken soup, and a filleted bass--all delicious!  Too bad rice was not included in any of the dishes so we had to pay extra for that, but really the only thing that could have been better was the seating (its way too crowded (they seated the three of us in a table for two and our dishes could not fit on the table).  I would come again but try to beat the crowd by being early or late.  Service was not too bad, even though they ignored us a few times because they were busy running around.
author: Elwood S.

description:
I used to love going here - both the food and the service had been great. So, you ask why one star? Well, the last time I went, service was absolutely horrible (we didn't get the waiter and waitress we had in the past). First, we had to flag down the waitress to order. When we ordered, she had a "I-could-care-less" type of attitude.  Then, when our orders arrived, she put down all three bowls of soup at the side of the table. She didn't care to find out whose order was whose, and set it down at that person's place. Nope, she just set it down abruptly and walked away. We were left  experimenting each dish, just to find out whose soup was whose. It was ridiculous, especially considering that the bowls of soup were extremely hot to the touch and hard to move.

That was bad - but what was unacceptable was when the bill arrived. She had overcharged us for one dish. My dad went to tell her that she had overcharged us. She then gave us the cash difference - but my dad reminded her that they owed us not just the cash difference between the price of the dishes, but also the tax difference. She played dumb for a minute, and then said it was not their policy to refund tax. Then, she said very loudly - so that all patrons could hear -- "What? You want two cents back? Fine! I'll give you two cents back!" My dad replied, "It's not the two cents - it's the fact that not only did you overcharge us, but you didn't properly refund us either for a mistake on your part."

After all this - not one word of apology or an attempt to make up for this awfully poor experience (no apology dessert, of course). Instead, she tried to embarrass my dad for asking her to refund us completely for her mistake. We are not going back, no matter how good the food is.
author: Carolyn M.

description:
I've been going here for about 5 years, and it is in my top three favorite restaurants in SF, so far. 

The food is great, prices are good, staff is attentive. I've never had to wait longer than a few minutes for a table. Parking and outer sunset location is the only downsides to this great restaurant, however, I am always happy to make the journey.
author: Morgan F.

description: Very small and crowded.... the food is delicious.  I especially love the Roti with the coconut ice cream!  yummy!
author: Ivonne G.

description: I LOVE THEIR CHICKEN WINGS. Tender and crispy, and full of sauce.  The pad thai was really good too.   They refill your water without you having to ask.  They give you a box of tissue if your food is really messy.  The host lady, who I'm guessing is the owner is sooo funny.   I like her.  She suggested what to order when we didn't know what to get.   I asked if the Thai tea was refillable one time, and she says "no, but its good"..  cracked me up, the way she said it.  She talked me into getting one.   The food was good, decent priced, and great service.
author: Sindy W.

description:
Marnee's food is better than many other Thai restaurants that I have tried.  various food selection from the menu.  Thai food is heavily flavored in general, so Marnee is not a bad place to eat.  I suggest you not to get their beef dishes though because the beef quality tend to be not the best quality.  

my rating of 4 can be slightly reduced to 3.5.

the reason that Marnee does not meet 4 completely is the dinning place is too small for the capacity that they try to fit customers into.  The tables are right next to each other that you can clearly hear next table's conversation, which is not something everyone prefers.  because the place is too small the wait staff tend to hit your table as they walk by.  the waiting time can be long when it is busy, and the quality of service can be diminished.
author: Bei K.

description:
I really like the Marnee.  
Nice cozy place that's decorated nicely. 
The owner lady is a fun character. 
Service is good and food comes out quickly. 
The Angel wings are To Die For. 
Love the pad thai, and Tom Yum and the curries. 
It definitely gets crowded so I try to avoid the weekends.
author: Viper m.

description:
there are so many other thai restaurants better than Marnee. 

i rather eat at osha or even king of thai! :) 

mm...king of thai sounds good right now.
author: Carol Y.

description:
I was craving some So Noodles, but they were closed on Super Bowl Sunday.  However, Marnee Thai looked adequately busy (because as a Chinese person I equate popularity with how good the restaurant is) and it looked like it was going to be a decent surprise.

Woah! Apparently my outter sunset friends have been holding back on telling me what kind of treasure this restaurant was.  It has a great vibe with the owners chatting it up with all the clientelle.  The food is delicious and their curry is home-made rather than factory bought.  And the dessert Roti is to DIE for. DIE FOR.  Seriously, so good.
author: evan t.

description: Yum, yum, delicious!  I heard many good things about this restaurant so I decided to treat my boyfriend for his birthday and Oh, Boy!, was it a treat.  We were seated quidkly, the service was good and the food was hot and delicious.  You must try the curry potstickers, the chicken wings and/or the homemade hot cakes.  Very, very good!  My boyfriend was extremely pleased with the restaurant choice in celebration of his birthday.  We will definitely be coming back for more.  Enjoy!
author: Rhonda G.

description:
Chicken wings!!

The wings are so damn good you don't even notice your getting a 2nd degree burn from the sauce thats now affixed to your fingers. It doesn't matter cause your mouth is in heaven.

I know they have other stuff there but mmmm chicken wings
author: Brian Y.

description:
I was there last week (October 07) and the food was really good! It was my first time going and I went because the person I was with happened to be a vegetarian. 

However, all was good until my friend pointed out a rather large rat under the table scarfing down left-overs. The rat looked to be 2-3 lbs, healthy, and it scurried from table to table. I pointed this out to the waiter who was just as shocked and unsure as to how to handle it. 

Fortunately, the time was 9:45 in the evening, which was close to their closing; however, it didn't make me feel at home that they had a rat infestation. The waiter confessed to a cockroach problem they battled earlier in the year, but that the rat problem was new. 

Nonetheless, my friend wishes she hadn't pointed out the rat to me. I wish I had never seen it! I thought the food was good and considered going back prior to seeing the rat. Knowing about the roach problem and the rat, the meal doesn't seem that appealing!!! 

I hope they remedy the problem and hire a pest company since the service and food was overall pretty good.
author: S B.

description:
I've gotta be honest.

The food was great, UNTIL I saw a huge bug scurry out from under my plate.  It was probably about 7 months ago, and maybe their little 'bug problem" is fixed now, but I'm pretty sure it was a cockroach. I was traumatized after this experience, and haven't been back since, even though I used to love the food. I'm sure there's bugs in a lot of SF restaurants, but I would really rather not see them. Out of sight, out of mind. Sorry, Marnee.
author: Jamie J.

description: One of the best pad thai's I have ever tasted, too bad the portions are REALLY SMALL! :(
author: Janet Z.

description: My friend wanted to go eat here for lunch......after I checked out the reviews on yelp, I thought to myself sure why not....my first impression walking to the restaurant was small.....I started talking to our waitress in Thai so that way when I ordered the food the spice level would be pretty hot since I'm Thai. After we received the food in my opinion...the food this not as flavorful as I thought it should be. The service was horrible maybe since I'm Thai she thought that I might be cheap tipper. To sum it all up , Im never going back again.
author: Mai S.

description:
BEST THAI FOOD IN SF!!!

I really love eating here. Very Authetic food. The portions are a bit small like most Thai restaurants, but the food taste makes up for it.

Best dishes:
- Ground basil chicken ( I LOVE IT!!!! A MUST ORDER IF YOU GO HERE, BEST BASIL CHICKEN EVER)
- Green beans
- Pad Thai 
-Thai Fried Rice

Depending on time you go it is either very crowded during the dinner rush or not busy at all usually during other times of the day. The restaurant is so cute. The decor resembles a small straw hut and there is usually a fresh pretty orchid on the table.

Even my dad who is very picky with eating food outside and never comments on any restaurants, said the food was good. I think I converted to him loving Thai food just because of this resaurant. 

Only negative is parking around here on Irving can be difficult depending on the time you dine here. I give this place a solid 4.5 stars.
author: Cathy D.

description:
This was a perfectly decent thai place.  the food was good, the service was only ok, and it was crowded.

maybe there is something i'm missing here.  but there isn't enough to get me as excitied as everyone else seems to be.
author: Steve S.

description:
This little cozy tiny joint is such a great place to authentic Thai food. They serve good portion & decent price!

Papaya salad, Tom Yum Soup, Yum Woon Sen, & the Seafood combo are so delicous here!!!!

I love this place!
author: Manda Bear B.

description: Marnee, you stink. Waitress who took our order, you suck. Food, you should be ashamed of being called authentic Thai food. HUGE disappointment.
author: Lo-Vell H.

description: Not bad but not good either, the red curry was far from being good and authentic. even SoiGow which has no authentic food at all is more authentic and tasty. For the price they charged not ok.
author: Wolf F.

description:
Fantastic Thai.  The best I have tasted in the city.  

I took my parents here when they came to visit me.  They didn't know what Thai food was, but they loved it!

Also, notably, this Marnee tastes better than it's inner sunset counterpart.
author: Angie C.

description: Absolutely gorgeous. I went with 2 friends and we all really enjoyed it. Great variety on the menu. It is a very small place so don't go if you're clostraphoebic. Food was delicious. We started with Wan Tum soup and beef skewers. I then got a dish with pineapple and cucumbers (sweet and sour) and asked for it spicy. It was maybe a bit too spicy (my fault) but it was great. Service was quick and staff was friend;y. Will definitely come here again.
author: Stephen T.

description: I love their food. I haven't been here for a while and their food made me want to go back soon. I ordered Potak soup, Jun Pad Poo and Hung Lae curry. Everything was devine. The food is very authentic. I highly recommend this place.
author: Emily R.

description:
Good calamari salad and tomyum noodles, but I still prefer King of Thai Noodles.

Don't get me wrong, the food was good, but it is pretty cramped in there and the table felt very cluttered with all the "decorative" items.  The portions aren't as big as they are at K.O.T.N. and it's not as laid back.

But of course, I'm not comparing apples to apples now am I? = /
author: Sally T.

description:
WOW, this place was aweful................
-ly GREAT! Has a nice atmosphere even though the place is small.

But the main reason this place deserves 4 stars is because the food there is quite good. The Pad Thai and Pad Se-Ew are exquisite. The Pad Thai has a nice bite to it and the Pad Se-Ew tastes amazingly well-prepared.
 
Plus, the waiters are great( Welcoming and energetic) and you get LEMON WATER.

Go eat here, you won't regret it.
author: Dylan T.

description:
Great Thai food. I was just recently there on a trip my BF and i made to visit our friends.  The place is very very small so i advise to call and make a reservation, or you will have to hear the "i dont know what time you will have to wait but i'll do my best"  Nevertheless, the food is WORTH IT... the Angel Chicken wings and delicious, and so is their Fried rice, soup and all other 5 plates we ordered and devoured in no time... lol

I will definitely make some time to visit this place again my next time in the Bay Area....
author: Martin V.

description:
I heard about this place from a co-worker while checking out an apartment just around the corner, and it was touted as one of the best Thai joints in town. Turned down the apartment, but came back to verify the claim for myself partially because I love Thai food so much, but also because the neighbourhood is more what I wish the Outer Richmond were like and wanted to check it out a bit.

The place was busy for dinner on a weekend night--a good sign indeed--though even for a table of four the wait wasn't unbearable. Strangely, a slightly older woman simply asked "how many?" when we arrived, and that was it. No waiting list, no name-taking, nothing. Amazingly, she just walked away, yet she came back a bit later and showed us our table with no fuss.

I'm a simple diner; often eschewing beverages in favour of simple ice water, and passing on appetisers so I can focus my appetite on the main course. I'm also perfectly content with simple dishes, so an order of Chicken-Mango Fried Rice from the evening's specials menu was absolutely perfect: the fruit was sweet and fresh, the chicken not overcooked or fatty, and the rice/veggies were the perfect consistency; not wet or greasy.

Thai food is almost never cheap; I seem to spend nearly ten bucks no matter where I go or what is ordered. Marnee seemed right in line with that, so no surprises. The ambiance is cozy for a dinner and not too noisy; maybe not quite romantic, but calming if you did want to make it a dinner date. Its design has a few "exotic" touches here and there, but seems mostly Western-influenced; definitely very little of the exquisite woodworking that is found at other places around town.

Bottom line: very good food, reasonable prices, friendly service. Heck, you can even order a whole coconut for about three dollars. Hope to enjoy it again soon!
author: Aaron H.

description:
I've been to Marnee Thani a couple of times and I'd had given them 5 stars before my last visit.  The manager on my last visit was unable to manage the wait list (kept ripping it up and starting a new one) and was constantly yelling in Thai to the wait staff and kitchen.  It was like having dinner at your crazy Thai mother-in-law's house.  Really stressful.  The kitchen was overloaded and the food was average Thai at a premium price.   Green chicken was watery and tasteless.  Angel wings greasy.   Rice was good.

Long lines, crazy yelling manager, mediocre food and high prices.  Save some time and go to Market street get a big mac and argue with a crazy homeless person.  Less $ and less stessful.
author: J S.

description:
Came here with a group of 6 and we were seated in a reasonable amount of time (provided that another  group was a no-show for their reservation).  The food was average and nothing too much to praise / complain about; however, one gripe I had was the owner. 

The owner insisted that we order certain appetizers even after we politely declined. Upon completing our dinner, the owner came by, made rude remarks to one of my buddies on how he can dress to "look smarter". All in all the curry appetizer she insisted we get wasn't that good plus her rude remarks at the end of the meal left a bitter taste in all our mouths.
author: Stephen C.

description:
This is the type of gem you get to brag about when all your friends rag on you for living "way out in The Sunset" (That's right... capital T).  Since moving to SF, Marnee Thai has been my go to Thai joint.  Angel wings are heavenly.  Basa filet is boomBASAic, and keep the Pad Kee Mao coming.  

Everything is full of flavor the prices are right, and the menu is extensive enough for you to come up with different combos every visit.  Although, I find my self going to my favorites every time.  

The restaurant is small but definitely charming and if you can get over the hoards of people waiting in the very small entrance and keep your eyes away from the front windows looking out onto Irving St, you could almost imagine yourself in some hut far far away, that happens to have a full kitchen and dining tables.  

Krung Thai is still king of the South Bay in my book, but if you were to put Marnee Thai and Krung right next to each other... I'm headed to the hut.
author: Nam N.

description:
Everything my friends and I ordered was good. The Yellow Curry, Pad Thai, Basa Fillet and their special Avocado Salad. We had half white rice and half brown rice.

Walking into Marnee you see a picture of the owner/chef taking a picture with Cat Cora. This place totally flaunts the awards they have received. But according to the menu and the list I saw, they haven't won an award in four years. So, I don't know what to say to that. Either they haven't updated their menus or they are past their prime.

Past their prime or not, their food is still really good. There is pretty much no complaint about the food. Everything was made just right. Not sure what else to say. If you like Thai food, come here. If you're on the fence about Thai food, this place will definitely help you decide on whether or not you like it. You'll end up loving it and set this place as a very high standard.
author: Andy Y.

description:
While I can't really say that Marnee Thai is "authentic" Thai food, it's good, none the less.

I think part of the fun in going to Marnee Thai is experiencing Marnee herself.  If you happen to go on a night she's in the house, you'll be entertained.  She's loud, animated and boisterous! 

Marnee aside, the dishes that I've tried here have not disappointed me.  I think by far, my favorite is the Tofu with Angel Wing Sauce...so goooood!  The pad thai is supposedly an award winner, but it seems average to me.  

My major complaint is the small size of this place.  The seating is super close and not a great spot for large parties.  Weekends can be super busy with a fairly long wait, but I will wait just for the Tofu with Angel Wing sauce!
author: Christy L.

description:
Curry so good that I just wanted to lick my plate afterward because I wanted to savor every last drop of the delicious sauce.  We tried both the chicken in green curry and the shrimp in red but could not decide which was better.  I had a taste of my friend's avocado and green mango salad and loved it!  (Normally, I shake my head at anything avocado related.)  Tom Yum soup was also good.  I  would pass on the corn fritters next visit...they were OK, but there's so much more to try on the menu!  

This is a very cozy, crowded, loud place- you could be bumping elbows with the next table.  Fun to go there with friends, but don't expect this to be a romantic date spot.
author: Judy K.

description:
The Yellow Curry and Pad Thai here are pretty well above average. Truth be told, either could constitute a convincing enough reason to stroll in for lunch if you're in the area.  

There is, however, a compelling reason to visit. I speak, of course, of the Angel Wings.

Angel Wings. Even the name is heavenly.  The taste is incomparable.  The best part? The crispy, fried, Sweet Basil leaves.
author: Zachary S.

description:
Marnee Thai is an Irving classic that predates most of the Thai spots you will find in the Sunset. I remember coming here when I was much younger (my sister is friends with the son of the owners) but having not been there in years, I couldn't remember how the food was.

So I decided to come here for lunch one day with a few friends and it was all goood baby. 

Pad Kee Mao is probably my most ordered Thai dish of all time, regardless of restaurant. In a way, it's a way for me to gauge the taste of a restaurant. I can safely say that I've never had Pad Kee Mao served like this before. The dish that I know is usually semi-spicy flat noodles served with basil and what I think is Chinese broccoli, various peppers and chili, with your choice of beef, chicken, or pork. At Marnee, however, the noodles are prepared with a tangier sort of sauce, which was both different and delicious. And of course I had to have it with duck when I found out that was an option. 

I'm definitely willing to come here more often now and check out the other dishes. I wouldn't say that Marnee is my new favorite spot, but it has my attention. The prices are slightly higher than their competitors--something I hear people mention quite often--but I really don't think it's that drastic.
author: Edmund C.

description:
3 and 1/3  stars 
Surroundings and the feel of the place is quite authentic and gives you a good dining experience. The food is between  good  and just ok. The food tastes better because it's  such a cozy place. A bit price for the quality of food, but hey your paying for the atmosphere too. Thai food is yummy in general its hard to come across a gross Thai food place.
author: Kristina S.

description:
Oh, I love this spot.  Here is another example of a good thing not changing and bringing her diners much comfort and pleasure.

The boisterous owner/manager/server is always a delight and she can always give you her opinion when needed.  Why do people always look scared or apologetic when asked what's the better dish?  There's no right or wrong, just what you think?

Anyway, I always get the corn fritters, one duck dish, one curry, and one vegetable dish.  I believe I've liked or loved everything I've tried.  I also like the atmosphere of the restaurant.  It's very authentic looking and it feels that way as well.
author: Susan C.

description:
I don't exactly remember what I ate !!! I just have limited memory.

To best of my knowledge, coconut based soup to start with and then red vegetable curry for entree. As a vegetarian, there are plenty of choices with vegis, tofu and soy protein. Though I am not a big fan of Thai food, but over all food was good.

What I liked most was May, owner of restaurant I guess. She was motherly. Happily accommodated all my request for making chef's work difficult (Just like any mother would do). And that's why I will visit again.
author: Sumit B.

description:
We drove.  We ordered.  We savored.  We took home leftovers.  We're coming back.  Even if it means driving all the way from South Beach.

Here's what we ordered:
- Tom Ka Soup - Be prepared, spicy but well worth it
Mango Fried Rice - Delicious combination rice peppered with shrimp, tomatoes, cubes of mango.
- Yellow lamb curry - The meat was tender, and broiled to perfection
- Red curry - Delicious

The owner, an older woman was gracious as our host, stopping by our table several times to check in on our meal.  Nice touch.
author: Dennis M.

description: A small, classic thai restaurant. Delicious corn cakes. Awesome curried beef with broccoli. Very entertaining service from the matronly owner. Love the traditional thai bamboo interior, too! It's nice to eat here after suffering through soooo many mediocre, soul-destroying, yuppified SF "thai" restaurants. This is very delicious and satisfying thai food.
author: M. O.

description:
Nothing really wow'ed me, everything tasted pretty typical. Would be
3/5 stars but the service is friendly and attentive, so I'll give them another star.

I typically always end up getting the curry. In this case, the curry was pretty typical of Thai curry, in that it's creamy but not too viscous. I've really only eaten here once, so I'll be back to try other things.

Seating is a bit cramped though, but what do you expect from SF?
author: Alexander M.

description:
This is my favorite restaurant in the city.  When you walk in, the decor makes you feel instantly comfortable.  The seats are located very close together to maximize the area.  While the other location is larger and more modern, the decor of an Asian hut feels really authentic.  It's especially welcoming when you step in from the mundane outer sunset neighborhood.  

Everything I have had is excellent, but my favorites are: Spicy Angel Wings (fried tofu during lent), Chan Pad Poo, Pad Garlic Prawns, and Chilean Sea bass with the garlic sauce.  AMAZING!
author: Katherine R.

description:
I love Marnee Thai! Last time I came here I came with my mom and my boyfriend and all three of us have SUPER different tastes. My mom got the shrimp papaya salad which she thought was GREAT, but I thought it was too heavy on the fish sauce. My boyfriend got green curry which was good, but my favorite, I'm kind of embarrassed to admit is plain ol' pad thai. I don't know what it is about sticky rice noodles with bean sprouts and shrimp, but I love it! The angel chicken wings are also really goood! They're sweet and tangy and really good with rice. Also, for you water lovers, they are on it with the refilling process. 

Parking here is hard, but here's a tip, look for parking INSIDE the park. You won't have to pay meter and there's a lot more spaces in there.
author: Heather W.

description:
Next time you go, start off with their corn fritters...they're so damn tasty! I loved everything we ordered here. Unfortunately, I can't name any specific dishes since our party ordered so many items but I can tell you that everything was delicious. Loved the atmosphere. It was an intimate setting yet kid friendly all the same....does that even make sense? Tip: It's worth asking about dishes not featured on the menu...we were able to try a special plate of  scallops and shrimp covered in roasted garlic.

Can't wait to visit Marnee when I'm in the Bay Area again!
author: Bunny J.

description:
If you are into pumpkin, try the pumpkin curry.  It's a dish that will set the bar so high that you'll be disappointed if you try it at any other restaurant. 

The Tom Ka soup is real and really good!!  You can tell this is not canned, nor is it just hot water with MSG in it.  Just thinking about it makes my mouth water, and I just had it 2 hours ago...

Their angel wings are the perfect combination of spicy hot and sweet, but not sugary sweet.  Little slices of spicy heaven!

If you love dessert like we do, I highly recommend the sticky rice with any of the items they have on the menu.  Though, my fave is the black sticky rice & coconut ice cream.  You won't find that anywhere else.

The restaurant is cozy and warm.  The lady who seats you and oversees the ordering is very experienced and DEFINITELY knows her stuff.  The staff is great and down to earth.  

There are 3 tables that seat 3, most seat 4.  The space is tight, but it's no different than all the other good restaurants that are packed with people.  If you're waiting outside, you, too, would appreciate the fact that they cram as many tables as you can so that they can seat you SOONER!!!  So, don't complain, please.  We're all here to enjoy AWESOME food!

Enjoy!!!
author: Glory W.

description:
Best Thai in town...again...its the quality & great flavors.
Love:
-crab noodles
-roast duck salad
-prawns in a blanket
-tom yum soup 
-tom yum noodle soup (lunch only)
-beef satay
-mango & sticky rice 
-bbq squid
-soft shell crab salad
author: C L.

description: I've lived by this place for a decade and went to try it for the first time the other night. The place was nicely decorated and clean but the seating was a bit cramped. We ordered the curry, some flat noodles and the Pad Thai. The curry and flat noodles were a bit too spicy even though we ordered mild. The Pad Thai is usually my go-to dish when I eat in Thai restaurants and it was pretty good here. Since it is so close to my house I would probably stop by again.
author: Queena T.

description: This place is so small and it smelled odd upon entering the door. made me lose my appetite.  The service here was not that great.  The waitress did not bother taking our order till we asked.  Also, there were a few orders that took awhile to get to the table which one did not require any cooking.  The pad see ew here was just okay a bit too salty.  Plus the prices here are expensive! $10/ plate and the portions are not generous.  I had better thai food at more affordable prices.
author: Ann L.

description: Best Thai food I've ever had!  Cozy atmosphere, friendly service, authentic decor, excellent presentation and awesome food!
author: Sandra M.

description:
I will definitely be back if not just for the corn cakes and the cucumber salad. Mmm, mmm, MMM! I admit, I was a bit fearful that Marnee herself would be around as I am terrified of her based on the reviews. Hell, I practically start crying when waiters sneak up on me to refill my water glass. 

And no, I'm not emotionally unstable.
author: Nathalie L.

description: Late night dinner. No crowd but plenty of patrons. Had the summer roll, Chicken Tom Ka, Pad Cha Talay, steamed jasmine rice, & fried banana with ice cream. Yes, a lot for one person, but I needed to try it all. I had been here twice before and wanted to see if the flavors were consistent. They were! Everything was absolutely delicious. I will continue to patronize their business and recommend them to others.
author: An Marie M.

description:
The best Thai (or Siamese if you want to get all PC) in San Francisco.

I have to comment on Melly B. - the owner, Marnee - Americans call her May, is one of the funniest and coolest accomplish women, she'll even read your palm if she has time and knows what people should order just by looking at them.  She also thinks she is being helpful, because in her culture giving advice is not a bad thing, it's a maternal sign of caring and giving - like it or not you are eating at an authentic Thai Restaurant when you come here.  Plus, the language she speaks (Taiwanese) is generally pronounced louder than English, kinda like Chinese and has harsher tones - so she is not 'yelling' at her employees, but merely giving them your order - plus, what's the joy of owning such a small place if you can't do as you please.

It's all part of the experience of Marnee Thai - they want everyone to feel like they are at a family style dinner party in their living room.  My review could be biased because I like the owners so much.

In comparison to the other Thai food I've had, Marnee still and always will rank supreme.  I think this is because they assure quality in their products and they make everything from scratch - you won't find any frozen food in their fridge.

I recommend appetizers number one and number five, the bacon wrapped prawns and their version of the egg roll - the sauce is so bomb, gotta have some addictive ingredient in it.  The Pad Thai and spicy chick with green beans are also wonderful and the Pad See Eiw -or however it's really spelled is amazing, especially if you add in a little dried chili.

Shit . . .try anything, I'm sure it's all great, I'm just so addicted to my favorites I'm having trouble branching out.

A must eat for all true San Franciscans
author: Lauren G.

description:
The food is okay here, but the size of the place leaves much to be desired.  If you've ever been to a hole-in-the-wall Chinese restaurant and been placed at a table with another person or group, this place can be the same way.
When I ate here last, I was essentially dining with the table next to me.  The only thing separating us was the flower vase and about 2 inches between our tables.  
I'd return, but hopefully on a less busy day when I don't have to share my conversation with my dining neighbors.
author: Allan H.

description:
Yum! Yum! Give me some!

Although I didnt get to sit inside, we ordered pickup. I went to grab the goods and loved this small, quaint place. Definitely somewhere I'd like to check out again!

The food was sooo god-damn good and filling, that I ate til I almost bursted at the seams! I sure needed the Pad See Ew to absord all the alcohol that I'd later be consuming.
author: William C.

description:
I give it a four for the really good thai food. Very very flavorful, big portions, and nice presentation (they arrange their food in a visually pleasing way and use pretty dishes and pots) There's usually a wait, but the service is quick and friendly, probably because it's so small, and they try their best to get people in and out. I wouldn't recommend coming here if there's more than 4 people in your group, it's more of a one on one type of place..

Don't go here for a peaceful dining experience, cause you literally sit cheek to cheek with people the next table over. My friend and I are two people who schooled in New York, so we're used to having conversations in packed environments, but it seemed like three tables around us were into our conversation too.

I'd still come back. The good food and prices make it worth it.
author: Geralyn Y.

description:
I used to come here all the time and I loved the food here.  Then I came back here last weekend and the pad thai was too sweet, the eggplant was too oily and bland.  The fishcake was just passing, but I've had way better.  The owner was pushy and kept telling us what was good there, but most of the stuff she recommended was not what we wanted, and she just wanted to make those decisions for us.  We said no jasmine rice b/c we ordered fried rice but they kept coming over and trying to give us jasmine rice... god.. it was horrible experience.
The tom yum was way too salty, and no spiciness at all.
author: AhLin C.

description:
Came here again last night, probably the 7th or 8th time I've eaten here.  I actually came here last Sunday too, so that's twice in 2 weeks!

The experience last Sunday was great, we had the Summer Rolls, Mango Fried Rice with Shrimp, the Sea Bass with Garlic and Pepper, and the Guay Tiew Koor noodles.  Based on last Sunday's dinner, I would have reaffirmed my 4-5 star rating.  The summer rolls were decent, and went well with the tamarind sauce.  The mango fried rice was amazing and very flavorful as were the noodles.  I felt that the sea bass was a little overpowered by the garlic and pepper that completely covered the top half of it, but it was still good if we scrapped it off.  Also, the portions for the fried rice and the noodles were decently sized, so it looks like their rice and noodle portions are larger than their a la carte entrees.

However, last night's experience was very disappointing.  I ordered the Mango Fried rice again (with chicken this time)  because I had like it so much last Sunday.  We waited about 10-15 minutes after the appetizer before our food came out. They brought out the wrong dish, and brought me Chicken Fried Rice.  When I asked them about it, they took it back, and brought it back out about 2 minutes later, but with a few diced mango pieces and cashews in it.  Obviously, they had just tossed in the mangos and cashews and just stirred fried the rice a little more.  I wouldn't mind this if it tasted like the mango fried rice I had before, but it definitely didn't!  It was saltier, yet less flavorful, and the rice was harder and drier because they had to cook it longer after they added the ingredients.  It tasted like their chicken fried rice with some pieces of mangos rather than the mango fried rice that I've ordered before.  This is totally unacceptable and the only reason I'm not giving it a 1 star is because I've liked the food in the past.
author: Tyler C.

description:
I came here on a Saturday afternoon with my friend who lives in Outer Richmond.  For those of you who follow my reviews, you know I always order somtum, this is obligatory in comparing places for me.  In addition to the somtum, we also ordered pad prig pao and chan pad poo.

The somtum was mediocre at best.  I certainly have had better, but it wasn't bad by any means.

The pad prig pao reminded me of some dish I made at my house before.  It was good, but not earth-shattering.

Now, the chan pad poo was absolutely amazing.  According to the menu iit is a "spicy rice stick noodles, stir-fried with crab meat and egg in chili garlic sauce."  If I had ordered this a little spicier, I would have been singing a slightly better tune.  I mean, not only was this dish great, but it could easily hold up a spicier punch.  I would easily drive across SF for this dish alone.  

The service was alright, certainly nothing special.  I didn't have any complaints, and my water was refilled all the time, which is always a good indicator.

I wasn't too fond of the actual décor in the restaurant.  It was intriguing, yes, but the reed or bamboo weaved construction confused me a little bit.  I almost felt like I was in a little hut, but knowing that I wasn't kind of ruined it for me.

Anyways, if you want to try a few new dishes out, come here.  It is a little small, and coming during the Saturday will probably require you to park a metered space, so keep that in mind.
author: Brent A.

description:
This place is just a golden nuGGet! 

While the food here is not spectacular, the portions are very healthy and the dishes are executed quite well. One dish that makes this place unique is their ANGEL WINGS. WOW!!! These are a great appetizer or even main course. The Thai ice tea is better than most places. Also, i am a fan of Tom Yum soup and i have to say the soup here was above average. Also try the pumpkin red curry, great flavor. 

The best part about Marness is the atmosphere. This place is pretty small (not so much if you're used to SF dining) and the owner likes to seat people nice and tight. We had 6 people dining at a table that is usually for four, but some how it worked!! 

The owner is an older woman who at times can be quite scary when she's yelling out food orders, but she really does take care of you. 

Simply put, if your look for solid Thai food, an interesting atmosphere, and some nontraditional but great service, Marnee Thai is the place! 

Happy DiNNing...
author: Nader A.

description:
I remember this place from years ago.  I would go there with my brother and our wives on a fairly regular basis.  The fat hostess at the time was obnoxious but tolerable.  There was usually a line and no matter how long it was, the wait was always "very soon" or "15 minutes."
I revisited the place a few nights ago and, my!, things have changed.  The fat lady's gone and with her, Marnee Thai's personality.  Gone was the line and gone were all the smiling, chatting customers that brought life to the place.
Slow night?  Perhaps. Then the food came.  Angel wings; what I remember as being succulent and fragrant was now dry, chewy and too garlicky.  Green curry chicken; (my favorite thai dish besides pad thai) was thin and skimpy - Osha Thai's is much better.  Roast duck on spinach; I've had better leftovers.  If you're a fan of roast duck, you'll know that you can always tell when it's been reheated.  Skip the sauce that comes with it; it only makes it worse.  Pad thai; meh.  If a thai restaurant can't do pad thai, that's sad.  It was plain and skimpy.  I think I could have done better myself.  Pad woon sen; good balance of flavors, fresh ingredients.  Clearly the best dish of the evening.
My wife, my two boys and I left most of the food unfinished.  Sad.
Slow night?  For good reason.  The service was good (the waitresses were polite and attentive) but the food was well below par.
author: P W.

description: not only is the food fantastic but the customer service is top notch!  My mom is in a wheelchair and when the staff sees us coming they rearrange the chairs at the table and come to the door to escort us in.  they treat my mom like a queen.  the food is authentic and reasonably priced.  the coconut cakes melt in your mouth, the spicy mango salad is outstanding, spicy but you can't stop wanting to continue eating it.  the chicken skewers are prepred and grilled perfectly.  Moist on the inside.  The pineapple fried rice is tropical tasting with generous chicken chunks.  The thai iced tea is blended perfectly, strong and sweet.  take out is just as good.  highly recommend.
author: Laura A.

description:
For whatever reason, I heard this location is significantly better than the other. First of all, not true. Secondly, it would have to be 10 times better in order for me to put up with the chaos the woman-owner creates. I'm sorry, but I don't pay to eat at places where someone is yelling the entire time. If I wanted that, I wouldn't have bothered moving out of my parent's home. I'm amazing that some people find her behavior charming, but to each their own. 

I had the the veggie Tom Yum at both locations and it was identical - yummy as hell. I also highly recommend the corn fritters - fried corn - can you go wrong? But most all, I will tell you to go to the one on 9th. And make a reservation.
author: Shal J.

description:
Marnee Thai is my favorite Thai restaurant.  They offer all my favorite Thai dishes.  Everything I've tried here has been delicious, I've never had a bad experience.  

My favorites:
- Corn Cakes (MUST TRY!!!)
- Chad Pan Poo (spelling?!~similar to Pad Thai but with crab)
- Yellow Chicken Curry
- Roasted Duck over Spinach
- Roti w/ Ice Cream (Holy cow, this is soooo good!  MUST TRY!!!)

Don't get scared by the loud yelling owner.  She may sound scary but she is actually a sweet lady.
author: Teresa W.

description:
Whenever somebody asks where they can find great Thai food, I always say Marnee Thai. Get the Spicy Angel Wings. It like a Thai version of San Tung's deep fried chicken. 

Marnee Thai, you're so fly.
author: Jen Y.

description:
The chopped papaya salad is delish!  And kinda spicey!  But the flame on your lips is worth it-- just be prepared to down some milk and/or a loaf of bread. 

Well, everything is not as hot as the salad, but that's all we really remember.  The Pad See Ew here is good, as is the Pad Kee Mao.  All of the dishes are rich in spices, but are also on the oily side.  People often say MT is one of the best Thai places in SF and we agree.  It's usually packed and you will need to wait at least 10 minutes before landing a table on Fri and Saturday nights.  Think of it as the Burma Superstar of Thai food... or vice versa... we're not sure which one rose to fame first.

Parking and traffic  is a bit tough around this area if you come here while the Asians still finish their late afternoon grocery shopping.  Avoid hitting them and their five bags of bok choi in each hand.
author: Kel S.

description:
I think we made a mistake by not requesting "Thai spicy" for our dishes. We had the pork belly with winter melon special that was right on time. The soup was very tasty (tom ka) and the curry was good, again, wish I had been more assertive about the "I know I'm a white lady, but I can handle the non-white spice" thang.

Must go back and taste more items on the menu.
author: G Z.

description: The quality of Marnee Thai of this location went down hill compared to that of 10 years ago,  too much sugar& MSG used in their dishes.  However, their location on 9th ave is a lot better, I was told the main chef who used to cook at Irving street location is now cooking at their 9th ave location.
author: Lillia B.

description:
yum yum! Angel wings.. very tasty, messy but tasty. Yellow curry... **drools** ......it gets a little bit cramped inside when it gets super busy and sucks for parking but well worth it. 

2 thumbs up
author: Trisha C.

description:
First time I went I was a little put off by the owner because I thought she was pushy.  On return visits I found this behavior endearing.  Food has always been wonderful and I highly recommend asking her what she recommends as she will not steer you wrong.  Be warned though, she may decide to order for you.  Highly recommend the fish dishes.

Location on 9th - Was not very impressed with my visit to the second location.  The service was horrible, really horrible.  Food arrived tepid and had to send it back ( I have never actually sent a whole dish back before for something like this, it was so cooled down the sauce was already gelatinous, gross!)  Had to ask 3 times for the check and we were charged for drinks we didn't have.
author: Gucci M.

description:
I ordered dinner last night for takeout, but could not make it before their 10pm closing time. Very cheerfully, they accomodated my slightly late pickup time, without any problems! It was absolutely awesome of them.

They make the absolute tastiest (on this coast, that is) Pad Thai i've ever had. Even though it's on the Vegetarian Menu online, you can have it with chicken or prawns. My boy had the Pad Kaprow with prawns, and the portion size wasn't impressive (just enough for one medium bowl of rice) but he was over the moon from its fantastic taste and "obvious quality of materials," meaning that they didn't use cheap-ass veggies and prawns.
author: Kristina Y.

description:
We've been going to Marnee Thai for the past six years or so, and we've NEVER had a bad meal.  Consistent quality, good service, convenient (for us) location, and the prices are very reasonable, given all of the above.  I am a big fan of their pad prig khing; I think I could put that chili sauce on my Cheerios and be happy.  When it's in season, they do this dish with asparagus and portobello mushrooms.  Just.  Amazing.

I love the woman who usually seats us; she's loud, yells at large parties for not making reservations, and has no qualms about recommending what she thinks you should order.  How fun is that?  I think it would take a biological attack to keep us away from this place...and even then, HazMat suits can't be _that_ expensive, right?
author: Brendon O.

description:
I love this place. They served delicious seafood dishes.  The owner is extremely friendly and knows her regular customers. She gives good recommend on how to match your dishes. We ordered a deeply fried fishes, the owner saw us not adding their spicy garlic sauce. She insisted us to try it and we did And it was great. Walk out the restaurant very happy.

Keep in mind, they are busy particularly on Friday evening.
author: Nancy T.

description: They have the best Thai food around and they have great service.  The owner is very sweet and very friendly.  I have been visiting this establishment for many years and I   have never been disappointed in the quality or service. They get busy at peak times.
author: Mosey S.

description: The first thing you notice as you walk in is how many awards this small restaurant boasts on their windows and walls.  These many awards (as well as the additional ones they keep at their other location) are well deserved.  This place is packed after 7 every night, with usually even a line to pick up to-go food.  The staff have a fun, family feel and I have never been disappointed by a dish as I visited once a week for the years I lived in the neighborhood.
author: Laura K.

description: Food is delicious, maybe a tad too sweet, but overall yummy!  Service there is hit or miss.  Sometimes service is good, and sometimes it's just crap and you get rolling eyes from the waitress because they've got your order wrong and the waitress is having a bad day, or whatever...  Some days they're so crowded the wait is ridiculous... but again, the food is good.
author: A T.

description: I went here because my friend and I were sick of going to King of Thai since it feels like a chain restaurant. This place has a very Thai cultured atmosphere with a lot of decorations. It's very cute. It's kind of small and cramped though. I had one of the noodles, forgot what its called but it's similiar to pad thai, and it was delicious! I ate the whole thing and the price is around $7-8, which isn't bad.
author: Vicki L.

description: There is not one negative thing that can be said about Marnee Thai. The service, the food, the prices... Everything is absolutely amazing! Not to mention Marnee (May) is the nicest woman you will ever meet. She really knows how to treat her guests and how to run a successful restaurant. The atmosphere is authentic; you walk in through the door and take a mini vacation. I strongly recommend #44 (I think that was it), which is a yellow curry dish with scallops and prawns. Deelish! We'll definitely be back very soon!
author: Daisy D.

description:
ARGH-I've been coming here for the longest time.  Since 2003.  I like the food, spicy chicken with brown rice, tom yum soup, pad see ew.  But the service is what really bothers me.  

I ordered to go so I wouldn't have to deal with the customer service (lack thereof really) and even with a take out service it was BAD.  I ordered a EXTRA spicy chicken with brown rice, I of course get WHITE rice.  I told the waitress about the issue, she mumbled under her breath and changed the rice.  I also see on the food slip that it said Medium spicy, when in fact I wanted it EXTRA spicy.  Argh.. so whatever I go to pay with my debit card.  She slides the card and says, your card is not going thru, do you have another card.  NO WAY.  I have money in my account.. so I ask her to do it again.  Another grumble under her breath.  She even rolls her eyes.  Again she attempts to process the transaction and she says "No, its not going thru."  So I give her another card and again, it doesn't go thru.  Obviously its a problem with her machine not my freakin card.  So another waitress says to me quietly, do you have cash, our machine isn't working.  NO DUH.  Don't say that my card isn't going thru when its obviously a problem with your machine, AND roll your eyes at me.  So I search my wallet for cash, and give up all my quarters to pay for my order which was made incorrectly.  

To wrap this all up, if you can ignore the snide gestures, bad customer service, and slip ups with ordering, this is the place to go for food.
author: Alice E.

description: The angel wings here are definitely a winner. Nice decor, albeit space is tight because location is small and they try to fit in more tables. I haven't tried the 9th Ave location but here it is easier to park during evenings.
author: H K.

description: pretty good thai, more american than lers ros
author: Niket B.

description:
So I finally went to this place last weekend. I heard about it but since it was on Irving and all ready use to going to other establishments when on said street, this place never really becomes an option. The place wasn't crowded but then again, it wasn't during lunch rush hours or anything. The food was great and the service was cool. I liked this place better than the other Thai place in Daly City that I might have reviewed... or not... eh, it's Friday and my brain is lacking oxygen from working. I can't remember everything.

I would give this place five stars but there's some things that get to me. One, there was this huge fly inside. I usually don't have problems with flies in restaurant unless they're all over our table, which it really wasn't, but it was freaking huge. Two, the place is on the small side for me. For some reason, they put us near this obnoxious group and since I was the third wheel, I got the side that other people were on and so I had to watch not bumping into the asshole behind me. There were other tables... I don't understand why they had to put us near them.

Other than that, I'm sure if I went here again and there was less annoying people and they gave us a better seat where I didn't feel cramped because of the person behind me, this place could be a five-star place. The Bangkok fried rice (or was it the Thai Fried Rice... I don't remember) was excellent, by the way.
author: Chris S.

description:
Love love love their pig on a blanket!

If you don't know what i'm talking about, then go find out.. don't just look at this weird. 

Angel wings are pretty bomb too.

I've been a fan of Marnee Thai for a while and been here more than a handful of time and the food is awesome. I don't really have a particular entree that i actually love but appetizer are what does it for me. 

Only complaint is can be a bit too crowded but over all still good service. Lunch time is best time to go.
author: Carol N.

description: I've tried both locations and have always enjoyed the food here, though I've only dined in at this location.  This particular location is super small inside, but otherwise a good place to go.  The pad thai is pretty popular here, but I usually prefer to order the pad see ew.  Their angel wings are soo good (really spicey!!) and I enjoy their papaya salad also.  I'm also a fan of panang curry and we ordered it with fish instead of the other listed meats and they made it with sea bass--YUMMMY!!
author: Tess E.

description: This is our go-to for Thai cuisine. I'm a creature of habit and always get the yellow curry. I'll change up on the meat for a little hint of variation. Actually, writing this review is making my mouth water.
author: David G.

description: The food was excellent! So was the decor. The only complaint that I had to say would be the wait. But darn it the wait was worth it. The customer service was awesome too!
author: Ronnel C.

description:
WOW!!! Looking for Thai Cuisine? Look no further. I've tried quite a few Thai restaurants from San Diego to Los Angeles, and even a few up in the Bay Area, but Marnee Thai has got to be THE BEST restaurant I've been to HANDS DOWN.  I know this sounds a bit cliche, but the food is absolutely fabulous.  Here's my rule of thumb:  When trying out a new Thai restaurant, you've gotta try 3 things.  Their Papaya Salad, their Pad Thai, and one of their curry dishes.  I believe these are "power dishes"- the dishes that make or break the restaurant.  We started out with the Spicy Angel Wings and the Papaya Salad.  Now, if you haven't been reading anyone else's reviews, about 90% of them tell you to try the Angel Wings... there's a reason for that... trust us on this one.  The Papaya Salad is extremely light and refreshing.  It's a great way to warm up your palate for what's to come.  We then had the Kang Keaw with chicken.  This is a green curry eggplant dish.  Here's what I loved about this dish: 1) the curry is not overpowered by tons of coconut juice, and 2) the chicken (or your choice of meat) and vegetables aren't drowned in a pool of broth.  We had this with some steamed rice, and I swear... I could have eaten JUST the curry broth and rice all day long.  Of course we ordered the Pad Thai.  This is the dish that won me over.  The noodles are perfectly cooked to the right texture.  The sauce is not greasy, and the flavor has a "home-made" feel to it.  Definitely not like any other Thai restaurant I've been to.

The downside to this restaurant... it's small and it gets crowded.  We went on a Sunday and luckily we made reservations.  By the time we were done eating, the waiting crowd outside had amassed to about 15-20 people.  I had to squeeze my way out of the restaurant.  We were seated right next to the kitchen entrance in front of the register.  This is not a good place to sit.  In order to get to the bathroom, you gotta go through the kitchen.  So, not only were the waiters, waitresses, and bus boys trying to get in and out of the kitchen; but now we had people trying to line up to get into the bathroom!  This was semi-tolerable.  What I didn't like was the younger waiter running back and forth trying to clean and set the tables.  I understand it's busy and you're trying to accomodate your guests, but it seemed a bit unprofessional.  He was literally RUNNING inside the restaurant.  And beware: if you haven't touched one of your plates in two minutes, they may take it away.  I was resting up to go for round 2 on my curry when one of the waiters reached in to take the plate from me.  I told him I wasn't done, and he apologized.  So for the down side of the restaurant, I had to retract a star from my rating.  But overall... I highly recommend!!!
author: Richie C.

description: This place was awesome.  A fan of Osha Thai, my tummy was equally happy, if not moreso.  Their seasonal appetizers (Hotcakes) were perfect, and the Pad Thai was the best I've ever had :).  Perfect find in the sunset!
author: Jen Z.

description:
This is one of my favorite Thai restaurant for decently priced and good food. Also, bring two or three extra people with you so you could order more dishes. These are the things that I normally order: tod mun, pad thai, papaya salad, pumpkin curry with chicken, bbq chicken dish and the best Pad Ma Keur (Stirred fried chicken and eggplant with basil.) 

People would probably questioned why I would ordered bbq chicken from a thai restaurant. Well here is why, the chicken is actually a young hen bba to such perfection that even the white meat is tender and moist. On top of that, it comes with a pineapple dipping sauce and when you mixed it together it is divine.
author: Allison H.

description: Marnee Thai is definitely on point and consistent with their service and quality of food! I've never had a bad experience here and the servers are just soo friendly! All the dishes I've tried here are all flavorful & authentic: pad thai, chan pad poo, roasted duck noodles, pad nor mai, spicy chicken with basil, imperial rolls, chicken satay, spicy angel wings, corn cakes, mango sticky rice, & fried banana w/ ice cream. Of course, don't forget the thai ice tea or fresh coconut juice! Great for lunch or dinner, they also have specials posted both outdoors and indoors so checkk em out!
author: A. T.

description:
Marnee Thai is THE BOMB

go with the Pad Thai or Pad Se You(spelling on this one?...no idea)


/review
author: Kevin R.

description: Good memories of this place over the years.  What's not to like?  Excellent thai food, in the easy going Sunset area.  Stroll after dinner, weather permitting.
author: Paul A.

description: i had number pad kee mao, it was alright, spicy noodles, i like rice noodles, the flat ones, so taste good. The thing i loved the most was the angel wings, there were huge, but some small ones too, and tasted pretty damn good. the flavor was intense, and good, and crispy with good sauce layer.
author: David L.

description:
I absolutely love this place.

And even better, it's owned by my friend's parents! So you definitely should give this place a shot.

I've never eaten here during their dinner service, but I'm sure it's just as good as lunch.

I've ordered their roasted duck noodles with soup. This was amazing. I love noodles in soup, so this was like heaven. When you first get it, it looks like something you could get at a Chinese restaurant, but once you take your first bite, you'll immediately see how it's a lot different.

Unfortunately I do not get to eat here often, but everyone I know enjoys this place as well.

If you love Thai food (who doesn't?), go down to Irving and try this place out!
author: Michelle P.

description:
My first foray into the restaurant was with some girlfriends of mine, this happens to be my friend's favorite Thai restaurant.  She has been raving about it for years, until finally she brought me and a group of our girlfriends here for dinner.  It did not disappoint,  Marnee Thai is probably the best Thai food I've had so far in SF.  Everything on the menu is consistently good and more authentic in comparison to the others (i.e. Osha).

Don't forget to order the roti for dessert, it is the epitome of crispy fried sticky sweet goodness.  We ordered one to share after we were stuffed to the gills, but I made them order a second because I still didn't get enough!
author: Burrito M.

description:
Love this place. Always crowded, but always worth it. Fast and friendly service, consistently delicious food. Plus, Marnee is usually there and makes sure the place is running smoothly.

We go about once a month and will continue to do so as it's our favorite Thai place in the city.
author: Danni M.
