description: THIS is some good thai! I've tried tons of other places in the sunset but this is by far the best! great staff, great food, and you can't beat the awesome atmosphere!
author: Austin S.

description: I loved this place! Picked Marnee Thai over the multitude of other thai restaurants in the area simply because of all the great Yelp reviews.  Glad I listened!! We got Pad Thai, Tom Yum Soup, Yellow Curry, and Pad Kee Maw.  Everything was well seasoned, tasty, and not overly oily or anything.  Service was also great.  The owner was exceptionally nice and kept on checking in on us.  We went on a Tuesday evening at about 6:30 and the place was lightly populated..good thing we got there a bit earlier because the place was jammed by 7 with people waiting out the door!  Also, loved the ambiance of the bamboo hut-feel and the traditional clothes that the servers wore.  Definitely coming back here for another Thai fix!!
author: Joanna M.

description:
Love the food!  Very flavorful and authentic.  Everything is good.  I especially like the mussaman curry and any of the fried noodle dishes.  

Service is decent considering it is always very crowded.  Lots of screaming and yelling out orders.  

Nice place for a date.  Not a good place for a party greater than 4.  It's too small, crowded, and you will end up in the corner squished together during busy hours.
author: Cin T.

description: I came here early in the morning with my girlfriend, and I guess I was craving Thai food so much that I didn't realize that I was 30 minutes before opening. Anyways, the food here is pretty good and one of the better ones I've had in SF. I had the green curry lunch special, and it was nice and creamy and at the right consistency. The only thing I didn't like about it was that it had a tad too much bamboo, but I still loved it. Prices are pretty decent. I would definitely try again.
author: Nick L.

description: This place gets really crowded, very quickly. Parking is a hassle, and there's no real place to wait. BUT the food is good and prices are very reasonable for SF.
author: Jessica S.

description:
I've never had a bad dish here, period. 

The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars, is because I always feel a little claustrophobic, and sometimes the crazy owner lady is a bit much to handle.

Otherwise, amazing.
author: Nikkol K.

description: I ate at this location since I had the one on 9th Ave. This place can be pack. Luckily my friend and I got a table within a minute. The service can be slow. It can be hard to get help. Luckily the food was awesome.
author: Ronald N.

description:
Marnee Thai has great thai food! My favorites are definitely, the corn cakes and the angel wings. I don't know of any other thai restaurant that makes these like Marnee does. The angel wings are seriously amazing - deep fried with a yummy garlic sauce. Totally addictive!!

The owner is a sweetie pie, although some may have the wrong idea because she's usually yelling out orders on the floor. Unfortunately, it's a popular joint and there's always a line at night. Lunch is ideal since its pretty quiet.

AND OH OH OH, do NOT forget to order dessert!!! The roti with ice cream is AWESOME. It's a fried piece of dough with condensed milk on top with coconut ice cream. MMMMMMMMMMM....
author: Angela T.

description:
I love Marnee.  

I have a stomach of steel, though.  I've eaten sushi in the desert and lived to tell.

I love Marnee, but it has had some rather unpleasant gastrointestinal distress aftermath for those of the week of stomach on several ocassions.  My dates either have weak bowels or Marnee's has just enough spice and kick to kill.

I don't care though.  I love Marnee's.
author: Jen I.

description:
The angel wings on its own would have gotten 4 stars, but the rest of the food I ordered coupled with the shoddy service shot the restaurant's rating down. I came with a party of 6, so we sampled a variety of the menu, but everything came out salty. I'm not sure if it was because everything was prepared in advance or if the chef's tastebuds were off that day. The roti looked and tasted more like a funnel cake than the traditional sweet Thai roti.

Now the service...the lady who took our order kept insisting that we order other things. Last time I checked, patrons got to choose what the heck they want to eat. I'm open to suggestions, but she was overly insistent about ordering more main courses. And the main course we ordered due to her insistence didn't even taste that great! Worst of all was the loud woman who was completely RUDE. Not only did she repeatedly bump into my friend while we were seated at our table without even apologizing, she also kept yelling in Thai and English across the restaurant.  She'd yell in Thai whether a table was done yet, yell at the poor wait staff in Thai, and then tell another group in English that they had to move among other things. 

Overall, I wouldn't bother coming to this place again. There are plenty of Thai restaurants in the city with comparable (if not better) food and certainly with better service.
author: Jane K.

description: I love this place. I usually get the duck fried rice and eat it with their chili sauce .... their chili sauce was sogood that I bought like  a small jar for $3 so i can eat it with stuff i get from other restaurants lol.
author: Cindy L.

description: Hands down the best Thai food I've ever had.  The specialty green curry dumpling dish was incredible.  I also enjoyed the calamari appetizer and the shrimp Pad Kee Mao w/ Prawns...  There was a long wait for the table, but it was definitely worth the wait.  Go here for a special occasion birthday - they will sing happy birthday the the "boss lady" will give you your fortune! Don't mess with the boss lady or else no thai for you!
author: Laura P.

description:
This is one of my favorite Thai restaurants.  Everything, and I mean everything is good there.  I love noodles though, so I'll usually get Yum Woon Sen (Thai noodle salad), noodle soups (ex: Yen Tha Fo), or stir fried noodles (ex: Pad Kee Mao).  Most of the noodle dishes are served at lunch.  Oh, I also love to eat the appetizers, specifically the Goong Sarong/Grabok (I forgot what they call it there, it's basically shrimp wrapped in wonton wrapper and deep fried)...YUMMY!  

The downfall, it's a tiny place, so when they have a full house (usually at dinner) it gets really packed.  They have a 2nd location on 9th (between Lincoln Way and Irving) though.  The portions also seem to get smaller over the years...boo.  

Don't forget to get dessert.  Try them all, they're delicious! =)
author: Sandy J.

description:
I checked this place out first in high school.  With the baller income of... nothing, I drove around with some friends to find some cheap eats.  It was late at night, and we were looking at menus on restaurant windows.  The place seemed to have pretty decent prices.  With no credit card at hand, and only $7 bucks in hand we walked in.  

When they handed us the menu, we found out that we had looked at lunch special prices.  That night 5 people shared 3 dishes.  I ate the decorative lettuce on the plate. The funny thing is the restaurant isn't even that expensive.  It's probably a couple bucks more than most Thai places.  Its not a cheap eat; but the quality of the food definitely matches the price.  Now a man, with all three chest hairs, I can order a reasonable number of dishes proportional to the size of the dinner party.  One meal and my parents were converted to Thai food lovers.  I was tempted to give this place a 5, but the place is really small, and we waited 30 minutes to be seated when we had a reservation.
author: Garrett W.

description: Delicious! The Spicy Angel Wings are a fantastic, tangy-sweet/savory way to start. The currys are wonderful as is the pad ma kuer with prawns! I also love their pineapple fried rice and can't leave without the mango with sticky rice or fried banana dessert. Definite MUST if you haven't been there yet!
author: Cheley F.

description:
6/8 update!  Added another star because the owner got back to me right away & cleared things up.  

Apparently our server entered and voided two incorrect amounts and then charged us correctly all on the night we were there.  However, for some reason BofA took a few additional days to post the voided charges and the 3rd, correct charge, so when I checked my statement 3 days after we ate at Marnee Thai all I saw were two charges one after the other, neither for the correct amount!  

To make amends for the angel wings issue, the owner also offered us a "credit" for an appitizer next time we come in.  The fact that we were charged in the first place for something we never *ordered*, however, keeps me from giving the whole experience 4 stars.  

--------------------

Original post: Check your credit card statement after dining at this authentic, friendly little Thai/Siamese place in the Sunset!

The food was very good.  The tom ka was excellent - perfect balance of sour, spice, and coconut, plus lots of flavorful mushrooms.  I usually don't order pad Thai, but I've had enough to feel I'm a fair judge.  It was good & veggis and prawns were fresh, but the dish wasn't exceptional.  We had the golden triangles for an appitizer and those were a hit at our table.

Here are the problems we encountered . . . mid-way through dinner our hostess/server/owner came by and explained in a cheerful tone something along the lines of . . .  " we have extra Angel Wings . . . it is a busy night . . . they are a favorite dish . . . would you like to try?"  "Uh, sure, okay!" my meat eating boyfriend replied.  We looked at each other thinking - wow, we're coming back!  A few minutes later a plate of wings arrived at our table.  At the end of the evening the check came . . .

You guessed it, we were billed for the Angle Wings.  Honestly, neither of us was surprised.  We're not naive.  Perhaps we should have inquired about whether they were going to be on the house.  Regardless, I don't feel this is the customer's burden.  We were offered something because they had "extra" of a favorite dish, and we said yes.  Oh well.  

Here's the kicker - checked my bank account today and discovered they charged us twice!  One charge for $46.50 and another for $46.  I called about an hour ago and am waiting for the owner to call me back.  I'm sure it'll be worked out, but after the Angel Wings issue, it has certainly crossed my mind that this error could be something other than an honest mistake.
author: eileen d.

description: Great food...great peps...long wait... make reservation...
author: Vishal P.

description:
we (party of 10) went here on a Saturday night around 7:30pm and had to wait almost an hour even with a reservation.  they kept telling us that it will be a couple minutes every 15 or 20 minutes.  to be fair but not an excuse the party at the table they wanted to seat us at hung out even after they paid.  it seems like a lot of people order to go which is a great idea if you live close by.  the restaurant is a bit small and so we were really cozy.  

we order pad thai, tum yum soup, pumpkin curry, green curry, red curry, papaya salad, corn cakes, and this special fish dish.  the pad thai and corn cakes were by far the best thing we ordered.  the pad thai was not mushy, sticky, or overly sweet.  the corn cakes were excellent and had a nice coconut flavor. 

i have to say though i think they dumb down the spicy-ness level for the demographics/population they serve.  the red curry was ordered spicy and it wasn't even close.    we ended up spending 19/person which wasn't bad.

the service was good.  they came by often enough to refill tea/water and to clear the empty plates.
author: huong n.

description:
I love this place. 
Was first taken here by friends about 10 years ago and haven't been able to kick the habit since then. 
The angel wings both chicken and tofu are amazing, but so is everything else that I've tried on the menu.
The Secret to getting a table here with out a long wait is simply come early or late. If you show up between 7-9 good luck! But I've had really good luck showing up at 6 or at 9 and sitting down right away.
Reservations are not really worth it, it just jumps you to the head of the line of people waiting for a table, useful, but not exactly a reservation is it... 
Still love this place and just wish I lived a bit closer!
author: Scott O.

description: Marnee Thai is an Americanized version of a Thai restaurant. It's like Natalie Thai in Los Angeles. Dishes like panang, yellow curry, red curry, and yum woonsen are much deviated from the original. Pad Thai and Papaya salad are closer to the real one. When the place is packed with large groups, service can be horribly slow because of the limited availability of their staffs.  I also got the feeling they tended to push you out too after you finish all the dishes esp when there are people waiting outside. So, not quite a good place to hang out and talking too much.
author: Elle W.

description:
I have never had Thai food like what I got at Marnee. I have had a lot of Thai, especially near work in Berkeley. You can throw a stone and hit a thai place. 

Anyway, Marnee, is almost perfection. I went there for the first time last Friday. I hadn't planned on going there. I was actually driving aimlessly around the city trying to find a decent place to eat around 9PM that night. Everywhere I went I didn't want to get out. Finally I somehow ended up in the sunset on Irving and found a parking spot. I got out and right in front of me was Marnee. I hesitated and thought...Korean or Thai. Since I was by myself...I went for Thai. 

I was seated by, and I am guessing, the owner or mother of the place. She was so cute and boisterous. Very much added to the charm of the place. All of the servers took care and did a good job of getting food out quick and hot. 

I decided on the Silver noodle salad and yellow curry with chicken. The silver noodle salad was surprisingly spicy but amazingly delicious. The yellow curry was out of this world. I am salivating just thinking about it. I think I might need to make a special trip out there to try something else.
author: Andrea T.

description: I've been to the Marnee Thai on 9th Ave several times but this was my first time here.  We must have walked in at the perfect time because after sitting down the place filled up quick!  We ordered the fried tofu appetizer and it was perfectly fried and super soft inside.  The dish came with two dipping sauces.  We also ordered the pumpkin curry.  They use kabocha instead of pumpkin which I prefer.  We got the dish vegetarian and it came with squishy tofu squares, more like the gluten stuff rather than tofu.  We also ordered the pad se ew, vegetarian.  There was so much food for the two of us we only ate a few bites of the noodles and took the rest home.  The bites of pad se ew was delicious though, with flavors of salty and a little sweet.  Yum!  They got super busy and the way the staff moved you could tell they wanted to turn the tables around quick.  Other than that, the meal was great.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
For the pad thai noodles (i hope i spelled that right) , the angel wings yum and the chicken curry!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Some find the owner pushy, but she's a trip because she is somewhat "psychic", but she guessed something about our friend was right on. Yeah she could have been pulling our leg, but we found it amusing! It's nice when the owner has personality!!

Everyone I brought there have enjoyed their food and it's cool to run into them having dinner with other people (yeah i know why didn't they take me), but it's cute to see that they really liked the place and weren't lying to me when saying thank you for introducing them to Marnee Thai!
author: M R.

description:
I freaking felt like i was in THAILAND! When my friends and i walked in it looked so cute! it looked like we were in a little hut. The waitresses were so friendly and attentive with filling our water glasses. AND THE BEST PART! the FOOOOOOOOOD!!! let me just tell you...the SPICY ANGEL WINGS. it was like a party in my mouth and everyone is invited. and i know my chicken wings...it is up there like top 5 status. the pad thai was delicious. My friends got the thai fried rice (perfecto), rad nar (so yum), green curry (so good and the beef was so tender), and the green papyrus salad (always a favorite). If your ever in San Francisco and your in the mood for thai, go to MARNEE THAI! you won't be sorry!

oh yea! and it was a girls birthday and the lady came out with a gong after turning the lights down...it was so cute! since the dining area is so little it was like a big huge family singing happy birthday to her.
author: Suzan L.

description:
Love the chan pad poo (crab noodles), angel wings, and green bean beef. I was introduced to this place by my old college roommate. The owner is a little eccentric and brags about how she can give a fortune telling with high accuracy. I don't believe in such things, as I came there strictly for the food, but my old roomie was pretty entertained.

Anyway, order the chan pad poo. Now that I've moved back to the South Bay from SF, I cannot find any Thai place that even comes close to Marnee Thai's version.
author: Jen S.

description:
First off, I'd like to say that I only came to this restaurant only because of the ratings it received on yelp. 

When we first entered it was packed, so we thought it is definitely worth the try. 1st thing I come to notice, no water was served to us as every table got water regardless. I do mean EVERY table. 

I got the Pad Se-Ew as it is my safe dish for every thai place. There was no taste to it as they changed to rice noodle (noodles used in Pad Thai) from flat wide noodles. We later found out we were charged $3 for rice which they claimed was on the menu as the waitress presented me the menu but could not show me where it shows a la carte dishes are not served with rice or noodles in addition to the price of rice. 

They then used example of Chinese restaurants assuming we were Chinese off the bat that a la carte are assumed not served with dishes. However I never heard of any Chinese places whom charges for rice when you order a la carte. Yes I'm sure there are places but I also do know some shows it on the menu for $1 or $1.50 for a bowl of rice but usually they dont even charge you for it. Overall bad service.
author: Ian C.

description:
Let's get this restaurant up to 5 stars!  

I love authentic Thai food, and the fare here is pretty good.  A while ago I ordered the Thai sausage special and it was delicious.  I hope that they are still serving this.

Although the place is pretty cramped, they somehow make it work.
author: Meena A.

description: The food was delicious and there was plenty of it. There's also a back room that's great if you have a large group. The drinks are also pretty good here.
author: lottie t.

description: One of my favorite spots for quick and delicious Thai food in the City!  We were introduced to hoa moke here, which is very good.  I also really like their silver noodle salad and noodle soups.  If you're lucky, you happen to eat here on a day when "grandma" has made her home-made dessert dumplings...almost like little bright-colored mochi balls in coconut milk...mmmm!  Have only ever had this a couple times and have never found it anywhere else.
author: Sherri C.

description: With an interior that transports you to old Thailand, this joint has got some great food and service. After reading some of the other reviews, I have to advise ppl. to avoid the crowd and get here for an early dinner. Luckily my friends and I had no trouble getting a table here since we got in around 4p. And if its a wkend, bet on fighting for a parking spot. We immediately ordered the sweet/sour chicken, pad see yoo, yellow chicken curry, and tom yum soup. We also ordered some hot Thai tea, which was pretty good, only minus the sugar and milk of the Thai iced tea. The food came out pretty quickly, and I liked how they were attentive to refilling our water and tea. Pretty affordable for dinner too. After splitting the bill 3 ways, we each put in $17 tip included. Next time I come back I'll have to try the angel wings ppl. have been raving about.
author: Thomas L.

description: Very good delivery...dont eat in the resturant but if you want goo tahi delivery food order from here.
author: Braydan Y.

description:
There are 2 main considerations for me when reviewing a restaurant:

 1. The service.
We had reservations for a party of 8. We arrive on time, wait for about 5 minutes, then are shown a table. There are only 6 settings and chairs. We clarify that there are 8 of us. They tell us to go back outside and wait.  10 minutes later we're ushered back in. This time there are 8 place settings and only 5 chairs. A mild improvement. We stand around and the place is packed. It's probably over capacity in there, and i'm taking the opportunity to look around at what everyone else is eating ;). We finally flag down someone about the chair situation. The chairs trickle in. Slowly. We order quickly and watch as 2 other tables get shifted about. People who are seated are asked to move to other tables so they can rearrange. It seemed very disorganized, and would only fly at an Asian restaurant. On the plus side, the food basically came flying out. The tip is automatically calculated for parties of 6 or more, so there was no way to make a subtle comment about the wierd mixup with the table or having to stand around without chairs. 2.5 stars.

2. The food.
Finally I understood why I waited around so awkwardly. The food is pretty darn good! We went with Yelpers' recommendations and tried the papaya salad, green curry with beef and eggplant, angel wings and pad thai with shrimp. I was surprised that the angel wings weren't stuffed like other angel wings i've had before, but they were crispy and sweet. The beef in the curry was a bit chewy, but the eggplant soaked up the flavors perfectly. We also ordered from the specials menu: the mango fried rice and 2 orders of snapper. My favorite was the snapper with the garlic. If you're a garlic lover, you've gotta try it. I wanted to order the chilean seabass, but it's endangered and all...so...I decided against it. Of course I drank a Singha beer. 4.5 stars.

If you come on your birthday, they will turn out the lights in the restaurant, bring out some icecream with a lit candle and hit a gong. The whole place will sing to you. It's not every restaurant where you get a gong on your birthday.

My dad tried to chat it up with the owner. She was too busy and was having none of his banter. Of course she wasn't too busy to sell him her cookbook for $35. She informed us curtly that it was autographed by her husband.  Oh, and the angel wings recipe in the book isn't exactly what they serve at the restaurant. You know, that would be too easy!

All in all i'd come back! I'd have a reservation and make sure to wear some comfortable shoes with my "laid back attitude" hat on to match.
author: Krista F.

description:
One of only two Thai restaurants in the Bay area that can come even close to rivaling the Thai food I grew up eating in my mother's kitchen and in the Thai restaurants of Southern California.  Marnee would get 5 stars if they had not made the unfortunate choice of Westernizing the spice level of too many of their dishes, therefore really cooling a lot of their dishes down.  

When we went with my Thai mother she asked Mai to make the Prik King with asparagus instead of green beans, and it was excellent.  The asparagus was perfectly cooked, the pork was tender, the sauce was not too oily.  We also had the beef salad-- the beef was perfectly cooked and it had lovely, well-balanced citrus and spice.  The calamari salad was equally impressive with fresh calamari without even a hint of rubberiness.  

We also had a lovely duck curry, and we actually ordered two dishes I have refused to order in a Thai restaurant for close to 10 years now: chicken satay and Phad Thai.  I normally wouldn't be caught dead ordering these two dishes, but they were suprisingly good - the satay was spicey, and the Phad Thai was not overly sweet-- a problem so many mediocre Thai restaurants and people who think they can cook Thai often make.  

Marnee is excellent homestyle Thai food that really reminds me of my childhood.
author: AaronandMaureen B.

description:
What sold me is the decoration of the place. The decoration is what won me over. It feels like you are in a hut. How often do you find restaurants like that? 

The food was good and not badly priced. I recommend it to people who love thai food. Service is also really good. They are super friendly.
author: Sonlay V.

description: Got the Pad Kee Mao and the Thai Fried Rice. It was pretty good, but i think next time I'll get a hotter Pad Kee Mao because at mild, it was not very spicy, but more sweet. I think they use that asian orange hot chili sauce that is kinda thick... Yep. I got pick up, and when I went in to pick it up... the lady was rude because over the phone she misheard the phone number and thought that I did not place an order... Then started talking back to me in a rude word. UGh.
author: Katherine C.

description:
We got here just before the dinner rush - 5.30p on a Sunday.

The resto is quite small, so my poor hubby was bumped into every time a person tried to squeeze their way through to the tables on the other side.

Service was okay - the woman in charge was quite busy and hectic herself - not spectacular, but not bad either.

The food, however, was pretty dang good. We didn't get the much talked about angel wings (next visit), but we ordered samosas (good, slightly spicy), pad thai (good, but on the sweet side), mussaman curry with chicken (the spiciest mussaman curry i've ever had) and pineapple fried rice (yum!) - and everything was really good! My toddler LOVED the fried rice (wasn't a fan of the thai iced tea, though) and had a taste of the pad thai.
author: Kelly R.

description:
Fabulous Thai in Sunset.  When I was a kid my mom would always take me here when we went to the city, and it was the only Thai food I ever liked!  (This changed when I found Siam in Seattle, but that's another review)  Now I love Thai food, just generally, but when I recently went back to Marnee's it was just as good as always.

Delicious Larb and Satay, I love their peanut sauce it's some of the best I've had.  And the Thai tea (not the bright orange stuff, though that's fabulous and all) was just delicious, delicate and at the perfect temperature, just warm enough to take the chill off.  To finish off I decided to try something new, and went with coconut ice cream and white sticky right for dessert.  Wow!  I might have to make that a regular finish to every Thai meal!

I'm looking forward to my next trip!
author: Lauren S.

description: Trusting Yelp reviews again has paid off. While the outside may look questionable, the food is simply fantastic. Lots of creative and different specials.  Service was enthusiastic and extremely attentive.  The food came out fast.   The Tom Yum soup had great flavor. The chicken was a little dry in the soup, so go with the prawns. Green curry had just the right amount of spice. Interior is pretty unique. Check out the ceiling.
author: Brian S.

description: how marnee thai racked up so many accolades and raving reviews i really don't know. there are numerous thai restaurants in the city that rival if not exceed the authentic taste of their food. the bf and i ordered a pad thai and curry pork. i do understand that most people would order a side of rice to pair with the curry, but i'm the type that does not appreciate seeing an item on the bill that i did not ask for...and i did not ask for rice. the lady who took our order didn't explain that rice costs extra. she didn't  even ask if we wanted rice. how we found out that rice is not included was the hard way, after the fact, when there was no way of returning it. this left me with a very sour taste. so much so that i'll probably never come back.
author: Melissa Y.

description:
This review is solely based on my latest Marnee Thai experience. (The last experience was not as pleasant because my reservations got all screwed up, but I forgive them because it was for such a large party.) 

Walked in today (Sunday) at 2PM for lunch and we were seated immediately. I really liked the orchids that were on the table. :D Anyway, along to the food; I had the pad thai, which was pretty good...better than King of Thai's. I also tried some of my friend's Chan Pad Poo, which is rice noodles with shredded crab meat, pretty good! The service was quick. But it seems like the wait staff only consisted of two people. Weird, but maybe it's cause I wasn't paying much attention. Overall, everything was delicious and my thai iced tea was very refreshing as well.
author: Audrey T.

description:
Today was my first experience here, I called in my order, which was ready when I go tthere, thank god ! THe parking over there sucks a little, but the Thai friend rice i ordered was huge ! It was great for the most part expcet the tofu was a little softer then I normally like, and my assistant ordered the Angel wings, which she said wern't that great because the chicken didn't seemed fried, which i guess is how it is normally made. 
 I would go there again because its the closest Thai place to my work, but I think i am going to try to sit and eat there next time ! lol
author: Marisa A.

description:
What a wonderful, quaint restaurant! The family who owns this restaurant and the one on 9th are exceptionally nice! Props go out to master chef dad, hostess with the mostest mom and heir to the marnee thai franchise, the son (whose name I will omit to keep his privacy! he's a wonderful guy who I went to high school with =) ).

The Corn Cakes are spot-on! Fried corn fritters are what they are and also what I always get every time I go. 

Also, can't go wrong with some spicy Papaya Salad! I also really love the Basa Fillet cooked in fresh garlic and black pepper sauce (you have two other sauce options to choose from) and the Tofu cooked with spicy fresh chili, garlic and basil (here also, two other sauce options). 

Roti with ice cream is also delish. Reminds me of roti tissue in Malaysia =).

A San Francisco staple!
author: Christine C.

description:
I've been going to this restaurant for years and always loved it...not tonight.  Food is average at best, they must have a new cook because it wasn't nearly the same as previous visits.  My order was to go and they forgot an item which isn't good since I drove about 8 miles to get there.
Not sure I'll go back for awhile, the place on 9th seems to be a little better than this location.
author: joan b.

description:
Mmmm.   Lamb curry.  Fan-freakin-tastic.  The penang beef was also excellent.  Obviously these had both been sitting in a pot thinking about themselves for quite a while, as opposed to getting stir-fried chinese style.

I wish they'd move to Boston.  They could even bring the roaches and used band-aids with them, and I wouldn't care...
author: Julian H.

description:
A must try if you are in the sunset area.  This little place is decorated like a little hut which makes it very interesting.  The food is also very good too.  

Only thing is that the tables are close to one another...a bit tight and uncomfortable.  And the lady who runs the place yells like a mutha fucker.  I'm Chinese and I'm use to people yelling in restaurants...but this lady takes it to a new level..  I could not enjoy my dinner because of her!
author: hello k.

description:
It was once my favorite go to Thai restaurant.  However, after visiting the original Marnee again I was a bit disappointed.  Maybe it was due to the fact that I didn't have to wait, it was a little weird to see 1/2 the tables empty when entering.  The ambiance was actually horrid!  They had techno-Buck Rogers-Thai music playing a bit too loudly, and the lighting was garish.  

The food was good, however I have found just as good Thai in other neighborhood places.  Overall a satisfying-yet mediocre experience.  Does that even make sense?

Oh....plus one star for the Yelp sticker on the front!
author: Brye L.

description:
Thus far, and still my favorite little Thai hut =)

ANGEL WINGS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!


(enough said.)
author: Sue Y.

description:
Love the food. I ordered Pad Pring Kao(spelling?), Pad Thai and Pad Gar Pao (spelling?!). A bit too greasy for my friends' taste, but then again greasy is good sometimes LOL.

Waitresses are very friendly and don't mind explaining each menu to my non-english-speaking friends. It's true that the table is too close to each other so don't say anything offensive, you will never know who's sitting behind you!! (or maybe you will, haha...)
I like the ambiance, and I can't wait for another trip here.
author: Maria H.

description:
3.5 stars for this place

Let's go with the negative first: 
minus 1.0 star for parking
minus 0.5 star for a loud owner/server (you guys know who i m talking about once you walk in)

The food is authentic and good.  One of the better ones in the bay area.  Not a lot worth mentioning... a very good Thai place.  One thing I have to mention is the dessert - Mango with Sticky Rice.  I think Marnee Thai has the best Mango and Sticky Rice dessert I've had in the bay area.  I'd come here and order just the dessert! (of course take out cuz I am sure the owner would force me to order other stuff too!)
author: Kapo T.

description:
My wife and I ate here a few nights ago.  I liked the interior, which is sort of decked out like a much cleaner version of a thai thatched hut.  

The wait staff was a little pushy.  I had the pumpkin curry and was very pleased with its subtle and balanced flavor.  I found myself enjoying it more and more the more I ate.  Glad I live within walking distance.
author: Josh F.

description:
We came here for dinner with recommendation from a friend. The place is small so seating is not the most comfortable. They were fairly packed on a Thursday night... Street parking was surprisingly not too hard to find. The food was pretty good and did not disappoint. I liked my Thai Iced Tea, it's the best I've had. The best dishes we've had were the Chicken Satay and Spicy Angel Wings.
I would give it 4 stars, but I have to drop a star after seeing our bill. We ordered extra noodles so because we didn't want rice. A waitress came in the middle of our dinner and scooped rice into each of our plate without asking if we wanted any so we thought the rice was free. Instead, we were charged for rice at $1.50 per person that we did not order.
author: Sydney L.

description:
Very delicious.

Space is a little cramped (or cozy, depending on your point of view).

Parking can be a little difficult but it is all worth it for the reasonably priced thai.

Highly recommend the Angel Wings.

It's hard to compare this place against others. If you're in for thai, this is definitely a solid choice so look no further. The cramped seating makes it feel like you've found a hidden gem. The prices are also reasonable at about 15 to 25 a person.
author: Joe Z.

description:
I am the queen of thai food.  Not the creme de la creme mind you - I have to read the descriptions before I know what most dishes are.  But I know how to appreciate good thai food, and in all my thai food endeavours, this place has been the best.  

The flavor is always wonderful.  There have been a few dishes that were downfalls - I do not recommend the tofu praram.  I do not want to detour you vegetarians, I am sure this place has wonderful vegetarian dishes if they in any way resemble the sauces used for chicken.  I only tried this one and it was more like peanut butter flavored tofu.  Still you can't bat a thousand, and for there to be a few dishes you absolutely love there have to be a few that ill suit your tastes, right?

The pad thai is good (this is the number one thing to judge in a thai food restaurant - pad thai and thai iced tea-which is also good).  I would recommend getting the pad thai without the bamboo shoots, unless you are a big fan.  I find the bamboo shoots absorb the sauce and dry out the noodles to an extent.  This is a take-out recommendation, not dine-in.  

The cost is also good for thai food - and the portions will last you well into the next day!  I would advise this place to anyone I like (but if I don't like you - don't eat here.  It's so not worth it ;).)
author: Rachel M.

description:
This used to be the only great, authentic Thai Restaurant in SF, along with their other location. It was the one place that was LA-quality and consistently great.

I went to the Sunset Marnee Thai last weekend and was sorely disappointed. We had the green papaya salad (which was still quite good, but missing some ingredients), the vegetarian green curry (which was not very good, whereas previously it was one of my favorite dishes), vegetarian pad thai (which was not very good, whereas previously it was one of my favorite dishes) and the sticky rice and mango dessert, which I had not had previously and was impressed with.

Overall, it was still a very disappointing experience. The green curry lacked much flavor, while in the past it was rich, spicy, savory and one of the best I've eaten. Even worse, they had skimped on ingredients and didn't add the pumpkin or faux-chicken, as they always had done previously. The pad thai was AWFUL! I literally couldn't eat it! It tasted as if someone had dumped sweetened ketchup on boiled noodles; there was no texture, variety or complex flavor present at all. It was canned pasta quality-- I'm not kidding.

The green papaya salad was still good (although it lacked peanuts and used to have more variety in vegetables) and the dessert was quite good, I will admit, but everything else had gone so far downhill that I would not try this location again. I will try the 9th Ave. location and hope that the quality I loved is still present there.
author: Jacqueline A.

description:
The first thing that caught my attention was the decor. You can pretty much see the kitchen right when you enter the restaurant. 
It was crowded when we got in, and it took awhile to actually get some service, but once the food came, I disregarded the service and wait time. I'm a fan of green curry, and of course, it was delicious.
If you're a fan of Thai food, come and experience this place.
author: Diane V.

description: Went really early, around 4:45 on a Tuesday evening. Wasn't crowded, but had awful music. My friend told me it was the best Thai in the city, but my go-to favorite Pad See Ew was the same as everywhere else. Nothing special, but not bad.
author: Brenda B.

description: Been eating here for 15 years and never tire of it.  Best Thai food in the city.
author: Jen A.

description:
This rating is not for the food... it's for the attitude/service of the rude waitress.  Definitely will not be coming here for a while.

Usually the food at this restuarant is great... that's why we wanted to come back here Monday night for dinner.......

We went to the restaurant at 9:45pm, 15 minutes before they closed.  Some restaurants will take you while some don't. So we went try to try our luck..

The waiter told us to pick a table to s it.... then this other BITCHY, RUDE lady ran up to the door from the kitchen and starts SHOOING US AWAY WITH HER HANDS while telling us "We're closed." At the end, she continued to do the rude hand motion and saying "Please leave" when we were already the on the way out.  What kind of service is this?!!!

If the kitchen is closed that's fine.  Tell us nicely. Don't start yelling "Please leave" when we're already heading out the door.  Don't treat us like animals!!

As the boyfriend stated, "the rudeness was not needed sometimes you gotta raise a backhand to a ** "
author: Joanna W.

description: Went there for NYE with friends after seeing Cirque Du Soliel - OVO. FOOD IS AWESOME!!!
author: Kim L.

description: This place is delicious! I was just there for dinner and the people are really personable and nice. It is a cute atmosphere and it pretty mellow even when it is packed. I have never had a dish I didn't love and this place is definitely one of the best Thai restaurants in SF.
author: Olivia K.

description:
wow! amazing food. 

I went there with a party of four. The place is a little bit small but it has an intimate feeling. The ambiance was great.

The mango fried rice was superb! Everything we ordered was good too. I would say the service was minimal. We did have a very funny waitress. When we ordered duck salad she said "Don't order duck salad that's better in the morning. I order you what I love." So we ended up ordering spicy duck instead, which was packed with flavor. Overall we had a good time there. :) best thai food i've had so far
author: Selina Z.

description:
The most authentic Thai cuisine can be eaten here! 
Besides the food, entertainment can be found here too, but you have to keep an open mind about it. 

Marnee, the owner, is a kind hearted and genuine person who will make sure your belly is content before leaving and treat you like family. For those who have been here, Marnee may sound loud and she is, but her words, directed to the staff and kitchen, will be adhered a lot quicker than writing alone. She's the boss and brains of her two locations. Her husband, the award winning master Thai chef, is the backbone in devising succulent savory dishes that command praise and honor from foodies alike. Some of his most noteworthy creations include Fresh Egg Rolls, Angel Wings, Pad Thai, Basa Fillet, Pad Cha Talay, and Pad Phone Ka Ree. Several pictures and newspaper articles of these awards are posted inside the restaurant along the entrance walls. 

If you walk towards the restroom in the back, you will notice several framed article clippings about Marnee Thai and Marnee herself. Marnee is well-known for her fortune telling and providing an accurate read about your personality. Because this may be a frightening experience to some, others will learn she tells a lot of truth behind her words. My wife and I have been bringing several friends and family to the Irving Street location for the past 10 years and introduced everyone to Marnee. We've had 3 good and bad reads from Marnee and I would like to share them with you: 
1) When my wife and I were engaged, we went to eat at Marnee Thai and Marnee read both our personalities. She said my fiance was the hot headed one and I was the water that cools her; in Thai it was translated to be Fire and Ice. Marnee said that I was the best one for her and not to let me go. Maybe that's the reason why she agreed to marry me. We both compliment each other in more ways than one. 
2) We brought good friends at the time that we used to party with every weekend to the restaurant. I bugged my wife to ask Marnee for a reading of the other couple and so she did. I remember her translation to my wife and I not worry about the other couple and worry about ourselves. We are no longer speaking to other couple due to disagreement and a bad change of behavior on their part. That was 2 years ago. 
3) During our engagement, we lived in Roseville and commuted on weekends to San Francisco and San Jose for wedding preparations. Since we ate at Marnee Thai on a monthly basis, we became good friends with Marnee and her husband. We invited them to our wedding and they accepted. While seated at the wedding, Marnee gave one of our good friends, who worked as a temp for Rocklin's Hewlett Packard, a reading. She told him that new opportunities will open for him and the next one he gets he should take it. He told us what Marnee said, didn't think much of it, and thought it was entertaining. Six months later, we heard the Rocklin HP was downsizing and laying-off people. We received a phone call from our friend and he said he accepted a permanent job from HP and has to relocate to Texas. He also mentioned that it was exactly like what Marnee told him as his fortune at our wedding. We were all shocked. To this day, he still works for HP and is very happy. 

*Life's paths and destinations work in mysterious ways. If you believe in fortune telling, I would definitely seek Marnee's services. She does palm reading as a side business. 

Sorry to get sidetracked, but back to the Thai food. Every time we go to Marnee Thai, we order enough food to feed 5 people even though there are just 2 of us. We always order Green Papaya Salad with crab and two chilies, Spicy Angel Wings, Beef Salad, Fresh Egg Rolls, Pad Se-Ew, Pad Prig Pao pork, Pad KaProw chicken, and Steamed Jasmine Rice. The Angel Wings are not your typical named appetizer because they are different than traditional stuffed chicken ones. They're fried wings covered in a garlic and tamarind sauce. My mouth waters even before I start eating them because the aroma is to die for. For drinks, we get ice water, an iced Thai Coffee no milk, and an iced Thai Ice Tea. For dessert, we get either the Mango Sticky Rice or Roti with ice cream. 
The staff is very attentive and will help you with any questions you may have in finding alternatives due to preference or food allergies. Great Thai cuisine, great customer service, and great location. What else do you need? 

Marnee Thai is my number one Thai food destination in San Francisco. I recommend this restaurant to everyone who wants a good experience. HINT: Make reservations. If you don't, you will most likely end up waiting a couple of hours depending on the day. There is another location on 9th Ave, but this one tastes the best in my opinion. 5 stars all across the board!
author: Hogan W.

description: Dependable, above average Thai food.  One of the few places that actually makes beef penang properly: chunks of tender beef covered in a thick peanut curry paste... none of this sliced stir fried beef swimming in crappy runny curry that you get elsewhere.  The chicken larb is incredibly tasty (a salad of ground chicken cooked with chili, lime, onions, basil on a bed of fresh greens).  Order ahead and pick up to go, as the dining room is cramped and always packed all night, every night.
author: david l.

description:
I was exploring Irving Street and this place was packed so I dove in.  What a cute interior! Fresh flowers everywhere and such a cute "hut" motif.

My pan-fried noodles were the best I've ever had.  They were spicy enough to kick me in the pants and had really soaked up all that great basil and Thai seasonings. The prawns in the dish were also very tasty.

The service was very good as well. The Owner (I'm assuming it was her) sure is a saucy, boisterous character!  But a charming and in-control hostess knows how to produce happy guests. Everyone in the place seemed very satisfied.

Including me. Thanks, Marnee Thai! I will bring my friends and my mom!
author: Aaron W.

description:
The place is small and cramped, but who cares, great thai food!  This place always seem to be packed.  At first, don't be intimidated by the loud yelling hostess.  As it turned out, she was the sweetest and coolest....recommending dishes, and yelling at the cooks to hurry up with our drinks and food.

They even have fresh coconut juice...right from the coconut (yes, they give you an entire coconut).

They wings are excellent, as is everything else (damn i'm vague...but that's what happens after you eat too much and you fall in a thai food coma and can't remember what you ordered).

Will be back regularly!
author: Tadd L.

description:
I ate at this restaurants years ago and only recently returned.  The one thing that I'll always remember about this restaurant is that the ceiling is shaped so that you feel like you're inside a hut.  Even though this place is small we were able to cram a party of 6 together, note our elbows were touching.  The rather robust hostess is super friendly, funny and treats you like you're family.  Overall the food was pretty good.  I'm not a huge curry fan but I actually liked the red and yellow curry here.  Everyone was raving about the angel wings but to me they tasted like they have been sitting in the fridge for awhile.  Some may argue but I like the chicken wings at San Tung better...shhh.

They have a Marnee Thai cookbook for sale for anyone that's interested.
author: Serena M.

description:
The three times that I've been here have all been great experiences.  I really like the closeness of the table - reminds me of Europe.  Food have always been great.  The angel wings, the fried tofu in satay sauce, pad thai, curry etc... are all DELICIOUS!!  I always leave with a very satisfying stomach and a smile on my face :)  

Lunch time is not so crowded while dinner can be a bit rowdy, but it makes the dining experience quite fun.  

LOVE IT!!
author: Chau L.

description:
My favorite Thai in SF.  The other location is just as good.  No black sticky rice and mango as they have at Suriya Thai (my other favorite), but I have to rate this place better overall in quality.

All of the food I have had is always top rate.  Small nice atmosphere, reasonable prices, and good service.  I'll keep visiting this place whenever I'm in SF and get the chance.
author: Rob B.

description:
I don't have much knowledge and experience about Thai food other than King of Thai Noodles, which seem more like Thai fast food to me. However, Marnee Thai felt different. The quality of the ingredients is obviously better than King of Thai and I ordered the crab fried rice and I could taste bits and pieces of crab meat in there, not fake crab! I particularly love the Angel WIngs and all its flavor! It comes out pipping hot and spicy too! The Pad Thai, on the other end, tasted like they used ketchup, but I wouldn't know what a authentic Pad Thai would taste like. 

All in all, this is one of the better Thai places that I would dine at.
author: Jeremy L.

description:
Not sure what all the hype of this place is about.

We had dinner reservations for Sunday night around 7:30, and it was packed - which was a great sign!!  

The place is tiny, the service wasn't great, nor was the food.  I understand that the place was busy, but I've been to a number of other Thai restaurants and they were always great with bringing you everything you ordered without having to remind them 2-3 times, like we had to here.

I hate to write up a mediocre review, but this is just like any other Thai place - not bad, but not great either.
author: Gina K.

description:
When I'm thinking of thai I'm thinking of Marnee thai. I really like this place. I'm a big fan of the fried rice with duck......yuuuuuummmmmmmmmmm. I love their shrimp rolls as appetizer too.
I hate that I have to wait a long time to pick up my food :(
author: Ghiz S.

description:
I've never been to Thailand or eaten traditional Thai food so I wouldn't know what to compare this place with. But as far as trying all other Thai restaurants, this is the best I've had. It's a tiny cramped restaurant but perfect if you don't want to end up throwing a knife at the waiter for the check. Everything I've tried on the menu so far has been delicous! Especially thier mango sticky rice desert! It's the best here!

Close and personal, slightly dimmed lighting, delicious food.. it's perfect for a nice little date... or two.. or three.. or four..
author: Leslie H.

description: So i have to say that this place did kinda bring me back to memories of when i lived in Thailand. Only other place that i have the same reaction is Bai Som on Clement. Great flavors, the only bummer was they didn't make it spicy when we asked for it to be as hot as possibly. I even said it in Thai...lol but i will be back regardless...I'll just be asking for my own Thai Birds on the side next time! : )
author: Sarah F.

description: INCREDIBLE. The best Pad See Ew I've had in San Francisco thus far has been at Marnee Thai. The sauce to noodle ratio was perfect, and the meat was tender and juicy, not overcooked like most places. The proportions were also very well sized. Super delicious. I left feeling like I could take on the rest of the day with a smile on my face! Will definitely be coming back as soon as I can!
author: Caroline B.

description:
I'm beginning to wonder if my 5-star rating reviews make me sound terribly optimistic and in love with everything and every place I eat.
In response to my meta-self-criticism, THIS PLACE DESERVES IT, SON. And is worthy of use of Caps Lock. 
Best Thai food I've had in the city. I wish I had 3 more stomachs. Their awards are well-deserved.
And... It's kind of adorable. It has a hut-like setting, with cute tableclothed tables, pretty orchid stems, and the like.
Sometimes they put orchids to adorn your food. Cuteness mind explosion.
author: Sora O.

description: Excellent, authentic Thai cuisine at low prices.  From the photographs on the wall, this place attracts some celebs (Iron Chefs Cora and Morimoto recently).  They've been in business quite a while now and have garnered many awards.  Our party of 3 ordered a lot of food and the tab totalled less than $60.  No skimping on ingredients in soups and salads, plus the service is casual, yet friendly.
author: John K.

description:
This place is a little pricier than other Thai restaurants Ive been to but I can safely say this place is better than the others Ive eaten at as well.

My oldest bro used to live in the Sunset area so every once in a while I would order takeout food from this place.  I dunno why we never ate inside the restaurant....actually I think I did once but it was a long time ago.  The food has been consistently good.  I can't point out any particular dishes as we usually ordered different things rather than the same dish repeatedly, but overall the food was good.

I like the bamboo decor on the inside, good for dates.  I wish maybe it was bigger inside but hey, sometimes you like that cozy feeling where everyone is closer.
author: Gilbert C.

description: Love the decor & dresses! I could eat that pumpkin curry every day for a month. I made no modifications so I'm not sure why were charged an extra dollar for it at first, but they were quick to apologize and fix it.  The soup and red curry were just what we've come to expect from other Thai restaurants. It is very busy in there.
author: Ria J.

description: This place has the BEST Thai food. Being of Thai descent, I would say it's very authentic. Cannot rave enough about the food. Even better than the food is Miss Maey. She will make you feel very welcome and has such a good heart. I met her that day and she made me feel like family. I will definitely finback for the food and miss Maey! The dessert is delicious. Just order everything miss Mary recommends! You will not be disappointed.
author: Tess K.

description:
I *love* Marnee Thai.  I used to live in the Inner Sunset, and now that I've moved, I still trek across the city a few times a month to come here!  Whenever people ask me for a restaurant recommendation, it's Marnee hands down, and I haven't had anyone come back telling me they were disappointed.

Start with the chicken stay wraps, then chow down on some prawn pad thai, and your taste buds will not be disappointed (unless they skimp on the prawns, which happens sometimes unfortunately).  I seriously have cravings for *their* pad thai.  

Service is always pretty good, food is timely, can get crowded/loud though.  If you sit near the front, you can get potentially annoying reverberations from the kitchen.  But it's always worth it to me. 

Great for a casual week-night meal, or low-key night out the boyfriend if we're in the city.
author: Lea G.

description:
Yummy consistent thai food. The waitresses will also consistently yell at you and tell you what to order, but they mean well, and dress outlandishly which makes it fun.
The curries and spring rolls are the best. Try the kobocha squash.mmmm
author: Kyla L.

description:
Yep those corn cakes are something else.

This is not traditional Thai though.  There are some fried entrees and even pecan pie.

The decor was atypical but cute.  I don't know if I'd go there on purpose necessarily but if I was in the neighborhood, already parked, and hungry, I might indulge again.
author: Femita J.

description:
The food is really good. 
Went here for my mom's birthday with the family. They dimmed the lights and banged a frickin' gong to announce her bday to the whole restaurant. Pretty cool experience.

Everyone was happy with the food-the pumpkin samosa special AMAZING. 
They do curries really well, and everything is just a flavorful cut above other thai places I've been.

The atmosphere is nothing special, and it's pretty tight in there once it's full. And it always is around dinner. Don't expect much space or fanfare (except the gong), but do expect nuanced and yummy flavors.
author: Jennifer J.

description:
Two Stars: Being on Time when they told me to be there for a Carry Out.
Minus Three Stars: Extremely Bland, Boring Thai Food. Nothing interesting that I ate.
author: Stephen H.

description: The best Thai restaurant in the city. It is usually very busy, so be prepared to wait. My favorite is the red curry with chicken!
author: Daniel R.

description: I ordered the prawns and scallop pad phong karee. it had eggs mushrooms onions. VERY delicious. My girl ordered the green curry because it had eggplant. Apparently she did not read that the green curry was the spiciest of the curries, so it was too spicy for her. The staff was very attentive and asked if everything was fine. We told him and he gladly took it back to add coconut milk to de-spice it. When we were done they helped packed our left overs and who every pack it, thank you very much. Gave us a little bit of extra rice to go with the left overs. I will definitely come back again.
author: Vincent T.

description: My favorite Thai restaurant in SF. I love the cozy interior which makes me feel like I am in a romantic little place by the beach in Thailand. The service is friendly and relaxed. As for the food, I liked all that I tried so far but one of their specials stands out: It is a fish dish in a banana leaf called "Hor Mok". You have to try it if you like fish. Heavenly! They offer this special only on weekends.
author: Dietmar B.

description: Very small restaurant. Very limited and tight seating.  Very aggressive and pushy when it comes to ordering.  I didn't take her recommendation and the boss lady didn't like that.  Told me I don't have all day to read the menu when I only looked at it for 5 mins.  Portions were on the smaller side.  Food however was tasty.  Not cheap, 5 people with no drinks cost me $63 before tip.
author: Nicholas W.

description: We walked in and were warmly greeted during a busy Saturday afternoon to only be introduced to hell's backroom, aka the noisy area in the rear of the 9th street Marnee.  We sat down for 10 seconds and got up, it was just too loud.  The staff was beyond accommodating, they were attentive, polite, and generally warm, but I write because of the food: it was GREAT, 4 of 5 dishes were big hits, $80 for a party of 4 including tax and tip.  RECCOMENDED
author: anthony e.

description: The wait can be long during dinner time especially on weekends. There is so much flavor in all of their dishes. My favorites are the beef with green curry and pad thai and even their plain rice is great. The only downside is the portions are kinda small for a big eater like me. I can down about $50 worth just by myself.
author: John W.

description:
I must say, Marnee Thai is both conveniently located and amazingly good. Try the Nam Tok (Beef Salad), they usually give a fairly generous amount of beef and whatever dressing/marinade they use makes your taste buds tingle with joy. I'm a rice man so the beef salad with rice makes it a meal of its own but add the basa filet with the curry sauce (i think its the #1 or #2 option) will give you the spiciness that Thai foods are so commonly known for. What makes this place so great is if you're not looking for anything exotic, you can get chicken fried rice and even that is still really delicious..

The service is lacking a little friendliness but it's not personal so just suck it up and enjoy the food.
author: Christopher T.

description: Pad kee mow, avacado salad, tom yum noodle soup... I always try one of these dishes when I'm here.  Especially the pad kee mow.
author: Victor C.

description: I was missing a good home cooked meal, so I was happy when a group of friends and the bf decided to come here. Inside is pretty small so its better to come in smaller groups. The food was delicious and the owner, she's funny. She can get the whole room going with her liveliness. But I'd come here again, one of the best Thai food ever.
author: Nancy T.

description:
The food at Marnee Thai is always good.  We didn't have reservations and thought that at 7PM, the place would be packed.  It was, but the wait was under 25 mins, which wasn't too bad. The kitchen is pretty fast and the staff really hussles to clear the tables to get customers seated.  We haven't dined at this original site in a while.  The owner, Mae Siri, works this restaurant with her younger son.  The husband and older son works the 2nd restaurant on 9th Ave.

She's very friendly and if you make an attempt to strike up a conversation with her, she'll take the time to chat with you.  Many of the regulars know her on a first name basis.  I have several favorite Thai dishes which makes it hard to decide on the favs or to try new ones.  The papaya salad was very, very good with just the right blend of a slightly tart dressing and sweetness.
We had 3 main dishes:  green curry with eggplant and chicken was moderately spicy and very good; the minced pork cooked with basil looked like something I would order at an Indian restaurant, but was surprisingly sweeter than I expected; the duck was covered in brown gravy and accompanied by a soy-like dipping sauce.  I'd probably order the green curry again and not the other two dishes.  Rice is extra at $1/bowl or $1.50 for brown rice.  They give you a piece of tamarind flavored candy with the bill.  I inquired if I could buy these at local stores in SF.  The waitress told me it's not available locally and they order it from Thailand.  Look for the "Yelp loves us"  sticker on their window.
Our meal came to $44 and we had leftovers which made hubby really happy!
author: Ry T.

description: What's up with the portions here? I understand you guys are a top-rated Thai restaurant, but why not give more of the satisfaction? I won't deny it, I like fattening up and getting my money's worth! It's just like any other mediocre Thai restaurant to me. And Thai is my absolute favorite food :/ Not ranked on my list of top restaurants, sorry.
author: Cindy S.

description: i wouldnt consider this authentic thai food. arent angel wings stuffed? WTF. most of the dishes we had taste like americanized chinese food but for what it was it was good or maybe i was just hungry.
author: Meuy X.

description:
When I think of Marnee, I think of their angel wings which are really delicious - garlicky, sweet, sticky, salty - and I also think about their fish sauce condiment on the table with chopped hot chilies which I love.  I've tried their pad see-ew which was pretty decent too.  Marnee is a safe, cute little place to go if you want Thai food since there are some pretty mediocre places out there.  You can't go wrong here.  The decor is cute with bamboo and the owner is very hospitable and likes to make her rounds at the tables.  

The restaurant is a bit small and gets pretty crowded and loud  so I wouldn't recommend a quiet little date here....but crowds seem to enjoy it.  I used to live right down the street and this place always seemed busy on weekend nights.  Personally, I really loved eating at my #1 Thai place, Sukothai, which was on 9th & Irving however that place has changed owners and I haven't been back, but I do rate Marnee as my second fav place to eat Thai food in the city.
author: Connie C.

description:
Their Thai food really is the best in the city.  Any family or friends that want thai- we bring them here, no question.  Just about everything I've had there has been amazing- even their their soy meat stuff.   It's worth going to this place just to have your fortune told by Marnee- who has the uncanny ability of looking at someone's face and describing their personality and future.  Sure she might be off 80% of the time- but it's still fun! ;)  

Although I love this place, I have to say I'm a bit worried after reading Missy B's review.  I haven't seen one cockroach since I've been in San Francisco- and it's terrifying to know that a giant one may live in one of my favorite restaurants!!
author: Sima S.

description:
This has been one of my favorite restaurants in the city. All of the food I had was really good, but my favorite is their Spicy Angel Wings!!! That's the best appetizer I've ever had in my life!!

The place is always crowded, especially dinner time. It's nice to have a reservation, especially if you're bringing a big party with you. Unfortunately the space is pretty limited. Everytime I want to go to the bathroom, I have to squeeze my fat ass between chairs and tables. I don't know how Marnee can move from tables to tables.

Oh, be careful with her. She seems rather pushy in giving order suggestion. You gotta have a strong will otherwise you might end up with too much food on your table. 

I love their b'day ritual. I have successfully gong-ed my Mom, my husband, and my husband's friend. That shit never goes old and you get free coconut ice cream.

I like this place better than the newer one cause I think the food is better and I like the atmosphere but, if you're really hungry and just want to eat good thai food, go to their bigger space on 9th and lincoln ave.
author: Perry S.

description:
I'd heard lotsa great things about this place, so I figured it was time for me to finally check it out myself.  Foodwise, I wasn't disappointed, and to be honest, that's what matters to me the most.  We had this excellent faux meat in garlic and pepper seasoning, such that even my non-vegetarian friends enjoyed it.  It's clearly not meat, but it has that meaty texture that is so delectable.  As a new vegetarian, this restaurant gives me hope that there are very good vegetarian options out there.  The green curry and the papaya salad were appropriately spicy, with the right amount to get you thirsting for water, but not so much that you need a fire hydrant to put out the fire in your mouth.

So why only a 4?  The tacky environment (please people, that's just lame), the lack of authenticity (whoever was managing that night was clearly not Thai, she was very Cantonese, and what the hell, no sticky rice??? where's my kao niow??), overly crowded (jeez, that place was jampacked!).  Good service though, and the line to wait wasn't overly long (5-10 minutes for a table for 3 at 7:30pm on a Saturday, although we got stuck on a 2 person table)

Overall, good place.  I'd definitely go back and spread the word to all my friends.
author: William C.

description:
We were sat DEAD center in the middle of the restaurant, in the exact spot where, in any room, I would be overly anxious and feel as though I were on the brink of a panic attack. I can't sit in the middle of rooms. I can't sit with my back facing a door. It makes me feel vulnerable and weird. Since the restaurant was packed wall-to-wall that night, I had no other choice. 

I have a thing for my position in the room. I didn't like where I was and how close the other table was. According to the other posts, it's always like this. And here is why:

It's THAT good.

I LOVED IT. So much so that I only subtracted one star from its rating due to my own quirky personal sense of feng shui. I'm even going to go back. The service was very friendly and my water glass was always full. Everything was so beautifully presented. I especially liked how they made the interior look like a hut. The taste of the dishes was exquisite, as well as the generous portions. The nice, cool Tsing Tao was there to wash down the ginger chicken I had ordered.

P.S. In the middle of dinner, I was taken aback by the dimming of the lights and the ringing of the gong to announce the birthday of "Beautiful Lady." I never found out Beautiful Lady's real name even as the entire restaurant erupted in the happy birthday song.
author: Meghan L.

description:
The chef is F'n famous and it shows in the food, no illegals in the back here getting exploited for cheap labor.  The food is not as consistant, or maybe just my first time here was so mind blowing that returns pale in comparison.
However the food and price and both good.  The service is slow, and the space is cramped, but the food makes up for most of it.

Enjoy yourselves, B#$#@#s!
author: Spanky M.

description:
I have been coming to this place since the late 1980s and always considered myself fortunate to have Marnee in my neighborhood.  This is one place I definitely missed during my 18 month absence from the Bay Area.  You won't find corn cake appetizer like the one you can get here.  The green curry with chicken has the most layered flavor of any that I've tried, be it NY or LA or anywhere else in S.F.

I have taken friends who considered themselves food snobs to Marnee and they have all had to admit how bad@ss this place is!
author: Marce J.

description:
One of the more premium Thai restaurants in the Richmond/Sunset district of San Francisco. The place is a bit small and crammed and the prices are a bit steeper than I'm used to. 

The food is relatively good compared to other Thai places.
author: Tech G.

description:
i came here with my thai friend one day expecting it to be good but when we ordered the pad thai, it seemed like dey used ketchup

EDIT: THEY DID USE KETCHUP
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
The food is pretty legit. 
Everything that i have had at Marnee was pretty similar to the Thai Temple Festival in North Hollywood. 
The chicken wings are absolute happiness in your mouth. 
the pad thai was pretty good. a little too sweet for my liking. although the green curry is the best. 
They have a few specials every now and then that i love. esp the sauteed veggies.

but dont forget to try the Roti served with ice cream. I mean how can you end your meal without dessert??
author: Alyssa A.

description: This place is amazing. Do yourself a favor by ordering the Pad Kee Mao with duck. If I found a genie in a lamp I would wish that Marne Thai had delivery service.
author: Lily P.

description: Great Thai food. Yummy somosas & fried rice.
author: Cindy C.

description:
I have been there for lunch once and takeout twice. I gave 5 stars for the quality of food. It's definitely one of the best Thai restaurants that I have been to. I have been to the other Marnee Thai. My favorite dishes are: 

spicy corn cake 
pumpkin curry with beef 
Angel wings 
Thai sausage fried rice 
fish wrap in banana leaf 

This location is spacier but I like the Pad Thai from the other location better. The Pad Thai in this location has little too much sauce. 

On a rainy Sunday night, I was surprised that this restaurant was packed. I saw no sign of recession here :-)
author: Cherry L.

description:
Went there for lunch and was satisfied. We got the pad thai, Tom Yum Koon soup, and a stir fried string beans with beef dish (recommended by the the waitress). The pad thai and the soup was not really outstanding as we did have better ones before. I didn't really like the type of mushrooms that they used in the soup...the string bean dish was tasty but a little too salty...The beef was pretty tender though, so that was good.
The service there is alright...they didn't really check up on us at all, but that's okay since we didn't really need anything anyway. I saw the waitress checking up on the table next to us, but she was talking so fast and was walking away even before those people at the table answer to her question of whether they need anything else...I wonder if she really wanted to know the answer...lol
My favorite part of the restaurant is actually the decoration and setting. They put up bamboo sheets on the walls and makes me feel like I am really in Thailand when I am sitting in there, It gave me this summer breeze feeling..haha, that was pretty cool.
I wouldn't say it's a highly recommended place to go out of your way to try, but if you are at the area and wanted to eat Thai food, it could be an option.
author: Anna H.

description: You will feel like a sardine in a can, because this place is small and ALWAYS packed. But there's a reason for that because Marnee Thai is delicious and rather inexpensive.  Highly recommend it, just be sure to make a reservation (especially if there is more than 2 of you)!
author: Katie S.

description: Got take out last night. This is the go to Thai restaurant. Always happy. They even called me saying they were out of the BBQ pork and recomended the duck. Super good.
author: David B.

description: I hadn't been to Marnee Thai in about ten years.  Whoa -- my loss.  A friend suggested we meet up there and I am so glad we did.  The corn cakes are really good and are not greasy.  Just delicious.  The samosas are good -- potato and pumpkin make them delicious.  I'm fussy about my green curry and Marnee Thai does not disappoint.  It is the right blend of spice.  Sometimes when I go to restaurants the vegetables in the curries or whatever taste old but at Marnee Thai the vegetables were nice and fresh.  I won't wait ten years to go back!
author: Heather L.

description: Great pad see ew. I happen to be a connoisseur so when I get a good one, I know it. I also don't ever let go. Sauced just enough, not mushy. Fantastic. Avocado salad was great as well. Gonna come back for some curry to make final decision but so far so good.
author: Mike C.

description:
Marnee Thai is hands down, the best Thai food I've tried- and believe me, I've gone far and wide looking!  It's worth it to drive into the city just for this place.

The food is absolutely delicious, no comparison!  The flavors they create are so authentic (My best friend is Thai and this place is always first on her list of restaurants to go to!).  I really wish I could describe what makes the food so great here, but it's really too hard to put into words.  Trust me, if you try the food here you can't go wrong.  Among my favorites are the papaya salad, pad thai (of course!), pad see ew, pad woonsen, the curries, and this sweet bbq tofu thing!  Oh, by the way, you have to save room for the Roti (thai pancake) so make sure to try it!

The restaurant is a little small and can get crowded at times, which means there's a lot of squeezing by people and loud talking by the workers... but you'll come to realize that that's just the vibe in this family restaurant.  All the workers are so nice!

And THE BEST FOR LAST... Miss May!  Seriously, when my friend told me there was a fortune teller here I was skeptical.  But, sure enough, Miss May told me about my personality and she hit the nail on the head!  After she tells you a little bit about yourself, she can go on to tell you about your future too!  I'm not a beliver in these things, but Miss May got me!  She's not always there though so try to catch her.  She really is one of the most awesome people I've ever come across.  

Try Marnee Thai, you won't be disappointed!!!!
author: Ashley M.

description:
The food here is amazing!  Order the yellow curry with lamb, even if it's not on the list of specials, it may be available.  Don't forget the angel wings, beef satay, or pad see ew with chicken, either.

The woman who owns the restaurant is kind and sweet, even if she has to shout to her employees to make the restaurant run more smoothly.

If you want to experience this location with ease, arrive before the rush at 7:30pm for dinner.  The Thai pancake with coconut ice cream is ridiculously sweet, but worth it!

Marnee Thai is my favorite Thai restaurant in the city, definitely. :)
author: Kelly S.

description: It was my first time eating there and I loved it. I came on a pretty busy night and the waitress was still very attentive. She recommended some dishes and steered us away from ones she didnt think we would like. I am Thai and I found the food authentic. If you do eat here, you definitely need to try the angel wings.
author: Tarin B.

description:
Both locations are good, and the waiters are pretty friendly. 

My favorite dishes during lunch time: Curry and Noodles (their green or red curry served with a side of vermicelli noodles), and Khao soy chicken (yellow curry with noodles in it).   They're about $7.00 and  really tasty.  If your not into curry, Chan pad poo (noodles stir fried with crab meat and onion) is really good too.  

For dinner:  Fish cakes and angle wings for appetizers.  Their yellow and green curry is my favorite.  They also have a really good eggplant dish.  Dinner for two is usually around $40, but it also depends on whether you order drinks or not.
author: Max T.

description:
I used to live out in the Sunset and avoided the "Asian Parking Lot" (Irving St) at all costs. Then my buddy (who drove) took me to Marnee Thai. Now, I eat there so often everyone knows my name and what I order. I walk in to "Hello Dwight!" as well as "Number 1 and number 5?" #1 and 5 are prawns in a blanket and imperial rolls. 

Prawns in a blanket you ask? Let me tell you...prawns, wrapped in bacon, wrapped in a egg roll wrap and then deep fried. Doesn't get much better. 

Entree...I only get one thing. Pad Thai. I am a Pad Thai connoisseur, trying it every where its on the menu, but nothing compares. The chef is a genius...and you can buy his cook book!
author: Mike A.

description:
Geez, I'm not sure why this place is so hyped up. My boyfriend and  I had some of the worst food we'd eaten in our lives.

I ordered the vegetarian Tom Ka which they ( the rude-for-no reason waitstaff ) said  could be made without fish sauce and my boyfriend ordered the tofu with chili and basil. 

When the Tom Ka came out it reeked of fish sauce. I tried it anyway thinking the smell could be fermented bean curd which also has a fishy taste/smell, but I  discovered that it was not bean curd at all. The soup was definitely doused in oily fish sauce and it was incredibly salty. My tounge shriveled up with the first bite, while my stomach started to churn. Neither of us could eat it.  It was the first time I had ever sent a dish back. 

Shortly afterwards my boyfriend's tofu arrived. It was equally disappointing. It had no flavor and was incredibly oily. The only reason we ate it  was to make the Tom Ka flavor go away.

We were both pretty bummed. Oh well, we'll just never go back.
author: .'antigone' ..

description:
I've been here before and always loved my food.  They are known for their angel wing's and rightly so!  We ordered the food to go.  The restaurant is always packed and the restaurant is small.

Angel Wings:  Their signature dish!  They were big pieces of chicken wings and drums.  Strong flavor of garlic, which we love.  They give you lots of sauce which is great over rice.  Not your typical buffalo wings, and its different from other angel wings.  We've had the angel wings from Osha Thai, but  Marnee thai's chicken were larger and more flavorful.
