Roast duck red curry:  Other than the fatty pieces, this dish still amazing!  It had a lots of flavor and the coconut milk was prevalent.  It was excellent on top of the brown rice.

Pad Thai:  It could have used a lil peanuts and more bean sprouts.  Other than that, it tasted authentic.  Lots of flavor and retained its authenticity.
author: Alden W.

description:
I love thai food and this place is the Best thai food in the city hands down!! Great dishes, great portions, great ambiance, great prices, great service and 2 locations to choose from. I'd recommend Spicy angel wings with crispy basil leaves and papaya salad for starters. And for entrees # 32 SIlver noodles with prawns and black fungus is good, as well as the garlic pan fried fish, or gai kra pow (minced chicken sauteed w/ basil leaves and chili) You can't go wrong with their pad thai. Best pad thai I ever tried. And for dessert,  Mango with sweet rice.  I even got my parents addicted to this place because they also love it. They rave about  it to their friends and coworkers. They get so excited when I invite them over, because I live so close and they have an excuse to eat there.

The downsides, parking may suck because it's on the street and metered, so best time to go is after 6pm or sundays when its free. And you may have to wait for a table during the busiest times from 8-9ish. It is well worth the parking hassle or the wait. What else is new right??
author: Sha'de d.

description:
This place is some of the best thai food i have had in the city. Last night i had the crispy tofu appetizer which is excellent, they get this nice creamy texture in the middle of the tofu that has to be tasted and felt to be believed. Then i had this roasted duck with pad thai dish that was also excellent. 

the wait staff refills your water with impeccable precision and skill.
the wait staff is a bit rude so they lose a star.
the food is damn excellent.
the location is awesome because i can rent a tight movie at le video right after eating and then walk home.

go here for some really decent thai food
ignore the wait staff
and have a nice night.
author: Sean B.

description: Pad Kee Mao with Roasted Duck - $9.95. Perfect balance of spiciness and flavor.
author: Dan M.

description:
We did not like soft shell crab with mango and garlic fish. It was a very small portion, overcooked and greasy. Thai food is supposed to be healthy, but what they cooked was far from being healthy and did not tasted good. Garlic fish was covered with black fried garlic and bright yellow oil. It was waste of our time and money, plus a blow to our livers.
Will never come back.
author: marina s.

description:
I ate at  this place couple months back without knowing it was so highly rated. Therefore, I decided to try it again to see if it was worth the ratings. It wasn't, in my opinion.

I came in here during lunch on a weekday with two friends. It was 12:30, the place was half full, and we were ordering to go. I ordered Pad Kee Mao, and my friends ordered yellow curry and pad thai. 

1. They assumed we wanted dinner portions at 12:30 PM.. therefore, they charged us dinner prices for pad thai and pad kee mao..which we had to ask them to fix. At least ask us if we want lunch or dinner..
2. They charged my friend for rice when she didn't even ask to have rice along with her yellow curry. Yes, usually people eat rice with curry, but i felt they shouldn't have assumed she wanted rice and charged her for it without even asking her. 
3. They seemed less than pleased about fixing their mistakes when they were at fault. 

But you can't judge a restaurant solely on customer service, although a big part of a restaurant experience is customer service. Therefore, I decided not to jump the gun until I have tried their food.

1. Pad kee mao: It was pretty good, a little tangy and light. Different than the stuff I've tried at other places but good nonetheless. Still, it didn't live up to it's ratings, critical acclaims, or the numerous awards adorning their wall stating that they were the "best thai restaurant in the US"
2. Pad Thai: Also on the lighter side and seems to be based on the same ingredients used for the pad kee mao. 
3. Yellow Curry: Probably the best out of the three dishes we got. 

IN the end, food tastes good, but the thing is, I've eaten at lesser thai places in Berkeley (which has alot of thai restaurants i might add) that tasted similar to Marnee. Don't get me wrong.. I'm in no way a food snob nor a thai food expert , but i'm perplexed by the rave reviews of this place. To me, it seems pretty ordinary. If I factor in the bad customer service, I would give this place 2 stars... but I'll give them another chance in the future and come back. ..it's just too convenient since i live 2 minutes away.
author: Jim Y.

description:
Thought this place would be a great place to celebrate my mom's birthday...

What a mistake.

The service really, really, really sucks.

And usually, I can reason why the service sucks.  I know the economy isn't the greatest right now, so I get budget and staffing cuts.  But that doesn't seem to be the case with this restaurant.  There is sufficient staff here...yet after flagging down practically all the waiters and waitresses to let them know that we were ready to order, we were ignored.  As a last resort, we started to do the embarrassing display of waving the hands wildly around...to which the staff pretended to have a sudden narrow field of vision that did not include the party of eight sitting in the middle of the room.  I kid you not, TWENTY MINUTES LATER, a woman came to take our order.  Apparently, this ONE woman ONLY can take orders, hence the long wait...  Why?  Good question. 

Now, this may not have pissed us off so much if it wasn't for what had happened earlier.  We made a reservation at 7pm.  At 6:45pm, we arrived to confirm the reservation and to just let the hostess know that the party was there and that we'll just be waiting outside.  Well...7pm came around...and went.  We were then told that a smaller table was being set up but if we waited longer, then another table would open up.  Confused, we asked what happened to our reservation.  We were told some weird answer about "customer turnover rate being slow"...  HUH?!?!?!!!!  

At least the food was good, so that kinda made up for the sucky service.  We tried the spicy angel wings, pad thai, mango fried rice, and panang pork curry.  The food definitely hit the spot...but it wasn't quite good enough to for me to give more than one star on this review.

So because we were a party of 8, gratuity was added into our bill.  If it was up to me, I would have cut that tip in half and then in half again.
author: Jo G.

description:
Good: quick service and attentive, two stars for this.
Bad: this is not authenticThai food (I am from out of town and also a Thai). In addition, it is also overpriced. I got a bill of $48 for 3 entrees and rice plus soda. Food is oily and way below standard, what's going on here? My friend said it used to be better.
author: iris c.

description:
The food here is good as you can see from all the other reviews but your service last night was UNACCEPTABLE! I cannot believe I'd ever have to write a bad review for this restaurant. There's a reason why I order take-out, it's so that I don't have to sit and wait for my food to come out. Especially when I know that your restaurant will be busy. I called for take-out last night at 7:00pm--prime time for dinner I understand. But after placing my order of 5 dishes, you told me it would only take 20-25 minutes. I didn't get to the restaurant until 40 minutes after just so I don't have to stand there and wait while you pack my order. I come in and the staff that took my order said please wait in the back by the kitchen--only another 5 minutes. Okay--that's fine, I see some take-out containers...maybe those are mine. Then I see you pack them up and hand it to another customer. WTH? okay...all good...maybe the next one is mine. Another customer comes in and orders to-go, and somehow she got her order before I even see my 5 containers! WTH is going on here? I only ordered 5 dishes not 10!!!  I asked how much longer since I've already waited 10 minutes. And my take-out order is nowhere in sight. You tell me another 5 minutes--just one more dish. I wait 5 more minutes--at this point, my BF is waiting in the car and getting irritated and said to just ask for our money back. I asked nicely---and the lady owner said two more minutes. I said no thank you, I just want my money back--I don't feel like waiting another 15 minutes for my food. She kept insisting that it will only take 2 more minutes---OK, you've said that three time already--- 5 minutes passed. I started demanding for my money and she refuses to hand them over--almost done she said. WTF I have never had this experience anywhere, ANYWHERE! I just want my money back. This is ridiculous! It shouldn't take one hour for take-out! At this point the owner was screaming at her cooks to hurry-up and there's only ONE dish ready. From the time that I placed my order to the time that I finally got my order was 1 HOUR! A business should appreciate and respect their customer's time whether or not they are sitting in or ordering take-out. 

I was cussing up a storm while eating...g*ddamm you! Your food is good but I can never come back again b/c of your horrible service!
author: Kim D.

description: Coming here is definitely eating some good, genuine Thai food.  You have to go visit this resto at least once in your life and order the Angel Wings!  Simple restaurant and good quality food!  I give it 4 stars because it's really THAT good!
author: Reese M.

description: My favorite Thai place outside of Thailand! Really nice staff and May runs a tight shift.  I could eat the Pad See Ew for the rest of my life and be happy.
author: Mary T.

description: Whenever I want great Thai, Marnee Thai has never disappointed. Everyone I have brought here have enjoyed here as well. I love their yellow curry and spicy angel wings. The staff are friendly and they give service with a smile even when they are slammed which happens a lot. The spot is small but feels cozy no matter where you sit. Have never had a bad meal here.
author: Karen B.

description:
Super small place, but super good food. I always enjoy thai food and was very happy that we were going here. The pad thai, angel wings, soup, thai iced tea drink, salad, peanut sauce chicken, tofu was delicious! I was a little sad that this place is super tiny and that I barely had room to lift my elbow up, but the food made up for it.  I would definitely eat here again. Maybe I might do takeout next time....

Though I have to agree with some of hte people, I did feel rushed. This place is definately not a place to sit and talk. If you are finished eating, make sure you pack your shit and get going.
author: A L.

description:
really crazy good thai food.  i almost always order to go and order the vegetarian dishes exclusively.

their veggie curries (red and green, it's a toss-up) are the best.  super fresh vegetables, perfectly crunchy and never over-cooked.  their pad thai is delicious, but my favorite noodle dish has got to be the woonsen silver noodles.  oh so yum.  i love this place!
author: Melissa C.

description: I'm not a fan of Thai food AT ALL, but Marnee Thai is where it is at! The Angel Wings are a must, as well as the "Chad Pan Poo" ( Pad Thai w/ Crabmeat). Both the food and the service is excellent. Just as someone else had said, Marnee makes you feel like your one of her own. if the food doesn't bring you back, she will! Enjoy.....
author: Tone K.

description:
I have been to Marnee before, but I seem to remember the food tasting better then.  It was five of us for lunch and we ordered, tom yum soup,
pad thai, pad kaprow (minced chicken) and panang beef.  And honestly, I had better food in King of Thai.  The tom yum was ok, the pad thai, which was so dissapointing, especially seeing the award for the best pad thai, was too sweet and just bland. The panang beef was tender, but lack taste (bankok garden has the best panang beef yet). At least the pad kaprow was good but overall the food was really dissapointing.
author: Vanessa B.

description: Food is great. Atmosphere is great also, especially the whole bamboo hut setting. Minced Chicken with basil, Yellow curry, pad thai, and the chicken wings, the dessert roti was melt in your mouth. If you are craving thai food, head over to marnee thai.
author: A L.

description:
Marnee Thai was one of the few Thai restaurants in the 1980's but now many Thai restaurants exist in the city and the suburbs that provide better quality and more interesting menu that makes me wonder why Marnee Thai has gotten so many awards recently. 
 
I had dinner recently and my ordered was quickly taken, the appetizer was at the table within a few minutes but the entrees came out of the kitchen separately 30 to 45 minutes later.  Two parties seated after us were served and left by the time we got our last dish.

The shrimp in my shrimp curry lacked flavor and was overcooked. The pad thai had a very sweet tomato flavor different from what I experienced in Bangkok or Changmai. 

Marnee Thai is not a destination restaurant despite its awards.
author: Ira W.

description: I love the food here the roti is really good lol my friend works here but it's really good
author: Gee L.

description: Great food, great service (love the owner!!) great prices... There are not many places that tick all three boxes! Love both locations... The one in the outer sunset can be easier to find parking :-) I am a regular for sure!
author: Joanne N.

description: I love this place. The spicy angel tofu is the best food around. The manager is known as "the queen bee" and she keeps it all in order. Better than the marnee thaii at 9th.
author: Adam T.

description: Last night was the second time we went to Marnee Thai. Upon being seated a strange thing happened.  I got that giddy feeling like when I was a little kid and I knew Santa was going to bring me something wonderful.  I heard about the place on Check Please Bay Area where it got rave reviews. We headed over to check it out ourselves and boy did it hit the spot!   I'm not very knowledgeable about Thai cuisine or anything I just know that it tasted delicious. Every dish was exquisite.  The woman (May) who owns the place, runs the dining room.  She made me feel so fussed over even though it was busy.  If you want delicious Thai food in a warm, loving environment for a great value go to Marnee Thai.  I recommend the Samosas. And the Roti (dessert).
author: Hope C.

description:
Delicious, yummy, tasty.....mmhhhh
the angel wings are so good, and the yellow curry, and the mango sticky rice, everything is just awesome. definitely will visit at least once a month. best thai food in san francisco, and price is fair too.
author: Choco M.

description:
The best Thai food I've had so far...

The Spicy Angel Wings, Tod Mun (Fish Cakes) are very good! I loved the Curry seafood/pork/chicken dishes and the Pad Thai is great. If you guys haven't, try the Pad Se Ew (Thick Noodle dish)...That's some bomb ass shiznitz! 

The waiter and waitresses are nice, but the chubby nice Thai lady owner was kinda forceful in taking our order. She would tell us to order more than usual...then we would have too much and had to take it home, but it's cool...hahahaah! Oh, by the way...she is very loud at times disturbing the peace...LOL!!! :LOVE THE THAI ICED TEA!! MMMMMMMMM!!

Gr8 food, but too crampy, kinda hard to find parking sometimes.
author: Marc E.

description: Wow this place was jamming on a Monday night! I've been to another Marnee Thai in SF and both Marnee Thais' were small and packed. Came here with a friend since we didn't get our crawfish. (somehow we were craving it.) We got the bbq chicken and green curry which turned out excellent. The crowd and service was friendly! I wish I had more money to try their dessert.
author: bernard w.

description: If i could have "0" stars-thats what it would be! But to review i guess they at least need one ... Definetly the worst Thai restaurant I've ever been to.  The service was bad/slow & the worst of all, bill was paid, & we were curretly waiting for our to-go order and they kicked us right out!!! And said we have to wait outside it's coming right up! WOW! Then after 15+ mins, they still said it's coming up! Soon after, we demanded a refund! NEVER AGAIN!
author: Mack M.

description: good place for a daily dinning out dinner.  very small table.  They should put less table for more comfortable seating place.  Food is average a OK.
author: tomcat f.

description: Food was amazing! Everything from soup to main course... Just too good!
author: Uma M.

description: Meh...this wasn't the worst Thai I've had but its far from being even good.  We ordered the pad thai and pad kee mao and both were vegetarian.  Both dishes were super oily and the tofu seemed like it had been re-fried one to many times.  They both had minimal flavor and spice as well but the real reason behind the 2 star rating was the service or the lack there of.  We were seated promptly but after that, the waitress(owner) went around to several tables who had arrived after us to take their order before getting to us.  We also ordered a thai iced tea for my wife which never ultimately arrived.  The thing that really pissed us off was the fact that despite telling the waitress we were vegetarian, she still brought out the hot sauce with fish sauce and then after asking about it just took it away and brought out another hot sauce without muttering a single word.  As a vegetarian, I get the sense that this place has poor food separation standards and there is likely a lot of meat or meat by products that end up in the food which to me is not acceptable.  I will not be back to this place again and am really surprised by the high ratings.
author: Sid P.

description:
Food-Garlic chicken and pad thai: Good and tasty. Papaya Salad-way too salty! It tasted like I swallowed ocean water after each bite. So salty it made me make a sour face.
Place-Way to small and cramped! Anyone but skinny will have a hard time maneuvering around.
Service-Sucks! We got there at a good time bc a party of four just left. So we were seated right away. The waitress (big lady who can hardly get around the restaurant-and wobbles when she walks haha) is extremely rude! As we were finishing ordering she insisted that we order one more dish bc she was sure we wouldnt get full. Mind you, we ended up having left overs! The food took forever to come. It came one by one (four dishes) and there was periods inbetween the dishes where we were just sitting waiting for the next dish. Then they forgot the last dish-garlic chicken. She yells in the kitchen. Comes out and says "Here is minced pork instead of garlic chicken. Just eat this it tastes better anyway." WTF! My mom replies with "Im sorry we do not eat pork. And we ordered garlic chicken." Fat lady wobbles to the chicken and yells again. Very unprofessional if you ask me. 

We were the last ones there. 2 fcukn hours to eat! WTF! Too bad the food is good. I would never go there again unless that lady some how miraculously disappears. I would complain to the manager but i think she is the manager based on the reviews here on yelp.
author: Ame C.

description: I have visited Marnee Thai in the past, and have really enjoyed such dishes as the prig khing j--string beans, baby corn, and mushrooms sautéed with chili paste--a very successful dish. The "thatched room" appearance adds somewhat to the appeal of this establishment. My out-of-town friends enjoyed their panang beef and mussamun chicken curry. While I take issue with the undercooked/tough pieces of cabbage in my praram phak, an assortment of veggies in a peanut & coconut milk curry sauce, the flavors were otherwise good, with a pleasant kick and not overly sweet overall flavor. I hope that I don't run into this undercooked/tough veggie problem on another visit. So, three and three-quarter stars for the effort, otherwise four stars for the service.
author: Ryan T.

description: Very small and crampy restaurant but food is awesome! Must tries: angel wings, pad thai, and duck curry! Just few dislikes: stinginess with rice and the boss' LOUD voice got a bit annoying to enjoy the great food.
author: Pommie S.

description: We had Mango Fried Rice, Green Curry Chicken, Roasted Duck in marinated sauce, Satay beef, Phad Thai, Squid Avocado Salad and Mango Salad for a friends re-union on a weekday, wasn't that packed (it normally gets very busy). DELICIOUS!! However, it's slightly bit overpriced. definitely order some Iced thai Tea.. very milky and yummy!
author: Sandy K.

description:
I love Marnee Thai! The owner is this very loud, big lady and the first time I went there she practically changed my order proclaiming that "This one is better!" and I wasn't disappointed.

The best combination which I always get is:

Spicy Angel Wings or the tofu version which just as good--garlicky but order  it with rice to balance it out. Also get Pad Thai--which they're famous for.

Restaurant is small so don't bring more than 4 if you don't want to feel claustrophobic...but obviously if you look inside the restaurant you might notice that.
author: J. G.

description: What the?!?  Every one seems to love this place, but I don't get it.  The curries have no heat, the Summer Rolls have very little and not fresh shrimp, and the pad thai was disgraceful.  Sorry - but I will not be back.
author: Leslie R.

description: Great place!  Always love coming here and enjoying their food and their unique atmosphere and personalities.  Try the angel wings, they rock!
author: Steven H.

description: Marnee Thai has the best Thai food that I've had in San Francisco. Whether you're trying the peanut sauce, or the coconut rice or the mango beef, you're going to get much more than you asked for. I particualrly enjoy their carry out option as well. It truly says something when its 7:30 at night and there is still a line out the door for the restaurant.
author: Alex M.

description:
Excellent food. 
Great service. 
Fun place. 
Not too noisy. 
Great interior. 
Fantastic menu. 
Great prices. 
May - the owner- is fun to talk with she will make you laugh. 

We eat out often and really I MEAN REALLY enjoyed everything about this place. If it's your birthday, it would be a fun evening to celebrate it here. 

We will be back soon. 

Yes the green curry pot stickers are "the best in the west".
author: rick l.

description: I brought my parents here for a light lunch after a cold drizzy hike on the beach.  It wasn't our original destination but it looked busy and appealing walking by so we decided to give it a try.  I loved that they serve their hot tea in a big glass.  The Tom Kha soup hit the spot on a chilly afternoon...spicy and flavorful. We also shared a green mango/avocado/prawn salad that was yummy.  The service was prompt, efficient, and friendly and lunch was under $30 for three of us.  I will definitely be going back for a full dinner soon.
author: Melanie L.

description: This place is over rated! They use dry pack flat large noodle and just soak in hot water and then claim it is fresh. When you tasted it, you can tell it is from 6 months in the bag, yulk! Very over rated, Passed reviewers who rated 5 stars must be single does not know how to cook or the friends of restaurant owner??? Waiting 1 hour just for noodle, not worth it!
author: Mason T.

description: I've been to several Thai restaurants in the bay and this is the best I've had so far in the area. Their pad thai and pad see ew are, hands down, among the best I have ever tasted. Their papaya sald was delicious as well. However, my biggest disappointment was their curries. Their panang curry, which is my favorite Thai curry, was not impressive at all because I didn't like type of beef they used and it didn't pack the heat I was looking for. The yellow curry was somewhat bland as well. On top of that, I felt like their portions were smaller than what I'm typically used to. But overall, one of the best Thai restaurants I've ever been to.
author: Brent C.

description: being from the bay, there's lots of good thai places around but i had the best thai food i've ever eaten here. the cooking and seasoning is perfect and sublime. sure, it's a little more run down but i enjoyed it.
author: Melissa L.

description: Probably one of the best places in the city. I think this place speaks for itself with all of the awards it has. Amaazingly there is never a line for this place (at lunch) even though every single dish is so tasty. The decor in there is so fun. It makes you feel like you're eating in a hut! The parking around here is well... dreadful but it is sf so can't be expecting too much
author: edward k.

description: I've been to their 9th St. location several times, and I always thought it to be consistently reliable in serving good food.  Their Outer Sunset location is no different.  The food and portion size are just as good, and they offer gluten for veggie dishes.  Though still cramped, I think there's slightly more inches of leeway between tables.  Still, there's always been something about both Marnee Thai locales that prevent me from giving away that fifth star, and it may be more due to the service than anything else.
author: Marsha Z.

description: An unsatisfactory dining experience. The 3 staff members kept yelling and talking to each other, with the women in screechy loud voices.  One of them screamed to another while pouring water and it was very unpleasant on my ears. Loud staff. The setting in the restaurant does not match the servers attitudes. The service was not good.  They were however extremely efficient in refilling water in the glasses. I had to get the waitress to stop as she zoomed past the table twice to ask for something. They are in an awful rush.  The man asked the table guests if they want more water from a distance, I guess he didn't have time to walk over.  Dropped the bill on the table without a word. Here's the kicker - when we asked for more rice since the initial serving was barely enough, she brought a large volume of rice but it was cold!!! And sticky. That's what I get for asking for more.  If you really want good Thai food and care about the service - go elsewhere.  They are not cheap either at $12+ a dish. The food was served on flat plates with a couple spoonful of gravy.  These dishes should have been served in a deeper bowl like plate with more gravy.  Wow they are really stingy. Nice decor but awful staff and service.
author: Jane S.

description: The location is small and cutesy but the food is amazing! The curry, the pan fried noodles, the fried rice, ALL OF IT! give it a try! :D highly recommended!
author: Maggie C.

description:
They have dozens of "awards" posted on their window and inside their menu, but I certainly did not get anything near an "award winning" meal.

I had the eggplant chicken stir-fry with basil; it was okay, nothing special.  It came served lukewarm.  We had two orders of brown rice for $4 extra, and it turned out to be a tiny amount of rice, but even worse, the rice was cold and dry like it was leftovers.  It was quite a dissapointment to expect hot steamy food on a chilly day, and wind up getting lukewarm/cold food.

Seating is pretty cramped.  Overall, just a very mediocre thai restaurant. Nothing special at all.

I'll pass on next time, thanks.
author: Wil K.

description: After a very good meal at Marnee Thai a few weeks ago my wife and I tried it again today for lunch.  The summer rolls were quite good today but my pad kee mao was lifeless at best.  I ordered it "Bangkok Hot" but it arrived very mild.  The server brought a jar of dried pepper flakes so I could spice it up.  The dish should have fresh Thai chilies cooked along with everything else not dry flakes that don't even work with pizza.  The noodles were soggy and lifeless and the broccoli was overcooked.  The dish could easily have been sitting on a steam table for two hours.
author: Gene D.

description: Oh sweet Jesus, say it ain't so. I am moving out of the g-damn yay and right before I leave I have the (mis)fortune of stumbling upon this gem of a tikki-hut/restaurant. San Francisco always taunts you with her perfection on the way out. Bitch!! Anyways, try the chicken wings, rice noodles w/ crab meat, papaya salad, red curry w/  tofu (creamy and nicely spiced but not too hot), and cool off  w/ a coconut (I haven't seen 'nuts like that since koh samui, circa '02). I went on a Sunday night and my friend and I were seated almost immediately. AND i found parking right in front. Nice.
author: Preet K.

description:
happy valentines all!!! you either LOVE this holiday or HATE it, but i'm gonna embrace it since mr lin and i are both going to be home, munching on cereal, and so be it, korean food. HAHA... 

***
disclamer: if you've read my review from yesterday, you'd know that the lunch i had at 2pm wasn't really lunch since i was STILL hungry which made me hop on the freeway and drive through sunset and buy me some thai food ... my part ii lunch filled me up for lunch // early dinner... kinda, but not really.

above average thai food, but it doesn't hit the 4 star mark. okay, 3.7555... LOL. i'm sry, marnee..

so i suppose, this is a review for yesterday's lunch//dinner and today's breakfast ... :I ahaha ... i say breakfast because i ate half of their pad phed (basically pad thai but i had it with prawns $7.50) which was pretty darn good... how could you screw up on pad thai? thats like your (thai's) signature dish? anyways, i'd so order this again. :)

yesterday, i ordered their chan pad poo... lol. (sticky fried rice noodles w/crab meat, eggs, and onion for $8). lol... you kno when you go to a new place, you stare at the menu for hrs? well, that's what i was doing -- that word "POO" stood out and so my curious monkey brain ordered that dish . should've known, it wasn't all that great, small quantity, perhaps because it was their lunch portion, but still ... it was ok.

service was friendly and sweet. 

parking can be a bitch at times, since it was lunch hours and given that we are on irving...
author: Jennifer S.

description: On Tuesdays, May will give an impromptu palm reading -- if you her treat her nice.  It's easy to pick her out: she wears beautiful traditional Thai silk dresses and wears  Thai jewelry and amulets.  As the owner, she does a great job of making sure people are having a good time.  You'll meet some genuine Thai folks there.  The food is okay, and May's husband works hard to make sure to do the best that he can with not-grown-in-Thailand ingredients.  But the best time I had was talking to the waiters and her, watching the cooks sizzle their garlic and peppers, and the Thai words whipping back and forth.  Brings you back to Trang and Bangkok on a foggy day in the Sunset.  The palm reading wasn't too bad, either.
author: ed y.

description:
When you order Thai Spicy, you would assume they would spice it up to Thai level spiciness, right? I swear, Thai Spicy holds no meaning anymore...

This review is a little late because this happened a year back. Not sure if she's still there. Not like I will be coming back anytime soon to this location. It all started when me and a couple of friends got here and got a table. Up comes this short stocky lady that seemed overly nice. We thought this could be a nice dinner. WRONG! We ordered all our dishes and asked for THAI SPICY on about 3 of the 5. We thought they would know what we meant. The lady seemed like she understood because she seemed to acknowledge us with a ton of yes yes yes and a bunch of no worries!!!...So we thought cool and waited patiently while knocking back some sake. 

When the dishes came out we all noticed one thing wrong. Where's the strong aroma of hotness from the food? The steam vapor that wafts to your nose and is able to make you cry just from the scent? We kinda went through the food with our forks and noticed that the dishes we asked for Thai Spicy lacked the extra oomph that we ordered. So we flagged down the lady and asked her to take it back and spice it up some more. She said no problem and went to the kitchen to bring up back a jar of the pickled chilies they have. The green ones that are hot and sour. We kinda stared at her and wondered what the hell was wrong with her as she proceeded to tell us to mix the chilies in for extra spiciness. We were not amused at this point and asked her to make the dishes the way we wanted them. So she took them back to the kitchen and she came back and apologized for the mix up and her actions telling us that she takes pills and sometimes she gets like that. 

One, never tell the patrons that you are on meds to keep yourself "normal". That will scare people away and not really give you any sort of sympathy.
Two, when a customers asks for a dish or dishes to be done a certain way, just do it. Don't try to bring something out and have us do a DYI on it. Tacky...
Three, remember the customer is almost always right.

Apart from that little incident and the correct spice amounts back in the food, we were pleased with the meal. I just hoped no one else had to deal with her on a day she forgot to take her meds...Seriously...
author: Anthony L.

description: I have travelled in Thailand and feasted on Thai food  throughout the US. This puts every Thai restaurant I've tried to shame. I use this restaurant to prove my point that thai food is best served from the US. There are two locations, one one 9th ave(next to Le Video) and one on Irving btwn 22nd and 23rd. Both are slam dunks. The Garlic eggplant dish is unbelievable, and I usually get the tofu prarham. No delivery, you've got to truck out to the inner sunset/UCSF.
author: Phil M.

description:
NO!! NO!....No, not this place.....somebody say it isn't so!!!..please!
Sigh*  This was, and I say WAS one of the finest Thai restaurants I had ever visited.  I remember once having a ground chicken salad in a spicy/herbal marinade that was the stuff of poetry and song.  But that was two years ago.   Last Sunday my family and I were all in the mood for some palate stimulating Thai, so what better place than Marnee Thai, right?  Wrong.

I remember the days of being greeted there by dainty Thai ladies dressed in those beautiful shimmery outfits, the kinds that make us ordinary western women feel like circus elephants.   This time, we were greeted and served by some woman of an entirely different ethnicity, who bluntly hurried us to order and then got all the orders wrong.  

    My daughter, whose culinary adventures do not yet go to very exotic extremes, opted for ordinary Pad Thai.  Can't go wrong with that, right?  Wrong again.   These noodles were overcooked and simmered in a sauce consisting of loads of ketchup and vinegar and a dash of spices.  The chicken pieces in it were tiny and sparse, loaded in a more than generous amount of grease.

   As she ate, I had ordered the coconut/chicken soup for the three of us, intending to think about my second dish while I slowly savored all the complex flavors of the soup.   However, I was soon to discover that this bowl was so small it was a joke to share with three people, but I did, and was left with a tiny bit of liquid in my tiny bowl and a few small pieces of chicken.   The other adult in our group was also taking his time trying to decide on his second dish, so he ordered a cup of coffee in the meantime.  A few sips afterward he tells me he thinks this is instant coffee.   I glanced up and saw that by the tiny kitchen they did indeed have a large jar of cheap, dollar store brand instant coffee.  Later, a trip to the bathroom where you have to cross the entrance to the kitchen, confirmed my eyes had not deceived me.   Honestly, wouldn't it be better for a restaurant to say they don't have coffee than to offer disgusting, chalky instant coffee?  But apparently these folks think that as long as they can charge for it, reputation be dammed.

   We were so disgusted by everything we were experiencing that we just decided not to order anything else.  After getting our undeservingly overpriced bill, we left and headed for Clement street, where we went to Clement Dim Sum and satisfactorily put an end to our hunger.

   So much for Marnee Thai - - and yet one more that bites the dust!
author: Alice C.

description:
came here for the first time today and i noticed that i never really noticed this place before after giong to irving almost every weekend over the summer. but wow, the inside is pretty cosey and nice

went there for lunch today and order some noodle plate with flat rice noodles that was kinda spicy with some basils and tomatoes and forgot what else but damn it was GOOOOOD. enjoyed the place and their service is great, i'm down to come here asap again!
author: Kenny L.

description: I feel like Thai food is a great staple to San Francisco.  There are Thai places all over the city, and it's a great place to take friends, or get take out, or just get some inexpensive greasy noodle action.  However, once you've been here a few years, you start to become picky about it: was there good food?  a lot of food for a little money?  good service?  I've been to quite a few places, and I feel like Marnee Thai really fits all the criteria.  I can come here and get the same thing I got last time and it'll be just as good.  I can try something new and know it will probably be good.  The service is great and super friendly.  I feel like you can't really go wrong with Marnee Thai.  So if you find yourself in the outer sunset craving some cheap and delicious Thai, check out Marnee.  You might not be totally wowed, but you definitely won't be disappointed.
author: Courtney H.

description: Please avoid going here.  I ordered a roasted duck dish to go and the food was scorched.  It tasted as if it had been run through a crematorium.  I called to complain and the manager told me he would have the owner contact me...and he never did.  Save your money!
author: J. D.

description: This Thai is first rate with standard thai price. The food at this restaurant is always full of flavor and fresh vegetables. Their fake meat is superb. Their staff is very proffesional, friendly, and one woman is full of great energy. They know how to serve in patient order - I am very keen to restaurants who give no care to the order (apptz, soup, meal) in which they bring items, and this place has it down. Their lunch specials are smaller portions of their meals and come with rice, so don't expect the soup, eggroll package. But the meal is worth focusing on who needs those. Also, come early for lunch and dinner to avoid crowds.
author: Sari G.

description: Yum.  This is a great place. It is small and cozy.  The service is good and so is the food.  Last time I was there we ordered this mango-fried rice dish with prawns.  It was awesome.  I normally like Thai food,and this is better than most.
author: Kate B.

description: Good food, decent prices, nice service, and it's in my hood.  That makes me a fan.
author: Kristine C.

description: I don't know what's going on with this place but despite all the rave reviews and awards- maybe its gotten to their heads!  the portion size was not happening- felt like they cut it down by half and their prices are over the top.  I ordered soup - which i do at every other thai restaurant and they charged me 1.5 times the price ($14) because it was for  4 people?!?  really? and the portions ONLY served 4 people in small bowls.. as to where other places will charge us on the normal price $8-9 and it serves so much more than that.  RIP OFF!!  stupid rule.  everyhting else was tasty but i can definitely get that same food somewhere else and i've been to many a thai restaurant.  OVERRATED- bathroom is small- place is too small as well- feels like servers are constantly swarming around you- thumbs down.
author: Elaine v.

description: Marnee Thai is definately 5 stars. The food is heavenly scrumptious and the service is prompt and amiable. I like the fun loving roly-poly owner (no offense) but she has such energetic character to make the place more fun to dine!
author: Michael K.

description: So I've been to Marnee Thai 20 times already but haven't yelped so here goes. ANGEL WINGS!!!! That's all you need to eat there to become a fan. Unless of course you don't like deep fried or sticky sweet sauce that coats your hands and stomach. Pad thai is also really good and dare I say the best in the city.
author: Sophia C.

description: This place is still my go to wing stop! Angel Wings FTW!!! I go there early to avoid the lines and have a quiet dinner. The place is on the small side but I like this over their 9th and Irving location.
author: Jon W.

description: I read the help reviews and decided to tried it again, I've tried this place a while back ago it wasn't all that good. But this time it blew me away.. The chan pad poo was yummy.. Should also tried the satay beef!!
author: Max C.

description: As far as the bay area goes, this place is hands down the best Thai place I've been too.  The food is consistently yummy and my family and I dine there often.  This place is pricey though, so be ready to pay.  Marnee is very small and often crowded on weekends, so make reservations or get there early, otherwise you won't get in.  I've seen people wait outside until a few minutes before closing.  If you like Thai food, give this place a try.  If you're looking for cheap Thai food, go somewhere else, cuz you play for what you get!
author: BigAppetite ..

description: Woon Sin Vegetarian...AMAZING. And the Gang Jued Soup Vegetarian is basicly the same amazing dish in a sou form. Even more amazing. Good Staff. Marnee makes sure you get what you need when shes in the restaurant. Overall, the food is really great. Never had anyone I'm with not love their food.
author: Caitlin S.

description: I personally barely eat Thai Food. I find that the place here is very cute. It isn't all that roomy but then it also isn't cramped. Their Angel Wings, Pad Thai and Thai Ice Tea are very delicious. The service here isn't the very best but it is good. Employees here all welcome you generously and they ask you how the food it also. Even though they charge you for tea and rice instead of having it free like other places, the food here isn't all that expensive. It may be a tad bit pricey but the food that you get in return is very delicious.
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
the interior makes you feel like you're in a tropical place already.  a great money saving illusional vacation away from the foggy and windy sunset district which it is actually located in.  it's nice to feel like you've escaped the outside world for a while as you're enjoying flavorful dishes with good service.
my friend and i ordered up several dishes and enjoyed every dish until we were stuffed.
author: charlotte s.

description:
This is by far my favorite place for Thai food. The service is great and the food is the best.

I normally order the pad see ew and it's very very good. The texture of the noodle is very different compared to other Thai restaurants; it's kind of chewy but in a good way. The portion is huge, I normally can't finish the whole entree by myself. They have this really good multi-colored jalapeno hot sauce that goes really well with just anything.

Their Thai iced tea and coconut drinks are also really good. They serve the coconut juice on a whole young coconut which is really neat. 

The service is amazing. Our water is constantly filled and they often check to make sure that we have enough rice in the silver pot.

Marnee Thai is the only place that I would go for good Thai food.
author: Wenting L.

description:
im giving this place a 3.5

its one of the more expensive thai places ive been to in the city and theres not much difference.. however, the portions are small and the duck fried rice was a little bit oily for my taste.. and where was the duck? there was only duck skin and fat (ew!) .. the pad thai was good but i feel the portion was way too small to justify the 10 dollar price.. ive gotten huge (and yummy) portions for only 7 dollars
author: JUDY L.

description: This place is so good. I always order the same things...Angel Wings and Pad See Ew w/ beef! The wings are go flavorful I'm starting to crave for some right now. The Pad See Ew is waaay better than King of Thai's and the beef is more tender also. This place seems to always be crowded so go early  for dinner! I have yet to try anything else besides the Pad See Ew, Angel Wings, and Pad Thai though. I've been coming here since highschool! Haha, but I vow to try something new next time...maybe =]..I just like to order my usuals cause I know what I like. =]
author: josephine n.

description:
Cute little restaurant. 16 tables. They have lunch specials but they dont come with soup as im used to thai lunch specials having. While the soup is meant for two they will let you get a half order (though the waitress couldnt tell me how much it would cost). As is usual for my first time at a thai place i ordered the pad thai. Looking at the tables of others it looks really good. One of the first impressions that i got from the place was the hot sauce they serve. It looks completely fresh, like they made it themselves. Ive not really ever seen that at an asian place, at least not the sauce you find on the table. Hopefully thatll be a good forebearance of what is to come! 

The soup arrived in a cute but oddly shaped bowl. At first glance two things came to mind 1) thats a lot of oil floating in it and 2) thats a big half order of soup. The soup was very tasty. Lots of mushrooms and chicken. There was also a lot of lemongrass and ginger in it, garnished with cilantro. While eating the ginger is fine i would recommend not eating the lemongrass as it takes 50 chews to break it down enough to eat.

Now the pad thai has arrived, it looked delicious, premixed for my pleasure, missing lime again though. Maybe thats a west coast thing? It smells delicious.

First impressions. Everything tastes really good, a nice sweetness to it and a robust flavor with properly prepared noodles. Here is the downside, i asked for thai spicy, and i got mild. I reiterated it twice, she said she understood. Unfortunately this loses this restaurant a star.

Well, i gotta give this place two stars. Becuase the only feeling i have right now is Meh. Did I mention the shrimp pad thai only had 3, count them, 3 shrimp and 5 pieces of shrivelled tofu? I didn't, well, I should have. Was it tasty, sure, but it wasnt much tastier than your normal place, the soup was the highlight of the meal...and the half order was 4.50 (versus 7 for the full). I wouldnt come back. My water was never refilled, i never got the lime i asked for and i was served mild pad thai. To top it all off the meal was 14 bucks. 
 
This place has tons of potential, and maybe if id ordered different things id sing a different tune, but I won't give them another chance unless someone I'm out with really wants to go here.
author: H B.

description:
Food was  okay to good, but I did have a bad service experience ...
I don't expect to return.  I hope others have a better experience.
author: Jack M.

description: I read all these wonderful reviews and my hopes were high.... I went there early too, just to make sure we got a table.  SOOO DISAPPOINTED!!!  We didn't finish any of the food and the wings were burnt....the worst was the waitress and service.  The manager or owner came in and said hello to everyone around us, EXCEPT US!!  Sorry to say, we were the only asians there....I felt so mistreated.  In Japan, people don't tip but service is priority.
author: Yuko Y.

description:
I love Thai food and you won't be disappointed coming here...and keep coming back !!!  

The food was great. The waiters/waitresses were very friendly but the services were quite slow, maybe because this place was so packed. 

 Anyhow, I will definitely come back.
author: Sonia O.

description: Fairly good Thai food for the area, now that Bangkok Garden is gone! Ventured here with my sister after we both were craving for our faves: Pad Thai, & Panang Curry Catfish! Give it a try!
author: Rachel C.

description:
Just got back from there tonight, and my tummy and senses are still RAVING over the great food we had there..

Usually, my strategy in a Thai restaurant is to pick a chicken dish, an appetizer and a seafood dish and something random.    So for tonight, we  took a good friend of ours out on a visit from Chicago to Marnee.  For appetizer, we began with the Mango Salad.  I am traditionally not a big fan of Thai salads, but the excellent sweet flavor of the extremely light and tangy dressing was a great compliment for digesting all those veggies and a couple of cashews along for the ride. While munching, I wondered where the Mango was, 'til my wifey told me that all that shredded noodle-looking stuff was the Mango.. d'oh!  VERY GOOD.

Following closely behind the salad was a traditional Pad Thai.  Excellent, and nutty, with a few huge prawns poking out amongst the noodles. Bravo to the chef for NOT drowning the Pad Thai in raw bean sprouts like other places.

Next up from the kitchen was #35 - the Pad Cashew Nuts w/Chicken, comprised of sauteed sliced chicken with roasted chili, cashew nuts and long slivers of onion.  The sweet yet somewhat savory sauce that came with this completely put my taste buds onto cloud nine, or ten.. DEE-LEC-TA-BLE!!  (especially over the thai rice)  This dish was the sleeper surprise.. I thought... Pad Cashew nuts?  Sounds just like a yawner Chinese Cashew Chicken (blech) from Panda Express, but NOOO... THIS IS completely GREAT!  The dark sauce reminds me of a pepper shrimp dish I had back in S'pore.  Incredible.

The following two plates rounded out our meal:
#44: Pad Phong Ka Ree, essentially sauteed prawns and scallops in a yellow curry, with eggs, mushrooms, bell peppers and onions tossed in.   I ordered this one as "insurance" to ensure we got something I liked, and the scallops were pretty good sized, tender and fresh along with the very fresh shrimp.  This dish did not disappoint, and the yellow curry was light, and the natural yummy compliment to the Thai steamed rice, which was a little dry for my taste. My wife also ordered the #27: Pad Kaprow - Pork  sauteed with fresh chili garlic and Thai basils.  Minced pork - A teeny bit dry, but still very very good especially when you found the good stuff at the bottom of the serving plate.   The flavors in this place are TOPS.. NOT greasy, and after going to a series of inconsequential/disappointing SE Asian places, Marnee is definitely what I was hoping for but never really expecting.

Service - pretty quick, attentive and very friendly, yet not overbearing or intruding. The owner always checked up on us, and the whole place was packed tonight, even on a semi-rainy Wednesday evening in the middle of the work week.  Due to all seats/tables being filled, we waited about 8 minutes for our table for three.

I'll definitely be back!  They earned their five stars as far as I am concerned.   Oh, and forget those one-review-hatchet-naysayers.  And nope. I  don't work for Marnee, nor am even a friend to anyone there, just a satisfied customer.
author: Harry W.

description: Hands down, best thai restaurant there is.  This has been approved by people who live in Thailand as well.  All their dishes are extremely delicious, especially their fish dishes (like Amok).  The owner has a 'strong' character, which makes it interesting and may turn some people off.  But if you focus on the food, you'll get what you want.
author: Luk S.

description: While I was watching Grey's Anatomy I realized I have not had Thai food since I moved back to Monterey Park. What does that have to do with the tv show? Nothing. It just came up in my head. When I was living in San Francisco I used to go to Marnee Thai when I craved Thai food for dinner. I loved their angel wings and raad na (I think that's how you spell it). The only thing that sucks is that there is always a line for dinner, the restaurant is really small, and the parking sucks. You can avoid all this if you decide to eat a late lunch there, then there won't be a line, the place won't feel as cramped, and you probably could find parking.
author: Rennie C.

description: What a fabulous place to come for Thai food! I ordered the Pad Thai...soo yummy! The only down side to this place is lack of space. They always try to squeeze in way too many people in this tiny place. The last time i ate here I barely had enough space to lift my hand to my mouth and was wedged into an awkward, claustrophobic space. Service was awesome and food was superb! Beware the Thai Nazi! She watches the place like a hawk! =)
author: nancy l.

description: i can't believe i never wrote a review for this yet. i've been coming here years back.. in high school? my usual here is their chicken pad see ew and their angel wings. drools!!
author: Valerie N.

description: i used to come here a lot with my mom when she worked on irving. and it was great. however, the last time i went there was a less than welcoming experience. first, the boss lady was LOUD. like screaming into the kitchen when she was taking orders in the dining room. also, i found a hair in my fried rice. at first i thought it was my hair and disregarded it. and then, low and behold, another piece of hair. i knew it definitely wasnt mine because it was at the bottom of my plate and stirred in nicely with the rice. yea. when i told the waitress... she said "it's not mine." i know it's not yours... but can you do something about it?! so she took my plate away and that's it. did not take the charge off the bill. and no apologies.
author: L M.

description:
If you come to Marnee Thai, come to this one. The one on 9th is never as good for some reason. 

Everybody has to try angel wings...if you don't you are missing out. 

All of the usual thai dishes are made pretty good here. Fresh ingredients, and good seasoning. Thai ice tea is sweet, but not soo much that I can't drink it. Soups are good, and salads are nice and light. 

The decor is tasefully done, but I wish this place was bigger. I always feel like im bumping elbows.
author: Josh M.

description:
1/27:  the last few times ive gone back, the food has gone downhill.  i need to find a new thai takeout place.
________________________________

reliable decent thai food!  if im in the mood for thai, this is my default place to go.
author: Dorothy L.

description:
would never step foot in there again.
ever. 
looked promising when we first went in.  The man greeted us with a smiling face and we were seated quickly. 
the lady with the heavy thai accent came over and asked for our drink orders
so we got thai iced tea
and i said that we were ready to order.  she was like 'one moment'
she left and never came back
ten minutes later, someone else came to serve the drinks and i told her that we were ready to order
and she said "in a minute" or something of the sort
she left and never came back
another ten minutes go by
i was confused- why wouldn't anyone take our order?
i thought to myself, maybe they are just that busy
but then another party arrives and their orders are taken.

so i put my hand up and got the attention of the guy who finally takes our order
the food takes another half an hour to get to the table
ordered pad see ew and beef salad
the noodles smelled good but did not deliver 
they got the textures right - broccoli was cooked al dente and noodles were not overcooked
but why was it so salty?!
same with the beef salad.  i was expecting something fresh, and yummy
it was so salty. like so so salty. the dish only had a few wilted pieces of lettuce and red onion. so disappointed.  The beef was all soft and weird.  maybe some people like that, but it just reminded me of cheap beef.
both dishes had small portions. so overpriced
the restaurant also felt a bit cramped and cluttered.  
wished i spent my money on some chinese food or pho noodles down the block.
author: Candy Y.

description:
you can sit comfortably for a lunch, but dinnertime is usually jammed packed.  my favorite meal would be the tom kha soup (with extra fresh tofu), calamari salad, spicy angel wings and a thai ice tea.  i also love their green lamb curry, basa filet, and pad thai.  the staff are extremely nice, my stomache leaves happy everytime.  everyone that i've recommended loves it too!

ps. 
i know what some of you mean by the owner lady.  she can be very loud, but she is overall a sweet lady.  i understand it can be fustrating when all you want is to enjoy your meal and your company.  i have to admit it was pretty bad a few years back, but i've been back recently many times, and she doesn't seem to yell as much.  i wonder if anyone has ever told her about her enormous chords?  maybe there is something that's causing her to talk so loud?  hm....
author: Paulina C.

description: It's been YEARS since I could say that a Thai restaurant left me feeling like I got a great meal. Marnee has succeeded in doing that. The Pad Thai is exceptional. The massuman curry is perfect. Whatever you do, make sure you order the Angel Wings, they are spicy and sweet just like you would hope. The iced tea here is perfect and the service and cute waitresses are spot-on!
author: Sherie R.

description: One of my favorite Thai spots in the city. It's totally one of those little sunset gems. Their tom yum soup is perfect.  I used to live across the street from it, and was spoiled by the proximity. Now I am living in a more central location of the city and still make the small journey out to the sunset to get my Thai fix.
author: Kimberly B.

description: Okay, wasn't floored by the quality of the food.  Perhaps it was because I went near the closing time?  It was a Friday, though.  I just found the food a bit bland.  Judging by all the reviews, perhaps I should try it again?  But that's the problem with this city: too many good restaurants, so if a place is mediocre the first time, there's no incentive to go back again.
author: Rohit G.

description:
This is another local gem in San Francisco.  I heard about it through a friend over 8 years ago.  I've been coming ever since then and have introduced it to many other people.  

You can't go wrong with Marnee Thai.  They have exceptional service and exceptional food.  I love ordering a thai curry, egglant and pork and a seafood.  The curries here are really good.  Red, Yellow, Green, it does not matter.  This is one of my favorite local haunts in San Francisco. 

It is a little bit more than I like to spend on a daily basis but it makes a great treat or date place.  I wouldn't recommend bringing in a group bigger than 4 to this place because it is so cramped.  That's why I only come here on date night with my fiancee.
author: Scott L.

description:
this is some of the best thai food i've had outside of bangkok.
they've evidently scored a ton of well deserved accolades over the years.
some of the very best food in the outer sunset.
pretty much rules that i can walk there too.

the first time i went there the woman who seems like she runs the place told my friend what to order -which was a bit pushy- but also an excellent recommendation.
author: william m.

description:
Francis T. is straight trippin'!  The fact he/she mentions Ragone in his/her conspiracy theory for dummies is proof enough. (What the freak does city politics have to do with a restaurant review ? Nothing!)

And that must be some special ass Temporary Work Visa the workers have- since I've seen the same ones there year after year after year.

I have been eating here for 20 years. I am a native 'Cisian and have eaten Thai food all over this city as an ongoing experiment - including most of the restaurants on Francis T's list to see if any place was better and Marnee Thai is my still my favorite.  

Scroll down and see all the 4 & 5 reviews, some from folks who have actually been to Thailand.

As a last note to Francis T: pad thai may not be down home Thai food, but there ain't no sweet & sour pork  or broccoli beef in China or CA roll in Japan either and every Asian restaurant in the city has these items on the menu because SF is a tourist city and that tourist money is just as green as us natives'- Asian or not. THIS IS AMERICA FOO! So let them order what they know, that's just more authentic dishes for me & my peeps. HOLLA!
author: Wordu P.

description: The place is really small but serves good Thai food.  There's usually a wait for table, but once you sit down, service is pretty quick.
author: Tadaa T.

description: I think all the other reviewers have already pointed out that this place has tasty thai food. It's upheld it's reputation and any dish i've tried there is good and it's cheap. The owner is a funny round lady with a mustache, but I love her. The only downfall is that there were 5 of us, and since it's a really small and busy  restaurant, we got placed for a table of 4 where I was sitting in the aisle, and the space in between me and the next table was really tight. Whenever the round lady would pass by, her big butt would be pushing me against my table, and it was very uncomfortable.
author: Emy s.

description: 1st take out meal in our new hood. Damn good yellow curry and beef salad. Staff was super friendly and asking all about us as their new neighbors. Will most definitely be headed back...a lot!
author: Mike G.

description: One of the best under priced Thai places around the city or even the bay area, here you can get anything from fried rice to Pad Kee Mao which is always awesome.  I have gone here for a long while now, living in the sunset makes you connect with all the restaurants around you...(haha)  Delicious food, although the room is very very very small, fits about 50 people inside, and there is absolutely no room to walk, but the decor brings you to Thailand with its bamboo insides and paintings on the wall, it is only when you walk outside that you realize your in California....But you can spend probably $25 dollars for two people which is awesome for a date, and theres a whole bunch of desert places if your not feeling in the mood for fried bananas and ice cream.  Most definitely one of my favorite thai places, much better then Osha Thai or any other places in the bay area..
author: Genesis K.

description: Have been coming here for years, and still it's my favorite Thai restaurant in the city! Nevermind the fact that the owner feels at liberty to shout at you should you step out of line! Better than their sister restaurant on 9th Avenue.
author: Kerrie T.

description: This is maybe one of the BETTER Thai restaurants in the city, excluding King of Thai Noodles. The guy who works here is extremely nice, this one lady is pretty messed up. My friend ordered a Thai iced tea and never got it and still got billed for it, but she changed it after. The food is good, but I usually get pad see ew.
author: Edgar G.

description: This is a favorite thai restaurant.  I've been coming here for 10+ years.  The food is always really good.  The owner can be loud and a bit pushy but I think she means well.  She's not afraid to voice her opinion, so if you want some recommendations, ask her and she'll tell you!  I like the decor in the original Irving location better than 9th Ave.  Parking can be a pain at both locations so be prepared to walk a few blocks.
author: Stacey L.

description: There is always a line out the door for dinner every time I come here. The food is really good and so it's worth the wait. The wife of the chef seats us and takes our order. She seems like she knows what's a good combination of food to order so I ask her for some recommendations on the menu.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
yeaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa! amazing interior, ive got to say that. the waitress who is there at night is quite a character too-- youll see, hahaha! 

i would say this is my favorite thai restaurant in the city. if you come during dinner time, youd most likely have to wait outside. it's not a large restaurant, but quality of the food is enough = good.
author: Veranna N.

description: Parking in Irving st. was a pain in the ass.  UGH!  To add to my annoyance, the wait for our table seemed far too long since everyone and their mama decided to eat the same time as my group.  They finally called our name and I sat down already preparing myself for disappointment.  "This better be good!"  After talking to the crazy waiter/owner and tasting a bite of the basa fillet with garlic and black pepper sauce, I completely forgot about everything.  One of the best Thai foods I've tried around the area.  The calamari salad and chicken kang ka ree are also pretty tasty and of course, you can't forget about their award winning Pad Thai.  -1 star because the place can be overpacked and of course, the parking.
author: Jacquelynne S.

description: It rocks!!! Omigod it was yummy.  Service was great too.
author: A R.

description: I will drop by Marnee to pick-up a couple orders of the Spicy Angel Wings whenever I am in the area.  The duck and curries are also really delicious.  I really enjoy the decor and the wait staff is great.  Best Thai restaurant in the Bay Area!
author: Alex H.

description: I came here 8 months ago.  It was delicious.  All I can remember is that the fried basil that came with the angel wings were very good.
author: Cindy H.

description: Cool room, and really great food. Owner has an interestingly forceful personality.
author: Don H.

description: Ok I guess if I'm going to refer (in code) on another review... I should review this place too.  This is my FAVORITE thai place.  (oh hey Rie... don't know ya but me too!) You can not go wrong here... the Green Papaya Salad... mmm, the BBQ Chicken I must have when I'm here: crispy skin, juicy tender chicken mmmMMmm,  Curry curry curry... all good, Eggplant yum ( a tad greasy... its just that way w/ eggpant) Greenbeans yes please! Tom Yum? yum!  brown rice? yay! and just when you think there's room for nothing else mangoes and sticky rice... oh so good.Roti? Rotme! (greasy but good)  And parkings not bad either!  The wings were good a bit oversauced for my taste... but that's me.... must go back for Pad Thai didn't know it was award winning! see you there!
author: Paula Y.

description: I give Marnee Thai a very solid 3.5 stars. I like how their food is on the sweeter side of the scale. Their Angel Wings are very popular with strong flavors of garlic and basil. One of the dishes I always get is their beef with string beans, also full of garlic flavor. I like their yellow, green, and red curry dishes, very solid. One thing I didn't like was their Thai ice coffee, it was way too sweet for my taste. The staff is pretty friendly.
author: Mike S.

description: Parking can be difficult but the food is great. Try the "angel wings" and som tum (papaya salad).
author: Kevin K.

description: If you love Thai, you'll love Marnee Thai.  Delicious food in a tastefully decorated restaurant and served by hosts in traditional Thai/Siam outfits.  I had the Pad Nor Mai vegetarian style (fake meat) and it tasted really, really good.  So good that I had to defend my plate from the marauding hands of my dinner companion and she's non-veg!
author: ITesh J.

description:
although last night was the first time in ages i've eaten at marnee thai, not much has changed. for one, the main full-bodied, vivacious server woman is still there (although i think she's lost weight). for two, the angel wings still kick ass. boy, are they delicious. but there's not much else that i can rave about at marnee thai. the rest of the menu is so mediocre that it baffles me as to why marnee thai remains one of the most popular thai establishments in the city. 

last night, i ordered the following:

- the coconut soup with shrimp (bland)
- the fresh spring rolls (bland - the thai don't know how to make a good fresh spring roll the way the vietnamese do)
- the yellow curry with chicken (bland - imagine that! a bland curry!)
- a side of roti (good but way too oily)
- fried banana with ice cream (sucked)
author: Baochi N.

description: The food is delicious and the service isn't bad either. The wait is long after 7pm, so either go early or make reservations. Don't be alarmed by the shouting of orders and don't be surpised if they ask you to move tables while you're eating dinner. This happened to me twice!
author: Adelina W.

description: Great Thai food (gotta love the spicy angel wings..now if they can stop making it so hot that the roof of my mouth stops peeling).  Service is excellent and you really get alot for your money.  Just wish the woman proprietor would stop screaming at the top of her lungs when she talks to the customers.  Reminds me of the soup nazi.  I started calling her the Thai Nazi.  Have a few Hall's.
author: Christopher C.

description: My girlfriend and I used to come to this spot all the time when she lived in this area. Even after she moved it was still a much frequented spot. Try the pad kee mao. The peanut sauce is absolutely to die for! She swore by the pad see ew!
author: Sashy R.

description: Went there after a long long day adventure around the city. The soup hit the spot and the yellow curry chicken with brown rice was fabulous. Great service, was quick and friendly. Have definitely gone there again and again.
author: Lisa S.

description: All I have to say is holy crap.  The woman that runs this place knows what she is doing.  I rolled in with a group of seven on a Saturday night.  She was very efficient and definitely got us in, got our order, and brought our food, lickety-split.  The food was ok though not stellar, and I have to say that I did not really like my imitation meat with cashews.  The meat was too soggy.  Also, they brought my friend's thai ice tea toward the end of the meal.  The pad thai was one of the best that I have had in a while though.   Definitely a good evening!
author: Joanna S.

description: I had dinner here with my husband an 16 month old daughter around 6ish on a Wed night.    The place is small but very cute and already had a few customers already.  We liked the woven bamboo that covered all the walls and ceiling.  Based on other yelpers we ordered their Angel Wings - they were crispy and the sauce was okay,  but way too much minced garlic for my taste.  If I had a choice between their Angel wings and San Tung's dry fried Chicken I would go with the other place.  They havent let me down yet.  We also had: Tom Yum Soup, Pad Thai, Yellow Curry Chicken, and their Spicy Seafood combo, and a Thai iced tea.  The food was good...better than going to King of Thai.  I would like to try this place again or their 2nd location on 9th.  All and all, I like the place and their serive was really great.
author: Sheenie L.

description: I'm a Korean girl, we like our food spicy. I'm no pansy when it comes to that shit. So for a place to be spicy to me, well that's saying something. I'm addicted to Thai food and Marnee is like crack to me.
author: Jackie I.

description: OK. This place is small and crowed. The food is OK, a little on the salty side. But service is outstanding. The owner really knows what good customer services are about. She is very friendly. As far as the foods concern, they are OK. The Tom Yum Goong (Thai Style Hot & Sour soup) is OK, so are the Eggplant and Pad Thai. Nothing special! Since it's in Sunset, parking is very difficult to find!
author: Joe C.

description: Love the food and the ambiance.  Its cramped the owner is yelling over the tables to her staff to bring more rice but these things add to the authenticity of this place.  The owner lady is awesome.  Line always out the door by 7p.  my favorite order here is their shrimp or basa fillet in garlic/black pepper sauce, corn cakes, and chan pad poo..menu decently priced.
author: Steph S.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants in SF.  The basil chicken wings are always good.  They are usually busy so if you do not mind the wait, this is the place to go.  But just like any other Asian restaurant, this place is small so if you do not mind the table next to you eavesdropping into your conversation and sometimes participating in it, then I highly recommend this place.
author: Patricia L.

description: Good, solid Thai food in the Sunset. The food is exquisitely prepared and presented. I'm deducting 1 star because they sometimes overdose on the salt.  This place has a pretty cute & intimate atmosphere.  The whole interior is covered in bamboo and for a while you can imagine yourself transported to a tropical island.
author: Edda S.

description: Best Thai food I've had in my life (outside of Thailand) - they have really good quality meat, which is something only a few Thai restaurants I've been to have. Would definitely come back again.
author: A I.

description:
the service is not at best, but the food are.
panang beef and silver noodle are always my favorite, although the rest are not disappointed either.
i still like go to the one on irving@23th rather than 9th@irving, although it's smaller, the food is better ( ithink..) and the parking is not as difficult as on 9th ave. i'm not sure if marnee herself still give you 'advice' as she used to..it's fun.
author: Suki S.

description: Marnee thai was one of the first restaraunts I ever came to in S.F. and it's one of the first places I take anyone visiting, it remains one of my favorite in the city. They have some of my favorite vegetarian selections in the city, the best corn cakes I've yet had and Marnee always has great suggestions, is zany to boot and cares alot about her customers. I much prefer eating there when she's present as some of the other servers can be kind of short, rude and overall confused---the four stars is because the last time they brought three wrong dishes to our table before getting it right.... but i've tried other thai places and always get the "it's good, but it's not marnee thai" syndrome, and then i go back....
author: Sarita K.

description:
I love the corn cakes and the cucumber salad. The corn cakes are bland, but crunchy to even out with the cucumber salad that is spicy. This is something that I always order when I go or even once for take out. 

I also like the mango salad and the soft crab salad. Those are both spicy and good. The other times I just eat whatever everyone else orders. The Basa fillet with fresh garlic and pepper sauce is good with rice. 

I've had the Rotti and thought it was a little too sweet for me. I think maybe because of the condensed milk they put on it. I love it.l
author: Jen C.

description:
After many months of wanting to try this place, I finally did last night after my friend and I discovered that the Blockbuster on Irving closed.  When a place is packed and there's still a few groups ahead of you on the wait, then you gotta assume the place is legit.

Luckily for us, we weren't starving so we were willing to wait.  After we sat down, it took them a little while to take our order, but I attribute that wait to attempting to seat a 13 person party.  Once they took our order, our food came out rather quickly.  The praram (chicken and vegetables in a peanut sauce) was very tasty, but then again, I always get that at any Thai restaurant and you can almost never go wrong.  Chicken would've been better if it was still a little juicier, but maybe it's just the way they cook the chicken for that dish.  It was also the first time I tried Thai iced tea, and it definitely didn't disappoint.  My friend said it's a good thing I tried it there because theirs is the best.

I am definitely looking forward to hitting up this place again.  Luckily for us, it was within walking distance from my friend's house so I was able to just park there and then we just walked.  But if you're driving, I recommend coming to this location instead of 9th if all you're gonna do is eat and not walk around because parking is a lot easier to find.
author: Joel J.

description: this place is great. I love the decorations on the walls and the fact that you feel like your eating in a hut in thailand or something. Everything is absolutely delicious..my favorite is the pad thai. The taste is just right not too saucey or anything. And get me a thai ice tea and im set. Ive been comming here for years ever since i learned how to cross the street lol =)
author: Sandy l.

description: I've been coming to this place since I was a little girl. The food remains unchanged in quality and everything taste delicious and authentic. Order anything on the menu! You won't be disappointed. It's a little crowded if you come for dinner. One time they placed my cousin's chair in the walkway because there was no seating. Solution: come for lunch
author: Tossama C.

description: the original marnee thai.  authentic as you could imagine .. even with a thai lady screaming at the top of her lungs for orders in the middle of the restuarant .. loll :)
author: Janice M.

description: The food overall was very good! Small venue, but very welcoming. Watch out if your friends bring you here for a birthday - the "celebration" involves gongs and the whole place singing to you!
author: Sarcastic T.

description: cockroaches crawling across the table - truly disgusting.  The waitress acted as though this was no big deal so I assume the kitchen is totally infested with roaches.  We didn't get to try the food because the cockroach crawled across the table before we could even order.  I hope the board of health pays a visit soon.
author: Lucy L.

description: Yum. This is the Thai restaurant I've been looking for. I loved the bacon/shrimp rolls, and the chef's suggestion chicken with basil.
author: Ellie P.

description: It's *so* cute and the food is amazing (try the beef salad or pad thai for out-of-this-world experiences). :)
author: David W.

description: I'm not generally a lover of Thai food. That said, this place is fantastic. I've gone there for many years, and it is consistently excellent. From their angel wings, to their red vegetable curry, and their soup and eggplant with beef, I have always come away wondering when I'll get to go back. I've taken friends from out of town and all have become regulars when in town.
author: Barbara S.

description: I think the best Thai Food I've ever tasted.  There was no wait at all and the service was fast and very attentive.  We had the Chicken Curry, Pineapple & Chicken Fried Rice & Pad Thai.....and dam it was so tasty and ummm ummm ummm.  This is the only place in the city I think I would go for Thai.  I HEART THIS PLACE!
author: Natacha M.

description: I love this thai restaurant because the authentic flavors (not fusion!) are in tact, the waiters are exceptionally super-friendly (and they look cute in their traditional thai dress!). I've finally found a place that has delicious Masaman (balanced spices & coconut milk) and their pad thai and fried rice (with chicken) are above par. Not too salty, sticky, or oily. Be advised that this is a tiny place with tables and chairs tightly close to one another...but that never really bothered me.
author: Audrey L.

description: This place is really different from any other Thai restaurants. It's not like King of Thai or any of those fast food chain restaurants. Marnee Thai is where they make some decent food which tastes super good!
author: Sarah O.
