description: Good food. The flavor could be kicked up a notch, but it's pretty good.
author: Joyce G.

description: Today marked my third visit to Marnee in the last three years or so.  Service was lacking (I remember this from previous visits).  We were very hyped up about a lunch menu-in my mind, the best reason to go for Thai lunch-soup, some sort of combo platter, feeling like I've sampled the best of the menu before I leave.  While there was a reduced price entree list, there are no combo lunch deals to be found.  I couldn't help feeling disappointed, although the very basic (boring to you, no doubt) choices that we made of pork with bamboo shoots (this is a description, not the name of the item) and pad thai were solid.  It's possible, from previous memories, that they may have gotten an extra star had I ordered the angel wings or fried bananas on this visit.
author: Beth V.

description: The best Thai food I've ever had in California! Very tiny restaurant, but it adds to the appeal.  Its always crowded so you know its good.  Best angel wings in town and their mango w/ sweet rice is always so fresh.
author: Michelle C.

description: MY favorite thai restaurant!!!! I went there three times with my friends! everytime i go there, i order their angel wings!! so delicious!! and their other food is good as well... great for sharing.. great service...
author: Lily T.

description: I love this place. My boyfriend and I come here at least twice a month. I took my friends and my family here as well and they enjoyed it. The decor is very cute and the staff is very friendly and accomodating. I always order the same thing and I never get sick of it - Pad Garlic Prawns! The prawn salad and tom yum soup is great as well! I've tried a few of the other dishes too and I'm never disappointed. We'll definitely be back soon!
author: Marla M.

description: I discovered this place purely by accident while exploring the Sunset District with an ex-gf of mine. And man, what a discovery it is. They don't take reservations so make sure to wear a jacket if you're hitting up this place in the evening. You'll shiver and quiver outside while you stare at the diners inside ooh'ing and ahh'ing over the goodies. But even frostbite wouldn't stop me to eat at this joint. Thumbs WAY up!!
author: John C.

description: Best Thai place in the Sunset and probably the oldest too. Cozy atmosphere, not for the clausphobic foodie.
author: Tina L.

description: Oh I love the angel wings, flavorful, tasty, just the right amount of spices, and tangy too.. just really a perfectly prepared appetizer. I have had many other items, I do like Pad Thai and they do that well. Been to both locations and I tend to like the smaller outer sunset location on Irving, seems cozier..
author: Jim W.

description: They make my favorite green curry ever. And the corn cakes are fantastic (but only order them if you are eating there). We live close, so we usually get take-out from Marnee, and it always takes longer than they say it will, but it's worth it.
author: Heather R.

description: get the CHAN PAD POO!! it was amazing, it's similar to Pad Thai for you all you Pad Thai lovers, but with a special spicy twist.  It is the same noodle but different twist to the sauce with soft crab cake meat.  I loved it and the service is awesome.  Waiters were extremely nice and coming by just to fill up our glasses without the need to ask for them to come by.  It is definitely a place to go if you want some good authentic thai  food.
author: Jacqueline H.

description: The angel wings are good. My gf devoured them! The pad thai was okay, but would definitely suggest Bangkok Garden's over there's. We had yellow curry which was good. The service was excellent and very prompt.
author: crystal e.

description: Awesome and authentic tasting Thai food.  I highly recommend the Basa fillet.  I haven't tried all of their dishes yet but I'm getting there.  Their food is also very well priced for what you get.  If you are in the mood for real good Thai food go here. To avoid crowds go during the week or make reservations.
author: Jaki B.

description: I love their spicy angel wings. One of the best I've ever tasted. There is a wait and the restaurant on 23rd is small, but it is worth the wait. The new one on 9th is pretty good too. But both areas do lack parking, which can be a turn off. But again, the food is worth it!
author: ann t.

description: I've travelled to Thailand purely for the food. And Marnee Thai is just as brilliant, if not better than, any thai food I've had in Thailand. It's certainly the best thai food I've had in the US. I've started trying to come here once a week because I'm slowly working my way through the specials menu. Everytime I eat here, the food is excellent. I've only had to wait for a table once out of the 8-9 times I've been here so far. I can't believe the Marnee Thai I visit is the same place some people are talking about in their bad reviews. I've never seen a slip in the standard of food, surroundings or service.  To those who say boo-hoo to Marnee Thai, I say, try it again, order the crab salad, chicken wings, and anyone of their curries, and then come and talk to me.
author: Shan M.

description: Oh man! Oh MAN! OOOOOH man! This Thai food is great! Their yellow curry is nice and thick. Its reasonably priced for the portions you get. And hey you're paying for some of the best thai food you'll probably ever try state side. We ordered take out but if you want to dine-in the are is very small but cozy. It was crowded when we showed up to pick up our food.
author: andre h.

description: We stood out in the cold for this place b/c it's so freakin' small inside.  Once seated, we sat by the door which wasn't fun that night, but the food made up for it.  My bf & I ordered the legendary angel wings, pad thai (we promised each other that we wouldn't order it at every thai place we go, but we always fail), and the basa filet w/ garlic & pepper.  Everything was yummers!  Although, the fish was a tad bit too salty / garlicy, but all we had to do was scrape a bit of it off the top.  Someone else here on yelp compared the angel wings to San Tung's dried fried chicken wings, and they were actually on point...
author: Christine O.

description: Yum Yum for  Tom Yum Soup! Yay this place rocks was there last night and had the beef salad delicious!!! Favorite Thai place in NorCAL 4sure!!!
author: michelle r.

description: Love the tom kai gai, imperial rolls, and pad se ew.  I've been going here for years and never tire of the excellent food, service, and cheap prices.
author: P-Rock F.

description: The angel wings are to DIE for. Sometimes they put too much sauce, but that is fun to have just to lick off your fingers. I like to put in take out orders just for the angel wings. That one dish could be my dinner for a week straight.
author: Mary L.

description: The Thai food here is awesome, after years of dining in subpar Thai restaurants "ahem" Thai King, this is surely a change of pace.  The pad thai here is awesome and the ambiance and the service. Highly Recommended
author: Michael R.

description: Thai Food is one of my favorite cuisines, and living in San Francisco I get the chance to go to many different Thai restaurants. However, I have never had better food and service than at Marnee Thai. Although it is relatively small, the food has HUGE taste. The owner is extremely friendly and when there often offers her suggestions of her favorites and what she thinks you will enjoy.  She has never let me down in any of her recommendations, everything is fresh and amazing.
author: Jen L.

description:
how can this be....?
i read where marnee thai was best in the sf weekly.
hum...i found the tom ka soup to be the telltale sign of 
a lack of integrity for a thai reasturant when you use button mushrooms as opposed to straw mushrooms which any asian
estabishment with any respect for it's customers would offer
in a popular dish, but to continue, the pad thai was okay, but hey
don't be afraid to be heavy handed with the peanuts! service...
well they were around and attentive, but i came for the food!!
i won't return!
author: h. w.

description: There are very few Thai places where everything on the menu is good. We have been several times now and there has not been a single item that we were not impressed by. The prices are very reasonable so you wont break the bank. Every Thai chef in the city should go to Marnee and take note. Good food is good food
author: andre w.

description: This is literally the best Thai food I've ever had in my life. I *highly* recommend the angel wings (I'm a vegetarian so I got them with tofu instead of meat) - they are out of this world. I also got the pad thai, which was excellent - not too heavy or greasy, as some places can make it. Very highly recommended!
author: Melanie C.

description:
This is easily the most overrated spot in the Sunset. It puzzles me why this place is always packed given the other options in the area.

My gripes:
Space sucks
Portions are small
Food unremarkable
Above average cost for Thai food
Service was average
Wait time for food was 35+ minutes during off peak time
author: Jason L.

description: Fantastic!  Nice service, great food and fabulous prices!  The place has the feel of a Thai hut and is clean and neat.  The sunset neighborhood is really quite quaint, too!
author: andrea n.

description:
one of the best thai places in san francisco.  i forgot what it was called but the pad thai dish with crab was really good.  they also have a noodle salad thing that is great too.  

the angel wings here are good. but i woulndt get anything sea food because of the portions.
author: David F.

description: The food is alright. Put enough sugar and oil on anything and it will taste O.K. As for the service... the female waitresses are conplete b1tches. Very sh1tty attitudes. They really make it rather unpleasant to dine there. The only dish I like is the Panang beef which I take to go!
author: diesel w.

description: I eat here about 15-20 times a year.  There are very few bad dishes.  If you like your food spicy, request it or else their spicy dishes aren't that spicy.  This place is crowded Friday and Saturday nights, but is only moderately busy otherwise.  If I'm staying in the Sunset, this is about the best Thai food.  I'll give it 5 stars, because I go here so frequently
author: Alan B.

description:
I heard so much about Marnee, so I had to try!

"Hello, welcome--how many?," bellowed the stout, fanatical, and welcoming hostess as we entered an environment surrounded in bamboo.  The waiters and waitresses, dressed in Thai attire, rapidly paced from the kitchen to the dining area again and again trying to keep up with their wild and deafening hostess's orders.  The restaurant must have an outstanding rep, for inside was packed and hectic.  Definitely, not for the claustrophobic.  After waiting for 15 minutes, we were finally seated, "Monk (mark), table for 2."  Once seated, we were moved later to another seating area to accommodate a bigger party.  After ordering, our food came out quite quickly.  "Babe, it's good, you like", stated our host.   We then devoured our spring rolls and two curries while watching for elbows and bodies.    "Babe, done-- good,"  whispered our hostess as she patted me on the back.  That was awkward  =P.  Afterward, we sat waiting for 15 minutes for our check.  Way to long!!

Overall -- The food was traditional and yummy!  Even though there was too much mint, I left satisfied.  Enjoyed the environment, but it was a little bit too tight.  The hostess and her staff were welcoming, busy, entertaining, and noisy.  Even though it took a while to be seated and to receive the check, I will definitely come back when I'm craving some thai.

Don't get intimidated by the crowd and leave you'll be chased by the hostess yelling  "Don't leave, we'll fit you.  I'll make space."
author: romeo b.

description: good Thai food but they have GOT to change that Thai music every now and then. every time I go here it's the same old song on a continous loop! kinda like fingernails to a chalkboard in my book! next time I put on the Nano earbuds to eat here.
author: Jeff W.

description: Best Thai food. Always a long wait though because of the tasty food. Still could bot find another place in the bay area that could beat this place.
author: Yuan C.

description: If you want to get a feel of what Thailand is like or just want to try out Thai food, Marnee Thai is the place to go to. The setting is very traditional and comfortable. Waiters and waitresses are also very polite. Pretty decent food at a reasonable cost.. Chan Pad Poo is definitely a "Must Order." Strings of crab meat is scatter within every bite into the Chan Pad Poo. If you are a garlic type of person, order "Basa Fillet - Fresh Garlic & Black Pepper Sauce." Simply delicious.
author: Janice M.

description: I love Thai food.  I frequent a Thai restaurant at least once per week.  One my first and last visit to Marnee Thai, it was a Saturday around 5:30PM.  Ordered 3 entrees + rice.  When my bowl of rice arrived, it was *cold* and hard - clear evidence it wasn't fresh, i.e. made that day/evening.  The waiter was not around, so I flagged the woman/owner and informed her the rice was cold & old.  Mind you, this was done politely.  Her response: "What's the matter, it's good enough for you."  She did not offer a new bowl of rice.  We waited for all of the entrees to arrive, asked for take out boxes, packed it up and settled the bill.   Obviously, no tip was left on the table.  From the posts, she is still rude and obnoxious.
author: Joe R.

description: The fact that anyone could give this above 2 stars is rather astounding & shows that those reviewers have not had much in the way of Thai food. I have been eating Thai for at least 17 years & have been to over 200 Thai restaurants, so I have a lot to compare to & this place was pretty bad. Lemme start by stating that the taste of the food was good, average, but good...it was the service that was really odd & that made it so I'd never return. Firstly, they seemed to have just learned how to wait on people as they hadn't a clue what they were doing. They were awkward and would laugh at odd moments. Brought our appetizer last and what they brought first was something we didn't order. Had to ask twice for my beverage. Entrees came right before our appetizer and the whole process just to get everything we ordered was around 45min. The restaurant itself smelled like wet dog. I think it was the smell of all the material they used to create their faux hut which didn't go well with a food place. Basically it attempted to cover up for the fact that this is a total hole in the wall.
author: Unicorn U.

description: Second best Thai food I've found in the city, with Sai Jai Thai being #1. The inner sunset location is a good place  to stop for lunch after wandering around the botanical gardens in Golden Gate Park.
author: Chris S.

description:
I WILL NEVER EAT HERE AGAIN. This was my second visit here because the 1st time the food was pretty good. This time my friend and I, who are both Asians, went in and sat down at a table, we were given our menus and after we waved to the male waiter that we were ready to order. He nod his head and than proceed to bypass us to take the order of a different table of a different ethnicity. Fine, after finishing taking their order, he proceed to bypass us again, to take the order of another a table, of the same ethnicity (different from us), but they had just came in and didn't even look at their menu yet. My usually good nature friend, wordlessly, got up and walk out of the restaurant. It just felt so rude to be blatantly discriminated because of your ethnicity. All we wanted was some service and food and look what we got. Thank you for letting me rant and getting this out of my system fellow yelpers.=)
Note: Go to Chabaa which is across the street. Not as crowded and way better service.
author: Erica B.

description: The thai food here is pretty good, not the best, but it's very clean and the wait staff is very curteous.  I like it because it's pretty easy to find street parking, something I definitely consider when choosing a place to dine in SF.
author: Chris Y.

description: Best Thai food I've had in the bay area.  Restaurant is small and seating is sometimes uncomfortable but the decor is festive.  The service is attentive and the food is consistent in flavor.  Most Thai places are dives but this place is date worthy.  Their pad thai is really good, as is the pad ma keur with shrimp.  The rice is served in these big cheap silver urns...kind of silly since they take up so much space on the table.  This is not the best place for take out...for some reason, the quality (and quantity) of the food suffers during the take out process.
author: happy t.

description:
i like the food...it's good....

i liked the crazy woman telling me that i should eat more vegetables (she's right)...

i liked the crazy woman telling me that i looked like a really good match for my date (she was wrong)....

i don't like the tables being really close together (especially when i'm getting into a fight with my significant other...THAT was awkward!)....

i like the OG marnee thai the best, but the one on 9th will do...

i agree with that other yelper in her observation of the hatred of lesbians exhibited by the waitress there....do you know what is even worse?  they hate lesbian piggies such as myself....so when i go there, i take kermit with me, and we pretend that we are hetero, albeit transpecies heteros....that way, i get an extra piece of spicy angel wing...yummy!
author: Miss P.

description: The food is excellent. They are quick with take out orders and always deliver quality. I have to bump it down one star because the employees have been rude to me on several occasions. Great food but not all that friendly at times.
author: Juliana S.

description:
generally a good spot. service was a lil slow and the place a lil small. 

DO NOT leave this place without trying the Spicy Angel Wings appetizer.
OMG...the BEST  thing ever! its a lil messy but definitely worth it!


the fried banana i would definitely skip. so not cool. :-/
author: Bee B.

description: Three words, Spicy Angel Wings. The best I've ever had. Since, my mom is from Thailand, of course, I needed a native to be the judge of true, authentic thai cuisine. And she loved it. I have friends who think that they know great thai cuisine. Sorry. You need to go to Thailand and try everything. Then, you will understand the complexities of each dish. I would give it a 5 stars if the restaurant was larger and parking more accessible. Marnee Thai is, above all, my favorite Thai restaurant.
author: Sharon J.

description: 3.5 stars? Great food, good prices. They really cram the customers in, though--it's pretty uncomfortable, and it gets pretty noisy. Also, the "round lady" everyone mentions is LOUD...the shouting kind of detracts from the joy of eating (let alone trying to converse with your company). Not a date place.
author: Ramon E.

description: Get something to drink with those angel wings! They are yummy but come with a bit of a sting! A good sting. My curry was underwhelming but I was happy with it overall. Leave room for the mango sticky rice. Service was good... it's a bit loud and cramped in there but the food offsets that. Reservations recommended, unless standing in the foggy cold appeals to you.
author: Patricia M.

description: This is where I come when I'm craving thai food and it's not around midnight (cause that's when I go to King of Thai). What do I order? Angel Wings, Pad Kee Mao, Tom Yum Soup, and whatever color curry I'm in the mood for. They've got the vegetarian option if that's what you need, or, you know, meat if you want that. It's not a very big place, I only ever come with a few people.  Pretty much every dish on the menu is full of flavor and spice.
author: Tiff L.

description:
The food was good. Although the curry was a little too salty. I had no problem with the food, but I did have a problem with the service. 

I understand that their restaurant is tiny, but I don't understand why my girlfriend and I were seated at a 4 seater table with another couple when there were 2 seater tables readily available. The place is really cramped, so I don't recommend going there on a date. People kept bumping into us as they walked by. 

The waiters were ok. You have to raise your hand to order, or else you'll never get your order put in. No problems with them, however that one lady manager/waiter..............Christ was she annoying and disrespectful. As we were about to give her our order, another customer walks through the door and she wanders off to greet them. It was unbelievable. She's also oblivious to her surroundings. As she was wiping down the table next to ours, she kept flinging water at us. If you go to this establishment, try going when she's not there.
author: Jason C.

description:
quick service, and really delicious food.. would definitely go there again.. only problem was the waiters kept getting confused abt which table the food should be served at. Hehe. a server came by with a dish and we said no we ordered something else.. ok sorry.. no problem.. they got the food we started eating (2 of us - so 2 entrees) and then halfway thru meal another dish comes by... lol.. i couldnt help but think to my self.... maybe they think we are gluttons lol.. 2 entrees apparently not enuf for 2 ppl.. we needed a third one. 
but nonetheless.. really really good food and i would go there again..
author: Aditi M.

description: This has been our favorite restaurant in the City, eat in or take out, for years. We start with Angel Chicken Wings and follow it with green curry with prawns, pork with spicy green beans, Pad Thai and a couple of Singhas. Makes me hungry just thinking about it. We've tried other dishes and have never been disappointed but always return for our favorites. Recently we have added a dessert, sticky rice with mango--delicious. Our son, now 30 and in New York City, grew up on this food and it's his first choice for dining when he comes to town. We have retired and moved to Pt. Reyes but always look forward to eating at Marnee's when we return to SF. Yes, the boss runs a tight ship but it guarantees attentive service and consistently excellent food. And yes, the place is tightly packed and sometimes you have to wait--a small price to pay for a delicious meal.
author: Doug H.

description:
I really would say the food is 4 stars. Everything is pretty good. Love the duck curry, samosas, pad see ew, etc. However, the service..is two stars, so I rounded up and gave it 3 stars. The rest of the staff is ok, but really the plump lady (that I'm pretty sure is the owner) is yelling in Thai across the restaurant the whole time, to the kitchen, to the staff, to the customers. Ok in English to the customers. Where to start...
There's always a wait for this place, so yesterday, my friend had enough foresight to make reservations. She arrived at 7:05 for the 7:00 reservations, and because we were missing 3 out 5 of the party (circling for parking b/c parking is a b*tch), the owner lady gave our table away. The other half our party arrived a minute later after my friend watched her give our table away. So we wait 20 minutes...
Then we get seated. After a few minutes owner lady comes to take our order. She asks,"What would you like?" Someone at the table opens his mouth about to spit out our order, when she turns away and starts yelling in Thai to the other staff, starts yelling to the other customers where to sit, etc. This happens 3 times or so during the course of ordering. Can you spend the 1 minute to take our order without interruptions?! This happened last time I ate here too. That's just rude. Yelling every time we're about to tell you our order. BAD SERVICE.
After we order, about 2 minutes later, owner lady wants to move us to a different table. After we've ordered, had our water, and settled in. She moves us to make space for a party of seven, and shoves us into a tiny table next to the wall, meant for 4. I'm at the "head" of the table, and the whole meal, the wait staff and the PLUMP lady, who really shouldn't squeeze between that tiny space, keep pushing past the back of chair to get through. AWFUL.
Service wasn't always this bad. I used to come here with my parents all the time and never noticed the bad service...Food is good, but how much bad service are you willing to put with?
author: Jessie C.

description: I've given their Thai food multiple chances, but has failed me every time. I once ordered their beef salad to-go & it was luke warm beef on a wilted salad. I couldn't make it past the second bite & had to throw it away. A couple days ago I went a bit more traditional ordering one of their signature soups, a side of brown rice & cucumber salad. When I went for my second helping of rice, I found a pubic hair in my rice, which turned me off completely. Maybe it was just this location, but I don't think I'll ever order from this place again.
author: jennifer b.

description: OMG! You have to try the drunken noodles at Marnee. They are rice noodles that are thick and sticky. I tried to make them at home by asking their staff to give me the secret recipe ;)
author: Joy J.

description: My favorite Thai restaurant...everything from their drinks to noodles to entrees are so good.  I recommend the spicy squid, corn pancakes, pad see ew, iced tea and pad thai.  Love this place.
author: Stephanie L.

description: For all the hype this place gets, we expected better Thai food. Don't get me wrong, the food wasn't bad, it just wasn't that great. We have had better tasting Thai food at lesser known places. The service was ok.
author: Joe M.

description: Be prepared to sit close to other tables and not order anything from the menu because when the owner takes your order, she may suggest entirely different plates for you and your group (so don't ask me what we ordered...but everything was great). She may also tell you that she "added more food" to the plate because you need to "eat more." So if you don't mind chatting with the owner, hearing her scream back to the cooks, this is a lively place to go. The decor is festive as well.
author: Janel Y.

description: One of my favorite thai places anywhere.  Expect to wait for a table if you come at peak dining times.  Great to take out-of-town visitors.  Even though I don't think pad see eew is on the dinner menu, you can make a special request for it and they do a great job.  Delicious!!
author: RonAnderson ..

description: The food is authentic and delicious, the menu has more of a variety than the typical pad thai, curry, fried rice routine.  The service is friendly and the thai hut style decor brought me back to Thailand...in fact, the food at Marnee Thai is just as good!
author: Debbie Y.

description: Not the best Thai food I've had in the city, but for this neighborhood, it's a great dining destination with friendly service.
author: Scott M.

description:
When we crave Thai we go here.  Our friend had taken me and my husband here before we moved to SF and I remember eating my entire meal of roasted duck on top of sauteed spinach for lunch.  Before then I didn't even order anything outside of beef fried rice in thai restaurants.

Four years after my first visit to Marnee Thai, we ended up living in the neighborhood and glad we found our favorite Thai restaurant again.
author: Mona B.

description: Although the food quality is good and the ambiance is quaint, I choose not to eat here as much anymore because their service has declined greatly. Their take out orders are never on time and they are downright rude.  If I'm paying money for a meal, I shouldn't be treated like some indentured servant or have to walk out of the restaurant feeling belittled. Sadly, I've heard from more than a few others that it's happened to them as well.
author: Mashimaro M.

description: I love coming to marnee thai. The food is just awesome. I love the pad thai because thats all i order from thai places. Its not too dry like some of the thai places i've ate at.
author: Patrick T.

description: I've been here once and the service and food was amazing! I came here with my friend and we tried the spicy angle wings, which were amazing. I've never tasted anything like them before.
author: Paula G.

description: The food here is good but the service was a disappointment.  I had a table for 3 and they refused to seat us without the third person.  There were empty tables and they still would not seat us.  It wasn't like it was a busy night either. One of the waitresses kept asking us if our third party was arriving.  That is usually fine with me but we already knew what we wanted to order and we were starving!   We wanted to order so that when our friend arrived the food would already be on the table but no would not seat us.  I was disappointed!!
author: Catherine S.

description:
good food...space sucks....i got elbowed in the head by some fat lady....

it gets stuffy, HOT and loud in there too! I just wanted to scream! yeah it gets that busy....i'll be back, but not with a group of people.
author: Rosalynn D.

description: Marnee's is one of my favorite Thai spots.  Inside, it's quite small and dim, with the walls and ceiling made of fake(?) bamboo.  Spicy catfish is good, pad se-ew is good, dessert is good..  Hard to name something that is not good here. The service is always attentive here too. I would not go here with more than 6 people though.  Maybe the 9th street location is bigger?  Never been there..
author: Fotos C.

description: Must get wings.  Food is very good, experience enjoyable.  Owner very fun.  A bit loud when it's full, but if traveling to San Fran gotta hit this joint.  I always make a stop there for dinner when in town.
author: Robert F.

description: Just reviewed their sister store on 9th nearby. Pretty much the same quality. Very good food, decent service, excellent price. Again this place is quite tight and large parties aren't recommended otherwise you'll probably be pretty uncomfortably packed. For new Thai enthusiast try the pad Thai, papaya salad, shredded beef, and any of the curry!
author: Dang L.

description: The wait can be long, but it's more than worth it.  Perhaps the best Thai food I've had in the Bay Area.  The owner has great spirit and contributes to the festive atmosphere of the place.  Highly recommended.
author: Alex Y.

description: Great food.  Tiki hut decor.  What more could you ask?  A loud middle-aged waitress who gives unsolicited medical advice, you say?  Well you're in luck, friend.
author: Igor N.

description: The food here is consistently fabulous.  The crab noodles will make your eyes roll in the back of your head . . .ask for them spicey.  The decor is cool - especially on a gloomy day - the fresh orchids and warm bamboo wall coverings will make you feel all toasty and tropical inside.
author: Valerie D.

description: Probably the best thai food I have ever had not that I have tried many.  The  best thing was the spicy silver wings it is garlicy and spicy.  The Curry egg noodles were good too.
author: Stevezee C.

description:
Maybe its me but I can't give this place 4 or 5 stars like everyone else here. Perhaps I have a different preference of how Thai food should taste. This seems to cater to the mild tongues and those that are not used to the shrimp paste and fish sauces. 

When we got to the restaurant, the first thing I noticed were the straw thatched walls..interesting hut-like environment. At the time we came in, there weren't too many people but I do suggest that you make reservations if you come around 7 or so (thats when it gets really busy)

For appetizers, we had corn cake because it looked so good at the other table. It was tasty like E&O but the batter was not as crispy. I did like the cucumber salad that was served with it. Yum. We had chicken larb salad which didn't really taste that great. It was salty, as if they put in a crushed chicken bouillon cube in there. I haven't come across a really good larb in the bay area. Moving on... We had Mussamun Curry Beef that was nice and smooth. The meats were pretty chunky along with the potatoes. I would order this dish again. Pad woonsen with pork was ok. The silver noodles was good but the rest of the ingredients didn't seem to impress me since the flavor was all soaked up in the noodles. I can't remember the last dish but it was a spicy shrimp dish that wasn't spicy even though we wanted this to be more medium. All of our dishes other than the shrimp dish were supposed to be mild but they weren't even spiced as far as I could taste. I don't know if I would come here again since the food was not really a stand out for me.

I do however think that service was great and they are good at refilling water. Its a quaint little place and if you're a first timer in trying thai food, then this is the place. If you've graduated to a higher level of spice and more exotic flavors, you might want to look elsewhere. The price could be cheaper considering the area. There's places in the southbay that I enjoy going to that are tastier with the same price point. Sad to say.. I'm not interested in putting this in my places to go list.
author: Luna L.

description:
what can i say about tis awesome little spot that hasan't already been said? honestly when i just want traditional thai cuisine and whithout all the fluff (e.g. osha/citizen/koh samui) i come here. the food is still amazing after all these years. Marnee will always be one of my first choices if i'm around the irving street area.

P.S. dont forget to order the mango sticky rice ;)
author: Timothy W.

description: I came here several times after my last post.  The service really really declined.  I am so disappointed with Marnee Thai.  We felt rushed several times.  Before we finished eating, they asked if we were finished, packed our food, did not ask if we wanted dessert, then dropped the bill on us.  Twice we ordered dessert, only to have it be forgotten.
author: Carrie-C N.

description: The best thai food in the bay area I've had - Angel Chicken wings are a must have from this place - because it puts everyone else's attempt to shame - I know why this place is constantly receiving accolades - all of the thai curries are tasty (even when they're not spicy - which is really hard...) - by and far the best thai food in the bay - and consistently the best!
author: Andrew T.

description: I came here with my boyfriend for lunch. The restaurant looked pretty full considering it was late afternoon. We ordered quickly because we were hungry. It took them over 15 minutes to bring us the food. The food was a little too saucy for our taste. It was nice that they packed our leftovers into boxes for us afterwards. We were content with the meal. The problem came when we were trying to pay. First off, it took them forever to swipe my card. Then, they ended up swiping my card for someone else's bill. There was a mass chaos trying to fix the problem which took half an hour. This was a very bad experience. I don't know if I will be coming back.
author: Christine L.

description: Food was good, but a bit over-priced due to all the hype.  Don't think I'll be back.  I'm betting there's a more reasonably priced Thai joint in the city that's just as good...my search continues...
author: Craig Y.

description: The food is ok.  What was exceptional was the roast duck fried rice.  Ambience is nice for a date but everything else was average.
author: Mike J.

description: As a vegetarian, it is hard to find good Thai food that does not taste "fishy."  I really enjoyed this restaurant because you can specify that you do not want any fish products in the food, and there was no fishy taste.  We ordered the vegetarian tom yum soup, vegetarian pad thai, and vegetarian pad se-ew.  ALL were delicious!  It was very crowded on the evening that we went, and I was impressed with the speed and efficiency with how parties were seated and served.  One of the things that makes me knock it down one star is that the tables are SO close together, and we were literally up in our neighbor's conversation!  But, overall a good experience, and we would go back.
author: K M.

description: I enjoyed eating at this restaurant.  The food was awesome and the service was wonderful.  You mustttt eat here! I loved the mango salad, woot woot!
author: Jacqueline D.

description: went back again last week for the first time in 10 years...  as delicious as elton john is gay.
author: richard s.

description: Marnee Thai has an awesome setting with bamboo walls and ceiling, which makes you feel like you have been transported in Thailand. The food is delicate but flavorful at the same time. If you go on a weekend try the Satay Wraps: a heavenly combination of different flavors/items that you can roll yourself. An advice: the wrapping procedure will give you enough time to understand when you are full without having to stuff yourself. Very nice food presentation that makes you feel at a gourmet restaurant. Fortunately then the bill is not as expensive as at gourmet restaurants at all;) One star less because the fried noodles that my bf ordered had a fishy smell, but maybe it was supposed to be like that...
author: Laura C.

description: solid thai food. good service. cute decor.
author: Jane C.

description: Great Food. Be prepared to drive all around for parking & waiting for your table.
author: cynthia l.

description:
So, after loyally sticking with Marnee Thai on 9th Ave, I finally ventured across 19th Ave to try the M.T. at Irving and 23rd. T and I finally settled the age-old dispute of Which Marnee Came First by asking our waitress. The answer, all ye seekers of the light of truth, is that the Irving Marnee came first. 
The atmosphere is more intimate than the 9th ave Marnee, with cool woven mat walls and roof and fresh orchids all over the place. At one point it seemed a little too intimate, with our neighbors nearly on top of us, but we were almost done at that point so no big deal. The food was very good, we tried a new spicy seafood dish that was just ok, but the beef with green beens and the praram pak were most excellent. As with the other Marnee, the service was average. 
Trying the Marnee on Irving is a great way to try to get over your fear of the sunset while retaining the comfort of something you know, like Marnee's green curry.
author: Kathleen B.

description: Not that I'm on Irving St that often, but passing Marnee Thai the other day reminded me of how delicious their food was the last time I ate there.  We had an early dinner (so no wait!) marked by  excellent service and amazing food.  Highly recommended!
author: Stacy L.

description:
This place has good food, but its very crowded. I was bumped by the waiters throughout the whole meal. Also this t-rex looking waitress bullied my table into ordering things that we didn't want to get, which werent even that good. We let her bully us since the last time i went, we didn't order anything she suggested and ended up getting horrible service. The food is good, service is decent. They were very good about refilling waters. I'd recommend going, but its hard to not get pushed into order certain dishes since the lady basically thinks ur ordering it once she mentions it. Seriously she was annoying, some may consider that good service, but i think its just annoying. If you want to eat food from this place, you must sit and order. There were people who called in and went to pick up the food and still waited for like an hour. I saw 2 customers complaining about having to wait for an hour their even though they already called half an hour before arriving. 

Overall, I think the place is pricy, but you do get good food. Service has its + and -'s. Its worth going there to form your own opinion about the place cause i can see how people's opinions differ at this place.
author: Jay L.

description: The only reason that I am not giving this restaurant 5 stars is that it can seem a little cramped.  But other than that, everything is fantastic.  The food is amazing!   I went to a dinner with about 8 relatives and they ordered items I would never venture to try.... because they were on the table I did.  WOW!  Everything was amazing.  My favorites are the cucumber salad, the spring rolls, and the yellow curry.  YUM.  Also, there is a woman who works there, who is a hoot.  She tells you what she thinks you can order.  A little pushy but take it in stride.  And the other servers are extremely nice.  Just a great little hidden gem in the Sunset.
author: Alexis J.

description: A cute little restaurant.  I had the chicken pad se-ew and mussamun chicken curry.  The pad se-ew was really tasty.  I've had it at other Thai restaurants, but nothing competes with Marnee.  Tasty noodles and it has that just-cooked taste.  I don't know how to describe it, but it's tasty!  The mussamun chicken curry was good as well.  It wasn't as sweet as some of the other Thai curry's I've had.  The food came pretty fast and I had it with a cup of hot Thai tea.  I'm going back to try more dishes.
author: Margarita M.

description: I would give this place more stars for the actual taste of the food, the curry is really good but a little small. It is getting two stars for the service. Our server kept yelling across the restraunt everytime she came to our table and didnt even bring us water or refill the hot tea once. The worst service I have had in awhile. She yelled right in my ear when she came to grab the bill, I almost got up and put her in a headlock, good thing I was getting over a cold. I might go back, we will see.
author: spencer k.

description: The best thai restaurant i've been to! The place is small and homelike, a good place for small parties. More than 4 or 5 and it'll be quite cramp and uncomfortable. The food is excellent! I loved all the dishes i've had there. You must try the spicy angel wings and the panang beef, just a few of the dishes i like here. service is pretty good as well.
author: Daniel C.

description: This place is one of my secret weapons to take out-of-town guests to.  It's out in the sunset, so very few downtown hotels will recommend it.  As a resident, it's easy to drive visitors out to the sunset and blow their minds.
author: Matthew G.

description: Woohoo is right! We love this place and have tried a lot of things from the Angel Wings to the avocado salad. The somosa is very under-rated and a must try. Nicely fried with the sweet and sour sauce to dip it in. The Beef salad is great, my wife says it's too salty. Blah, Blah blah Charlie Brown I think it's great. The Juices off the beef adds a little more zing to the dressing on the rest of the greens. For a little extra kick they have this great hot pepper sauce mix with chopped peppers readily available on the table for you to enjoy or over indulge. The owner, who's a lovely lady shouted across the restaurant as she saw me pouring her pepper concoction onto my plate saying, "not spicy enough?!" I shook my head and said "nope". Try it, it's especially great with the BBQ chicken and love the Panang Beef. The dessert is also done right but we fill up so much on apps and mains we often miss the Mango Sticky Rice or Fried banana. Great first date place but please go easy on the peppers if that's the case.
author: graham c.

description: just ate there last week and loved everything we ordered.. from the phad thai, to the angel wings, to the crab salad... everything we ordered was GOOD! i definitely hit up the spot again..
author: Mark K.

description: Love Love Love this place.  I've never ordered anything here that I didn't like.  When people ask for recommendations, I say everything.  eat it all.  my fav dishes are duck fried rice, yellow curry, and all their appetizers.
author: rosalyn m.

description:
hands down, some of the best thai food i've ever had.  i've eaten at both restaurants and have always had the best food.  i pretty much always order the chan pad poo- spicy garlic noodles with crab meat, eggs, and jalapenos- and it is freakin' amazing!  i've also tried the pad thai and yellow and green chicken curry and it's all really good.  

i like the atmosphere in the restaurant and the place is almost always packed.  i always take out-of-town guests to eat at Marnee Thai and they always think it's incredible.  love it!!
author: Jen V.

description: Last night I was there with my girl friend... Very dissapointing... The only positive was the friendly server...
author: Tjay a.

description:
small location...great decor....big flavors!
angel wings is a must.  

to be honest i'm not big on thai food, but i'd go here just for the wings.  

http://marneethaisf.com/index.html
author: Craig I.

description: After reading some good reviews of this place, I thought that I would try it out. It actually was one of the worst Thai food eating experiences I have ever had. I got my papaya salad mild and my pad thai extrememly spicy. I have never had pad thai spicy before. Since moving from Boston to San Diego, and now to here, I have struggled to find a favorite, mouth-watering Thai restaurant. Boston's Brown Sugar Cafe is THE BEST Thai food I have ever tasted. I love the west coast, but my taste buds are disappointed. I won't give up though. I am determined to find Brown Sugar's equal!
author: Keely G.

description: I really enjoy going to Marnee Thai on a random weekday. Generally it is less crowded than on a Friday. I thought that it was crazy that it looks like a hut on the inside but to be honest it really does make up for the fact that seating area is tiny and the the service might not be the best. The food itself is great. The owners of Marnee Thai wanted to charge more they wanted to. They have the best pad thai and tom ka that I have tasted anywhere else in the city.
author: Nicole T.

description: This place would be a great place to bring a someone for a date, except i went with 2 guys ahaha. Ok, the food is pretty good and the place is has a very nice atmosphere. Prices are a little high but all-in-all a nice place to eat.
author: Pat T.

description: I'm a fan of this place, especially the Irving street location. The staff is alway welcoming and friendly, and I always leave the place satisfied and my taste buds appeased.
author: Maria C.

description:
yuuummmmmmmmmy!!!

i hadn't had thai food in such a long time and marnee's totally hit the spot. super affordable and soo tasty. my friend and i shared both the avocado salad and pad thai with tofu.

avocado salad was seriously, amazing.  it's chunks of avocado with shredded green mango, shallots, prawns and then is topped with toasted coconut. the dressing used was spicy but in the most perfect way..i'm not a huge fan of spicy things but this was honestly to-die-for. 

the pad thai was also very good and had lots of veggies, mmm. service was also great. will definitely be back.
author: Tess B.

description: I love their beef salad! This particular one has the perfect blend of mint, lime juice and a touch of rice powder which explodes with flavor! Not to mention the tender slices of beef! The best ever!
author: Lillian C.

description: Best Thai food I've had in SF, and that's saying a lot because I've tried many Thai places around here.  The food is outstanding and the prices are reasonable.  Service is great.  I highly recommend this place for anyone who likes Thai food.  Good for dates, friends and family.
author: Daniel B.

description: The food is great, especially the curry dishes. They offer gluten-soy protein as an alternative to meat which I love. The ambiance and service is a little lacking, but if you like a casual place to enjoy a really good meal, Marnee Thai is a must.
author: Roger D.

description: This place was average. The interior is small and cozy, decked out in dim candle-lit setting. The curries were thin and a little tasteless. Their noodle dish (I forgot which one) was pretty good though. Their portions are kind of small though. I'd pick King of Thai over Marnee Thai any day though. King of Thai = better tasting food + cheap prices.
author: Bridge H.

description:
first time i went on a weekend night i swear the food was heaven

next few times i went was on weekday daytime. the food was sucky and cold and stale tasting

but what makes me give this place two stars is there is a female server there who is a beeyotch. giving everyone attitude and overall being a type of person that once you come in contact with somehow makes your day sucky.

im never come back here

BEEYOTCH
author: Edward S.

description: When you sit down, it looks like you're in an island hut in Thailand. So scrumptious and fresh. This place has the best Thai food I've ever had . . .enough said.
author: Amber P.

description: I finally got to try this place after MANY years of hearing about it from our friends.  Being Thai, I know the difference between authentic Thai food and Americanized Thai food.  I must say this is a good blending of the two.  We thoroughly enjoyed the Spicy Angel Wings and the Corn Cake appetizers.  The Pad Thai was very good - one of the best I've tasted.  For dessert, I ordered the Coconut Ice Cream, but didn't have much because my friends ate most of it!  What little I tasted was really yummy.  Overall, a MUST if you are in San Francisco and craving for Thai food.  However, be warned that they are super busy and the place is TINY.  If you're patient, you'll be well rewarded.
author: Linda C.

description: We were there on the early side for dinner, around 5:30, so we were seated immediately. It soon got packed. Everything we ordered was excellent. Will be making a trip back soon!
author: Scott B.

description: We love this place.  My husband always gets the wings.  It is always delicious.  We go too often for our waistlines but love it so much.
author: jennifer j.

description: I happen to be allergic to MSG.  I had the Barbecue five spice chicken.  I couldn't sleep at all after eating this chicken, so, there could've been a lot of MSG or perhaps other seasonings that didn't agree with me.  The chicken had a plastic texture and was not moist.  For $10.95 I do not recommend this dish.  It was way over priced and the only pieces were a couple wings and a couple of thighs that were hard and tasted terrible.  Plus, the sodium was high.  The pad thai was just okay, nothing special.  I've eaten pad thai at other restaurants and the prawns were fatter and tastier.  Very dissappointed and will never go there again.
author: Jerry H.

description: Pad thai and pad see-ew were really good. The customer service is nice, the owner is actually the lady taking orders. The interior feels like the inside of a bamboo hut. Prices for dishes are around $10 and the portions are pretty big.
author: Retired B.

description:
I'd give it 5 stars if I could only eat there when the owner is not there. She gives me anxiety attacks. She SCREAMS at her employees from the middle of the crowded dining room, which makes me really uncomfortable. If you have issues with your employees, please deal with them out of the sight and hearing range of the customers. Also, she drives me nuts by giving me medical advice EVERY SINGLE TIME she waits on me. Drink hot tea, no ice. Hey, you're not a freaking doctor and I don't want to talk about my medical problems at dinner.

But apart from that, I adore the food. I love the chan pad poo, which is this wonderful dish of pad thai noodles, crab, egg and jalapenos and you can't get this dish anywhere else. I love the tom kha and the tom yum soups. Just the right mix of spicy and coconuty/sour and lots of veggies. They make the best chicken satay I know of. Silver noodles, barbeque chicken, fried fish, garlic spinach... they're all so good! Why can't they fit a big group of people in here so I had enough people to order all the great dishes at once??
And the curries, how do I love thee? Yellow, red, and particularly the pumpkin squash curry which is like a mix of red curry and peanut sauce. By the way, the pumpkin curry isn't on the menu, but they'll make it for you if you order it. The pumpkin curry is my favorite. 
And although I can never save room for desert, if you have more discipline than I, GET THE MANGO AND STICKY RICE. It's amazing.
author: Melly B.

description:
Best Thai food ever.  Service is friendly.  Order the chilean Seabass, the chicken wings  and the roast duck.  Cannot go wrong.

Place gets super crowded on the weekends so go early
author: kenny l.

description:
UPDATE: This place still sucks!!!

So I've been coming to this place for years but after last night I will never come here again. THE SERVICE WAS AWFUL. I DO NOT RECOMMEND coming to this place. There are tons of of other Thai places in SF that have good food AND great service. They have officially lost my businesss.
author: R G.

description: The pumkin green curry is the best I've ever tasted. Delicious!!
author: Shelly B.

description: My favorite Thai place in SF.  I always get pad see ew, and fortunately they always serve it to me.
author: Ryan L.

description: I love marnee thai. My absolute favorite thai restaurant in the world. The interior  is nice and clean. The food is delicious. I cannot speak for the service because i have only gotten takeout from this location but i am sure it is also wonderful. Too bad they were not open on christmas day or any other major holiday but that is understandable. They need a break too.
author: KC F.

description:
HAhahahaha!

I like how the lady below who states she "is the waitress who served you", is updating a TOTALLY. SLIPPED. IN. review.

She's never been disappointed.... and the service is great too. 5 stars!
author: Amelia S.

description: How does this not have 5 stars one yelp? It is the best Thai food I have ever eaten. Me and my husband and our roomate went there to eat recently. We all had something different and shared. I usually always get whatever seafood combo is on the menu and theirs was simply to die for. It was just the right amount of spicy and yum. My husband and roomates dishes were super yummy too. Also the server, this lady named May I believe made the whole experience incredible, hands down the best server I have ever had at a restaurant period. If you want a great, inexpensive dining experience definately go to Marnee. At the end I ordered the Roti with ice cream. OMG it was soooo delicious we all had a little fork battle trying to eat it (and my roomate doesn't even like sweets!)
author: Brittani H.

description: Marnee Thai is not only the best Thai food in San Francisico, it is the best Thai food I have had ANYWHERE. I first tried Marnee when I was living in the neighborhood a few years ago. Now I'm living out of state and insist on going there every time I visit SF! Marnee herself is always there with a fantastic recommendation-- listen to her! The spicey tofu angels, pad thai and chicken pra ram are all outstanding, but really, everything is. Don't miss it!
author: Danielle F.

description:
We went odd hours.  The food was good.  We got fish cakes, Tom Yum soup, Pad thai and chicken dish.  
Service was adequate.
I do say that their other location has better service and better atmosphere.
author: Miinno N.

description: This is my go to spot for Thai food take-out.  I recommend the Spicy Angel Wings appetizer and for a main course I usually go for the Pad See-Ew.
author: Jeremiah A.

description: This restaurant use to be the best. We several dishes including  the pad thai and the mango fried rice. The mango fried rice was fabulous, the other dishes were mediocre and the pad thai was the strangest I ever had. (I have had a lot of pad thai) They use ketchup. yuck!
author: tami F.

description:
LOVE it.  I now live conveniently around the corner and it is undoubtedly the best restaurant in my hood.

-Yummy Papaya Salad & Avocado Salad
-Yummy Pad Thai
-Mmmm Pumpkin Curry
-Mmmmasaman Curry

Marnee is head hostess and she will take very good care of you....Just be prepared to share a table with strangers or at least get cozy.
author: Goldie S.

description: After having lived in Thailand for three years, I've been back in the Bay Area needing my fix of Thai food now and again. I've given up on most other places for lack of quality or authenticity, but Marnee Thai consistently offers both. Everything I've tried here has been delicious and true to Thai traditional cuisine. My only complaint is that the degree of spiciness has been toned down for the Western palate. Even when I speak to them in Thai and ask for it phet mak (very spicy), the food comes with only a tease of heat. Still only worth half a star of demerit. It's a tight pack in the restaurant and also a bit chaotic, but this doesn't bother me. Overall an excellent restaurant which I would highly recommend.
author: Joshua H.

description:
We dubbed the cute woman (the owner maybe) who kept making sure we were doing okay our Auntie. Eating here is now known as "eating at Auntie's house" because this woman makes us feel so loved! I came here with two friends and we all really liked this place. I ordered the pad thai with chicken. Upon its arrival, I noticed it was a bit more wet than my past experiences with pad thai, but this didn't bother me. Still yummy though! We all agreed that it was pretty good pad thai, and that we would order this again. We also ordered the angel wings to share, which were pretty awesome. One friend said it was too garlicky, but I didn't mind. We gave this dish alone 3.5 stars/5 stars, mainly because it was overcooked and a bit dry on the inside. One friend ordered some version of pad thai (forgot the name) but it was with wide noodles and it was extra spicy, while the other friend ordered some sort of chicken and a fresh young coconut to sip on. We enjoyed the decor and really appreciated the way we were treated by our Auntie. She totally made us feel at home! 

Final Verdict: Did you REALLY need any more convincing? Dude, 400+ reviews? Are you fo' realz?
author: Dana F.

description: Place is yum! I love their fried rices and yellow curry chicken. To end the meal with mango sticky rice!
author: Men A.

description: We love Marnee Thai, and find it to be one of the best Thai restaurants in the city. The owner is adorable. Yes, there is usually a wait during dinner hours, and the seating is tight at both locations, but the food makes up for it.
author: Stacy G.

description: I love this restaurant. My friends an I hv tried some other Thai restaurant but this one is the best. Everything is good and people are friendly.
author: Ashley T.

description:
Simply the best Thai restaurant in town.!!!!!!!  Service is quick and friendly.
The food is very unique and flavorful.  Try Banana blossom salad,
Basa fillet, B.B.Q. squid, Shrimp cake, Angel Wings, Hor mok and any specials of the day that they offer.  This is a must try restaurant for Thai food lovers!!!!! I've been to Thailand, so i know the food is authentic
author: kevin s.

description: This place is the best for Thai food from the excellent dishes, to the crazy lady that won't let you order two eggplant dishes and will convince you out of angel wings for their special, to their cool islander decor.  There's a second Marnee Thai on 9th and Irving which is good in a pinch, but I prefer the Outer Sunset one.  Go, just go, you won't be disappointed and you won't break the bank either.
author: Michelle T.

description:
If you are str8 or gay men you will have or have been experiencing good food and service.  I'm delighted for you.

As for lesbians....run, run quickly away from this horrible,
lesbian-phobic restaurant of torture.

I'll make this simple, there is this waitress that literally makes our dining experience miserable. You name it....she has done it!  This waitress HATES!  Literally hates lesbians.....oh she just loves to giggle and flirt with Gays (men), but us girls......its a living hell to be served by her!

My partner and I are vegetarians.....she delivers food with meat in it.
Though she reads everything back correctly......she delivers food with meat in it....and she YELLED at me that that was what I ordered!

Vegetarian fried rice.......we got :   chicken fried rice
tofu with spinach.......we got: duck with spinach
vegetarian red curry.........we got:  beef with red curry

The waiter apologized for what happened....but the creature yelled at him in Thai.  I paid the bill and left her 10 cent tip.

The waitress wanted us out of there!......She got her homophobic wish!
author: jazmineb B.

description:
Food: Nothing wow about it. Just the old, boring similar Thai food menu. The angel wing was great, but nothing beats san tung. =)
Bev: Thai iced tea was consistently waaaaaaayyy too sweet! 
Service: Food came about 5-10 mins after we ordered. Pretty decent service given the crowd. 
Ambiance: The decor is definitely different. They use weaved bamboo as the rooftop to create a more traditional authentic Thai atmosphere. But, I guess it doesn't work, because I care more about the lay out of the place and where I'm seated. Obviously, they try to squeeze so many tables into such a cramped space. I'd rather wait for the tables on the side of the room than to get seated in the centre.
author: Jessica W.

description:
My experience here is deserving of no stars.

My girlfriend and I had a 9:30 dinner reservation, and we arrived at 9:15pm. As we walk in, we are greeted by this wacko old lady who, throughout the dinner service, will scream orders back to the kitchen from the main dining room area. That alone ruined the dining experience. 

As we are approached to be seated, this same lady sneezes twice onto her hands and then proceeds to hand me two menus. WTF

After we are seated, and 10 minutes elapses, we are asked to move tables to accommodate a larger party. After an additional 20 minutes of being at the restaurant, we finally get somebody to take our order and give us water. 20 minutes!!!

The restaurant is cramped and noisy, and it doesn't help to have the main hostess/server yelling throughout the entire dining experience. The food was greasy.

Please avoid this place if you enjoy fine food and dining.
author: Sam G.

description: Some nights, if the right chef is there, they run Hor Mok as a special. And it's totally amazing. Even if that chef is not there, it is still one of the best Thai restaurants in the city.
author: Nick S.

description:
Absolutely amazing food with a  Great and  friendly staff. Only downside is the restaurant is too small and you can feel like you're eating with another  party - but the food and service are great!!!!  

Keep up the good work!!
author: Wayne B.

description:
Although I'm no expert by any means, this was great Thai food -- significantly better quality than most Thai places I've tried in both ingredients and preparation. I got the red curry with chicken, and the bamboo shoots were so yummy, plus the sauce had just the right amount of kick.

We didn't wait long despite the crowd -- it's kind of small and a little busy, but you can tell the service works very hard to keep everyone satisfied. Very good prices for yummy yummy food. Have already recommended it to others and will probably continue. :)
author: Ellen H.

description:
This Thai restaurant needs to make space between tables to at least one foot away from each other. It is so cramped in there, when people walked through between tables, they brush against table flower vase and table utensils.
Another bad thing about this restaurant is the owner lady talk and yell into the kitchen to order food to be cook. It is so loud and noise in there, just making eating out so uncomfortable. Somebody let this restaurant know about this. Thank you.
author: Max W.

description: Good food, not spectacular.  Worth a visit if you are in the neighborhood.
author: Meghan G.

description: I've eaten Thai food for nearly 30 years and our dinner last night was the best I've had. Every dish was spot-on perfect in flavor, texture and presentation. And our hostess May was an added delight - warm, funny, filled with good advice and fortunes for all. the calamari salad is a great starter and don't miss the black rice cakes for dessert.
author: Christopher I.

description: Decent food overall. We got the 'golden triangles' (samosas with squash and potato filling), vegetable coconut soup and pad thai. The soup was excellent: light, flavourful, lots of veggies, was not overwhelmed by the coconut taste. Pad thai was a little too sweet and slightly greasy for my liking. Will go back here if in the area, cost ~$17 per.
author: Raj I.

description: for the love of GOD don't even attempt to eat here.  not because the food is bad, but because the service is severely lacking.  on any given day of the week they have no more than 2 waitstaff, regardless of the hoards of customers lined up on the sidewalk.  inevitably one of the two will be stuck ringing up customers at the register and answering the phone for take out orders.  if marnee herself is there, stay out of her way. I've seen her push customers around, yell at them to move their chair closer to the already closely packed table, and berate them to other customers. she's exceedingly rude, loud, and unpleasant.  takeout is a better bet but plan on waiting for at least 45 minutes even though they'll always tell you it'll be ready in 20. regardless, they suffer no shortage of business.  this is a thai food goldmine. cha-ching!
author: Jessica L.

description: Marnee is a thai restaurant in the outer Sunset. There are actually two locations, but the one I am reviewing was the original. The restaurant is small but cozy. There were some decorative colored lights strung from th ceiling. Each table had an orchid and candle, and the lighting is dim. We got there at 7:30 and it was pretty crowded, so we were lucky to have made a reservation. The staff was very attentive and friendly. We started out with some kind of tea which tasted like Korean "bori-cha" or barley tea. The tom yum soup was very good and very very spicy (I asked for it, and I got it) with lots of vegetables and tofu. Then came the "spicy" angel wings which were deep fried chicken wings with crispy basil and a sweet sauce. They were not spicy, despite their name. Nevertheless, very tasty, as fried things tend to be. Then came the pad see ew (with chicken) a dish, along with tom yum, that I nearly always get at thai restaurants, so I am quite a pad see ew conaisseur. This one was quite good I must say, the noodles were sweet and properly seasoned. After the noodles, we got beef panang curry. I was not that impressed. Although the sauce was good, there was not enough of it. I am used to curries in which the meat and/or veggies are covered in sauce. This dish had slices of meat and broccoli, with a bit of sauce on the side. I also thought the beef tasted too meaty, it would be nice if they had a chicken or vegetarian version. Perhaps they do, and next time I will try that. The mango and sticky rice was okay, but not as good as when I make it at home, or at other thai restaurnants (like President Thai in Pasadena). Overall Marnee is one of the better Thai places in the city, and I would come back again.
author: Kate A.

description: stopped by this marnee location on friday hoping to avoid the 9th and irving crowds.  when i arrived (party of 2), they were packed to the gills, but the waitress assured us they'd be ready for a small group in 5min.  40minutes later, we were finally seated.  after that, service was very prompt and the food as excellent as the restaurants inner sunset counterpart.  actually, the set-up of this marnee is pretty cool in that the walls are lined with jute mats reminiscent of a southeast asian bungalow.
author: Roshni R.

description: another over hyped SF restaurant...i know part of the novelty is the brashness of the owner (a la Sam Wo's, Bruno Persian Aub Zam Zam, etc.) but she is not entertaining. I don't mind so much that it took a long time to order & get our food (most restaurants rush you in/out...) but aside from this, the server never came around (wait for missing fork, need a napkin?, all of that little stuff...) prices were decent if I remember...
author: Deo V.

description:
We had reservations for a party of 12.  The hostess made us wait outside until more of our group arrived.  When 9 arrived, we informed her that most of our group was here.  She changed our reservation to a party of 9 because she did not understand that we informed her that 9 of the 12 had arrived.  We were sent back outside.  After 40 minutes, I finally told the hostess that most of my group had driven from the East Bay and were tired of standing in the cold outside.  She sat us at a table for 9 that was so cramped we couldn't move our arms.  It would have been comfortable if they had not given away a table for two on the right of our table.  When three more guests arrived the table for 12 was still not ready.  After 10 more minutes, she sat us at a long table with hardly any room to wiggle.  Our reservation was at 6:15 p.m., and they didn't seat us until 7:30 p.m.  Once we ate and were settling down for a little conversation, at 9 p.m., we were told to LEAVE BECAUSE SOMEBODY WAS WAITING FOR THE TABLE.  

HOW RUDE.  I SELECTED THE ESTABLISHMENT BECAUSE OF A REVIEW ON KQED'S CHECK PLEASE.  After reviewing the Website and finding out that the location at 2225 Irving did take reservations, I decided it would be a nice place to celebrate my Birthday.  Not the place to host a dinner.  You're better off taking out and having the party at your home.
author: Harriette H.

description: I was at the 9th avenue venue; Had dinner this past Saturday with a birthday party of 25.  Chef Chai called me to confirm that evening and we pre ordered our appetizers, salad and soup. I was truly impressed with the efficient and polite service from the moment we walked through the door.  Despite it being packed that nite, we were seated promptly for our 8pm reservation.  As soon as we were seated, within minutes our appetizers came out.  We ordered the spicy buffalo wings (a big hit!).  The calamari salad was avg. and the tom yum soup was ok.   I'd have to say the food did not meet my expectations (I have high expectations =)  perhaps because they were super busy that nite?  But the service and eagerness of the staff to accomodate our every request more than made up for it.   The 9th avenue venue has the banquet room downstairs that say can fit a party of 40 but to be honest, it was a bit cramped. I'd say a party of 30 or less would have been more comfortable.  I would definately come back, this time with a smaller party and try it again.
author: Amanda A.

description: the best thai food in the city.  beef salad is amazing, as are the famous wings.
author: Rio K.

description: This place is so good, my husband and I have been coming here for years.  It is definitely one of our favorite restaurants in  the city.  There are so many good things on the menu its hard to say which is our favorite, but the spicy angel wings and Pad Thai are a must try.
author: Erin O.

description: its always a treat eating here! service is wonderful, i feel like im in a thai home with the best food! angel wings are always a must! i love the cleanliness!
author: Dae M.

description: I've only been to this place once and I'll never go back. Mainly because of a certain rude fat manager. I ordered a chicken dish and instead they brought me shrimp. It could have been an honest mistake or maybe they were trying to increase my bill. Who knows? Anyway, when I (politely) informed them of the mistake and asked them to send it back and bring me chicken, they started giving me a hard time. I assume this is because I am a young guy and I was there with my girlfriend (who is now my wife). Maybe they didn't consider me an important guest since my bill was not that high. Anyway, some big mama-san came out and started speaking to me in a condescending manner about refusing to accept the prawns. She finally gave in and told me she would give my prawns to her kids at home who are not so picky. First off, I am young professional in my 20s. I am not your kids at home. That is incredibly disrespectful and I wanted to choke her fat neck. Secondly, it was their mistake not mine. Most respectable restaurants try to correct their mistakes and make their guests happy. Not this fat piece of human garbage. Even with her broken english she knows how to insult and disrespect her customers. She seems very arrogant and thinks she is running a 5 star restaurant. She has a group of her favorite customers who she bows and scrapes to, and she treats the rest of us like we are unimportant. She feels that she can treat people how she wants and they will still come to gobble up her thai slop. So far, much to my surprise, she has been correct in that assumption.. Very shady restaurant if you ask me. This is the first negative restaurant review I've ever felt compelled to write. That's how bad this place is.
author: Vince L.

description: Tofu Angel Wings - Heaven on a Plate
author: Susan A.

description: as fergie would say, t-t-t-t-t-tastay tastaaaay!
author: Eda L.

description: excellent pad thai, and fast, friendly service
author: Meghan E.

description: We went to Marnee Thai yesterday with a large group after reading good reviews here.  It was worth the drive upto the city.  Place is small but food is amazing.  Service is not top of the line but we didn't have to suffer for anything - especially coz it was Saturday night.  The lady who ran the place told us when we entered that her place is small but her food is amazing - hence worth the wait.  She kept her promise and it was indeed worth the wait.  Food was exceptional - good variety, spicy as we desired.  All in all, this place hit the spot.  We would surely recommend this place to everyone and come back.
author: S D.

description: Im Thai and i love love love this place.  I've been searching forever to find really good thai food and i have! Great atmosphere, a little small, but not to bad.  Really friendly servers.  i've been to many other places that people hype up but this is by far the best!
author: Amy W.

description: After leaving here there was no doubt in my mind these people are here foremost to serve you good food.  Everything was presented beautifully and tasted great and the service was excellent and very friendly from the servers to the owners.  The first thing you notice about each dish is how fresh the ingredients are.  The Mian Kum appetizer was a wonderful example of this.  Fresh spinach leaves that you top with shredded coconut, onions, fresh diced ginger, peanuts, sliced lime, dried baby shrimp and their sauce which are laid out for you.  It was awesome and like nothing Ive had before this is the dish that I left thinking about.  Next up that I have to mention were the imperial rolls which were delicious, crisp and flaky.  I cant say Ive ever had better.  Chicken satay was good and the peanut sauce great.   The Thai Samosas were my dad's favorite.  Green mango salad, very good.  The Gang Jued soup was also great.  Their curries we ordered were both good, but not the stars of the meal.  And lastly I have to recommend the mango sticky rice for dessert.
author: Michael M.

description: This is one of my favorite Thai places in the city - it feels a little like being in a big hut in the jungle!  When Marnee is there, she'll make sure you order well, that the sauces are not all the same for the different dishes you order.  The curries - whichever you try, and I've tried a few - are all perfect - flavorful with a little heat but not too much.  Last time I was in we ordered the shrimp and green beans with a red sauce - again, plenty of flavor, just a little heat, but the pepperiness didn't overwhelm it at all.  I love Thai tea, but last time tried a coconut milk drink served right in a coconut which was just as refreshing and wonderful a contrast to the spicy food as the Thai tea without being too sweet.  I would take anyone here - romantic enough for a date, festive enough for a group.  It can get a little crowdy though, not much elbow room, so best to get there early.
author: Sophie B.

description: You know when you've struck gold again! What a smashing little (and I mean little) Thai restaurant stuck way off the beaten track of downtown SF. I can honestly say that I've never been in a restaurant where there were so many eager customers both seated and queuing out the door. You really must book if you don't want to wait an hour or more. Menu is very extensive, reasonably priced, and there's a specials board and an additional specials menu. I discovered the corn cake starter and could eat these 'till the cows come home. I always judge a Thai restaurant on how well it makes a green curry and they certainly didn't disappoint here. Of course, being American, I had to ask for it to be made a little more spicy and, when it came, it hit the spot perfectly. The owner and her staff were very helpful and the corn cakes were their recommendation. Service was good and prices were perfectly reasonable (for SF that is). Would recommend this place to anyone looking for something far better than the greasy over-priced food found in most US eateries.
author: stuartx

description: I haven't been here anytime in the last 2 years, but I use to come here all the time (started going to this place back in 1999). This restaurant is a staple in San Francisco! Order anything on the menu and your stomach will be really happy!
author: JG W.

description: my favorite Thai restaurant and no im not basing this on just because i know the son  which will be the next chef there btw but own how i like the food myself. i never had a dish i didnt like there. everything was good and fresh. dinner time can be a wait at this location so you can always go to the one on 9th ave. angel wings...yummm. papaya salad....double yumm...dammit, im starting to crave it. oh yea, free dessert? for the friends and family that is. sorry people. cant beat that.
author: Tuan D.

description: i finally decided to branch out and try something other than pad see ew, pad woon sen, curry, pra ram, or whatever.  i picked the khao soy chicken and i am impressed!  i got the to-go order so they had the egg noodles, cilantro, pickled something, and lime in on take out box, and the yellow curry sauce with chicken in a clear round tupperware.  i took most of the curry sauce and combined it with the noodles and it tasted similar to the coconut chicken curry noodle soup from mandalay.  however, i like this better because it has a good consistency and not as watery.  this is a definitely 4-stars and i need to go back to try other dishes.  and the prices are very reasonable.
author: Michelle W.

description:
NEVER! NEVER WILL I EVER GIVE U BUSINESS MARNEE THAI! 

I've promised myself to never go to Marnee Thai again! their service is horrible. It's really crammed in there all the time. I can hear every couple's conversation next to me when i'm sitting at the table because the tables are so tight next to each other. They're very pushy about what you should order from their menu. And lets be real, this isn't a fine dine place like Fleur de lys for it to have tiny artistic portions, it's just another homie restaurant on Irving and yet they're frugal about their portions.
