I, as always, ordered the peanut chicken dish (i forgot the actual name) and my friend ordered deep fried crab over a bed of salad. In all fairness, their food usually tastes good. BUT THAT NIGHT I WAS GOING TO THROW ALL OF OUR DISHES BACK AT THE OWNER'S FACE! first off, they are not graceful at timing to bring both dishes at the same time- 15 minutes after my friend got his dish, mine came along. 

My friend's dish comes along and he takes a bite out of his crab and realizes the the breaded and deep fried crab is soggy, rubbery,cold, and old. Now please people, we all know what fresh deep fried anything tastes like; it's crispy and hot. Knowing that any decent restaurant in sf would gladly take back it's food if something was wrong with it, my friend and i agreed to tell the hostess/ waitress/owner. So we expressed our thoughts to the lady expecting that she would simply apologize and order another dish for us but instead she starts arguing and telling us how freshly deep fried the crab is. Soon after, she goes into the kitchen and starts screaming at the chef in Thai and comes back and offers us to reheat the crab in the MICROWAVE for us! even a diner wouldn't say that to you in SF!Come on people, you CAN tell the difference between a freshly fried french fry and an old stale french fry, how hard is it to tell the difference between a newly fresh fried crab and an old fried crab that was made at lunch?! she was extremely rude, we're giving you business and supporting your restaurant and instead you come screaming at my face and get angry?! 

so as i tried just forgetting about it and tried to enjoy the rest of my time left with my friend, she has the nerve to come by to ask me how our meals are and tries to flatter me by saying how big and beautiful my eyes are! lady, i don't care, you ruined my night and put my friend and i in a bad mood on a Friday night!!!!!!!!!! 




All i wanted was a decent dinner to enjoy my night with my friend. 
I live in a city that offers amazing food where ever you go, i know what good service and fresh good food is! 


NEVER AGAIN, NEVER AGAIN!
author: Setareh s.

description: I am saddened that a yelp'er was disappointed by Marnee Thai-- just the cute owner alone was enough to make me go back.  Even with the tiny space, she made our big group feel comfortable and the corn cakes and garlic broccoli dishes were completely worth getting our elbows jostled.
author: Anjali K.

description: Best Thai food in San Francisco. Reasonably priced.
author: Robert S.

description: It was the longest day in 2006, we took off early from work to catch the sunset at Ocean Beach. Well it was not perfect  but definitely near perfect. With the setting sun, we decided to keep rolling the "near-perfect" theme of the day! Following one of our friends advise, we came to this hot spot at the 9th and Irving and decided to make a visit to Marnee Thai. Sure enough our theme of the day discontinued but for better,  it became "PERFECT"!  Great food,  everything was very good, but there was one dish which reached the pinnacle of perfection, it was chicken-eggplant combo.  I immensely enjoyed food here and definitely the best Thai food I have ever had. I  hope to have many happy returns of such perfect June 21st in future.
author: Kingshuk g.

description: Extremely poor service made the good food seem unimportant... The place is very cramped and the loud head waitress (seems like the owner) shouting across from one end of the restaurant to the other didnt help the atmosphere. We had a reservation and had to wait for atleast 20 minutes before getting a table. We almost couldn't talk as the next table was joined one side to our table. Food was reasonably good but the attitude of the owner really bothered us and we contemplated leaving the place... take out could be considered.
author: A A.

description: Fantastic food and great atmosphere.  I lived in Thailand for more than a year and a half, and Marnee Thai is the closest I have had to authentic Thai food.  I highly recommend the fried fish with garlic and the cashew nut chicken.
author: Brian A.

description: Ok the owner of this place is so very nice and she really makes sure everyone is happy with their food and service. I was brought here by my husband's coworkers for a celebration for a work thing, I dont remember what, but ever since then we have come here for their food. I dont you know about you but I love their Angel wings for appetizer. I must caution you that it is very hot and I always burn my tongue eating it cuz I cant wait for it to cool down. Its that good o.O. I bring friends and family here all the time. I brought my brother that was visiting from New York City here and he came to visit me a second time a few months later. He admitted to me that another deciding factor that got him to come to visit me was because of this restaurant. Gee thanx little bro, but hey Im not complaining because he is my family, much love for ya! My husband and I always come eat at this place for birthdays and anything to celebrate. The food is pretty inexpensive for how delicious it is.
author: Cher A.

description: not the best red curry I have had but I love the atmosphere and the bossy owner who helps you order and helps you eat the Food!!  she is funny and great help
author: Mark f.

description: After a few years of forgetting about this place because there's simply so many other restaurants on Irving, my husband and I craved the Spicy Angel Wings so we stopped by for dinner.  The food is still as delicious as ever, especially the angel wings.  Although the angel wings are on their appetizer section, we eat it with the rest of our meal because the sauce goes great with rice.  The service was very attentive and fast.  However, because this restaurant tends to get very busy at dinner time, I'd recommend coming early or you might have to wait a while.
author: Helen V.

description: im not a big thai eater but i LOVE the angel wings here.. i come just for the angel wings! i had the curry before but it wasnt like typical thai curry it was tender beef in a dry curry there was no stew..... the decor is very nice and clean and they have fresh orchids in the restaurant everyday. the chef/owner gets good reviews in the newspapers. its a very small place but i have never seen  a LONG wait. so try it if you want thai food.
author: Linda L.

description: Love Marnee Thai...  The food is fabulous and May is simply lovely.  :)  Charismatic, sweet, friendly, and ummm... psychic.  Yes, psyhic.  Yes, she can tell you exactly what you will be ordering.  (She does do that sometimes, but if you really experienced just how gifted she is with her psychic abilities.... You'd believe her and just take her word ON EVERYTHING.)  We've been frequenting this restaurant for YEARS... like 10+ years or something.  Chai's cooking is the best- Angel Wings are my favorite.  By the way, after suggesting this restaurant to my single girlfriends, I found out that most of them said that they got good advice from May regarding life, love, and future plans.  One girlfriend once went to the restaurant to only report back to me that May did give her some good advice... It was to get a better bra because the "long breast look" wasn't very nice.  Haha Carla!  Angel Wings and a psychic reading.  :)
author: J T.

description: The best thai food I have had so far. The service is quick and the proportions are fair. The prices were reasonable and the angel wings are to die for. Kind of a odd entrance for a restuarant cause it feels like he ceilings are low. I would come here again and again if I could.
author: J L.

description:
my favorite thai in the city, maybe ever.  we have terrible thai on the east coast so when i came here, i really wanted good thai.   marnee's the go to place.  

i love the pad thai and wings here.  i've never had anything mediocre here, the food is always good and fresh.   the only thing that sucks is people yelling in your ear.  i guess that's part of the charm?
author: shar d.

description: Ambiance could be better, but food is great.  Outstanidng noodle dishes, but soup could be better (they focus in spiciness instead of flavor)   Keep an eye out for the pumpkin curry - solid!
author: WP D.

description: 3.5 Stars. Liked the food, but it wasn't that spicy... had to use the chili sauce on the table to add some flavor, but what can I expect - they cater to the crowd. Service was great - they were very respectful and didn't try to kick us out as me & a good friend were chatting away :)
author: Jeannette L.

description: This place used to be really good until they opened their second location a few years ago. I've tried it a few times since then and I've been disappointed every time time I visit. The food seems to have loss some of it's flavor over the years.
author: Brian W.

description: my favorite Thai restaurant. the food is soo good here. the owner is also really nice and the staff is fast and efficient. i knocked off a star because some times the food can be a little too salty. whenever i eat here my group always orders WAY too much food. corn cakes, angel wings, pad thai, fried rice, curry, chicken and beef satay....yummm....
author: Cindy Q.

description: i have gone here for 8 years. my wife, who is 38 weeks pregnant, drove to the restaurant to pickup our order. when she returned we realized they didn't provide all the food. i called an asked them to bring it to us..they would not. after spending thousands of dollars on their food..these greedy thankless worms didn't pay any respect.
author: Unn U.

description: we stumbled upon marnee one night when we were wondering in outer sunset and felt really lucky that we found a place that had won so many awards.  quaint cute family-run restauasrant and the food wasn't anything to write home about but it was alright (i've had better, i've had worse) - we had the fresh spring rolls, seafood curry and the pad thai but i got a stomach ache afterwards (which is very rare -  i swear i can drink the water in mexico).
author: michelle k.

description: I used to live around here and this was one of the places we would frequent. It is really good Thai food. The place is small though, but they did open up a new location on 9th ave. I think I've been to that one once. It was slightly worse but still good. The owner is kind of loud but friendly. I believe pretty much everything I've tried is good. Do they have mango rice here? If they do, I liked it. =)
author: Luke F.

description: I was not too impressed with this place. I came here with my cousins for dinner recently. One of my cousins advised this place was really good for authentic Thai cuisine. The food was decent, but I prefer Osha Thai. Also, the wait was ridiculous! Our reservation was for 7pm and we did not get seated until 8pm or a little later. The place is just way too small. We got a somewhat larger table than other people, but we were still squished. My chair kept getting bumped into by the waiters and waitresses. It was quite annoying. The owner (I believe) was quite loud and pushy. We wanted to order just one order of the angel wings, but she insisted that we order more than just one order and of course it was way too much. I was also disappointed in their panang curry. Usually when I order this dish, there is a lot of curry sauce that comes with it. This dish hardly had any. When I asked the owner if that was the correct dish, she said that is how panang curry is made. That may be so, but why doesn't she explain that in the menu. Also, why does everyone else make a lot of sauce with it and this restaurant is the only place that does not give a lot of curry sauce with it. The rest of the food was decent, but I was expecting so much more. I may go here again if I am in the area, but most likely not.
author: Kimberly L.

description: Great Thai food, even better than places I ate in Thailand.   A small and sometimes cramped restaurant.   The staff is very friendly, though often rushed.   Best to go late in the afternoon for more relaxed dining.   Haven't been to their other location since I've been such a fan of this restaurant.
author: Ken J.

description: What a disappointment! Two stars for the food, which, admittedly, was really good. 5 of us came here last night and everything we tried was good (pad thai, veggie deluxe with chile-basil sauce, papaya salad). All of it was good. So why only 2 stars? The service was horrendous. First (and this would have been forgivable were it not for the incident at the end of the night), I had called to see if I could make a reservation since there were 5 of us and was told yes. So, why did I bother to give them info for making a reservation when they were going to do nothing to reserve a table for us!? We arrived a couple of minutes before 8 (the time of our reservation) and ended up getting seated at 8:30. Um, doesn't the concept of a reservation rely on actually reserving a table!? Ok, moving on. The service was abrupt and inattentive the whole time, with the waitress moving on to the next person before the person doing the ordering was even finished.  The end of the meal, though, was the real kicker. Our bill came and, given that we couldn't read anything that was written on the bill, we all used the menu, with prices, to add up how much we owed. When our total came up $15 short, I asked our waitress if she could explain the bill.  First of all, they had added a $1 charge per person for rice when only one person asked for any (or ate it). Seemed odd given that 2 of us had pad thai and certainly neither ordered or wanted rice and one person only had dessert. Hmmm.. Then when she got to two of the items we ordered the prices were two dollars higher each than what was printed on the menu. When I pointed this out, she said "ok she would take it off", with no apology or explanation. It was as if she was saying, ok, since you realized that we added extra amounts on for each dish, I'll take it off. Unbelievable.  I'm quite sure there were other "errors" on our bill, but we were sick of dealing with it so we just paid and left. There are far too  many good thai places in this city to put up with this kind of bullshit, good food or not! We won't be back.
author: SL N.

description: I stumbled upon Marnee Thai by closing my eyes and randomly picking this restaurant out of the Yellow Pages.  Since that time in Oct 1998, I've been eating at this restaurant at least once a month.  I've taken everyone here and no one else has told me that another Thai restaurant serves better food than Marnee Thai does.  I've become very fond of the owners and enjoy their service and food there.  Whether you are a regular or not, you'll find the food to be spectacular.  Mind  you, this is not a fine dining sort of place nor are you going to expect your typical type of "American" style restaurant service there.  My favorite dishes that I always get there are: Green Papaya Salad or Green Mango Salad, Pad Thai with Shrimp, whole fish with spicy sauce, and pad pra ram.  You've got to try the Roti with ice cream and the Mango Sticky Rice.  Marnee Thai knows how to make me and my belly happy!!!  Five Stars to Marnee Thai
author: storm o.

description: Every time I go here I love it just a lil' bit mo.  All their traditional stuff (pad Thai, friend rice, basil chicken) is fab but I love to get my spicy on when I eat Thai so I try to order the curries as much as possible.  Every single one is great and unique in flavor - whether its the chicken, vegetable or lamb its ALL GOOD!  I am also the biggest sucker on the planet because I totally bought the "cookbook".  I do cook pretty well so it's not the saddest thing but I have yet to make something.  It has all the recipes though, so hopefully I will update my post soon with my newly found Thai skills.
author: Kristina C.

description: I love their Angel Wings and pad thai. I love the decor too. The staff is friendly and I get to eat my wonderful food with my thai iced tea. The wait may be long on a busy night.
author: bob k.

description: I have heard such great things about this place and was expecting better so when we finally got our food, I thought the taste was average for a decent thai restaurant. I suppose if you go in with lower expectations, you will have an ok experience
author: Nadeem R.

description: One of the best thai restaurants in the city!  It has all of the thai favorites like pad thai and spicy chicken wings--but my fav are things that are harder to find at other thai restaurants like hor mok (fish curry steamed in banana leaf) and miang kum (assortment of small ingredients wrap together in spinach leaf with sauce--very yummy)
author: pat s.

description: Love the Tom Ka.  I always order whatever the owner says to order ... the matron of the joint has never let me astray.  Oh, and this place is very veggie-friendly.  I always get substitutions.
author: Kris H.

description: I love Marnee!  Our favorite dishes here are the Pad Nor Mai (ground pork sauteed with chili, garlic, bamboo shoots, egg, and Thai basils) and Pad Thai.  The dishes are ALWAYS perfectly seasoned, with the ideal combination of freshness and spice.  Not to mention it is affordable.  When we are feeling lazy, I just order three or more orders of my favorite dishes, and take it to work all week for lunch.  Love Marnee.  You must give it a chance.  Although I have never eaten in the restaurant, since I always prefer take out.
author: Charisse L.

description: i haven't been to the other location but then again i don't feel a need to.  i've been to this one quite a few times and have never been let down!  the food is always amazing and the service is friendly!  this past weekend i got two more people hooked on this spot for the atmosphere first and once they tasted the food, they were also hooked!
author: Ronda G.

description: Just went here and I have been here many times.  I went here with my Thai friends and the food here is good as always and always crowded but worth the wait.
author: albert c.

description: my friend joy goes here at least once a week and i now understand why.  this is the best thai food i've had since visiting thailand.  everything is full of flavor and extremely authentic.  the service and owners are exceptionally warm and friendly.  i will definitely be back!  :)  thank you marnee!
author: Irene L.

description: it's pretty good food, but the female server is a complete bitch!  i sat down with my girlfriend in the corner table close to the door.  we ordered and were having appetizers and our drinks when the female server says to the table next to us "you have to move because i have a big crowd coming in now."  the gentleman and his son declined to move.  she then walks over to my table and grabs the food and says "you have to move to the back."  i said no i do not have to move to the back since i sat here first and i was already eating.  she insisted, but i told her that i'm not moving.  after that, our food was rushed to us by a different male server (who was nice) even though we hadn't finished our appetizers yet.  while eating, the female server kept looking our direction and speaking in thai to the other servers about us.  frankly, good food, but lousy / mean service = fuck no, never again bitch!
author: T D.

description: this place is good - not as good as lanna - but good.  they offer a greater selection and it feels just as cozy.  i'll have to admit that everything here tastes pretty fresh and we've never had trouble finding parking.  the wait can be a little on the long side though.
author: Raz R.

description: IMy friend asked where I wanted to go for my birthday and I told him Marnee Thai's.  Last night was awful.  We ordered two dishes:  spicy wings which were not fresh and chicken with string beans which were so oversalted that I couldn't eat it.  I don't usually complain about my meal but since I couldn't eat either item, I told the waitress who was the owner.  She started arguing with me in a booming voice that the cook had been there 20 years and had I wanted less salt on my food, I should have informed her when I ordered.  I like salt but this was permeated with salt.  She then walked away and 5 minutes later came back and said she would give me new wings but only half an order and if I wanted dessert.  We got new wings that were fresh.  So I mostly ate the rice.  She also wanted us to order a third dish which we didn't and she wasn't happy about that.  While we were there another party of 6 sat down and after she went over to speak to them, they left without ordering.  They appeared to be upset.
author: Nora S.

description: this is mine and my gf s favorite thai place !!!! my first time, i tried the chicken basil, spring rolls, and duck with spinach and i kid u not! it was soo good that i remembered the taste!! sometime they can be rushy but its all about turnovers right??!! lol i suggest going at night instead of lunch time bc the chefs are different i think. but if u do decide to go during lunch, try the bbq thai pork rice plate.. mmmm .. i love the owner! shes like a second mother to me..
author: Kat M.

description: everytime we walk by this restaurant its always packed with people waiting outside.  is it that small that ppl have to wait outside? or is it so good that ppl wait to eat there? i think they purposely make the place small soppl have to watch outside, making the place look more packed.  so i thought, why not?  it was crowded and the food was delish. green curry- pretty good except it came in a dish in the size of miso soup bowl.  the beef natang- i cant believe we paid for that. it tasted like lik a tree bark with beef jerky flavor.  we ordered some other dish with chicken which was ok.  i think the food i saw other people eatting had much potential. but im the fool who always order green curry at every thai place.  it was wierd that they charged for tea bc it costs more to put a lemon in my water then brew a teapot with probably the same used teabag they've used for months.  so were done and i ask the guy for my check. ok he packs our food and then leaves. um do i not have to pay?...waiting for 15 min...okee he forgot to give me my bill...should i just leave bc he probably thinks he gave me the bill already. so i just go up to the register for my bill to pay for it.  the girl ringing it up takes her precious time unrolling the the reciept tape.  geez not that hard but for time-consuming.  overall great experience except fact that the servers were slow at getting back to us
author: ruby l.
